review.title: Disappointed with facilities
review.reviewText: Old fashioned hotel, neat and tidy however no restaurant.  Too far from restaurants, considering the hilly streets you need to walk up and down.
review.positiveRemarks: Staff were very helpful but this doesn't make up for the location and no restaurant.
review.negativeRemarks: Provide restaurant facilities
review.locationRemarks: Need to use cab or uber to get anywhere.

review.title: Nice hotel close to main points of interest.
review.reviewText:
Excellent staff and easy access to everything. Little more attention to cleanliness would be recommended. 
Nice touch with music and vine between 5Pm and 6PM although we did not take advantage of this as exploring the city instead.
review.negativeRemarks: Little more cleanliness would be really great.
review.locationRemarks: Nice hotel close to everything. Union Square just 10 min walk.

review.title: Great hotel in central location
review.reviewText: The hotel is located back of Union Square, which makes it easy to explore all central areas of San Fran. Hotel staff were very friendly and knowledgable. The room was spacious, comfortable and had all you need for an enjoyable stay.

review.title: Do Not Stay Here, Please
review.reviewText: I had a horrible experience here, arrived pretty late at night from my flight, got to the hotel and realized it was 1) in a shady part of town. Next, I got to my room and the Tube Light (yeah!) across the hall was broken creating this loud horrible sound so I felt like I was in a horror movie! Could not sleep it was so loud. So, got moved to a different floor and guess what, the Heat wasn't working, and the space heater they bought was from the Stone Age. It didn't warm up until 3/4am. Though the staff tried to be helpful, it's just a crappy hotel, not worth the price.

review.title: The staff is really excellent at Hotel Carlton
review.reviewText: Staff is very accommodating and they take steps that every concern is properly attended to. The hotel is older, although that should be expected when staying for less than $300. Consistent service and a reliable choice, though more a plan B if hotel prices are up throughout the City. Those are generally the occasions when I've stayed at Carlton.
review.positiveRemarks: I like the location of the hotel. Urban environment and easy walk to my conference in Union Square.
review.negativeRemarks: I think the hotel could benefit from installing new room doors that can keep sound in the hallways at bay.
review.locationRemarks: The location is north west of union square. Close to food options, but night time walking and good food nearby seems limited.

review.title: Perfectly good but not for light sleepers
review.reviewText: The staff are great and the hotel is perfectly nice. However the walls & doors are paper thin so expect a lot of indoor noise. We could even hear the continuous whirring of the elevator and our room wasn't that close to it. Not great if you are a light sleeper. We were on the 9th floor so at least street noise wasn't an issue and the road didn't seem too busy anyway so even lower down I think it would be quiet on that front. Fire exits (first thing I always check) were good. The hotel offers complimentary wine some afternoons in the reception which is a nice touch. However the live music was totally wrong for the occasion - a weirdly dressed, middle aged man in punky vest top Etc with futuristic sunglasses on an electric keyboard blaring his rock compositions jarred hugely with the rather genteel crowd trying to enjoy a relaxed drink and a natter. Everyone looked bemused and I felt rather sorry for the man who would be considered perfectly talented in another setting but here everyone was just gawping at him because he looked so bizarrely out of place. Whoever books the hotel's live music should know their clientele and the tone of the hotel better. Maybe they book this guy so no-one stays for a 2nd glass of wine!!!

review.title: Nice hotel 10 mins  from Union Square
review.reviewText: Comfortable, slightly old fashioned hotel about 10 mins walk from Union Square. Decent sized rooms, free WiFi, and free wine at happy hour every night.
review.locationRemarks: Also just 3 mins from cable car line to CBD, which is actually easy to get on unlike Union Square to Fisherman's Wharf.

review.title: Old with high noise levels
review.reviewText: The hotel was very noisy which made it hard to get a good night's sleep. It is a lot older than it appears in pictures but was clean and the bed was comfortable. The phone in the room did not work so I was unable to call the front desk, which was very inconvenient. The staff was friendly!

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: Very friendly staff, cute rooms with plenty of space, great views and good location! Planning on staying here again on our next visit :)

review.title: Attractive hotel not far from Union Square
review.reviewText: We enjoyed our stay. Desk staff were very helpful. We had a great time in San Francisco as tourists for two days.The hotel was an easy walk to Union Square
review.positiveRemarks: We liked the room decoration, the charm of a historic place, and the convenience.
review.negativeRemarks: Bathroom light is outside bathroom so if to go to the bathroom you turned on the light, then opened the bathroom door, flooding the bedroom with light

review.title: Nice hotel but quite a walk into union square
review.reviewText: Long way from fishermans wharf but good local bus service in and out, can walk to union square but quite steep hills

review.title: good hotel, location so so, breakfast lacking
review.reviewText: hotel staff was awesome, location is great for bars/restaurants/tourism, but the Tenderloin can be a tad "interesting" in the wee hours of the night.  It was a decent stay, but I value near proximity breakfast a lot in a hotel.  The breakfast at the hotel was seriously understaffed, one server taking care of 25+ people doesn't make for a great experience.  The food was fantastic, but coffee refills and water were hard to come by, not b/c the servers were bad, they just didn't have the bandwidth for all the customers.
review.positiveRemarks: comfortable, convenient location for Market St
review.negativeRemarks: more servers at breakfast
review.locationRemarks: work

review.title: Convenient, central location
review.reviewText: Stayed for four days with my family.  We took Lyft to all areas of the city for about $10 a trip, but it's also on a couple of bus routes.  Lots of shops and cafes within a block.  The hotel is very clean and looks like it was recently renovated (I am a stickler for shower tile grout).  We were on the 7th floor so not bothered by street noise.  At times we could hear people in adjoining rooms, but again not bothersome.  Would definitely stay again.
review.positiveRemarks: Very clean, and in a central location.
review.negativeRemarks: Light in the closet never turned off.
review.locationRemarks: Coffee shops, bars and a Walgreens incase you forget anything or to stock up on snacks.

review.title: Really nice hotel in central location
review.reviewText:
This is a nice centrally located boutique hotel. The hotel is old but with quaint updates. Nice plush bed and modern sink and tub. The decor is old world. 

The front desk staff were friendly and helpful. Gio was a comedian with a dry humour. And the lady who served us breakfast on Saturday was great. Btw, the breakfast was delicious. They had a proper restaurant with the best quesedias with eggs, cheese and avocado. The line up was healthy fresh food. And a bonus! Mr. Holmes Bakery is just around the corner. Get there early because line ups start fast. 

At night, it's not easy to find a good place to eat. But it was cold when the fog rolled in that we didn't venture too far. Or, we ate in China Town and Little Italy that we didn't try any of the restaurants near the hotel.

review.title: Great Vacation getaway
review.reviewText: This is my first stay at Hotel Carlton and it was an amazing experience. We were upgraded even before our arrival. Once we arrived the check in process was quick and staff was very helpful. The hotel is located close to all the amazing areas in the city. The hotels wine reception was great with live music every day.

review.title: A few blocks too close to the bad part of town..
review.reviewText: Don't get me wrong, this is a welcoming and a decent place to stay...but the location is a bit raw and towards the wrong part of town.

review.title: Friendly, Casual, Lively, Unpretentious
review.reviewText: It's the kind of place where guests may actually chat with each other in the elevators or lounges. Tours, backpackers, locals, all very friendly. We stayed there for a weekend-long wedding at the Lodge, and it couldn't have been more convenient. We also stay there frequently when we come to the city for evening events, because we live a long drive away in the mountains.
review.positiveRemarks: I like the colors and global style. I also love that they have a floor for guests who bring their dogs, which we sometimes do.
review.negativeRemarks: I think it's just fine as it is. It's not trying to be a luxury hotel and it isn't priced like one.
review.locationRemarks: Get tips from the front desk. We go to Toast on Polk St. for breakfast because they have gluten-free options.

review.title: Always great
review.reviewText: My daughter and I stay at The Hotel Carlton about once a year while in San Francisco for business and fun
review.positiveRemarks: The location can't be beat if you want easy access to all the great areas in and around the city. It is an old hotel that has charm
review.negativeRemarks: My only criticism is that the walls are thin. If you get a noisy neighbor, it is annoying. Otherwise, this is a rare jewel!
review.locationRemarks: Polk St. for shopping and dining.. Great little breakfast "greasy spoon" up the street called, "Golden Coffee". Easy access to public transportation

review.title: Pretty & stylish hotel!
review.reviewText: Our room was bright, cheery and very clean.  The lobby was stylish & the staff very friendly.
review.positiveRemarks: It was a great price for how nice it was.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing I can think of.
review.locationRemarks: You can walk just about anywhere.

review.title: Hotel Carlton
review.reviewText:
We stayed at the hotel because it had good reviews and it was in walking distance to The Great American Music Hall.
Hotel Carlton meet all our needs and expectations. I would stay there again.
Very accommodating and friendly. The hosed wine in the lobby in the afternoon is nice too.
This hotel is next to a very questionable neighbourhood

review.title: Nicely renovated, but the walls remain thin.
review.reviewText: We've stayed at the Carlton twice now. I actually didn't mean to book it a second time, but I'd forgotten we had stayed there previously. The staff is super welcoming and the location is good. And if you stay on the top floor with a room towards the back, the room has no street noise. The challenge is the other guests. The hotel is an old property and, although it has had a lovely and needed renovation on the rooms, the walls are thin.
review.negativeRemarks: Sound proofing.

review.title: Great San Francisco hotel
review.reviewText: Great hotel and experience. Hotel staff was extremely friendly upon arrival and offered us a late check-out. We were travelling with bicycles and they offered a bike lock-up although we chose to store them in our room. Upon arrival there was a complimentary wine social which was great and a very nice start to the evening. The room was clean and nicely decorated, there was a filtered water machine on the next floor which was a unique feature. The only complaint I have is that we were woken up at 5am by the sound (and smell) of the garbage truck outside our window. Overall it was a great stay and we will be back.

review.title: I don't who called boutique hotel
review.reviewText:
Very old bldg not well conditioned. Nice location and Moroccan theme but that is it. Poor sound isolation,  no modern AC or heating equipment.  Staff mostly friendly (not all) but tried to sell us city tours at much higher rate than what you actually could pay for by going to the bus directly. Strange.
I don't recommend the hotel. I consider it 2 stars at most.

review.title: Nice, comfortable hotel + an excellent restaurant
review.reviewText: Location in a quiet area but still in the city. Professional and friendly staff, inviting comfortable reception area with newspapers and serving free wine daily at 5.30 pm. Elevators. Comfortable and charmingly decorated clean rooms. The restaurant highly rated and serving excellent middle eastern food. A great experience. Will go back.

review.title: Decent Hotel near the action
review.reviewText: Nice staff, very friendly and service attentive. Indian style restaurant inside had a great breakfast (pancakes) and there was a cool bar/pizza place next door to hotel which was also great. The room was small for my taste but provided everything I needed. I asked for a frig. and received it promptly. The only issue was the air conditioner/heater which we couldn't  turn on but fortunately we were not really of need of it due to the weather during our stay. Valet will cost you but I think it's worth it. The area is downtown and not particularly clean but it was a short walk to central park area where we commuted by bus to the tourist hot spots.
review.positiveRemarks: Great Service, good food, felt safe inside the hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: Old building, could use a face lift.
review.locationRemarks: Multiple and countless bars and restaurants nearby. It was difficult  to decide at times. I suggest a tour bus to see the many popular sites in S.F.

review.reviewText: For a week long stay, you would think there would be complimentary laundry service. I couldnt believe it was a charged service.

review.title: Nice and close to shopping
review.reviewText: Staff were very friendly and accommodating. Definitely enjoyed my stay

review.title: Pleasant stay
review.reviewText: It was my third time at the Carlton and overall I think it has the best value for money in San Francisco. The restaurant is great too and the staff is funny and welcoming.

review.title: Affordable hotel close to Union Square
review.reviewText:
This hotel met our needs.  The room was quite spacious, with a large closet in which we could place our bags, shoes etc so that it was easy to keep the room neat.
The staff are extremely pleasant and helpful, they have wine in the lobby from 5-6.00 pm each day, which is very welcoming after a long day of sightseeing. The situation is close enough to walk to many areas but is also easily accessible by San Francisco's excellent transport system.
There is a very good middle eastern restaurant attached to the hotel.  We enjoyed a breakfast and a dinner there.
The hotel is noisy, both internal noise and external. It is near a hospital, so sirens were audible all the time.  Make sure you have earplugs!  I would stay here again
review.positiveRemarks: The staff were friendly and helpful.  The hotel had a nice atmosphere, it is an old restored building and has been nicely decorated.
review.negativeRemarks: Better soundproofing
review.locationRemarks: Just a few blocks from Union Square and from the Powell and California cable cars. Also on the Sutter bus line.

review.title: Paper thin walls
review.reviewText: Everything about this hotel is adequate or better, except that the walls are paper thin. I kept thinking people were actually in my room, but it was just the neighbours. Nice staff.

review.title: OK hotel in a good location
review.reviewText: Stayed at Carlton while attending a conference at the Mosconi Center.
review.negativeRemarks: Walls are very thin
review.locationRemarks: Walk to Union Square, bars and restaurants in the area

review.title: Close to GAMH
review.reviewText: It has a lot of charm, since it was built in the 20's.  It has been updated and very colorful. We stayed here because it was within walking distance of the Great American Music Hall.  We were happy about the wine tasting in the lobby and our breakfast was good.
review.positiveRemarks: The colorful decoration and the cleanliness of our room
review.negativeRemarks: Maybe a little less cost of overnight parking---$35.00

review.title: Nice hotel in the old part of San Francisco but no
review.reviewText: Nice hotel in the old part of San Francisco but not for me.  The hotel has character and design. Breakfast is Indian style. As there is an Indian restaurant downstairs. Staff is excellent. Wonderful. I didn't care too much for the rooms though. Nothing really wrong, but the building is older but has been nice, but the walls are very thin and there is space is in caps by the doors that I prefer not to be there. Overall a good experience but I wouldn't go back.

review.title: Good hotel, but not for families
review.reviewText: We stayed (family with children) and the staff was fantastic. The hotel is very well communicated and in good condition (although a bit old). The area is OK during the day, but not recommendable during the night, primarily if yo need to walk with your children after 8 pm. The rooms are noisy, and we had to call reception because other rooms were very noisy during the whole night.
review.positiveRemarks: Great staff. Helpful and very friendly
review.negativeRemarks: Better room noise isolation

review.title: No air conditioning and uncomfortable bed.
review.reviewText:
This hotel was very enjoyable and great for the price but I was very let down about them not having air conditioning. I've never been to a hotel in my life that didn't hair AC, so that was annoying because it's very loud outside at night to leave the windows open. 

Secondly, the bed was very uncomfortable and the pillows are thin and cheap. Most hotels are upgrading to memory foam beds and pillows as they're super comfortable and last forever. This place needs that upgrade. My mattress was worn out and felt broken on one side so I had to sleep on the other side. 

Lastly, they have oddly large closets in the room. The closet was half the size of the room, it would be nicer to just have a larger room with a sofa in it. Also, the sink in the bathroom is terrible. It's so fancy but you can't even fit your hands in to wash them and it also keeps clogging up and doesn't drain like normal sinks. 

I do want to mention that the gentleman at the front desk is excellent. He has designed his own artwork throughout the lower level and he takes so much pride in his job. He also performs at night. People like him make traveling a fun experience. Give that guy a big raise and a promotion, he is 75% of the experience of staying in Hotel Carlton, the other 25% is the room.

review.title: It is a boutique hotel.
review.reviewText: We enjoyed our stay at this boutique hotel.  The staff heard that we were kept up by a rowdy client and that the police came to stop the noise.  They sent us a nice little gift with chocolates, wine, and a gift card.  Great service.
review.locationRemarks: Don't walk through the Tenderloin district to get to this place if you are coming from the BART.  Come from the south east at the next station

review.title: Paper thin walls
review.reviewText: you can hear conversations from the next door rooms and toilets flushing! Doesn't make for a good nights sleep!
review.negativeRemarks: Sound proofing between rooms and corridors.

review.reviewText:
From pulling up to the hotel, the valet parking attendant was very welcoming.  The lobby decor is happy eclectic.  
The rooms are clean and cleverly designed; the amenities are expected; happy with the multi electrical/IT plug on the desk! Also a nice plus with a bathroom robe.  Newspapers in the lobby each day and umbrellas to borrow as needed. 

Upon check in, we asked for a dinner recommendation and Saha, located inside the hotel, was suggested.  
Wow, what a pleasant surprise! The food was delicious; Yemenese Arabic Cuisine.

review.title: Great charming cool hotel
review.reviewText: This was a great hotel for my six night stay for work; the neighborhood is interesting and diverse with lots of new cafes, bars, bakeries and near downtown services.

review.title: Terrible experience
review.reviewText:
Very noisy rooms. The doors are like made of papers. We could hear everything our next door neighbors were talking about. Not only this but we could also smell the marijuana they were smoking. Awful experience! 
We had to leave in the middle of the night. The staff was very apologetic and helpful.

review.title: Quaint hotel
review.reviewText: Cute from a far but far from cute. Beware you can't adjust heating and are left to open windows to hear sirens all night. Walls are paper thin which left me terrified in the middle of the night thinking someone was using my restroom! Not a great neighborhood with very little around. On the positive, great staff, nice and clean and free wine reception every evening from 5:30-6:00. Oh and the tiniest elevator I've ever seen! Quaint!
the hotel has an interesting, ethnic look to it which is pretty cool and it's located in a fun area. parking is super expensive at $40/night but we were able to find street parking in the area.

review.title: Nice for the price
review.reviewText: I'll stay there next time I'm in San Francisco. Clode walking distance to busses and trolleys

review.title: Old hotel with thin walls
review.reviewText: This is a old hotel was no amenities grouchy desk staff

review.title: No heat, broken blinds
review.reviewText: In town for JPM conference.  Needed nice, clean, comfortable accommodations.  Had to have space heaters brought in due to no heat in the rooms, broken blinds in the room.  Would not stay again.
review.negativeRemarks: Upgrade rooms to match the price.

review.reviewText: Great hotel, staff, and location. Enjoyed our stay with no complaints. I recommend staying here.

review.title: Fantastic hotel and friendly staff
review.reviewText: Great place to stay and very easily accessible from the station. Room was newly renovated and had all new furnishings. Staff were friendly and very accomodating. Would recommend to anyone staying in San Fran.

review.title: Great location.
review.reviewText: Really central and just enough out of tenderloin which can be a tricky area. Great location. Clean room. Friendly helpful staff. Reasonable price.

review.title: great service at hotel
review.reviewText:
Great hotel relatively high up. Staff very helpful. Room excellent. We are tea drinkers but I managed through tea through coffee machine.

Would recommend as relatively high up and easy distance of most parts of central city.

review.title: DON'T STAY HERE IF YOU HAVE KIDS!
review.reviewText: Well overall the hotel looks nice, its clean and the staff are great! I stayed at the hotel with a child.  We stayed for 2 nights the first night the people next door had an argument at 11pm and I could hear every word the issue is the door between the 2 rooms is not sound proof or not the proper door.  When the people  next went to the bathroom I could hear what they are doing in the bathroom (1 vs 2).  The next night there was a different couple and I could hear them having sex ( i am with a child in the room) and I could hear where they were going afterwards...  there was mold on the ceiling and the shower was dirty.  Stay there if you don't have kids ... the rate was great... the staff was great and the resturant attached the hotel is amazing.
review.positiveRemarks: the staff and and restaurant are great!
review.negativeRemarks: Clean mold off ceiling and maybe add sound proofing.
review.locationRemarks: lots of homeless people at night! didn't feel safe when I went to the market down the street.

review.title: Simple hotel for a simple stay
review.reviewText: The hotel was alright and I wouldn't go back. Part of the problem was not knowing the city that well and just picking a cheaper hotel near my destination. Understand that San Francisco is noisy in most places, has terrible parking in general, and can be dark and unsafe in a lot of neighborhoods. However, this hotel was particularly noisy because of very thin walls and poorly sealed doors. The pipes in the walls were very noisy and the heater in the room would make odd bubbly noises all night. There was no mini-fridge in the room but a very spacious closet. The hotel room was very basic. It was not a place that you wanted to spend much time. The hotel elevators were quite old as well and with 9 floors and luggage they were essential. They will do valet parking only but watch out: tow trucks will tow you alway if you spend even 5 minutes on a curb. I was lucky to have someone with me in the car to get the valet. There is no space to load/unload/wait in front of the hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: It had a colorful and eclectic decor.
review.negativeRemarks: Ease of parking/valet accessibility. Mini-fridge. Better noise insulation from hallways.
review.locationRemarks: There's a ton nearby. It's a 10 - 15 min walk to Chinatown, Union Square (shopping), and a lot of great bars and restaurants.

review.title: Great ambient
review.reviewText: Great staff, everyone is super friendly.  My hairdryer was broken & they replaced it within minutes of me calling the front desk.  The free wine tasting in the lobby at 530pm was a plus.  Would definitely stay here again. Keep up the good work Hotel Carlton!

review.title: Accessible without the expenses
review.reviewText: Just a few blocks out of union square everything was very easy to get to. Cafes, restaurants and bars and cable car near by. Nice if u want some piece n quite without being too far from the action. Staff were all so friendly and helpful.

review.title: Fabulous Staff and hotel
review.reviewText: I stay in hotels frequently for business and am so accustomed to almost rote like folks that when we arrived I was knocked off my feet by how friendly ALL of the staff was and it wasn't just the greeting as they were so helpful and friendly the entire time. I loved this hotel. It's such a nice break from the hustle and bustle of the outside world. We will absolutely come back here.
review.positiveRemarks: Friendly staff, helpful staff, quiet hotel, dog friendly, clean
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing
review.locationRemarks: It's in SF and Union Square is nearby. We attended the Nutcracker at the Opera House.

review.title: Good hotel for a few days stay in San Francisco
review.reviewText: Pleasant experience in a clean and welcoming hotel. Staff makes you feel at home from the moment you check into the hotel. Hotel is near to the airport with airport shuttle available. Good location - near to union square and cafes.
review.negativeRemarks: The walls are quite thin, resulting in occasional noises. But it is still bearable.
review.locationRemarks: Mr Holmes - cruffins!

review.title: Really nice hotel, very clean and cozy.
review.reviewText: Had no trouble checking in. The staff was very friendly and attentive. It was a great place to stay. Would definitely stay there again.
review.locationRemarks: We were very close to the famous Lombard st. and not too far from Pier 39. There were a few local bars near us that kept us entertained at night.

review.title: Excellent hotel
review.reviewText: Overall, the Carlton Hotel was excellent value for money.  The staff are efficent, friendly and make you feel very welcome.  All facilites worked as expected.  The hotel is located about 10 minutes walk from Union Square and as a consequence the place is more quiet then some hotels at or right by Union while being sufficiently close.  l will most definitely stay there again.
Good location and rate. Ask for a high floor rear facing room. Light filled and quiet.

review.title: Friendliest staff
review.reviewText: This hotel was great the staff was so friendly the rooms were nice and it's just so perfect it's basically a 30 minute bus ride from any sf tourist attraction

review.title: Pleasant
review.reviewText: The hotel staff were friendly, my room was very clean and comfortable, and the décor of the whole hotel was very nice. I was very impressed with how luxurious it was considering how much I'd paid.
review.locationRemarks: There's a good number of restaurants and cafés very close by, in addition to the hotel restaurant.

review.title: Loved this hotel so much
review.reviewText: This hotel is the best hotel I've stayed at so far. The decorations are beautiful, the staff is so friendly and funny, and the rooms are super nice and clean. Definitely coming to this hotel on our next visit

review.title: Super clean hotel but very tiny
review.reviewText:
Cleanliness is 5 stars.  Staff were excellent.
Bed and pillows were great.  There was wine complementary but I did not try. Public parking next door $20 per day was cool.  Over all 3 night Thanks Giving cost $475 was a good deal.
The only draw back that hotel was not in a nicer location and old.  I stayed in Harbor Court Hotel during the last trip

review.title: Nice hotel in SF
review.reviewText: The price for stay was good and staff were kind. I would use this hotel again if I been to SF.
review.positiveRemarks: When I couldn't connect to Wi-fi through my PC, they kindly looked into the problem.
review.negativeRemarks: I think the wall was a little bit thin so voice from next room reached my room. That annoyed me.
review.locationRemarks: There are so many things to do, for example sightseeing, eating, shopping.

review.title: Clean hotel one mile from union square
review.reviewText: Clean rooms, centric location and helpful staff. They helped me booked a 48 hour big bus tour and airport shuttle for a fair price.

review.title: Cool, comfy & great staff
review.reviewText: We had a fabulous stay at the Carlton. The staff were all incredibly helpful, courteous and funny. The rooms are great, the location perfect for exploring San Fran and the rates really reasonable. Breakfast at the restaurant was fine, but there's great brunch just three blocks away at Mymy. Would absolutely stay here again and recommend it to anyone visiting the city.

review.title: Nice hotel near Van Ness
review.reviewText: Paper thin walls and doors, all sounds in hallway and nearby rooms were audible and nearly intelligible. The hotel was beautifully renovated, but they needed to beef up insulation. Radiant heat was ameliorated by a ceiling fan and operable windows, but that let in sounds of a 24 hour city and sirens of the nearby sketchy neighborhood. Good for a get away; $35 valet parking.
Older hotel but nicely decorated with a sense of style. The staff was very accommodating.
Room could use some refreshing., bath tub was damaged and looked bad.

review.title: A hidden gem
review.reviewText: We were very happy to have found this lovely gein the middle of an overpriced city. At 4 o'clock there was a wine reception every day in the lobby with the fire going and while we were there live music    The staff were friendly always ready to call us a cab and we were walking distance to the financial District in downtown.  The rooms were kept very clean    You can't avoid the homeless people in San Francisco but I felt that we were in a safe place

review.title: Casual vibe
review.reviewText:
I have stayed here 3 times, and I'm glad to report they have upgraded and remodeled the rooms.  It used to have more of a hostel feeling, vs. a true hotel feeling.   Now, it's downright perfect.  If you enjoy boutique, casual vibe to your hotels vs. a sterile, uptight vibe from most corporate settings, Hotel Carlton is just right for you.   

From the happy hour and local music freebie, to the Nob Hill location, Hotel Carlton suits me just fine.   I love that they are eco friendly, and don't supply you with those crappy little bathroom products that take up a ton of waste.   Instead they have a dispenser in the showers that offer wonderful aromatherapy products.  I actually used all of the lotion, which I typically throw out because it is filled with alcohol --experienced that from other hotels.   I used to work in cosmetics, and I can tell you from an expert, the Hotel Carlton products are nice and work.

The room we had faced the side, not the street and I was surprised at the low noise level.   In room coffee was great, strong and not bitter.   A nice water and ice dispenser right outside our room.   Comfy bed, and easy air system.

If you like a funky vibe, and aren't uptight, try Hotel Carlton.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, friendly staff, clean rooms, bath products.
review.locationRemarks: Nob Hill location, great restaurants.   Blue Swan Oyster House on California and Polk is an experience!   Best oysters I've ever eaten.

review.title: Nice looking & good location, but tiny and loud
review.reviewText:
The hotel is aesthetically pleasing, but the front desk staff was of no help during a call prior to arrival. The room was small, but this is understandable from an old hotel building. The main upset was the level of noise. Thin windows, thin walls, and doors that feel like closet doors, we were up all night (5th floor). It was so loud that we forfeited our second night (no refunds through Expedia) and stayed at a box hotel - a good night's sleep is what we really needed.

I mention this seemingly negative information because I truly love the brand. We have been regular patrons where possible (last year we spent nearly two weeks worth of stay at The Citizen in Sacramento). Do us all a favor, spend a few dollars and build in some noise protection. Would be well worth the end user price.
review.negativeRemarks:
From above:
"Do us all a favor, spend a few dollars and build in some noise protection. Would be well worth the end user price." So loud we left.
review.locationRemarks: Cheap parking two doors down, decent restaurant next door, 10-minute walk to Union Square

review.title: Nice hotel but thin walls
review.reviewText: Everything was great- clean, good location, friendly staff. My only complaint is that walls are incredibly thin.  I could hear the people next-door's conversations and their snoring . It kept us us at night.

review.title: Lovely staff and good location
review.reviewText:
The hotel is 15 minutes walk from Union Square and has plenty of restaurants, bars and supermarkets nearby.  
The staff were always really lovely, funny and helpful.  
The decor is a bit zany but the room and bathroom were comfortable and clean, only downside is the noise from outside on lower floors and from the hallways/next room.  I was okay as I had the end of a corridor on a top floor but you could hear every noise from inside rooms as you walked down the corridor.  
We stayed as we were attending an event at the Moscone Centre which is walkable in about 20-25 minutes or a really quick taxi.  The hotel arranged a very affordable airport transfer for us too which was late but great.  
Lots of plug sockets, good iron and ironing board, safe, dressing gown and extra blankets were provided.  All in all, a very good stay.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff, the location and Sweet Woodruff, the restaurant/bar nearby.
review.negativeRemarks: Noise from hallways
review.locationRemarks: Sweet Woodruff is a great little bar/restaurant nearby. It is super casual and the staff are chatty. The food was delicious plus great beers!

review.reviewText: A very enjoyable surprise in lower Nob Hill. Cozy lobby, nice room, very friendly and helpful staff. Next time we'll make sure to enjoy the restaurant and complimentary wine hour with live music.

review.title: Nice/typical boutique hotel in San Fran
review.reviewText: Nice/typical boutique hotel.  Normally AC isn't needed in San Fran... however it was a warmer night while staying on the top floor, just to find that the hotel doesn't have AC at all.
basic hotel, kind of old and worn but sufficient for the purpose of sleeping and getting dressed, etc. nothing fancy, Updates were minor.
Clean and comfortable small hotel . I will stay again .

review.title: Noisy.
review.reviewText: Was told that I was attending a convention too late. Made the reservation in a haste. Woke up in 4 successive evening hearing cop car siren around 2-3am. Doors have gaps that sound can get in from the hallways. Adjacent room with connecting door also have gaps. You can hear door bang from four rooms away, or light conversation from the walls. Privacy can be problem. Located a block or two block from strip clubs. Walking in the evening along Larking, you will see suspicious individual lurking in the dark leaning on the wall . The staff are respectful and helpful which is a plus .
review.negativeRemarks: Sound proofing . External noise and internal noise . People can hear even the quietest conversation on the hallways and the other room.
review.locationRemarks: Located two block from strip clubs. Walking in the evening along Larking, you will see suspicious individual lurking in the dark leaning on the wall .

review.title: Nice hotel and accessible to public transport
review.reviewText: Nice hotel, the hotel staffs are very helpful. We have stayed 9 nights and thoroughly enjoyed the trip.

review.title: Cozy Boutique hotel reminds me of Europe
review.reviewText:
Chose this hotel for it's uniqueness and location. Really wanted a different type of hotel to stay in for a quick three day trip to the Bay area with a couple friends. Was not looking for a giant cookie cutter hotel. I wanted to stay at a warm, welcoming, cozy hotel. This was the place! When we pulled up to the front of the hotel the staff was extremely friendly. Check us in no problem. I added valet with in and out privileges. Excellent valet price compared to other hotels in the city. They parked and took the car out when we needed with no problems. Just call ahead 10mins from the room. 

The room was clean and cozy. Reminded me of some the places I stayed in Europe earlier this year which was great. Size of the room was perfect. Our room had a giant walk-in closet. We were able to put all our luggages in there. Took out clutter from the rest of the room. There was also a safe in the closest. The hotel room had no AC which is fine because we stayed mid October and again reminds me of Europe. It had big windows that opened all the way and a ceiling fan which kept the room nice and crisp. The room had a nice view of the neighborhood.

Friday night the lobby had the fireplace lit. From 530-6pm the hotel was serving free wine to guests. During that time Golden Gate Philharmonic Quartet was performing in the lobby for guests. It was a nice thing to come back to after a day of exploring the redwoods and the city. Other guests that were in the lobby seem to have enjoyed it too.
review.positiveRemarks:
Staff
Location
Room Cleanliness
Overall warm, welcoming atmosphere
review.negativeRemarks: Refrigerator in room
review.locationRemarks: Location was perfect. Exit out the hotel and make a right and a whole neighborhood filled with bars places to eat and hangout is just steps away.

review.title: Mediocre hotel in a sketchy location
review.reviewText: Mediocre hotel in a sketchy location. Lobby was beautiful (fireplace, nice floors, etc.) and staff was very friendly and accommodating. Main downsides are the neighborhood and that my room was way smaller than expected.
review.locationRemarks: Sketchy location. Do NOT walk around at night!

review.title: Nice hotel fairly central to most of SF.
review.reviewText: We thoroughly enjoyed our experience. The staff was friendly, courteous, and accommodating.
review.locationRemarks: Central to all we enjoy in SF

review.title: Great value and very comfortable
review.reviewText: Excellent location and accommodating staff.  The hotel was little noisy, especially form street noise (sirens, traffic)
review.negativeRemarks: Better soundproofing
review.locationRemarks: Almost everything is within walking distance. BART stop only about a 15 minute walk.

review.title: Nice hotel, 20 min walk to union square
review.reviewText: Quirky hotel, bright colors. A bit dated.  But overall nice stay for the price.  Bit out of the center. It's ok if you don't mind to walk.

review.title: Reasonable value in the City
review.reviewText:
Hotel staff is very nice and accomodating.............. location about .8 to 1.0 to Union Square. 
Reminds me of a European style Hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing
review.locationRemarks: Close enough to Union Square

review.title: European like hotel in a good location.
review.reviewText: Staff is great! Hotel is updated, clean and in a great location. Unfortunately the pipes must not be insulated and when other guest shower it is very loud. I would only stay at this hotel if I were to have business meetings and getting up at 6am. I do not recommend it for those who want to sleep past 6:30 am!

review.title: Over priced flophouse with a new coat of pain
review.reviewText:
Awful. Two fire alarms in one night. Workers hauling glass bottles on 7th floor hallway in middle of the night and making a racket. 

Really a disappointment. Not as good as a Super 8 or Best Western!
Nothing worked in the room . No AC and the fans didn't work

review.title: Simple Hotel, Great Location
review.reviewText: Overall, we had a good experience in our four nights here. The location is perfect within Union Square and there are many things accessible nearby. The staff at the hotel was absolutely fantastic and very helpful! The free evening wine social from 530-600 is also a perk. The rooms, albeit simple, fulfill most basic needs. The biggest issue we had was the lack of AC and warm rooms. However, we visited during the second week of September and average temperatures were 90 degrees, quite unusual for SF. There were no refrigerators in the hotel rooms which was slightly not ideal. I would stay here again and recommend this to a friend.

review.title: If it is hot, bring earplugs
review.reviewText:
This hotel has no air conditioning.  360 days a year in San Francisco that is just fine.  I was there those other 5 days.  It was just comfortable enough on an upper floor with the ceiling fan on, only sheets, and windows open (hence earplugs). I didn't mind the "back in the day" feel. It fit my choice of hotel experience:  an early 20th century urban mid-rise in SF.  But if you sweat like a pig or are menopausal, check the weather forecast.

Otherwise the hotel was great.  Fresh room decor as always with this boutique chain, effervescent staff, great location.

review.title: Short vacay with 12 year old grandson
review.reviewText: Perfect place for us.  Tastefully refurbished, very pleasant with wonderful view (9th floor).  Staff nice and friendly, and helpful, too.  Handy for walks, shopping and busses. Made a wonderful stay!
review.positiveRemarks: Upgraded with nice amenities, location handy, vintage was great.

review.title: Nice themed hotel.
review.reviewText: Nice decorations, had a great theme. Rooms were very comfortable.

review.title: Nice modern hotel, well located
review.reviewText: really enjoyed our stay here. Staff extremely plight and helpful. Fairly well located, but not in the main tourist section. A bit close to Tenderloin (a pretty rough area). Try and get a higher room (we were on the 7th floor) as the views are fab and the street noises barely audible.
review.negativeRemarks: A fridge in the room would have been a nice extra, but ice machines available on some of the floors.

review.reviewText: Everything was fantastic.  Only complaint is that their cable was cutting in and out on the television
review.negativeRemarks: Cable connection

review.reviewText: convenient location, clean and quiet room, very comfortable beds, and staff was above and beyond helpful
Staff were all very helpful and friendly. Parking across the street for $20 or valet for $40.

review.title: Good value
review.reviewText: Good value for $$.  Park at garage next door to save money. Nothing nice in close proximity to hotel but it's a good place to use as a base to visit other nice areas in city.  Use public transportation to avoid parking hassles.

review.title: Great Hotel !
review.reviewText: Enjoyed the stay from the moment we checked in. Staff was friendly and made us laugh as we checked in. Valet was great for parking on the street is difficult due to amount of cars in SF. Room was beautiful but realized there was no a/c. Didn't need it because windows open and we had a wonderful strong cold breeze the whole stay. Street below is loud at night earplugs were helpful. Room was very clean and bathroom. Bed was comfortable. I would stay there again. Truly enjoyed my stay and I'm a picky person.

review.title: Great hotel. Great location.
review.reviewText: Hotel was very clean. Staff very accommodating. Price is great.

review.title: Cute, basic, no soundproofing
review.reviewText:
While the hotel is cute and one staff member, Theo, was especially friendly, others were not and the walls are paper thin. Doorman was unwelcoming and fairly unhelpful. Most everything was pretty standard, pretty basic. We heard every single word the guests in the next room said - just as if they were in our room talking to us. Fortunately they were speaking pleasantly in normal voices and went to bed by midnight. If they had been partiers, we would have had to change rooms. Also fortunately, their love making was quiet, but we certainly knew exactly what was going on every minute. 
The reception clerk said he would look up our Joie de Vivre account and add our stay, he did not.
Additionally, the advertised gluten free options in the restaurant were not, in fact, available, and although I told the waitress I had a health problem and could not eat dairy, there was cream sauce on my eggs and cheese in them. My problem would not cause a medical crisis, but if you do have a problem like that, don't eat in that restaurant. (Although the waitress was quite sweet.)
None of this ruined our trip. Beds were comfortable, and everything else OK.
review.negativeRemarks:
Doorman
Soundproofing
Restaurant
review.locationRemarks:
Lots of clubs
Movie theatre

review.title: Nice hotel though not as close to Union square as
review.reviewText: Enjoyed meeting British family and other guests at evening wine reception; enjoyed the view and open windows in our room. Coffee in room was great. Staff friendly and helpful.

review.title: Nice hotel but a bit noisy
review.reviewText: the hotel was fine but the door is noisy.  when I stayed there, there were guests coming in and out late at night. shutting the doors were noisy and it woke me up several nights.  sirens was another additional noise.  better sealed windows would be nice.  over all the hotel was nice but noise was a problem.  a bit of a walk from union square but manageable.
review.negativeRemarks: change something to make shutting the doors less noisy and better sealed windows to reduce outside from noise.
review.locationRemarks: a bit of a walk from union square but manageable.  a short distance from Polk street where there are a lot of good small restaurants.  that is good.

review.title: clean but too far away
review.reviewText: It is a clean facility with a nice happy hour but it is too far away from everything.  Rooms are small and shouldn't hold more than 2 adults and 1 child like Europe. Trying to fit 4 into those rooms isn't recommended. If I were them, I would implement Europe's 3 max to a room that size. I will not stay again because of the location and size of the room.

review.title: Cute hotel, but noisy...
review.reviewText: Staff were great...friendly & helpful. Room was cute, nice size & clean. Walls were so thin, sounded like neighbors were in our room. Kept us up both nights. Heard the street traffic too - to be expected in a downtown hotel but it wasn't as noisy as the guests next door.

review.title: Friendly hotel very comfortable clean
review.reviewText: Very fine experience.  Much nicer than larger and impersonal hotels.
review.negativeRemarks: Restaurant is noisy at dinner hour
review.locationRemarks: Good location

review.title: not for sleeping in
review.reviewText:
Great staff  excellent in every way 
Rehabbed older hotel with original doors that are very loud when they shut. 
All morning you can hear  the maids and guests shutting doors 
Not the hotel for you if you want quiet in the morning to work or sleep late. You can hear 
everyone in hallways as halls are narrow.

review.title: Hotel of yesterday and today
review.reviewText: Immediate feeling of a modern vibe in an excellently cared for classic building. Staff were informative, lobby spacious and comfortable, and rooms well appointed. Area is mixed. Easy walk to Polk Street bars and restaurants. We would go back.
Great stay, no issues, good location.  Would go back again and stay here.

review.title: Great location, great staff.
review.reviewText: The room was very comfortable but more importantly, the staff was welcoming and very knowledgeable in their suggestions to first time visitors. We wouldn't have seen as much of San Francisco without their guidance.

review.title: Two days, too long.
review.reviewText: We showed up two hours after check in time to a weird interaction with the front desk and then when we went up to our room the bathroom was still dirty (trash in the cash, stuff in sink, and a wet floor). We let them know and they offered to "upgrade" our room which actually ended up smaller but at least it was clean. This hotel has a lot of potential but it was just lacking. The furniture is chipped and things are stained, there was even paint missing off of the wall. These are little things that would make the overall feel of the hotel better. We had a rental car and the parking situation is a nightmare, there is no street parking so you have to walk a few blocks to the garage that costs quite a bit. Not very convenient or pocketbook friendly.
review.negativeRemarks: Guest interactions, the front desk staff was very snooty and that's the last thing anyone who has just traveled for hours wants to deal with!
review.locationRemarks: Many coffee shops and little restaurants nearby, great if you're walking as parking is pretty difficult.

review.reviewText: My room was very noisy as it was in front of the elevator.  Also, the walls are thin so you can hear your neighbors even when they're just talking.   The location is terrible as I did not feel safe walking around the hotel to get food.  The staff was nice but that's not as important as the other things mentioned above.  Definitely not worth the money here.  It was like staying in a motel.

This is a lovely little hotel just outside of the city centre. We stayed here for 5 nights and had to change rooms due to neighbours 'making noises' next door - we let the staff know the next morning and were upgraded to the top floor room which was much quieter. Overall - a nice stay.

review.title: very nice hotel, accessible to everything
review.reviewText:
We really liked the room, very nice bed, huge closet, clean bathroom.
Couple of things though: 1) I wish it had a mini-fridge where you can store some stuff and 2) I wish the bathroom had more counter space, there is hardly none, so you had to put my shaving kit and my wife's items on the cover of the toilet.  Otherwise, the hotel was very nice, Don't forget to have wine tasting at 5:30pm. One more thing, don't waste your time and money at their "Saha" fusion Arabic restaurant; I'm middle-eastern and did not care for the food nor the prices and the atmosphere; very expensive for portion of food the size of "hockey puck" and playing Indian music at Arabic restaurant, What's that all about???
review.negativeRemarks: Add mini-fridge and more counter space in the bathroom
review.locationRemarks: very nice location; two blocks to Van Ness Street which is a major street, catch Muni # 47 to go to the beach

review.title: Great location-- slightly off the touristy path--
review.reviewText: Thoroughly enjoyed our stay-- the restaurant is delish!

review.title: Not a 3-star hotel
review.reviewText:
Room and bathroom are minimal. Putting some colorful paints on the walls doesn't make it a 3-star hotel.
Bathroom was very basic.
It was very awesome. Hotel staff was very nice and sweet.

review.title: Great location, walked everywhere
review.reviewText: Frisco is just a big dirty city the hotel is an oasis in the city.

review.title: Nice staff, old, loud building.
review.reviewText: We interacted with 4 staff members, who were all extremely nice. The lobby is gorgeous. Our room was decorated nicely, but the window looked out at a concrete wall 10 feet away; so no view or sunlight, which made the room quite depressing. Also the building is old, so noises carry! We could hear every word of the conversations between the couple next door. Most of the noises came from outside I think. We slept with the pillows on our heads to cut down on the noise!

review.title: Step out of chaos and into comfort!
review.reviewText: We stayed for our Son's wedding at City Hall. We arrived on Thurs close to 3pm check-in after surviving SF city traffic. Arrived tired and with some culture shock with practically every driver in a hurry unphased by random double parked vehicles. The valet parking is great once the busy arrivals are cleared. Hubby stayed in the car just up the hill from the hotel entrance and I checked in which took a very short time since I had booked with Expedia and all charges were pre-paid. Staff were very friendly and quickly helped with luggage and valet parking. After some sightseeing in the city we returned for quick valet assistance. Our room was comfortable and we were on the 8th floor right corner which gave a view of local activity at the corner store a few blocks south which is noisy with windows open but when closed is not a bother at all. Liked ceiling fan for air circulation during warmer March weather. Bathroom fixtures were nice and it was clean. Room decor was nice too. Beds were comfortable and although the room had two double beds and was narrow and long, the 3 of us (hubby, myself and teenage son) made good use of larger walk-in closet for storing luggage and as a changing room. Hubby and son ventured into the neighborhood for breakfast and found really fresh fruit, eggs, pancakes at local mom-pop store. Overall we felt very comfortable during our stay. The staff are friendly and attentive. Valet parking is worth the reasonable charge. Lobby/wine tasting very nice too!

review.title: What a treat!
review.reviewText: This is a great little hotel. We arrived to an unbelievably friendly and helpful staff. Were given a very quant room way up on the 8th floor with a nice view. The room was clean and comfortable. The real gem of this place was the staff. They knew exactly where to send us for great seafood or pastries in the morning even cheap t-shirts for the kids.
review.positiveRemarks: Great staff, nice rooms, great location
review.negativeRemarks: The walls are paper thin or my hearing improved greatly while staying there.
review.locationRemarks: Easy access to the BART, cabs, trolly and locations of interest.

review.reviewText:
Really liked the place. The breakfast menu was great and what I tried was super tasty. More sophisticated menu was available on the weekend and I loved the crab egg benedict. Their chef is a genius. 
Overall good location, nice and clean.

review.title: Charming gem in sketchy neighborhood.
review.reviewText: Tough to select a hotel in SF. Most are pretty expensive. I was on a tight budget but I didn't want to stay in a dump. I found the Hotel Carlton fit my criteria. Geographically, good location. The photos on line didn't do it justice. It is a beautifully renovated space, middle eastern feel, small rooms but nice, trendy cultural decor, beautiful photography throughout. The water pressure in the shower was a little low but tolerable, no biggie. The Niagara force toilet more than made up for it. The gentleman that checked us in on our late arrival was friendly and very helpful especially when it came to parking arrangements. Otherwise the only other contact with staff was with housekeeping, very loud at times. On the downside, the walls are thin. The couple in the room on the other side of us had no volume control on their voices. You could hear just about everything including, well, I'll stop there. I know the hotel has no control on their guests but I do wish management would post a sign on every floor and in every room that said something like "You are NOT the center of the universe so please, as a show of common courtesy to your fellow guests, be as quiet as possible. Thank you". The neighborhood was a little sketchy. Some homeless close by, hookers on the corner the last night we were there. Nice bar next door. A bakery with a long line of folks every morning just around the corner. Walk a little further and some good local bars and eateries. Not a quiet hotel but nice.
review.positiveRemarks: Geographically, good location. It is a beautifully renovated hotel, middle eastern feel, small rooms but nice. Nice little restaurant in hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: Thin walls, noisy neighbors, very noisy housekeeping.
review.locationRemarks: Nice bar next door. A bakery with a long line of folks every morning around the corner. Walk a little further and some good local bars and eateries.

review.title: Nice interior design concept.
review.reviewText: The hotel itself was clean, comfortable, and had very cool rooms. I would have liked to have had a microwave/fridge and free parking. Parking ranges from $20-40. Other than it was great and the staff was helpful and nice.

review.title: Nice design and friendly staff
review.reviewText: Very easy to get to the hotel coming in from the Golden Gate. Check in was really fast and welcoming. Top floor room was small but clean and nicely appointed. No air conditioning but the room was comfortable with the ceiling fan and open window. Dinner in the restaurant was amazing.
review.positiveRemarks: Friendly and helpful staff. The concierge was fantastic. The restaurant was really good. The rooms are well designed with Middle Eastern touches.
review.negativeRemarks: Ice bucket in the room would have been good. Had to use the glass pitcher provided.
review.locationRemarks: Good location, about a 15 minute walk to Chinatown, 20 minute to downtown, 1 block off bus route.

review.title: Not sure if this is typical of downtown San Fran.
review.reviewText:
I found this to be a bizarre hotel experience.  The primary thing to me is that it was not only fairly expensive by Big City standards, but also *not* air conditioned.  I've never in my life stayed at a hotel that lacked Air Conditioning, nevermind one with such a high MSRP.

The desk staff was also pretty rude, too.  A coworker and I were trying to find a breakfast place, and they acted like we were bothering them asking.

Flip-side... The hotel atmosphere was great, and the rooms were clean.  The restaurant was incredible.

As my review goes, the negatives were entirely about the rude desk staff and the shock of having to sleep in a room without AC.  I was thankful the air temperature outside was unseasonably cool, but the cleaning crew decided to turn on the heat.
review.positiveRemarks: The atmosphere and the restaurant were great.
review.negativeRemarks: Air conditioning.  Seriously.

review.title: NICE hotel
review.reviewText: beautiful experience....... i loved  !!!! For sure we gona come back there
review.negativeRemarks: yes
review.locationRemarks: top

review.reviewText: This was one of the more affordable hotels I found for just staying one night.  It's close to Polk street which has a wide variety of bars and clubs to go to at night. I really enjoyed the hotels culturally ethnic theme/decor.  It felt more warm and inviting than most hotels.  Also, a plus was that Expedia allowed me to checkin early to the hotel and gave me the option to request things about my room (e.g. A view, 1bed or 2, etc.) Overall, I had a great experience!

review.title: Nice older hotel
review.reviewText: Hotel built in 1920.  From 5th floor to 9th floor upgraded.  Rooms are small but very clean.  Hotel staff is very friendly and helpful.  However, it is located in the Tenderloin district which is not the safest area of San Francisco.  Centrally located for public transportation including Cable Cars.
review.positiveRemarks: Cleanliness of the hotel and the staff.
review.negativeRemarks: Staff should be more helpful directing people to other restaurants in area.
review.locationRemarks: Not a safe area so not comfortable out at night.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: We planned a night out on the town on Polk so this was a great location. Loved the complimentary wine in the evening(530-630) and the vallet per night around 35 which was a great deal compared to our other night stay at another hotel. Staff was extremely friendly and check in and check out was quick and efficient . Will def. be going back !!

The Hotel Carlton was a very nice place to stay. It is an old hotel that has been well taken care of. I read a lot of reviews that mentioned being able to hear the neighbors. We did not here the neighbors, but we did hear everything going on in the hall and if you are in the hall, you can hear what's going on in the rooms as you walk by. Our room was comfortable and clean. The service is great. For the money I would definitely stay here again.

review.title: Not what I was expecting
review.reviewText: The staff was good, but the hotel wasn't quite what I was expecting. They should have put more money into the building renovations. My room was on the alley side but the traffic noise made it pretty hard to sleep. It is time for better windows.  You could also hear every noise in the hallway. It was not surprising when there is a one inch gap at the bottom of the 60 year old door. I could also hear every detail of our neighbors phone conversation (could have been a lot worse). Additionally, the bathroom was so small my six year old said he couldn't turn around in there. He was right. There was no room to move at all and no place to set your stuff. You should also know that it is not very close to the heart of Union Square. However, the biggest surprise was the $78 parking expenses I received over the course of two days. At least they allowed for in and out privileges so you can go pay high parking prices elsewhere. The experience was ok but was not impressed enough to ever go back.

review.title: Excellent location, very pleasant & helpful staff
review.reviewText:
Excellent, would definitely use again
Very close to many of SF attractions
Best bakery in SF just around the corner
5 min walk to Union Square
review.negativeRemarks: none
review.locationRemarks: within walking distance to many of SF attractions

review.reviewText: Very friendly. Pretty oriental touch and decoration.
Clean, comfortable and good location.  10 minute walk to Union Square.  You can get an Uber anywhere.  Not many amenities but that was fine.

review.title: pleasant stay 15 minute walk from Powell and Marke
review.reviewText: The hotel is clean with a superior staff.  All the staff have happy faces and will do what is necessary to make sure the stay is a good one.  The building is an older one.  the rooms are roomy but basic. However the wi fi was fast and reliable in the rooms.
review.positiveRemarks: The Staff, service and good wifi.
review.negativeRemarks: A little more sparkle in the rooms
review.locationRemarks: The hotel is a 15 minute walk from Union Square.  Also there is a large grocery store across the street.The Public transportation on Van Ness is 5 min

review.title: Nice hotel close on near Union Square
review.reviewText: The room is really small and lights bright through from other room's door.  No Bell Boy.
review.locationRemarks: Wow! Lot of up and down sidewalk.

review.title: Nice hotel. Wonderful staff.
review.reviewText: Great staff. Clean rooms. We were always welcomed when we entered and left the hotel. The staff called the shuttle service for us when they saw they were running a bit late. Great great people.
review.negativeRemarks: Can't think of anything.
review.locationRemarks: Nobb Hill is close by. The bus is close by.

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: The hotel was very nice and the location made it easy to get all over town - either walking, cable cars or busses.  The staff were all great.

managementResponses.response: We are so pleased that our team went above and beyond in service during your stay at the hotel. We are continuously improving the guest experience and will use your feedback for future renovation projects.

review.reviewText: Off the beaten path, tired hotel but nice staff.  For the price, it was ok but not great.

managementResponses.response: We are sorry to hear about your experience with noise at the hotel. Please be assured that we do our best to ensure a good nights sleep for all of our guests. We are sorry that we fell short in your case. We are glad you enjoyed the decor of the hotel!

review.title: hotel in center of the city
review.reviewText: while the hotel and room were clean and decorated pretty (Hindu inspired decor) be aware the walls are paper thin so the smallest noise to the loudest chatter can be heard throughout the entire floor. Although the hotel says it has a quiet time from 10-on the noise level was high and persistent until about 6am from outside and inside the hotel. Furthermore, For some reason someone thought it was a good idea to hammer something until 3 or 4 am. If you plan on being out all night until the morning then this is the hotel for you, if you want some rest at a decent hour then it's not.

review.title: Right hotel in the right town
review.reviewText: From the minute we arrived at the hotel, weary from our travels, the hotel staff welcomed us like long lost clan, handed us a bottle of wine & showed us to our room. Nothing more really needs to be said, that night set the tone for our new home away from home.

review.title: We will be back!
review.reviewText: My wife and I greatly enjoyed our stay. The Hotel Carlton is a well refurbished, character hotel, in a central downtown location of San Francisco. A newness without loosing it's history, or charm. We are retired, but had no difficulty finding excellent dining and entertainment  at the hotel and within a few blocks. Transportation to and from San Francisco International, Fisherman's Wharf, China Town, museums, Golden Gate State Park, tour buses, etc. greatly expanded our trip to view the Ai Weiwei art exhibit on Alcatraz. We are from Denver and the culture of the Hotel Carlton and San Francisco was just what we were hoping it would be. We will be back! Thank you.

review.title: Convenient city center location
review.reviewText: Friendly staff, great location, old boutiqu-ey; and rooms very clean.

review.title: Bad experience, good staff
review.reviewText: Bed bugs! Staff dealt with it as best they could but still not a good experience.

review.title: Central San Francisco hotel
review.reviewText: I chose this hotel knowing very little about the city of San Francisco, but based on maps it was close to public transit, including about 8 blocks to BART. The downside is that 8 block walk was through a less than pleasant neighborhood that featured many panhandlers aggressively panhandling, including following you for a block or 2. During the day time this was a different scenario. It was convenient to bus lines, and getting around was easy. The room was comfortable, and the amenities were adequate. However, the walls were paper thin. Any noise in the hallway always sounded like it was right outside our door. Our neighbor for the few days we were these had 7am speaker phone calls daily, it it sounded like they were in our room. Also, we were on the third floor and traffic noise from the street below was always a nuisance, especially the 7am seemingly daily trash pick up. The slat blinds also did a poor job of blocking light, in fact at night the room flooded with outside light. The shower seemed cramp, and the shower curtain leaked water on the floor every time.
review.positiveRemarks: The central location near transit was a big plus. The comfortable bed was nice. The hotel character was nice, plus it wasn't a chain.
review.negativeRemarks: The biggest improvement that could be made is noise deadening, it would have changed a lot about my review.
review.locationRemarks: The hotel is near many MUNI buses and the BART, making it very easy to access the entire city and Bay Area. Really close to museums and the City Hall.

review.title: Fantastic Staff!
review.reviewText: We had a great experience, start to finish. We arrived our first night, just as the free nightly wine serving was in full swing, live music playing, friendly staff mingling with the guests and the folks just stopping in for a glass of wine. Staff was helpful and friendly.  Edgar was funny, kind and helpful with advice. Room was clean, comfortable and nicely decorated. Location was perfect, especially for folks that want to just walk and experience the city. Will stay here with out a doubt, when we visit again.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing.
review.locationRemarks: Great location.

review.title: Comfy hotel with nice details
review.reviewText:
The hotel is very well located, a few blocks from the busy Union Sq., where shopping, transport, tours and other interesting attractions are located. 

Nice interiors with details and decoration resembling east Asia. Rooms are not so spacious but are nice and have the basic things any traveler would need. 

The restaurant menu is simple but delicious, personnel at it was very attentive. Personnel is most helpful assisting with parking, tickets to tours, events, directions to attractions, etc.
review.negativeRemarks: I guess price is a bit higher due to location and the city itself, but with this ammount you could get a nicer room in other location.

review.title: Great Decor and Location
review.reviewText: The Hotel Carlton was an excellent location in San Francisco and their "worldly" decor was absolutely gorgeous and completely my style.  The hotel puts on a free wine tasting daily from 5:30-6pm with live music (on Saturdays.)  The staff was super friendly and willing to answer any question we had.  The room was nice - a decent size and VERY clean.  The only negative thing I would say is that the walls are pretty thin and so you can hear your neighbors frequently.  Yet - quiet hours from 10pm - 8am seem to be well respected so it wasn't much of an issue.  The hotel restaurant, Saha, was also delicious.  I definitely recommend this hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: The walls are thin - so you hear a lot of stuff that goes on in the hallway and outside.  That's a hard (and possibly impractical) fix.
review.locationRemarks: The Fillmore is a great venue - has awesome shows.  Union square is right around the corner and tons of great restaurants in the area.

review.title: Great stay!
review.reviewText: Simple hotel but has everything you need. Nice and clean and bright. Hotel staff was great! Very friendly and helpful. A bit of a walk to the Bart but not too bad. Good central location.

review.title: Boutique Hotel In City By The Bay
review.reviewText:
My husband and I spent the Valentines weekend at the Carlton Hotel on Sutter St.  If you appreciate the charm of historical buildings then you will appreciate the Carlton. from the old school elevator to the original photography in the rooms and in hallways, the owners of The Carlton have created a beautiful, like home experience.  It feels as if one is the most important guest by all employees.  I would definitely recommend the Carlton to anyone who wants to experience San Francisco but does not want to be in the tourist trapped areas.

Satisfied.Customer
review.negativeRemarks: Water pressure in shower could be a little stronger.
review.locationRemarks: Walking distance from Union Square, near Polk Street with lots of bars, and music.

review.title: Loved the Carlton!
review.reviewText:
Felt like I was treated like royalty there! Very
Inviting and comfortable! Good vibes too. Stayed for three nights to attend writers conference at the mark Hopkins. I only live 45 miles from the city but didn't want to commute. I grew up in San Francisco so this was the first time I've ever stayed at a hotel in the city! So much within walking distance and thoroughly loved it. I'd go bank in a heartbeat

review.title: Very clean, friendly and helpful staff.
review.reviewText: Very noisy. Could hear the guests in adjoining rooms. Could hear everything from the street even on the 5th floor.

review.title: Really disappointing.
review.reviewText: The hotel website is completely misleading -- this isn't an updated-yet-classic property in a trendy neighborhood with a hip bar next door.  You pick your way through trash, beggars, hookers, and dog crap on the sidewalk to an old building where the corridors, elevator, and rooms are tiny and free of most amenities. The bathroom compares -- unfavorably -- to an airplane lavatory.  The walls are paper-thin and the room door even thinner, so you hear every conversation and every forcing of room keys into the sticky locks all up and down the corridor. The walkie-talkies carried by housekeeping blare at all hours, and the cleaning staff started banging on the door every 5 minutes starting at 8:30 AM on Saturday morning.  The best efforts of the very pleasant desk staff just can't make up for this cramped, noisy, outdated, and wildly-overpriced property. This surely must be the lowest-budget asset in the otherwise-pleasing Joie de Vivre group -- try ANY of their other properties, and you'll be better off.
review.negativeRemarks: Shut it down and remodel it, top to bottom.
review.locationRemarks: Skeevy neighborhood, littered with trash - both literal and human. The only nearby attraction is the Tenderloin.  Stay ANYWHERE else in San Francisco.

review.title: Good loction.  But rooms next to the street noisey
review.reviewText: Very pleaseant hotel.  Nicely appointed.  Rooms were spacious and tastefully done
review.negativeRemarks: Seems pretty good the way it is.
review.locationRemarks: Embarcadaro and Ferry Building.  One Embarcadero for shopping

review.title: Great hotel and wonderful staff.
review.reviewText: We loved the friendly staff, even the housekeeping staff were just as friendly as the desk staff. We enjoyed the wine in the lobby at 5:30 and the musician that came into play and sing. We loved the fresh, clean feeling of the room and the very nice bathroom. Another plus for us were the photographs in the room. We have seen too many hotels with bad, awful art so it was a real pleasure to see something that was good.
review.negativeRemarks: Didn't think of anything.
review.locationRemarks: The location was very convenient--close to shopping at Union Square, the opera house and symphony.

managementResponses.response: We are so glad you enjoyed the guestroom decor and service from the team at Hotel Carlton. We are sorry to hear that your neighbors disrupted your nights sleep. We hope you still enjoyed your time in San Francisco.

review.title: Nice room, thin walls
review.reviewText: First impression of the hotel was good. It was in a decent location and the rooms were quaint and unique. Things went a bit downhill the first night when we could hear the couple next door making love, long into the night. The next night we heard the couple above us in a domestic argument. We poked the walks to see if they were actually made of paper (kidding, of course) as we could hear everything the people in the next room were doing. Despite this, we liked the look of the room and the staff were friendly.

review.title: Awesome hotel but bordering on a bad area
review.reviewText:
The staff are lovely here - all of them were friendly, quirky and humourous. Really made the experience interesting. Wine receptions at 5.30pm are a nice touch too, although we only managed to make it to one evening. The rooms are clean and modern, and have a great exotic aesthetic to them. 

The only issue is that the hotel borders on the Tenderloin area, which is home to a LOT of homeless people, which was a bit of a shock to us as first time visitors to San Fran. As long as you head north to the wharf, or east to Union Square it's fine, but don't go directly south - it's a bit of a shock to the system.
review.locationRemarks: The Fly Bar next door is affordable and good. It's about a 15 minute walk to Union Square, and a 15-20 bus ride to Fisherman's Wharf.

review.title: Very good value
review.reviewText: The hotel is a beautifully remodeled and redecorated older building with a very friendly vibe. The staff is friendly and helpful. The rooms are clean and pretty and include everything one needs to be comfortable. There is nice Middle Eastern restaurant on the premises that serves 3 meals a day. It has a bar that serves beer and wine, no cocktails. My only criticism is that it's located in a neighborhood that's a bit unkempt and there's not much to see or do within a couple of blocks. All in all, though, a very good value and an enjoyable place to stay!

review.title: Not bad, but know what you're getting . . .
review.reviewText:
I recently stayed at the Carlton when I was in SF for business.  Many other hotels were booked and so I took a leap of faith based on its generally favorable reviews.  

The staff was pleasant and I enjoyed the vibe of the Carlton.  Unfortunately it also suffered from some issues that would prevent me from recommending it, particularly for business travel.  

The Carlton is located very near or in the Tenderloin, meaning that it's easy to walk into a sketchy situation within a block or two of the hotel.  It is also nearly a mile from the nearest BART station, and it's fairly hilly walk.  My room was generally pleasant, but I found it unpleasantly warm, and opening the window to get fresh air presented its own problems, because the neighborhood is VERY noisy.  There is a bar next door and repeatedly during the night I was awakened by the crash of what sounded like an entire large trash can of glass bottles being dumped.  The traffic noise is also unpleasant.  

Overall, while I liked the staff and the facility reasonably well, I would not recommend the Carlton.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff and decor were very pleasant.
review.negativeRemarks: Location, noise level, addition of air conditioning so the room could be cooled without opening a window.
review.locationRemarks: It's the Tenderloin.  There are some tasty ethnic restaurants locally but it's generally a seedy neighborhood.

review.title: Good
review.reviewText:
There was very clean and comfortable.
and the staffs were kind for me.

review.title: Excellent hotel.
review.reviewText:
Brilliant Hotel. Lovely Tibetan touch. Good location. Well priced. Lovely rooms. 
Highly recommended.
review.negativeRemarks: Only thing is that the walls are a little thin.
review.locationRemarks: Close to everything.

review.title: Intresting place
review.reviewText: Hotel was nice enough inside staff was extremly friendly and helpful also. The only down fall is the neighborhood a block down was little sketchy. But other than that good place to stay.

review.title: Nice hotel
