review.reviewText: Friendly staff good location comfortable rooms. I'd certainly stay their again

review.title: Great hotel in great location
review.reviewText: Fantastic boutique hotel in the heart of the city. The staff are so helpful and friendly, the rooms were clean and comfortable, it was reasonably priced, really I have no complaints about the hotel. Would recommend it to everyone.

review.title: Wonderful find in San Francisco!
review.reviewText:
The staff was so very kind and accommodating!  I am not fond of sterile modern hotels.  This place had a comforting established feel.  The room in two hues..a lovely light blue on the ceiling, cream on the walls, charming edgework on the floor and door frames.  Lovely artwork on the walls.  Nothing like the chain hotels.    The room was a calming place for this single female business traveler.  Clean and updated bath, VERY comfortable bed.  I was warned that the neighborhood was "transitional".  While not luxury, it was a city street, like so many and I never felt unsafe.  
The staff was very kind and helpful...even getting the elevator for me when I had to run up to the room after I had checked out to get something I forgot.   They supplied a map of SF along with areas to "avoid" (they weren't that bad)  and a good place to grab breakfast...the wine and live music in the charming lobby in the evenings gave me a welcome place to relax before dinner.  The restaurant in the hotel, Saha,was fantastic!   My friends and I had a wonderful meal with great service.
Location is central to most everything I needed to get to.
review.negativeRemarks: Elevators kinda slow...not much to do about that.
review.locationRemarks:
nicely central in SF.  
DeYoung museum
Chinatown, Northbeach, The Wharf a short cab (or Uber) ride. (could be walked if you have comfortable shoes)

review.title: Nice hotel in lower Nob Hill area
review.reviewText: The rooms are a bit small, but they are nicely renovated and very clean.  The hotel staff is delightful--they are all very friendly and helpful.  The front desk staff, in particular, are very witty and make you feel immediately at ease.  They greet everyone with, "Welcome Home."
review.negativeRemarks: Rooms are a bit small, but they cannot change that.  The elevators are quite slow, too.
review.locationRemarks: Lower Nob Hill, close to Union Square--tons of restaurants very close by.  The restaurant in the hotel is also very good.

review.title: Cozy hotel
review.reviewText: Very friendly staff  make you feel at home immediately. Good central location

review.title: Was good until 2am
review.reviewText: Hotel was really nice!  Rooms are great with wonderful staff.  Everything went great until shortly after 2 am ( bars closed?) and the neighboring room came back.  They were talking and it sounded  like they were right inside our room.

review.title: Way exceeded our expectations!
review.reviewText: This was a last minute booking and we could not have been happier!  It was not only very clean and comfortable but extremely stylish with a restaurant that I would recommend whether you are staying at the hotel or not. The staff was lovely and made us feel extremely welcome and at home. I love the International flavor and the emphasis on Moroccan style in the Decour and at the restaurant which was delicious. The rate for low season was extremely reasonable and I would definitely stay here again when I return to San Francisco.

I enjoyed my stay but I had a wake up call for 4am and they never woke me up. I missed my flight! The manager did make good on it promptly but .. Otherwise nice stay. Good location pleasant staff. I would stay again even with the wake up call issue.
review.negativeRemarks: don't trust the wake up call.
review.locationRemarks: Fishermans wharf,china town

review.title: Wonderful hotel near Union square.
review.reviewText:
The staff went above and beyond to make our stay enjoyable. Our rooms were immaculate, well decorated and comfortable. The onsite restaurant served a phenomenal breakfast!
The only downside is that due to the age of the building, the walls are very thin..

review.title: Great value for SF in beautiful historic hotel
review.reviewText: Beautiful historic hotel with lots of great restaurants, bars, and music venues nearby. Nice city views available. Staff was amazing. Hotel walls are paper thin, though, so you can hear all activity in the hallway and in the next room. Free wine happy hour with live music was really fun. Saha, the attached restaurant, is also fantastic.
review.positiveRemarks: Great location, value, and staff. Also a cool historic building.
review.negativeRemarks: walls are paper thin, so you can hear everything.

review.title: Great downtown location.
review.reviewText:
Right  in the middle of downtown in a busy section of the city.  No parking. Clean, comfortable room.
Quiet in spite of location.  Would stay here again, if had business in the city.
review.locationRemarks: Close to good coffee shops & walking distance to great overall shopping.

review.title: Nice Hotel in a Transitional Neighborhood
review.reviewText:
The hotel is an older style building that has been renovated and updated.  The front desk staff we're incredibly friendly and accommodating throughout my entire stay (1 week).  The room could best be described as what you would expect when you go to visit a close relative - bed/bathroom/closet.  The room was very clean and appointed with a desk and chair, device charging station, a comfy stuffed chair next to a window, a good size closet with ironing board and iron, in-room safe, dresser, and big TV.

The bathroom includes a shower/tub combo with excellent quality toiletries and was very clean on check-in.

The hotel is located on the edge of the Tenderloin neighborhood which is in a very urban area and can feel a little sketchy at times.  I walked in the evening without being hassled, but was usually in my room by 10pm, or took an uber to the hotel if I was going to be later.  There is access to the hotel entrances by room key card if you're going to be later than midnight.  Morning walks were quiet and I usually passed a few professionals walking to work.

I can't stress this enough - If you're not used to continuous city noise (sirens, city vehicles, people yelling/shouting/laughing loudly) this is probably not the place for you to stay.  If these noises help lull you to sleep, then you'll have no issues.

Special shout out to Theo at the front desk who helped me with my stay.  He also runs the nightly wine tasting and fills in as the entertainment some nights.
review.positiveRemarks: Comfortable room - Windows that open - Ceiling fan was a bonus - Excellent toiletries
review.negativeRemarks: The only improvement I could think of was the sound insulation.  The walls are a little thin, but that's to be expected in a older building.
review.locationRemarks: Cable car a few blocks away, restaurants (Fly next door, and Golden Coffee for breakfast), there's a small market one block down if needed.

review.title: Cozy, chic hotel near downtown
review.reviewText: I would like to say that the staff was really helpful in providing us sightseeing tips around town based on our short stay in SF. They made every effort to make sure that our stay was comfortable. The room, bathroom and toilet was spotless clean. The only thing we thought it would make sense to add was a fridge.
review.positiveRemarks: Comfortable bed, clean room and very helpful staff. Will definitely consider staying here again during my next visit.
review.negativeRemarks: Our room could have included a small fridge
review.locationRemarks: Chinatown, Columbus Avenue....

review.title: It's all good at the Carlton
review.reviewText: Yes, you can tell the Carlton is a older hotel, by the size of the rooms and bathrooms but the place is meticulously clean and very tastefully furnished. The staff was wonderful and very accommodating, our iPod playing clock radio did not work and they had a maintenance man there within five minutes to put in new batteries and make it go. The room and bathroom are spotless, The in and out valet parking was reasonably priced and very convenient and we simply could not of had a more pleasant stay. When we had back to the big city the Carlton will be on the top of our list.
review.locationRemarks: It's two blocks from the major bus line on Van Ness and three blocks from the cable car line on California. It's a little close to the tenderloin and

review.title: Great restaurant friendly staff and funky elevator
review.reviewText: Comfortable bed with modern bathroom in a cosy room.

review.title: Wonderful
review.reviewText: I loved this hotel.  It is beautiful, cozy, and the restaurant is good.  The elevators are really small but decorated with cool maps and photos of the world.  Having a string quintet playing on Friday night was the best moment of the stay.
review.locationRemarks: It's a solid walk to Union Square, if you don't like walking I guess you wouldn't like it.  Very close to the cool Farm:Table cafe!

review.reviewText: overall I would go back but the bathrooms are tiny.  The bedroom is large but if it is warm there is only a fan.  Staff is the best.

review.title: Great price for super cool rooms.
review.reviewText: I thoroughly enjoyed my stay. Being from the south, I would have enjoyed a little more heat output from the furnace in the room but other than that no complaints! Cozy rooms, staff were friendly and funny.

review.title: Nice hotel staff and decent rooms
review.reviewText: I really like the staff at this hotel.  Very friendly and will try to help you with everything.  The rooms were alright - thin walls - spent two nights listening to a couple next door fight.  It was not a pleasant sleep.  The beds were comfortable and the bathroom were clean.  I think if the walls weren't so thin I would have given a better rating.  The distance to Union Square and Chinatown was not bad at all.  It is about 20 minute walk.  Overall, I would recommend this hotel to friends but be inclined to tell them if you need a quiet sleep this is not the hotel for you.  Even with ear buds I don't know if that would solve the issue.  It didn't for me :(
review.positiveRemarks: Friendly and helpful staff. Distance to some of the sights.
review.negativeRemarks: Don't know if the thin walls can be improved.
review.locationRemarks: Union square. Chinatown.

review.title: Nice, but rooms are too close to one another
review.reviewText: Nice, warm atmosphere and incredibly inviting staff.  My only complaint was the proximity of my room (606) to the adjacent room.  There was a door that separated the 2 rooms and there was about an 1" gap from the floor to the bottom of the door.  Hence, I could see the lights on, shadows as they walked near the door and could hear "everything" from my neighbors room.  I assume they could hear me as well.  The good news is the we both were very considerate and kept noise to a minimum.  Given a choice, I would stay here again, but only if there was a room with a bit more privacy and one that didn't require tip-toeing around early in the morning and late at night.

review.title: Very nice hotel. The staff were incredible.
review.reviewText: The staff were so polite and helpful. The hotel is near Union Square and located at the lower part of Nob Hill. Will be back!

managementResponses.response: We are thrilled that you found Hotel Carlton to be a warm, welcoming ambiance with very clean guestrooms and common areas. We are in the midst of several soundproofing projects to help improve our historic building for our guests. We hope you visit us again once these projects are completed.

review.title: Not great
review.reviewText: Really nice staff and very clean.  It's an old hotel without air conditioning and the windows only opened a few inches so we were a little warm.  Wall are paper thin and we could hear entire conversations from 2 doors down.

managementResponses.response: We are sorry to hear you had trouble with our parking services at the hotel and with the team member who helped you upon arrival at the hotel. We have spoken to the team so other guests do not encounter the same experience. In addition, we have worked with our housekeeping team to ensure they are quiet in the mornings so as not to disturb our guests.

review.title: not friendly, noisy hotel
review.reviewText: i'm not high maintenance at all, and i've traveled quite a bit to a variety of hotels both in and out of the US. this is probably the worst hotel i've stayed in. first of all, valet isn't real valet. it's basically park your car wherever on the street and bring in your key and they'll give it to the driver whenever he comes back. the staff at the front desk is ok, i think the person who helped me wasn't the greatest but the other gentleman seemed to be a lot nicer. the room size was fine, but the bathroom had a used bath cap which was kind of gross. as for sleeping, the hotel has quiet hours since their walls are literally paper thin. our neighbor got up to pee and i heard them open the bathroom door, pee, and flush as if they were in our room. anyways, back to the quiet hours - they end at 8am. apparently that means that the hotel staff is free to scream and yell in the hallway, yell over their radios, and make horrendous noises when cleaning. I was actually shocked at the lack of respect for their guests. they know their walls are paper thin, why wouldn't they then be extra considerate. it was incredibly frustrating.

review.title: Nice hotel , not far from Union Square
review.reviewText:
Nice hotel, a bit old. Location is okay (15min walk from Union Square).
Wifi was okay , not the best.
No A/C at rooms, and fan too slow in my humble opinion...

review.title: Will go back again!
review.reviewText: I was actually surprised, after reading the reviews I thought it would be a so so hotel. But when we got there the staff is very nice. And the hotel room was quaint, I did really enjoy the hotel room. A couple of downfalls were  the hallways were kind of smelly and  outdated.  And, it was noisy outside when we kept our windows open.  That's bearable. We will stay there again.
Staff was amazing! Great place would recommend the place. For sure I will return again when visiting sf

review.title: I was pleasantly surprised!
review.reviewText: Entrance was nice, Everyone was very friendly.  The elevator was cool! When I walked into the room I was surprised at the room decor. The bed was comfy, nice pillows!  A very simple painted dresser that looked liked it may have been old and just refinished I found to be new. Same for the bathroom. I would definately come back again!
review.positiveRemarks: It was quaint, but every detail was very nicely done. Very clean!!!
review.negativeRemarks: Really nothing that I could see.
review.locationRemarks: I was there for work. I just like that there was a variety of places to eat.

review.title: Staff was incredibly friendly and accommodating!
review.reviewText: I would definitely stay at Hotel Carlton again. In addition to being vey hospitable, the location was a short walk to union square.
Room was very noisy, next to ally,. Woke up at 6 am from garbage collection outside window... Had to change room

review.title: Comfy and friendly.
review.reviewText: Very friendly staff, especially T(h)eo who rocked the stage during the complimentary wine hour.

review.title: An usually hot week in SF
review.reviewText:
The staff was terrific. The rooms very pretty. If it's hot stay in lower floor room. 
Oh and bring books for the elevator!

Restaurant is excellent!

review.title: Beautiful hotel with lots of character!
review.reviewText:
We stayed for just one night at the Hotel Carlton for a birthday weekend/mini-vacation in San Fran and it was a genuinely unique experience. Upon arrival, we were greeted by a hilarious and ridiculously accommodating front desk agent. We were actually able to check in four hours early which was quite a surprise. The lobby is in a Moroccan-esque style with beautiful framed photography all throughout the building. You can tell it is an older establishment but they have done such a fantastic job with the decor, it felt brand new. The rooms are clean and beds very comfortable. Pretty noisy at night, but the iHome makes for easier listening than the street noise. Wine reception was great, as was the space/electronic music that was entirely unexpected. It also gets VERY warm at night with just the ceiling fan to keep you cool. 

Overall, a great experience. Probably the best customer service I have ever had at a hotel.... ever. Would definitely come back again.
review.positiveRemarks: The decor, friendly ambiance, wine reception, clean rooms.
review.negativeRemarks: Bigger bathtubs, air conditioning, better quality towels.
review.locationRemarks: Location was very central. Easy walking distance to a lot of good restaurants.

review.title: Wonderful Experience
review.reviewText:
Very lovely hotel! Great service, wonderful art that's welcoming but not run of the mill, comfy beds. Peaceful and clean in a modern environment. 

Try not to check in between 5:30 & 6 as the wine reception packs the lobby. It's very festive but if you are registering and parking and stressed from travel it's like crashing a party in your own house that you weren't invited to. If you arrive earlier, the wine reception is a great start to a beautiful night in San Francisco! 

Breakfast in the morning is a breeze in the restaurant. Very prompt service and delicious!

review.title: Great updated rooms and lots of light
review.reviewText:
Our stay was very pleasant. We liked the room, modern and clean , with lots of light.
We only put a 3 on the room comfort since there was a door between our room and the next one, and you could basically hear eveything that was happening in there: talking, TV, coughing, toilet... Fortunately we had a quite quiet neigbor, but it could have been a nightmare, and it also made us very conscious, as, if we could hear them, they could hear us...
review.positiveRemarks: The room itself, the location. The 5pm wine reception was kind of neat.
review.negativeRemarks: As mentioned above, the fact we could hear everything happening in next room...
review.locationRemarks: Great location, close to all exciting spots

review.title: Too noisy, no AC
review.reviewText:
My two big beefs were the fact that this hotel had no double paned windows, so traffic might as well have been driving through my room. Also NO AC. Had I known that, I would never have booked in the first place. If it was there in the info and I missed it, my bad. The ceiling fan did not create enough air and it was impossible to open the windows because of the noise. I usually like the AC fan noise as white noise to help me sleep also. 

The staff was nice and the room was clean. If city noise isn't a problem with you then this hotel would probably be fine.

review.title: Nice hotel near Union square
review.reviewText: Lovely staff, walking distance from Union square.

Enjoyed the hotel.  The location and everything were what we needed.  
Was not happy with the 2nd Floor room, next to the stairs, above the restaurant.  It was noisy and a lot of foot traffic.  I would definitely stay here again, but would prefer something on a higher floor, further from stairs and elevators
review.positiveRemarks: Loved the Boutique feel.  The complimentary wine and music evening was enjoyable.

review.title: A sweet little boutique.
review.reviewText: I've visited SF many times so I am familiar with the neighborhoods that border this hotel.  One direction can be a bit seedy while the other direction is Nob Hill.  If you are comfortable with the fact that you are not in Kansas and need to use common sense, you will enjoy your stay.  The staff was very helpful and I enjoyed my room.  I only had breakfast at the hotel but it was very good and the people working in the restaurant were very kind.  I would stay again and recommend to friends as the experience overall was very good.  If you are willing to walk a little further to Union Square, this hotel beats other 3 star hotels in Union Square.
review.positiveRemarks: Staff were kind and my room was very comfortable.
review.negativeRemarks: The restaurant has very good food but the look needs to be updated to be a bit more welcoming and in line with the décor of the rest of the hotel
review.locationRemarks: A little bit of a walk to Union Square but buses can get you to Fisherman's Wharf quickly and great shopping in on Hayes is walking distance.

review.title: Good hotel
review.reviewText: Hotel staff was very friendly and funny! They were able to switch our rm from 1 king bed to 2 full beds to accommodate having an extra friend tagging along. Good location close to union sq and restaurants.

review.title: Good central location
review.reviewText: Good stay with some very interesting scenery that comes out at night

review.title: Comfortable & clean hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel was clean, quiet and comfortable. The hotel is also well located, c. 10min walk away from Union Square and few minutes walk away from the cable cars taking you to Fisherman's Wharf. Afternoon wine hour was a nice touch.

review.title: Great place to stay...
review.reviewText: Lovely, spotlessly clean boutique hotel. Staff was extremely friendly and helpful. Easy walking distance to Union Square where we got on the hop on, hop off bus ( tickets available at hotel) to all the major sites. We also walked to China Town and Fisherman's Wharf ( good walking shoes required ). Upon returning to the hotel each day at 5 pm we were greeted by a glass of wine and live music in the hotel lobby. A classical quartet one day and reggae keyboards the next. The hotel restaurant has great Mediterranean food and good atmosphere. Only downfall is it can be a little noisy. If you are a light sleeper bring earplugs. We would definitely stay here again!

review.title: Nice staff.
review.reviewText: It is in a pretty central location for many things.

review.title: Older Hotel
review.reviewText:
Although fairly centrally located, it is still a bit off the beaten path.  Bus service is readily available which will get you anywhere you want to go.  

The hotel itself, while comfortable and clean, is a bit in need of updating.
review.positiveRemarks: Friendly, knowledgeable staff.  The room was clean and comfortable.
review.negativeRemarks: The street noise late at night is the only significant complaint I have about this hotel.
review.locationRemarks: Although it is centrally located there is not much to do or see in the immediate vicinity.  The public transportation options are very good.

review.title: The Carlton
review.reviewText: My husband and I enjoyed our four night stay at the hotel. A 30-minute evening wine and music event allowed guests to mingle and share experiences. We had two excellent breakfasts. A pleasant experience for sure.
review.positiveRemarks: I liked the international visitors who chose to stay at The Carlton. We also liked the maps and pictures that lined the two elevators.
review.negativeRemarks: Improve the quality of the wine.
review.locationRemarks:
The area has several Middle Eastern restaurants. 
Located in a fringe area, the hotel will appeal to the more adventuresome traveler.

review.title: Convenient hotel close to major streets & sights
review.reviewText: My friend and I stayed in San Francisco for a week, and we stayed at the Hotel Carlton. The staff there are very friendly and accommodating. In terms of tourism, if you purchase tour packages where the tour company offers complimentary hotel pick-up (which is what we did; we purchased tours to Yosemite Nat'l Park and Monterrey/Carmel), they definitely know (or should know) of Hotel Carlton and offer to come pick you up from your hotel so that you don't have to go to a meet-up spot (very convenient if the tour is early in the morning). The rooms are decently spacious, but not very big, although it was just enough space for my friend and I. The rooms were clean when we arrived, and everything was in working order and good condition. There is no fridge, but they do provide a Keurig machine with coffee and tea. Unfortunately they don't provide complimentary breakfast at Hotel Carlton, something that I thought would be standard with most hotels, including the Hotel Carlton. It is close to Union Square and several other attractions, such as "the crookedest street in the world" on Lombard Street, which is just up Hyde and close to the Hotel Carlton.
review.positiveRemarks: It is located in a convenient location; there are lots of eateries around, it is close to major streets (and therefore major transit/BART/Muni routes)
review.negativeRemarks: Offering complimentary breakfast to guests.
review.locationRemarks: Location is acceptable, although it's on the edge of the Tenderloin district/neighhourhood, which is a rough/run-down area of San Francisco. See above

review.title: Sister trip
review.reviewText: After a long day on the road and arriving to the hotel, the staff was not only prompt, professional & caring, they were very, very funny. My sister (who has traveled very little) was extremely pleased & comfortable which was very important to me as her little sister and guide. In looking back on our trip to San Francisco and the hotel, we wished we had stayed longer to dive  a little deeper into the city and all of it's little gems.
review.negativeRemarks: A kiosk or board that listed local neighborhood activities/events for visitors. (e.g., concerts, comedy shows, art shows or music, etc.)
review.locationRemarks: Not being very familiar with San Francisco, I felt this was a nicely located hotel near all of the touristy things.

review.title: Great hotel.
review.reviewText: 20 minute walk to union square and only a few small hills.  Lots of places to eat close by, not fancy places, but alright after a long day of site seeing. Very close to vibrant nightlife if you are young and into that sort of thing

review.title: COuld hear people in the other rooms and corridor
review.reviewText:
Stay was alright. Could hear other people in the next door rooms and corridor. 
Very disturbing

review.title: Great location, amazing staff
review.reviewText: Stayed at the hotel Carlton for three nights and it was such a pleasant experience. While the building itself is quite old ( meaning thin walls and lots of street noise) it was decorated beautifully with renovAted and modern bathrooms. The hotel offers complementary wine tastings at five And while me and my friend missed the event, Edgar, an amazing employee brought us each a full bottle of our choice to enjoy at our leisure. The staff is incredibly accomidAting and friendly, making the check in/out process effortless. The location of the hotel is within a five minute walk to union square and Powell street trollies. While the hotel is located in an area that is bit older and shabby, it is a perfect area to get around on by foot and therefore a minor con against the hotels many pros. I would definitely stay here again without hesitation.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff was Great and the location unbeatable
review.locationRemarks: Close to Powell cable cars and union squAre

review.reviewText: Was ok! Probably will not stay here next time. Expensive for what you get, but still ok.

review.title: Pleasant hotel in SF
review.reviewText: The Carleton Hotel is obviously making an effort to place themselves in the boutique category although I would not go so far as to agree. Our room was pleasant and decorated to differentiate it from run of the mill hotel décor. Problems were the hotel was noisy (you could hear slamming doors, clunking footsteps on the metal stairway nearby, voices in other rooms) very audibly.  Don't expect a bunch of extras in the bathroom.  They supply bath gel, shampoo, and conditioner dispensers in the shower, but the bath gel, while it was filled, did not work. There was a bar of soap for the sink--that was it. I didn't bother complaining--just used the shampoo instead in the shower. The hotel is on the cusp of the Tenderloin, so be aware if this bothers you.  I visit SF regularly. This a decent hotel at a decent price for SF.  Would I stay here again?  Maybe, if something better was not available.  It would be okay.

review.title: Wonderful staff, thin walls
review.reviewText: Staff at the Carlton are exceptional; helpful, funny, professional and efficient.  The hotel itself is spotless with great decor, comfortable beds and close to both Union Square, transportation and many wonderful restaurants.  Our only problem was the thin walls; unfortunately we had a noisy couple next to us and got a earful of their arguments, bathroom habits,  pre-partying conversations and sex life.  Staff were very responsive on the evening it was very bad (pre-party gathering with a couple of extra people who had no problem shouting and swearing), but they can't do much about structural issues. I regularly stay at boutique hotels and this is the first time I've had a problem with this kind of noise.  If you're a light sleeper, I would try another Joie de Vivre hotel or bring earplugs!
review.negativeRemarks: Re insulate your walls and invest in double pane windows to cut down on street noise, however, I know that's not likely to happen.
review.locationRemarks: In the Tender Nob area, some homeless, walking distance to Union Sq, Chinatown, lots of good eats.

review.title: Staff was very helpful and very willing to help
review.reviewText: Hotel clean, staff was wonderful, rooms were cozy and clean.
We stayed for 2 nights. The location is great, the design/style of the interior of the hotel is nice and warm.

review.title: Very good location for a tourist.
review.reviewText: Good downtown location, good price/ performance relationship.Clean. Excellent attention and kindly clerks.
review.negativeRemarks: Seems to be remodelled...
review.locationRemarks: Close to Market St and Union and ChinaTown. Metro & BART stations.

review.title: Good location old hotel
review.reviewText: The location is good but the hotel is very old. No fitness center. The room key is not working.

review.title: decent hotel
review.reviewText: Not worth almost $400.00 per night. simple, clean room. The room has a tv but does not have channel for Giants games. Incredible for a San Francisco hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: location to where my business appointment was.
review.negativeRemarks: charge about half of what i paid.
review.locationRemarks: i was not there for pleasure.

review.title: Great stay in a central location
review.reviewText: The staff were very friendly and helpful; I liked the little touches like the framed pictures of staff and their favorite spots around town. I stayed for 7days, the room may be small for two but it was clean and comfortable. The neighbourhood is in transition - there is a rough edge amongst the new and quirky shops that are popping up.
Great hotel, worth the money. It's not to far from Polk street. Not to mention the free all you can drink wine. Ask the front desk.

review.title: Great hotel! I was pleasantly surprised!
review.reviewText: Holel was close to restaurants and events we attended. It was Clean, comfortable, friendly. A true winner, affordable as well . Great staff, eager to please. I will return .  It was a lot like a iGreat hotel in Europe . Not super huge rooms but sufficient and very clean and comfortable .

review.title: Nice location and staff
review.reviewText:
Hotel Carlton is  a great place to stay if you want to be away from the Embarcadero, Union Square Fisherman's Wharf area. Some of the reviews I had read warned about thin walls and they proved correct. It was not so much street noise, but the interior hotel room hallway/ service noises. 

I was very excited there was a Keuring coffee maker in room, however mine did not work. There is also a shower dispenser of shower gel, shampoo and conditioner which was a great amenity, however the shower gel did not dispense. 

Overall the staff was very friendly and accommodating. The location and room itself were great especially for a single person staying the weekend. I wish the hotel had a coffee shop and room service :)
review.negativeRemarks:
- Noisy hallways
-Thin Walls
review.locationRemarks:
- Border of Tenderloin/ Nob Hill
- Close to Polk Street
- About a $10 ride to anywhere else in the city

review.title: Hidden Gem
review.reviewText:
My wife and I were looking for a hotel last minute and found this the night before. The price was comparatively low and I was skeptical of what this place would be like based on the reviews I saw here. Turns out it was fantastic! The staff were very friendly and we were immediately upgraded to a top floor, corner suite. It's true that the walls are a bit thin, but the hotel was quiet at night and we had no problems or complaints at all. 

We had no troubles with the free WIFI at all.

The room was well appointed, though no fridge. Great bathroom and bed, very clean. We both thoroughly enjoyed our stay and couldn't believe others hadn't rated it higher. The neighbourhood is a bit rough, but it's SF. I will definitely be staying here again the next time I go to SF. 

If you need to park, there is a parkade next door for $20/24hours.
review.negativeRemarks: Thin walls, but wasn't an issue when we stayed
review.locationRemarks: Thai Idea - vegan Thai restaurant within 5 minutes walking. AMAZING.

review.title: Original boutique hotel
review.reviewText: Would have loved to stay longer. Enjoyed this updated hotel with all of the comforts of home. The staff was quite nice and very helpful. I made the reservation through Expedia but was given a room on a higher floor by the clerk. She said it would be more restful for us.

review.title: Internet deal
review.reviewText: Great price, great room, quiet! Staff very accommodating

review.title: Too much Noise, Room no insulation.
review.reviewText: terrible experience, too much noise, people smoking, playing music in the rooms and no body take actions to control the people.
review.negativeRemarks: windows and walls must be insultated to control noise.
review.locationRemarks: just clubs and bars not too much to see arround.

review.title: Nice hotel. About 5 city blocks from Union Square
review.reviewText: Nice hotel. Nice room finishes. Very noisy, though.  Walls were very thin.

review.title: Cute boutique hotel
review.reviewText: Super cute boutique hotel. Front desk staff was very friendly and smiley. Room was big enough. Wish there was actual counter space in the bathroom, but that seems to be the way it is in SF. Area is a bit sketchy, but again that is pretty normal in SF. Room was clean and bed and pillows were comfortable. Wifi was speedy. Wish they offered coffee/breakfast.

review.title: Would Stay Again
review.reviewText: The hotel staff was extremely pleasant and helpful for the duration of our stay.  We had cancelled at a different hotel and booked here instead, upon obtaining a good rate and reading the reviews. The room was large for in the city, very clean, the bed was extremely comfortable, and the bathroom looked newly rennovated.  The walls a little thin, so it is a bit noisy, but, overall, I would be happy to stay at Hotel Carlton in the future.  The restaurant on site serves a great breakfast at a very reasonable price, as well, and the staff is extremely cordial.

review.title: Welcoming ambience in mid-priced city hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel lobby provided some pleasant surprises, Happy hour with complimentary wine and a quaint middle-eastern restaurant. Front office staff were polite and generally helpful. Seems popular with domestic tourists to San Francisco.
review.negativeRemarks: Bathrooms and amenities.
review.locationRemarks: Location is less than perfect in terms of undesirable people in the neighborhood. The next door Bar and restaurant outlet is very convenient for guest

review.title: Nice near union square
review.reviewText: Best part of the hotel is the complimentary wine services everyday 5-6 pm

review.title: Very central hotel for all the cities attractions
review.reviewText: Very good hotel, with friendly staff. Happy half hour is too short and should be extended to an hour. Room was a good size which makes a change for a city hotel and both room and the rest of the hotel was spotless. Loved the decor with touches of colour a really good idea. Second time I have stayed here and hopefully won't have to wait another 7 years till I'm back. It was good first time around and didn't disappoint second time either. Thoroughly recommend this hotel for all it has to offer and it's great location.
review.negativeRemarks: The free wine half hour should be extended to an hour
review.locationRemarks: Very close to Nob Hill but also the rest of downtown, so don't need a cab

review.title: Noisy hotel in dodgy area
review.reviewText: It is not normal in north america, in 2014, to hear your room neighbor talking, snoring or watching tv just like if he is in the same room than you. I felt like I was in a hotel in Bangladesh. I will never be back to this hotel and may be even any of the A joie de vivre hotels
review.negativeRemarks: add a microwave and fridges, and the insonority
review.locationRemarks: a little bit dodgy but not scary. few nice resto near by.

review.title: Great hotel great price!
review.reviewText: Got our room on sald was a litgle worried about the area but it was better than expected. Free wine and music made the night very memorable. Overall an amaxing and unique plsce, would definitely come back.

review.title: Great budget hotel!
review.reviewText: The rooms don't have every convenience, but the staff makes up for it. No minifridge, but they put our food in the employee's refrigerator.

review.title: Nice
review.reviewText: I like the Hotel. Thin walls like they say. But charmingly appointed.
review.positiveRemarks: The decor and cleanliness. Bed was comfy too.
review.negativeRemarks: Noise from the staff. They really bang on your door. In my case they bang loudly and then came back, did it again---even though I'd replied loudly!
review.locationRemarks: Nice restaurant next door. Easy to get cabs--walk around...

review.title: Hotel Carlton
review.reviewText:
The Hotel Carlton was a pleasant surprise for our first visit to such an old hotel. The rooms were very updated with modern bathroom fixtures, efficient heating, and a comfortable bed. The maid staff was very friendly and the desk staff was exceptionally helpful and friendly and very funny. They were always ready to help with any of our problems or questions and had a quick connection to the cab company. Everyone behind the desk was great.

The neighborhood is old with limited dining available. A local business advised against go out alone a night in this area. Need to take a cab everywhere.
review.negativeRemarks: The dining room service and menu could be upgraded to offer a better selection of items. The food was good but limited in choices.
review.locationRemarks: This location in an old part of SF is not great due to the closeness of the Tenderloin district. The hotel has no control on it's location.

review.reviewText: We booked this hotel the day before and it was just what we needed. Great location, staff was helpful, and wine happy hour was awesome.

review.title: Loved the staff, location, room
review.reviewText: There is no A/C as many reviewers will tell you. But the hotel tries to tell you that the ceiling fan helps. No, it really doesn't. Loved everything else about this hotel. But there was no sleeping in 90 degree weather in this hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: Everything but the lack of A/C. Staff are phenomenal!
review.negativeRemarks: Better fans if not retrofitted with A/C

review.title: Nice hotel - not in the best location
review.reviewText: The staff and hotel were really nice, however this the area is on the edge of Tenderloin which attracts some of the more interesting characters.
review.negativeRemarks: The rooms carry noise especially in adjoining rooms so better insulation around these woudl be good.
review.locationRemarks: As mentioned above the location is not perfect, you are near the centre of SF but it is a leittle seedy

review.title: Odd area, but nice boutique hotel
review.reviewText: This hotel surprised me a lot. I booked last minute, was originally going to stay futher in the Tenderloin district but decided against it. This hotel was very clean with a very friendly and helpful front desk. Room was clean, but it got a bit cold in the room at night.
review.positiveRemarks: Wine tasting in the lobby was great. Also the staff made the experience good!
review.negativeRemarks: The elevators were very small it was hard to get luggage in and out.
review.locationRemarks: walking distance to union square and near the 47 bus stop that takes you to Fisherman's warf.

review.title: Pleasant stay
review.reviewText: The situation of the hotel makes you walk a little bit more up and down compared to hotels in the Financial District and Union Square but it's ok, public transport takes you wherever you need to go right in front of the hotel. Rooms are not that big but nicely decorated especially the bathroom. Hotel staff was so friendly and helpful. Although we didn't try the restaurant it seems to be good because it was always full. Yes, the walls are thin and if you have a noisy neighbour it might get boring. Internet is working for free. Be prepared to pay 35 usd + tax if you rent a car and leave it with the valet parking of the hotel. On weekends it might be easier to find a place to leave the car in the street but during weekdays it gets very difficult. Overall opinion: it's worth its price and price-quality is ok.
review.positiveRemarks: Very friendly staff Bathroom decoration Coffee in the room
review.negativeRemarks: Better isolated windows Noise from neighbours
review.locationRemarks: See above

review.reviewText: it was okay. it was okay. it was okay. it was okay. it was okay. it was okay. it was okay. it was okay. it was okay. it was okay. it was okay. it was okay. it was okay. it was okay. it was okay. it was okay. it was okay. it was okay.
review.negativeRemarks: the noise is unbearable. paper thin walls, so much city noise, hallway noise, etc. too much to get a good night's sleep.

review.title: Just too cramped
review.reviewText: The hotel staff are very helpful and pleasant. Unfortunately the hotel is very outdated with small bedrooms and bathrooms that might as well be a closet. There is no air conditioning. Walls are paper thin and you can hear what's going on in the next room which is sometimes more than a person needs to know.
review.negativeRemarks: Really nothing.
review.locationRemarks: Downtown close to union square and Chinatown

review.title: Amazing staff, great location!
review.reviewText: Very pleasantly surprised with this hotel. Great price for the quality of hotel. Hotel was very clean and nicely decorated. Had a great city feel to it! Hotel room made me feel like I was staying in a really nice San Fran apt. Staff were so friendly and helpful. Walking distance to great restaurants and most tourist spots. Would definitely stay here again!

review.title: Great service
review.reviewText: We stayed 4 nights here and found the location very convenient when using the MUNI system. Many bus routes very close by as well as California Cable Car. Rooms were clean and view from corner unit was great. Heard previous comments of noise from other rooms/halls but these were few and did not bother us. Staff was very helpful and the free wine time at 5:30 was unexpected and a nice way to mingle with staff and other guests. We will definitely stay again and would recommend to others who are looking to explore San Fran.

review.title: Nice Place!
review.reviewText: Great location near all the tourist locations. Old bulding but with modern bathroom and room fixtures. I would stay again.

review.title: Great hotel close to Union Square
review.reviewText: We had a great couple of nights at Hotel Carlton. The staff were very friendly with a welcoming personalized map, a great room with a view and happy hour! We will recommend you to friends.

review.title: One night stay. Loved Sahah restaurant for dinner
review.reviewText: Incredible food. Easy location near Davies hall polite valet free wine to joy of life club member . Live music in lobby and free wine hour to all. Lively!

review.title: We'll be back!
review.reviewText:
Beds are the comfiest I've ever slept in!
Location is spot on for union square and fishermans wharf
Free wifi is a bonus as is the ice machine
Thanks for making our first visit to San Francisco a memorable one.

review.title: Old fashioned-modern comfort
review.reviewText: The staff were welcoming and extremely helpful throughout our stay. The ambience was old-world, yet up-to-date with international touches we loved.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing
review.locationRemarks: Great restaurants, close to bus lines, easy access to museums and the wharf.

review.title: Charming older hotel. Comfortable, inviting.
review.reviewText: Staff was outstanding and accommodating. They catered to our every need--taxi's, restaurant info, etc. LOVED the 5:30PM wine reception (with music). This was a time when all the hotel guests came together and shared their day in San Francisco! Beds were very comfortable. We had a very good experience.

review.title: Nicely decorated and situated hotel.
review.reviewText:
I stayed at the Carlton Hotel twice while on business trips and probably will again.
It's well located and although you will find some shady looking folks walking around the area, that is true for most of San Francisco anyway. I like the fact that it's not a huge brand hotel so you don't get lost in the corporate blanket.
review.positiveRemarks: Great decor, home-like feel and good size.
review.negativeRemarks: There were a few scuff marks that could have been painted but it's minor and I like perfection.
review.locationRemarks: Great place to get breakfast is Jins Cafe 2 blocks down on the same street. They make a SPECTACULAR fresh orange juice.

review.title: Very nice hotel, conveniently located
review.reviewText: Hotel is clean, staff was nice and helpful, walking distance to many attractions in the downtown of San Francisco.

review.title: Walkable to places of interest.
review.reviewText: Hotel staff friendly. Larger room than expected. 5:30 pm wine reception with musical entertainment was a nice touch. Better soundproofing needed between rooms but I wasn't bothered enough to prevent a return stay. Great restaurant, Saha, in the hotel. Good low cost breakfast options within a two block area.
review.positiveRemarks: Great price for easy access to local areas of interest.
review.negativeRemarks: Soundproofing between rooms.
review.locationRemarks: Great location. Easy access to Union Square, Cable Cars. Would be uncomfortable walking this section of Sutter Street by myself at night.

review.title: good location comfortable and affordable
review.reviewText: The hotel was very clean and the rooms were comfortably furnished.. The staff was very friendly and accomadating.
review.positiveRemarks: I liked the location and the accomdations at this hotel Also liked the fact that is was a Green hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: The only complaint was that the noise from the street was loud and distracting.
review.locationRemarks: The hotel was close to Union Square and many restaurants.

review.title: Lovely green hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel is very environmentally friend. I really support their idea. The rooms were comfortable but a bit noisy. We keep getting connecting room, which we could hear every conversation from the next room. Our first room also had traffic noise, we mentioned to the staff and she gave an upgraded room at no charge. The room with city view was great but still a connecting room. This hotel would have been a 5 out of 5 but the noise from the connecting room, made me quite uncomfortable. But I would return and remember to ask for a non connecting room next time. They had great service and nice food.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: I decided on a whim to take a trip to the city and needed a place to stay. I was lucky to find this cute little boutique hotel close to all my favorite spots! The only issue about this hotel is that it is old and you can hear a lot of outside noise and people in their rooms through the walls. If you are a light sleeper you may not want to stay here but other than that if you need a nice hotel give this a try.

review.title: Average hotel, with very pleasant staff.
review.reviewText:
The location of the hotel was pretty close to major areas and attractions by car or bus. The staff were very friendly and the best part of our stay.

The hotel itself is older with refurbished interiors. The walls are paper thin - we could hear the occupant in the next room snoring loudly. Every night, we could hear the loud sirens of ambulances and fire engines. Maybe that was the area we were in. There is no air conditioning but there is a fan, which is fine for March.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff were very friendly and helpful.

review.title: GREAT FOLKS - GREAT LOCATION
review.reviewText: Overall the hotel was great - I didn't love the restaurant and wished they had other options. The mattresses were too soft for my taste. The staff was so upbeat, kind and helpful.
review.positiveRemarks: The Staff was the best. The rooms were a nice size and nicely appointed.
review.negativeRemarks: The mattresses and the restaurant.

review.title: Beautiful rooms
review.reviewText: The hotel staff was absolutely amazing. Made our entire trip.

review.title: Quaint
review.reviewText: The room I stayed in came with one King size bed, one complete bathroom, a standard television, walk in closet and side desk tables with table lamps atop. The bed was made well with a handful of pillows organized aesthetically. The material of the mattress was loft and just right for a good nights sleep. The bathroom was spotless and I especially liked the flat base sink, very unique! I was on the fourth floor where I was able to overlook Sutter st. and neighboring buildings. Overall, the ambiance of the hotel is engaging and pleasant. The staff were helpful and the creativity of design of the hotel was applaudable. One thing that was not fond of was that the conversations from next door could easily be heard into my room. The walls appear "thin."
review.negativeRemarks: Adjacent walls of hotel rooms. Reduce noise intrusion.

review.title: Great Overnight Adventure
review.reviewText:
THEO! Love Theo. He was the most important part of our journey at check-in. Big Smiles and warm greetings. I'm sure we could have asked him for anything and he would accommodate us.

This is a more budget conscience boutique hotel, but did not skimp on our expectation. It gave us all that we needed in terms of location, valet parking, large and comfortable lobby and easy access to our rooms and the in-house restaurant. The property is close to Civic Center, Hayes Valley and the Van Ness street artery that takes you out of The City, north to the Golden Gate Bridge. Our room was a double with a decent view. The room was clean, no dust or dirt present. The bathroom was clean with the usual quality amenities. Keurig and a great size T.V. in the room. Complimentary wine was a nice plus, as was the wine hour.

I have stayed here before, years ago and apparently I enjoyed the visit enough to return here. And we would return again. We didn't dine in their restaurant, Saha on this visit. On my previous visit I was impressed with their Arabic Fusion menu. Most of all, thank you Theo for your warm and hospitable greeting.

One note on neighborhood, it borders the seedy Tenderloin - just be careful.
review.positiveRemarks: Quirky and worldly...great feeling of travel. The décor in the rooms, halls and lobby is great
review.locationRemarks: Civic Center, Hayes Valley, Symphony, Opera, Van Ness Street/major traffic artery

review.title: Pleasing
review.reviewText: I had a great time! There's an amazing restaurant in the hotel where we got dinner and Sunday brunch. The room was a bit small, but we had a king size bed and a decent view. It was my birthday so they gave us a free bottle of wine. The walls are a bit thin, but we weren't disturbed. It's a perfect location and there's a bar right next door which was pretty decent and comfortable. We walked to Japantown and could have easily walked to union square. There's access to all sorts of public transportation. And they'll give you a tourist map and mark the fun destinations. If you come by car, park at the lot on the corner (the staff will direct you). It's $20 per day or $28 with in/out privileges, versus $35 if you let the hotel park it. The staff are nice and they have some happy hour keyboard music and wine tasting. We just walked through, but noticed there were a good amount of people. I can't wait to go back!!!
review.positiveRemarks: The restaurant, location, free wine, staff, room view.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing really.
review.locationRemarks: Japantown, Union square (both about 6 blocks). Nice bar next door. The hotel's restaurant, Saha, is a must for dinner and brunch!!!

review.title: Great location near lots of restaurants, concerts,
review.reviewText: Interesting restaurant - safa, would stay again. Nice Quite room, helpful staff, Wish Safa was open on Sunday.

review.title: walking distance to Union Square and shop
review.reviewText: Hotel is nicely appointed, had a great walk in closet (!) and is convenient to downtown. There are some places to eat (cafe types) nearby; the restaurant food was good. The staff was exceptionally friendly and helpful. We were overall very pleased with this hotel except that there is no air conditioning. Even though we were there in February, it was exceptional weather, daytime highs in the low 60s, 40s at night and we were too warm to sleep well. The second night we opened the window, and there is a ceiling fan which helped, but easily regulated air temp/flow would have improved the experience.
review.positiveRemarks: Unique decor gives it character; it's not cookie cutter. The staff was so friendly and helpful, they made us feel welcomed.
review.negativeRemarks: air handling in the room
review.locationRemarks: Near Nob Hill, an easy walk to shopping and Union Square. parking options are valet at the hotel or for lesser charge parking garage across the st.

review.title: Great staff
review.reviewText: The staff was fantastic! My lady and I walked in to the reception and were treated like old friends. After some laughter and paperwork, the fella upgraded our room for free. The water purifier built into the ice machine was a definite perk.

review.title: Affordable hotel a few blocks back from Union Sq
review.reviewText: The staff here were absolutely fantastic, the room was lovely and they brought us a fridge without us having to ask, free of charge. The hotel has a lovely charm with a fireplace roaring in reception and it smells lovely.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing.
review.locationRemarks: The hotel is about 5-10 minute walk back from Union Square with lots of cafe's, bars and restaurants nearby. The cable car is within a quick walk.

managementResponses.response: We are so happy to hear you enjoyed the lobby and elevator design at Hotel Carlton. We appreciate your comments regarding cleanliness at the hotel and will ensure our housekeeping team is notified so other guests do not have the same experience.

review.title: Decent hotel with deep cleanong required
review.reviewText: Lobby georgeous, elevator perfect for an older hotel. Hallway ok.. Hotel room...we could hear every word the person said next door ALSO, we could hear them going to the bathroom, coughing + everything else. Yuk. The walls were really dirty, the lights dusty, ...really dusty. Room smelled of extreme incense. Keurig machine..a plus.The room

review.title: Nice hotel, 10-15 min walk from Union Square
review.reviewText: Great, great staff. Professional, friendly, witty, efficient. Great housekeeping staff too. The hotel is in one of the rare buildings to have fared well in the 1989 earthquake due to its ancient but well designed anti-seismic basement steel structure, says the hotel brochure. Tis an old building. The room was comfortable with cable TV and HBO. Free wifi had limited bandwidth, which was enough for email and downloading must of my work files (no videos). (You can get higher bandwidth if you pay.) Very clean bed linen and bathroom. One inconvenience was the central heating. The radiator had some sort of air valve to let the air out and therefore improve the heating efficiency of circulating water (especially on the top floor, where I was). It obviously worked very well (that thing got nicely hot!) but the valve made a pressure cooker sound of varying volume and in the middle of the night that was not welcome. Typically one purges the water circuit from time to time to remedy this so I don't know what the deal was here. I saw an electric radiator in the hallway of my floor one morning so I might assume my room wasn't the only one with a heating glitch. In San Francisco, even in February, it's not much of an issue, though. I just heated the room during the day and turned the thing off at night. I saw they were remodeling the whole second floor, so I think this hotel is working hard to improve. Given this positive energy, location, and the price, I would definitely stay there again
review.positiveRemarks: Location, price, excellent staff at front desk, restaurant, and housekeeping
review.negativeRemarks: Heating on the top floor is very efficient but a bit noisy
review.locationRemarks: Union square 10-15 mins walk away

review.title: Nicely priced hotel right near Union Square.
review.reviewText: Just a one night stay in Feb. 2014. They allowed us to check in early which was nice. Room was dorm-like but for one night it wasn't that bad. City view was alright as well. Nice bathroom. Overall pretty darn good.
review.negativeRemarks: Increasing the "happy hour" to an actual hour. Its only a half hour. And maybe a little better quality of wine.
review.locationRemarks: Its SF, there is stuff everywhere.

review.title: An Older Hotel with Character
review.reviewText:
Renovations were in progress while we spent two nights at the Carlton, but there were no disturbances to us. Even the workmen using the elevators were cordial. As expected our room was on the small side but more than adequate. The price was very reasonable for this convenient location in San Francisco. Our car was parked for us about two blocks away ($35 a day) but whenever needed would arrive in ten minutes.
We were meeting our friends outside the hotel and they had arranged dinner plans. Surprise! We went right back into our hotel to Saha. Our friends had eaten there before and were looking forward to it. We agreed that it was a fantastic choice. Saha is arabic fusion, delicious, with excellent service and very reasonably priced. Next trip to San Francisco will include both the Carlton and Saha.
review.positiveRemarks: Music in the lobby with complimentary wine brought about the friendliness in everyone.
review.locationRemarks: We walked to Union Square and China Town. A short enjoyable walk. We also enjoyed Fly next door for a late night drink and Starbucks 3 blocks away.

review.title: Perfect for our Quick Stay in SF
review.reviewText: Charming old building, restored nicely into a modern hotel (much nicer than a generic new property, in my opinion.) The staff was warm and friendly. It was a few blocks to whatever you might need - restaurants, grocery stores, the cable car, shopping. A good place to come home to after a long day of sightseeing. Probably a good place to spend a lazy day relaxing, but we didn't have the luxury of finding out.

review.title: Perfect for our Quick Stay in SF
review.reviewText: Charming old building, restored nicely into a modern hotel (much nicer than a generic new property, in my opinion.) The staff was warm and friendly. It was a few blocks to whatever you might need - restaurants, grocery stores, the cable car, shopping. A good place to come home to after a long day of sightseeing. Probably a good place to spend a lazy day relaxing, but we didn't have the luxury of finding out.

review.title: Perfect for our Quick Stay in SF
review.reviewText: Charming old building, restored nicely into a modern hotel (much nicer than a generic new property, in my opinion.) The staff was warm and friendly. It was a few blocks to whatever you might need - restaurants, grocery stores, the cable car, shopping. A good place to come home to after a long day of sightseeing. Probably a good place to spend a lazy day relaxing, but we didn't have the luxury of finding out.

review.title: Love this hotel!
review.reviewText: Very pretty decor, good beds, large comfy lobby with fireplace, and caring staff.

review.title: Good Tender Nobb Location but a Bit Noisey
review.reviewText: The walls are super thin so if you have neighbors, you'll want ear plugs. The evening reception is fantastic. The clerk played music and sang (really well) while they served wine.
review.negativeRemarks: Better sound proofing.
review.locationRemarks: A great restaurant and bar right next door. Also only 6 blocks from Union Square.

review.title: Nice hotel for the price, but ...
review.reviewText: Nice hotel for the price, but don't count on the "free town car" service. On arrival I was informed of the "free town car" service offered by the hotel, in service from 7:30 - 9:00 AM. I followed the instructions and arrived in the lobby and requested a car 15 minutes prior to the time we needed to depart for our meeting. The transportation did not arrive as promised, even after assurances from the staff several times that it was "five minutes away" and we ended up hailing a taxi and arriving late to our meeting in the financial district. It would be better for the hotel not to offer the service at all rather than have it be unreliable.

review.title: Nice place to stay in San Francisco
review.reviewText: The staff was exceptional! Our room was small but very nice. The bed was comfortable. My only comment is that we were located on the 6th floor and they were painting on the 3rd floor - which is why the room smelled of paint when I first got there. I simply opened the windows and the smell was gone.
review.locationRemarks: We stayed here because it was about 1 mile from the Fillmore and we were going to a concert.

review.title: I love this hotel!
review.reviewText:
This hotel is so comfortable and pleasant, and the staff is THE BEST! Located near some good restaurants, although a bit of a walk (20 minutes) to Moscone. And good rates, too! I wll defintiely return.

I travel extensively for business and I am always pleased to find a "little gem" of a hotel like the Carlton. I saw families at the Carlton who also seemed to really enjoy their stay.

review.title: Quiant, adorable hotel in a great location
review.reviewText: We were upgraded free of charge to a room on a higher floor with a better view. The staff was more than accommodating, and even after checking out, they held on to our luggage so we could explore the city before flying back. They even arranged a comfortable personal car to drive us back to the airport, at the same price as a taxi.
review.positiveRemarks: The decor was adorable, there's free wine happy hours everyday from 5:30-6:30pm, and the staff was unmatched.
review.negativeRemarks: It does not have a fridge or microwave in the rooms.
review.locationRemarks: Close to Powell Street, Chinatown, cable cars.. A good walk to Fisherman's Wharf if you're up to it.

review.title: Convenient and clean
review.reviewText:
Great remodel and in an great location. Big closet. iPod doc station is great.

However, the walls are VERY thin and you hear everything from the people next door.
review.locationRemarks: Great location. There is a parking lot across the street that is about $10 cheaper /day.

review.title: Great Boutique Hotel in the heart of SFO
review.reviewText: Hotel Carolton is a great SFO Boutique Hotel. The Hotel is very comfortable,
review.positiveRemarks: The staff is very friendly and the hotel is very clean.
review.negativeRemarks: The restaurant could be open more extended hours.
review.locationRemarks: Nearby streets are full of great local restaurants and bars.

review.title: Nice hotel and good price
review.reviewText: We spent 4 days in San Francisco and the hotel was the best value that we found near Union Square.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing
review.locationRemarks: The hotel is near the Union Square (almost 10 minutes by walking) and near the China Town also.

review.title: Excellent stay in San Francisco
review.reviewText:
I enjoyed four days stay in this hotel. The hotel is located in the area where there are so many restaurants and grocery shops. It is safe in the area even at night. The hotel itself is a little bit old, however, the room was very clean without any dust. The wall between rooms was a little bit thin, so I could overhear what other people were talking next door. But everybody was quiet in the midnight and my sleep was not disturbed at all.
Overall, this hotel is excellent and it is the best hotel in the United States as far as I know.
review.positiveRemarks: Clean and tidy. Hotel staffs are very kind.
review.negativeRemarks: Wall is a little bit thin.
review.locationRemarks: Very good access to restaurants and grocery shops. Safe area.

managementResponses.response: We apologize for the miscommunication surround your reservation. It is our hope that we are able to efficiently help all guests who arrive at the hotel and do so in a warm and caring way. It seems like in your case we missed the mark. We will be sure to speak with our front desk team so future guests do not have the same greeting that you did.

review.title: Avoid
review.reviewText:
Arrived to the hotel only to be told my booking had been cancelled, front desk guy rung expedia as he said they had cancelled it, didn't realise I could hear the conversation when he found out they hadn't actually cancelled it. He rebooked me and then said he upgraded me for free to a deluxe room, even though that's what I had actually paid for. He was extremely rude.

Room was covered in dust and absolutely tiny. Would hate to see the less expensive room!

Overall, terrible experience. Definitely recommend you do not book here

review.title: Nice hotel, quite and near center of town.
review.positiveRemarks: Unique boutique hotel with high energy

review.title: Clean hotel, paper thin walls.
review.reviewText: Hotel was pretty clean and room was spacious, staff was very nice, BUT walls are soo thin. We could literally hear the neighbors conv. Not a good thing at 2 AM. Also room smelled like spices every morning due to the cooking in the restaurant downstairs. A major negative was the daily $30 valet fee. Its literally 1/3 of what we pd for the room. Not a bad stay, jst a few negatives. The staff is very helpful and friendly.

review.title: Room was very nice and clean.
review.reviewText: The only bad input was the noise.... very noisy you can hear the next room activity and the busy street was not a good place to really have a good and restful sleep.
review.positiveRemarks: The new and fresh look with the nice and happy furniture.
review.negativeRemarks: window sealers.
review.locationRemarks: Very noisy. recommended if you don't mind noise.

review.title: Would recommend it!
review.reviewText: We only stayed one night, but found the staff extremely helpful, courteous, and pleasant. We had a delicious breakfast, and found the location great for walking and parking....

review.positiveRemarks: The staff was very friendly and helpful.
review.negativeRemarks: Our room was rather cold. The heat in the hotel did not appear to be on but the hotel immediately provided us with a heater when we called.

review.title: Cute Hotel
review.reviewText: Hotel decor is very cute. Not a great area but it felt safe inside the hotel. The walls are very thin, so bring your earplugs. We were by the stairs and could hear everyone going up and down. Also, the bed did sag in the middle a bit, but not too bad. Overall, a pleasant stay.
review.negativeRemarks: They should cover the gap under the door to reduce the noise.
review.locationRemarks: Walking distance to American Music Hall

review.title: Ignore most reviews
review.reviewText: Hotel is a classy step back in time. Was concerned after some reviews but stay was awesome. Theo at the front desk was an exceptional employee who was a wealth of info and support. The reviews mentioned the Tenderloin area and it's associated problems. None of that was apparent nor a concern. I felt safe and secure at all times and have stayed in far worse environments elsewhere in the world. Yes, the walls are thin and yes you can hear your neighbors but most were considerate and did not detract from our stay. It's an old historic hotel for crying out loud. If you don't want noise stay at a Super 8.

review.positiveRemarks: cosy, pretty and very conveniently located. really nice stay and very comfortable. Rooms are a bit small, excellent for couples.
review.negativeRemarks: i can't think of anything
review.locationRemarks: great places to eat, awesome breakfast places and union square is a nice 15 minute walk away

review.title: Nice place, good value for money
review.reviewText: Loved the decor and ambience of the hotel, the free wifi, the friendliness of the staff. Bagels/muffins/cereal in the morning would be a nice touch but there were coffee shops nearby.
review.positiveRemarks: Cosmopolitan, multi-cultural references in the lobby and room decor (and elevator). Location.
review.negativeRemarks: The walls are very thin and could hear people in the next room very clearly.
review.locationRemarks: We were able to find free overnite street parking nearby with effort; be careful about time restrictions re: street cleaning varying by day of week.

review.title: Home away from home
review.reviewText: I had the most amazing Christmas week at the Carlton all the staff was amazing and helpful... they were beyond accommodating. When I first arrived they had sold out of the room I had booked, at first I was dissapointed since I had reserved a king bed, but they upgraded me to a city view room and sent up a bottle of my favorite wine. I couldn't have been happier. Everything was perfect!!

review.title: Nice hotel at great price
review.reviewText: Clean and spacious rooms, very friendly and great location near Union Square. Will definitely stay here again.

review.title: Great experience
review.reviewText: Amazing staff that were very helpful and friendly. The room was a bit smaller than we expected at first, but it was a perfect amount of space and the bed was very comfortable and clean. The bathroom was also a little bit small, but they did a great job cleaning it every day. You just need to be careful of the surrounding area, which is the Tenderloin district. Overall, a really great experience!
review.negativeRemarks: all the stuff above
review.locationRemarks: The location is only 2 blocks from the cable car, so pretty convenient. Just be careful going south because it is the Tenderloin area

review.title: Very good hotel experience
review.reviewText: If you're looking for a hotel with complementary wine tasting and live music performance by the staff, this is the hotel for you. If you're just looking for a clean and nice place to stay in San Francisco, this is also the place for you. I would recommend the breakfast place Golden Coffee two blocks up Sutter Street on the corner of Leavensworth. I would recommend both the hotel and the restaurant to friends and will stay there next time.

review.title: comfortable stay central location
review.reviewText: We needed a room with good reviews, moderate cost, nothing fancy, and we got that. The hotel is old, but clean, nice staff. The bathroom was a bit cramped and if you need a big dresser and mini fridge this is not the place for you. The drawback for us was that the in house restaurant was very limited, no continental breakfast and everything was ethnic food, so we had to go out for breakfast every day. But, for a clean no frills room it fit the bill.
review.negativeRemarks: restaurant and bathroom
review.locationRemarks: It was close to the muni lines and easy to find. The location made it easy to access bus or transit lines to anything pretty easily.

review.title: Hotel close to Union Square
review.reviewText: Great stay, I would use parking down the block a good tip is early bird rate.
review.negativeRemarks: wish they had room refrigerator

review.title: Great choice thanks to all reviewers
review.reviewText: I was very happy with this hotel!! The room was very clean at all times and the staff was great. I decided on this hotel from all the great reviews from Expedia and was never disappointed. The room was an excellent price and despite the fact that any hotel in SF charges parking fees, they were the most reasonable. The location was great and within walking distance to Union square.

review.title: Poor temperature control in room. No thermostat.
review.reviewText: Not pleasing. Extreme TV noise from adjacent room going well beyond midnight. Had to call front desk twice to intervene, in order to get some sleep. Uncomfortable bed to sleep on.
review.positiveRemarks: Good location; 6 blocks from Union square
review.negativeRemarks: Thermostat in room to adjust room temperature and comfortable beds
review.locationRemarks: Pleanty of good restaurants around the area

review.title: Second time staying and would go again :)
Nice Hotel with excellent ubication
review.reviewText: it was an amazing experience staying in this historical hotel, great hotel staff, totally recommended
review.negativeRemarks: room size
review.locationRemarks: Union square, a lot of restaurants , bar

review.title: Area was not the best but close to the main spots
review.reviewText: Had an early arrival so called from the airport and the hits told me they had a room so I went straight away. Turned out that the room was not suitable so they upgraded me to the next available room which was a very nice gesture and much appreciated, staff were friendly and nice

review.title: Very cool hotel
review.reviewText: The set up was different than any hotel I've seen before, but I think that added to its downtown charm. (There was a very large closet in the middle of the suite.) The staff was great, and there was a wine social one day in the lobby and a very interesting musician playing. Ok, he was a little weird, but very unique. Overall, I'm really glad we chose to stay here on our little vacation!
review.positiveRemarks: Beautiful and one of a kind! Such a comfortable bed too.
review.negativeRemarks: Well, the window in the bathroom had wood trimming and it was affected by the moisture in the air.
review.locationRemarks: Lots of bars and really good restaurants. Just a short walk to Union Square.

review.title: Very nice hotel
review.reviewText: The staff at the front desk was wonderful.the rooms were very clean.we would go again.the wine reception in the evening was a great way to wind down after a busy day,and meet people

review.title: The hotel was near a venue.
review.reviewText: It was nice and clean!
review.negativeRemarks: Service is not great!
review.locationRemarks: Near to Davies hall!

review.title: Lovely experience in SF.
review.reviewText: I had a pleasure of staying at the Carlton Hotel in SF this past couple of days. The hotel is charming! I felt like I'm staying at my family's home. Loved the lobby area with relaxed atmosphere, fireplace and wine. The room was very comfortable and full of character. The hotel restaurant Saha is a middle eastern restaurant. I had a fabulous dinner there. The dish Lahem Souhar was marvelous!!!!!
review.positiveRemarks: The price, the comfort and location were excellent. Also, the atmosphere... relaxed, charismatic.
review.negativeRemarks: Although, the bathroom was very clean, soon it will need renovating.
review.locationRemarks: Walking distance to the Opera, symphony hall, shopping.

review.title: Good location to most places.
review.reviewText: Good place to stay. Walking distance to most places. Valet parking is $35+tax. Maybe nearby public parking lot is a better choice. Breakfast not included. WIFI works.

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: I stayed at this hotel for the thanksgiving holiday. I really loved staying there even though I didn't spend much time at the hotel. I would recommend staying at this hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: I loved the room decoration and most importantly the room was very clean and the bed was comfortable.
review.locationRemarks: The location was okay, just a short walk to Union Square (15 minutes) which is not bad. We parked our car in a parking just across the street.

review.title: Charming hotel
review.reviewText: We had a pleasant stay at this hotel. It is a great place to stay if you like an older building with character.

review.title: Nice old hotel, friendly staff
review.reviewText: The location is a little Tendernob, and there can be characters walking around, but we've lived in SF before and don't have a problem with it. Coffee shops nearby and walkable to Union Square. The furniture and decor has been updated. the staff are incredibly friendly and they have a nightly happy hour. our only complaint is that there was a door to the next door room (like it could be an adjoining room) and the door was very thin. The man next door snored very loudly the first night and the second night he was up talking on the phone very loudly and closing doors etc so couldn't sleep very well. bring earplugs
review.negativeRemarks: seal off doors. or make soudproof.

review.title: Nice hotel in a good area
review.reviewText: The staff was nice and kind. The hotel was pretty clean and all facilities worked fine. The only thing we did not like was that our room was next to the elevator, and all day and night we kept hearing it go up and down. It was annoying. Other than the hotel was good. It was like a 10 min drive or less from the golden gate bridge, pier 39, and china town.

review.title: Great place near Union Square.
review.reviewText: Friendly staff and clean comfortable accommodations. Would stay there again. Restaurant was good but middle eastern cuisine wasn't our favorite. Could still get American breakfast which was very good.

review.title: Nice hotel in a quieter area
review.reviewText:
The hotel has friendly staff, and a lovely reception and waiting area. The room was a good size, and decorated in pleasant colors. It's located away from the busy tourist parts of town in a more residential area.

One thing to be aware of is do not walk down Larkin Street as it goes through the Tenderloin. If you take BART use the Powell station. Civic station will require you go, a long walk, through a rough area wbich even during day is sketchy. The area where the hotel is located is fine even at night.

review.positiveRemarks: Good value for a decent hotel

review.title: Nice hotel
