review.reviewText: I thought the hotel was awesome, nicely furnished and comfortable. First complaint: Our check in was @ 3:00 pm. We were not able to get into the room until 4:00 pm. Explanation was that room was being cleaned. Second complaint: only warm water for the shower in the morning, not hot. I would stay there again.
review.positiveRemarks: Updated comfortable and clean room. Parking available is inexpensive.
review.negativeRemarks: Hot water for showering would be great. The room to be ready when checking in on time.
review.locationRemarks: Anywhere you want to go is within walking distance from this hotel.

review.title: In the heart of the city
review.reviewText: This is a fabulous hotel. We were treated very graciously by the staff. The room was really nice and cozy and quiet. We love the eclectic global decor and vibe of the place ! It is really beautiful , interesting, and comfortable. The happy hour was inviting and fun. The restaurant was awesome and the food was good too! We had a wonderful visit .
review.positiveRemarks: We liked pretty much everything ! It was a great experience. The staff was kind and helpful. And We Love the DECOR and coziness of the place.
review.negativeRemarks: Maybe include breakfast as part of the deal. Or give discount coupons for some of the nearby places and attractions.
review.locationRemarks: We explored on foot , with a little help from the desk personnel , and ended up at Brenda' s for breakfast - which was awesome ! Thanks again.

review.title: Love the hotel
review.reviewText: Great hotel and the staff were amazing! 5 min walk to union street. You won't be disapointed

managementResponses.response: Thank you for taking the time to share your comments about your stay at Hotel Carlton. Hotel Carlton is situated in Lower Nob Hill, a prominent residential neighborhood located near Union Square, Civic Center and just a few blocks from the cable car that can take guests to the Financial District, Fisherman's Wharf and Ghirardelli Square. We offer a morning town car service for our guests that is available on a first come first serve basis and can be reserved by speaking with our front desk staff. I'm sorry to hear the hotel was not what you were expecting. We hope you will try one of our sister hotels that is located closer to Union Square the next time you are in San Francisco.

review.title: It was far from union square. Very inconvenient
review.reviewText: Boring lobby. Nothing else close by to do. Saha restaurant food was not good ,and over price! Very inconvenient location . Long walk to union square. Room were not very clean and very noisy. Room also very stuffy and kind a too warm if keep window close to block the noisy street. Don't think we will recommend to anyone. We won't be back even with a great discount!
review.positiveRemarks: The staffs are nice and polite!
review.negativeRemarks: Have a shuttle to and from union square. Make the room quieter and train housekeeping to improve cleanliness. Better food restaurant !
review.locationRemarks: Nothing near by that us the problem!!

review.title: Great staff. Clean.
review.reviewText: Was looking for a hotel while attending a meeting. This was a good choice.
review.positiveRemarks: Staff was great. Hotel is old, but redecorated tastefully. New fixtures in bath. Clean. Comfortable.
review.negativeRemarks: My room had a thin door to an adjoining room. While working during the day, I could hear every word of the neighbor's conversation.
review.locationRemarks: There was a cafe one block east 965 Sutter that was a good place for breakfast.

managementResponses.response: Thank you for taking the time to let us know about your stay at Hotel Carlton. We appreciate your feedback. Hotel Carlton is located in the heart of San Francisco and with that brings city noises. We are in the process of testing different sound proofing improvements throughout the building as we recognize not all guests are used to this. In addition, we are in the process of augmenting our historic building with occupant controls on our heating system so our guests can have better management of the temperature in their rooms. We hope you choose to visit us again the next time you are in San Francisco so you can experience some of these new additions.

review.title: The noise, oh God, the noise. Plus other problems.
review.reviewText:
This hotel is an old building that seems to completely lack soundproofing. And it's on a busy street. Be prepared to hear every garbage truck picking up dumpsters at 5am, every emergency vehicle, every bus engine. And be prepared to hear word-for-word everything the people in the next room say to each other. And the elevator beeping. Just everything.

Unless you are deaf, don't expect to get a good night's sleep.

Staff are super friendly but slow.

Location is close to a really good street, but immediate location is quite seedy, with garbage on the streets and homeless people sleeping on the sidewalk nearby.

Also, the room has no thermostat of its own, and they keep the building a bit cold (saving money on heat).

Also, the windows needed washing.
review.positiveRemarks: Close to desirable parts of town. Free (if slow) Internet. Plenty of hot water in the shower. Room was clean.
review.negativeRemarks: Soundproofing MUST be improved if people are supposed to sleep here.

review.title: Locked out at 3am
review.reviewText: We were locked out at 3am due to door unable to open after we attempted to find the ice machine. They do not have vending machines. Staff had to kick door down. Yes, kick door down...lol Shocking! Really bad night, but the manager Jamie in the morning made up for it. She compensated us by giving us our one night stay for FREE and a future FREE stay. Do we dare to stay again??? Yes, we will!
review.negativeRemarks: Night staff un-professional
review.locationRemarks: No close stores in walking distance.

review.positiveRemarks: Excellent staff. Excellent restaurant in the hotel
review.locationRemarks: This is a great location for exploring. Within walking distance to many of the city attractions.

review.title: Great little find
review.reviewText: The staff was absolutely great. The hotel is conveniently located, friendly and cozy. Loved my stay, will be back, for sure.
review.negativeRemarks: The dining room could use a little updating, but nothing wrong with it as is. Liked the food.
review.locationRemarks: Borobodur Indonesian restaurant located within 3 blocks walk, fantastic recommendation by the staff. Great food and inexpensive. It was a wow.

review.title: Nice Hotel, perfect location
review.reviewText:
First, the location... it is a great place near buses, cable cars, union square and it is easy to go anywhere you want. As in every place we went in SF you will see homeless people and panhandlers, but we never felt insecure. Just try to avoid pointed dangerous places at night.
The rooms where nice,... you have to realize this is an old building and there are things (i.e. cracks) that you will not want in a new hotel,... but here are part of the experience. The room was clean everyday and the matress and bed give us the best rest at night.
About the noise,... it is true, the walls are thin... so just wish for good neighbours. We stayed for 6 nights, and just in two of them we hear kids yelling... but after 9 pm it was quiet.
The staff was incredible, always with a smile and ready to assit you, they make a difference.
review.negativeRemarks: It was all OK.
review.locationRemarks: You have restaurants near, buses at 2 blocks, great for tourist without the noise and fake mood of the wharf.

review.positiveRemarks: Clean rooms, very comfortable beds, nice overall atmosphere in the lobby and hallways.
review.locationRemarks: Not the best location but only a 10 minute walk to union square. The area immediately outside the hotel was fine.

review.title: Centrally located and great value!
review.reviewText: I was a bit nervous because we usually stay in mainstream hotels when traveling but we were pleasantly surprised. We spent most of our time out and about but we were extremely comfortable when we arrived back to the hotel each night. The beds are not the most comfortable but the rooms were clean and the staff was great. I would certainly stay here again.

review.title: Fair value hotel
review.positiveRemarks: Room and bedding was very nice. Lobby area comfortable and entertaining. Hotel staff (front desk, bellman, house cleaning) nice and positive.
review.negativeRemarks: I suppose it can not be improved....but, the walls are quite thin. I learned everything about my neighbor and her family as she chatted on the phone.
review.locationRemarks: The location was not bad. If you go one direction, it can get a little rough...but great organic coffee bar nearby and a 24 hr fitness

review.reviewText: A little far from what we wanted to do, but walkable.
review.negativeRemarks: I think tehre was a wine hour for this hotel, but no one told us anything about it at check-in.
review.locationRemarks: Fly, the restaurant next door, is actually pretty good, and cheaper than the in-hotel option.

review.title: Ideal base from which to explore San Francisco
review.reviewText: Obliging and friendly staff gave good advice on exploring city

review.title: Love me some Hotel Carlton
review.reviewText: This Hotel was recommended by a friend who stays at The Carlton everytime she visits San Fran. The staff were so helpful and friendly long before our arrival in the city. Front Desk Staff went out of their way to ensure the activities that were important to us were booked and where ever possible gave us tips and advice on what would maybe work better for us. The room was clean and bright and welcoming. I liked that there are rooms choices with separate beds for those times when travelling with friends. We never did make it to the 5 o'clock wine party but we did dash through it on occasion and it looked like great fun.I look forward to staying there again in the future.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff, the beds, the decor and architechure were in sync, the staff, town car availablilty, the staff, the great comfortable lobby...
review.negativeRemarks: being an old building it did tend to get noisy but there's not much to be done there.
review.locationRemarks: within walking to important San Fran venues and shopping, and close to many many bus routes. Really appreciated by big walkers like us.

review.title: Great remodeled old hotel in a great locatiom
review.reviewText: We loved the old completely remodeled hotel. Looks like. New european eclectic hotel. Many restaurants and bars are at walking distance as well as some places for sightseeing in san francisco
review.positiveRemarks: Beds are great. And also the style
review.locationRemarks: Close bars and restaurants.

review.title: Clean & Comfortable hotel
review.reviewText: I had a very nice and comfortable stay at this hotel. Was concerned at first glance but it's a really clean, quite ample hotel. Nice reception in the lobby as I was checking in and the hotel staff are fantastic.

review.title: Very good staff and location
review.reviewText: It's at good location of SF downtown which also mean it might be noisy. When we checked in that we been arranged to a 2F room which is facing the street. It's noisy. Room is clean and neat but bit small. However, I reflected to the front desk they are help me to change to higher level room which is nicer room (upgraded?) and also very quite. The staff is so helpful and warning whenever you have request to them or any questions. I like the service they have.

review.title: Great hotel and Excellent guest service
review.reviewText: Front desk representatives were knowledgable, quick to assist with checking in or out, and made my stay very fun.

review.title: Nice hotel for NWM
review.reviewText: This hotel was the ideal spot for the Nike Women's Marathon, though incredibly overpriced due to demand (350/night). It was really close to the starting line. The hotel staff was friendly and helpful (and also a bit funny!). Though they ran out of double bed rooms, they gave my friends and I a rollaway bed for our one king bed room at no extra charge. They offered to give us a bottle of wine, but we couldn't accept it, since we were running the next morning. The facility was a bit worn down, but tastefully re-decorated. The restroom had paint peeling off the top wall in the shower, but that didn't make it a deal breaker. Overall, it was a great place to crash at for one night and I would probably stay there again if I can get their regular, cheaper rate.

review.title: Overall an OK place to stay
review.reviewText: The room itself was nicely appointed however the windows and doors were not updated--all street and hallway noises were to be heard (2 inch gap below door). Luckily I was in a corner room so the noise I heard was minimal. I frequently stay in SF for business and was hoping to have found another nice place but was a bit disappointed. The location was not bad, valet was a bargain ($35/night) but would prob stay in Japantown for a better "deal".
review.negativeRemarks: Windows and doors could be updated

review.title: good hotel
review.reviewText: Close to financial district and accessible from downtown San Francisco. Good breakfast joint down the lane, Jin's. Coffeeshop and restaurants in walking distance.

review.title: Poor value.
review.reviewText: Our room overlooked the street and was noisy all night. Next time I'll look for a better value (I paid $300).
review.negativeRemarks: It was worth $100.

review.title: Unique hotel close to many different neighborhoods
review.reviewText: This was a wonderful hotel! The staff was super friendly. The rooms are smallish, but very comfortable and nicely decorated. My only complaint is that even though we were on the 7th floor, we could hear a lot of street noise at night. In spite of that, I would definitely stay here again!
review.positiveRemarks: Within walking distance to many different locations. Free wine at 5:30 everyday! AND, the staff is super friendly and helpful!
review.negativeRemarks: Street noise, even on the 7th floor!
review.locationRemarks: Within walking distance to downtown shopping, cable cars, Chinatown. There were cute coffee shops close by.

review.title: Will go back
review.reviewText: Great little hotel. Friendly, professional staff. Far removed from the cookie-cutter environment of many hotels. A little patina is appreciated in an all together pleasant experience. The walls are a bit thin--read, I was awoken twice by a rather passionate couple next door. I was also found the lack of black-out blinds annoying w/ a bright red sign outside my window...perhaps that set the tone for my amorous neighbors.
review.negativeRemarks: Black-out window coverings
review.locationRemarks: Close enough to Union Square and cultural centers of the City.

review.title: Excellent hotel
review.reviewText: Hotel is close to everything. Hotel staff were very welcoming anything we needed they got. Room was spacious and immaculate! Wine mixer is a good touch. Would definitely stay again!
review.positiveRemarks: Very clean and staff really friendly.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing
review.locationRemarks: Close to union square, Chinatown, fisher mans wharf. Lots of bars and restaurants.

review.title: Interesting and convenient location!
review.reviewText: I loved the decor and overall quality of this hotel - it is however a boutique hotel which meant the rooms are on the small side. However, with that said, I enjoyed my stay immensely and would stay here again.
review.positiveRemarks: The style, decor and staff! Also, it has a very artsy vibe which makes it a great environment.
review.negativeRemarks: There were a few stains on the carpet in my room as well as an odd odor in the closet - just a few cleaning details - nothing major.
review.locationRemarks: Great location, within walking distance of Union Square.

review.title: Great staff, cool concept
review.reviewText: Staff were absolutely excellent, funny and helpful. The hotel has a global Eco concept which is cool. Would stay here again!

review.title: Cute hotel, awesome staff
review.reviewText: The rooms were clean and comfortable. Mine lacked A/C, but the fan has an adjustable speed which keeps the room fairly cool. They have Lather soap from the boutique in Pasadena. The closet is walk-in and HUGE. The staff really made the difference at this hotel. They were super helpful and made me laugh even when I was exhausted from travelling.

review.title: Nice boutique
review.reviewText: Nice amenities; great boutique hotel. Nothing fancy, just very comfortable.

review.title: Great hotel in great location!
review.reviewText: Trendy and clean, great friendly staff, great location to walk/taxi around the city!

review.title: Nice hotel - relatively centrally located
review.reviewText: This is the second time I have stayed at this hotel. I like it and the new refurbishments (cosmetic) are pleasant. It's an old hotel so that if you can hear someone close the door and in the morning I could hear my neighbours talking quite clearly. Street noise is practically nil. Keruig in room, and filtered water on Floor 4 and you are provided with a jug. A green hotel. But I have it on good authority that the water in San Fran is superb - it comes form Yosemite! Hard to find a place for breakfast though. The restaurant is not up to par.
review.positiveRemarks: Very nice and polite staff. Lots of smiles.
review.negativeRemarks: Springs on the doors so they don't slam.
review.locationRemarks: It's very near Union Square.

review.title: good surprise, very nice staff
review.reviewText:
I firstly booked a room for an other hotel, but my reservation was canceled so I had to pick a new hotel for the same day !
The staff was super nice at reception, very helpfull tips about everything, thanks again mark and your colleagues !
the room has been remodeled and is really nice, not too big but hey it is San Francisco.
We were staying at the 8th floor, far from the elevator, so no problem for this sounds...just noise from the streets...awalls are very thin..But overall a very good choice !
review.locationRemarks: lots of restaurants !

review.title: Great hotel, great location, reasonable price
review.reviewText: Comfortable clean quiet affordable. Friendly staff

review.title: Nice hotel, great staff
review.reviewText: We stayed here for 5 nights in August. It is in a great location to explore San Francisco. The staff were very helpful and friendly. The wine tasting was enjoyable, it gives the hotel a very social welcoming atmosphere. The only downside is its very noisy outside at night, but that's inevitable with being in the centre of a city.
review.locationRemarks: So much to see and do in San Francisco. Golden Gate Park is a must!

review.title: Hotel Carlton on a very busy weekend
review.reviewText: Staff was friendly and pleasing. The room was satisfactory size and the bed was comfortable. The street is busy but not too noisy to sleep. It is in a great location for walking and people watching. We had a mixup with valet, forgive and forget.
review.negativeRemarks: valet service

review.title: Nice hotel not to farfrom union square
review.reviewText: We had a nice stay, the zone all around is not so charming but you can reach union square in 10 minutes.
review.negativeRemarks: Door and windows are not sound proof
review.locationRemarks: Nothing to do close to the hotel you have to move to reach chinatown or union square.

review.title: convenient to cable car and other transportation.
review.reviewText:
We had only one day and night in the city. staff was very helpful in directing to transportation which would make the most of our time
enjoyed the happy hour wine and music
Room not fancy, but adequate for our needs.
review.positiveRemarks: staff, happy hour , and easy access to attractions
review.negativeRemarks: noise level from adjacent rooms
review.locationRemarks: went to Beach Blanket Babylon which is short cab ride away. loads of fun

review.title: Great location, friendly, helpful staff.
review.reviewText: only stayed one night but would have been happy to stay a week. Two blocks from California St cable car which gives easy access to Chinatown, waterfront and city.
review.negativeRemarks: soundproofing between rooms & corridors
review.locationRemarks: Restaurants, cable car, Chinatown,

review.title: Convenient, centrally located Boutique
review.reviewText: Within walking distance to transport and city shops. Clean, comfortable room with helpful staff offering good suggestions and answering all our queries.
review.negativeRemarks: Fridge for the room
review.locationRemarks: City shops. hop on hop off bus tours to many local attractions. Tram services nearby.

review.title: Great time in San Francisco
review.reviewText: I thoroughly enjoyed my stay at Hotel Carlton and in fact booked an extra night as I was so pleased with both the service and atmosphere. It's in a good location within walking distance to Union Square and the staff are always on hand to help. My friends and I had a great time with the complimentary wine hour too. If I were in San Francisco again I would book again.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff, quality of rooms and location
review.locationRemarks: Good location within walking distance of Union Square

review.title: Great little hotel
review.reviewText:
I really liked staying at Hotel Carlton. The employees were very friendly and helpful. We were greeted right away during check-in and our room was ready for us. The manager called the room shortly after our arrival to make sure everything was good with the room.

The room was small, but just right for our needs. This was the first time ever that my husband didn't complain about a sore back in the morning. Every hotel bed in the past has caused him to have a sore back. I liked that I could open the windows and have fresh air in the room. I really like that. I have read other reviews about noise from surrounding rooms, but I never heard a single person. It really was as if we had the place to ourselves. We didn't because I always saw other guests.

The only thing I see that needs work is that the rooms can use a good painting. Now, the hotel does have a sign in the lobby telling of the restoration that is going to happen in the hotel. With that said, it's understood that the place needs to be painted.

They have wine tasting in the lobby. We don't drink, but every time we passed in the lobby during the tasting everyone was having a great time.
review.positiveRemarks: I like the staff and enjoyed the room.
review.negativeRemarks: The rooms do need a little attention, but it in no way caused us to not like our stay there.
review.locationRemarks: The hotel is close to the Tenderloin District, but we never felt uncomfortable even walking down the street every night well past midnight.

review.title: Lovely save the Service
review.reviewText: I stayed a night in a queen bedroom. Very much enjoyed the beautiful view from the room as well as the tasteful decor and attention to detail.
review.positiveRemarks: The rooms were clean, tastefully decorated and thoughtfully furnished. Great view from the room!
review.negativeRemarks: All though everything was taken care of without any incidents I found the staff unwelcoming when in came to answering concierge type questions.

review.title: An evening in San Fran with kids
review.reviewText: Loved the hotel. Very clean and comfortable. Would definitely stay here again.

review.title: Walking distance to St. Francis Memorial Hospital
review.reviewText: I was having surgery at Saint Francis Memorial Hospital early the day after check-in. Everything I needed was within walking distance. The staff was very informative and helpful, especially Theo; a complimentary bottle of wine was delivered on arrival. Valet parking was convenient and reasonably priced. Fly's restaurant next door is a little loud, but the food and service was outstanding. I would definitely stay there again.
review.negativeRemarks: Maybe delivering the complimentary wine at the reception desk at check-in, instead of waiting for it to be delivered to the room.
review.locationRemarks: Everything is close, and my girlfriend and I felt safe walking around the area by ourselves.

review.title: Most friendly hiotel
review.reviewText: Staff is great. Could not ask for more from them. Hotel itself is a bit farther from Union square than most. However the walk is not bad. the only real complaint is the quality of the toilet paper. Not really a serious problem. Check out the nearby Italian restaurant around the corner up on Hyde St.Cafe Colomnini.
review.negativeRemarks: Toilet paper
review.locationRemarks: can walk to most things.

review.title: Good renovated hotel.
review.reviewText:
Great service by the staff and management when we asked to move to a different room. The customer service was excellent! Very knowledgable staff who answered every question. Easy walk to Union square and all the shopping. We found a local Vietnamese vegetarian restaurant called Golden Era that was fabulous!
We took the Big B bus tour and they were very helpful in getting us around town by simple walks to their numerous bus stops. Molly our tour director, was a wonder and great fun. She even helped us get back to Union Square the next day on a Big B. bus.
Lots of walking so plan on having good walking shoes and in July the weather is manic, cool, foggy, sunny, warm, then cool again all in one day!
review.positiveRemarks: The staff, the beds, it is clean and maintained.
review.negativeRemarks: More ice machines.
review.locationRemarks: Location is in the Tenderloin area that is not considered the best but we had no issues. There are a lot of Homeless beggars but they aren't dangerou

review.title: Hotel Carlton
review.reviewText: Friendly, cosy, clean and tidy, it was a pleasure staying at this boutique hotel in June 2013. The staff were helpful, friendly and humourous, so nice to be referred to by name given the number of guests. Also great to see the commitment to recycling and the environment. Loved the roomy walk-in closet for storage of clothes, suitcases etc. San Fran is lucky to have these old and unique hotels. The Nob Hill area provides easy access or transport to the main city attractions, allowing the experience of city living without the immediate distractions of shopping or large business operations. Restaurants and laundromats are in walking distance.
review.negativeRemarks: The addition of a small fridge would be useful.

review.title: Terrific staff and wonderful room for handicapped
review.reviewText: I broke my ankle and needed a room on short notice. The staff was so accommodating and the room was spacious and perfect will all accommodations for handicapped. Really appreciated it all!

review.title: nice and clean hotel
review.reviewText: staff we met were filipinos, very accommodating and friendly.
review.positiveRemarks: the location, away from the crowded place but not too far from the tourists spots.
review.negativeRemarks: parking... though there's a cheaper public parking across the street.

review.title: View out the window was of a brick building.
review.reviewText: The staff was very friendly and helpful. Our room was very nice and the eastern theme was different. Only issue was that the walls must have zero insulation because we could hear just about every word coming from the room next door and they were loud! Lots of slamming door noices etc. But the bed was comfortable and I slept well. I would stay again. Deepest bathtub ever!
review.positiveRemarks: Like the theme, decor etc. So glad that they have valet parking because I wouldn't have wanted to park in San Francisco. The staff was very friendly.
review.negativeRemarks: Noice reduction between rooms.
review.locationRemarks: Lots of restaurants in the area

review.title: Lovely Hotel-just right.
review.reviewText:
The staff were so lovely-I randomly found Hotel Carlton after I had a terrible night at another an arrived at 8am and was told I could have a room straight away.
All staff were lovely even when bumping into housekeeping or maintenance in hall ways they were so nice. The room was quiet and just right-the king size bed was so lovely and comfortable. The only tiny little thing wrong is you can hear what's going on in the next room very easily-easy fixed though-just turn the TV up ;)
review.positiveRemarks: Just right- nice and easy to find, location - close to union square. All staff were wonderful and helpful. I really liked the room it was lovely.
review.negativeRemarks: Sound proofing perhaps.
review.locationRemarks: Close to union square-5 min walk-shops/convenience stores and restaurants close by.

review.title: Nice hotel close to relevant SF points
review.reviewText: Ok ir you need to be close to downton SF, valet parking very slow, 35 min to Bring The car

review.title: Super friendly staff
review.reviewText:
As from check-in till check-out, super friendly staff. Happy hour with free (really nice) wine at the lobby.

Rooms are ok, clean and pleasant. Missing some extra blind for total darkness during early morning...
review.locationRemarks: 30-40 min walk to the piers.

review.title: Friendly Staff, Clean Cozy Hotel
review.reviewText: I enjoyed my stay and would indeed consider staying again. There is no AC and being that I stayed on one of the Hottest weekends SF is known to have it would have been nice but over all the ceiling fan and a few open windows was great. SF doesn't get too Hot most of the year. The room was cozy and clean the staff was pleasing. Overall great Hotel and Highly Recommendable.
review.negativeRemarks: perhaps the ice machines, I had to try several different floors or go to main lobby for ice
review.locationRemarks: great location, bart stations not too far

review.title: Good value
review.reviewText: Very clean and well appointed older hotel. Staff were very friendly and helpful. Location is fairly close (about 7 blocks) from Union Square at the northeast boundary of the tenderloin area ... So it was still safe but in a less than affluent area.
review.positiveRemarks: Great staff, clean rooms, fluffy towels and crisp linens on our king sized bed.
review.negativeRemarks: Thin doors resulting in more noise from the hallway.
review.locationRemarks: Fairly close to banking district in an older part of the city

review.title: Hotel Carlton, San Francisco
review.reviewText: Nice hotel, pretty good location but parking options aren't great.
review.positiveRemarks: Loved the design and cleanliness of the room and the over-all service. Beds were extremely comfortable
review.negativeRemarks: It was nice to have a large walk-in closet but needed lighting that stayed on instead of a sensor. Parking is expensive.

review.title: a really nice hotel
review.reviewText: We had a great experience at the Carlton hotel. Staff was genuine and friendly; I loved the international decor. I found the room very clean and homey feeling. The bed was very comfortable and I slept wonderful. the high priced over night parking fee was the only thing that I didn't like. Otherwise, I'd stay there again and recommend to friends.

review.title: Great, if you can afford it..
review.reviewText: Great hotel. Located on the edge of the Tenderloin. so you get some flavor of the gritty underbelly of SF outside. Within walking distance of Nob Hill, Union Square, etc. Rate seemed high to me (200 UK pounds, or about 310 USD), but I supposed that is to be expected for a last-minute reservation in SF in mid-June.
review.positiveRemarks: Great lobby decor. Free evening wine tasting at 5:30
review.negativeRemarks: Slow elevators, but they match the old hotel style.
review.locationRemarks: Great acces to various parts of SF

review.title: Cozy digs, centrally located.
review.reviewText: This hotel is comfortable and welcoming, centrally located with helpful staff. The parking fee is competitive for the area, but should be taken into account when considering the cost, but overall it was a good value.
review.positiveRemarks: I love the welcoming lobby and the slight smell of lavender when you enter the room.
review.locationRemarks: This hotel is an easy walk to Washington Square and the trolleys. In the other direction you can walk to restaurants with food from around the world.

review.title: Nice place, good price
review.reviewText: Very helpful, friendly staff. Walking distance to a lot of the attractions.

review.title: Excellent
review.reviewText: Excellent, great location,nice people it was a really good time there my and my daughter
review.locationRemarks: Excellent

review.title: city view
review.reviewText: Second time around I had a great expereince the first time but the second time around my room wasn't so great. I purchase a kings delux with city view. All I got was a side view of windows and the room was drak. The bed cave in so i didnt sleep well and I can hear the guy snoring in the next room. But over all i love the location and the 24 hour in/ out parking.
review.negativeRemarks: the lighting in the room
review.locationRemarks: great location, dinning and night life

review.title: Hotel was a gem we'd definitely use again
review.reviewText: This was the last stop on a two week trip and provided a great way to finish our last three days. The hotel, its staff, and general atmosphere were all great. At the end of three days of rigorous exploring in San Francisco, our room in the Hotel Carlton provided a serene, comfortable nest to come back to. Everyone in the hotel worked hard to give us a great experience and we appreciated their efforts tremendously.

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel is very nice, centrally located near downtown, shops and great restaurants. The staff were very kind and helpful. I would definitely return to this hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: The room we stayed in was small but clean. The best part, they allow dogs!
review.negativeRemarks: The only complaint would be that you could here your neighbors as if they were in the same room.
review.locationRemarks: The location is great, close to shops and great restaurants.

review.title: Nice experience and great location
review.reviewText:
The staff members were very friendly and helpful. The hotel had recently been updated with pleasing colors and a rather unique style and artwork.

We were able to walk to many great restaurants and shops from the hotel.
review.locationRemarks: great

review.title: Great staff, great location
review.reviewText: I love the place because the staff were really friendly and helpful, they tried very hard to make everyone feel at home. Also the location was great, close to Union Square and there are many great places to eat close by. My room was very clean and comfortable and Ilike the design of the place, very unique and has its own character.
review.locationRemarks: Close to Union Square, and many restaurants nearby, many different choices.

review.title: Nice Hotel
review.reviewText: This is a very nice hotel that is close to Union Square. It has that old hotel charm. Very clean and nice. I would definitely stay there again.
review.locationRemarks: Close to Union Square.

review.title: It is clean and the stuff is helpful
review.reviewText: the comfort is little bit like nylon is not too much comfortable
review.negativeRemarks: like to have fridge and may be microwave
review.locationRemarks: perfect and it is close to union square

review.title: A good choice for central inexpensive hotel
review.reviewText: Friendly staff. Rooms are quite spacious, the bed was comfortable, plenty enough storage space if you are staying longer. Hair dryer, ironing equipment, toiletries, safe box all supplied. Free wifi. The location was good. We walked everywhere from there, however public transport is very close if you need it. My room faced the street but I wasn't disturbed by any noise. Trash collection at 7 am, yes, but I was awake so didn't bother me. Unlike some reviews I've read, I did not see any unsavoury characters around the hotel, I felt perfectly safe there. Breakfast quite basic but more than adequate. Complimentary wine at happy hour a nice touch. Overall a good place, one to recommend and/ or return to.

review.title: Good for families, singletons and everyone else.
review.reviewText: Excellent location, 10-15 mins walk down Sutter to get to everything from Union Sq, to City Hall, Shopping, Wharf, you name it. All staff I encountered were very courteous and friendly. Hotel has a great bar next to it (hmmm, their grilled cheese on sour dough), amazing sushi restaurants close by, such as Sanraku just a couple of blocks away (go on, you won't be disappointed) on the way into downtown. Only downside was the room needed some TLC, particularly the bathroom, which suffered from cracked tiles, holes around the door frame needing to be spackled, etc. Great price, great location, great staff, well-appointed, comfortable room and king size bed, great area for foodies, just needs a lick of paint and some spackle as it seems too easy to fix not to do it.
review.negativeRemarks: Bathroom needs some TLC, but everything was clean and functional.
review.locationRemarks: Don't stay downtown, the neighborhood bars and restaurants on Sutter are catering to repeat customers, without the tourist prices and bad service.

review.title: Excellent, Very Friendly, Well Priced Hotel
review.reviewText: The Hotel Carlton is a very nice hotel with very friendly and extremely helpful staff. It is in a good location with several nice restaurants and San Francisco attractions close by (all reachable either by foot or via the various nearby public transport options). The hotel also has its own Yemenese restaurant which serves excellent food and some very nice local and imported beers, wines and teas. On a couple of occasions we had some issues with late night noise created by neighbouring guests but the front desk were swift to deal with these individuals.
review.negativeRemarks: Its not the most sound proof of buildings but the staff police the hotel's 'quiet hours' (22:00 - 08:00) very well.
review.locationRemarks: It's a typical big city American street nicely located between the Union Square (15 min' walk) and Fisherman's Wharf (25 min' walk) areas.

review.title: My One-Night Stay
review.reviewText: No air conditioning. Windows do open and I cooled using outside air. Good wireless access. Parking is an issue, as it is in most of San Francisco. Staff could not have been better! These guys really give it their all. Plenty of good food in the neighborhood. Mostly quiet inside, but take a fan to 'cover' traffic noise. Free wine tasting in the evenings were very popular! Room was small, but immaculate.
review.negativeRemarks: Parking hassle.
review.locationRemarks: Convenient.

review.title: GREAT PLACE TO STAY FOR ALL
review.reviewText: Hotel was nice home like feeling and classy. The staff was really helpful in everything from bringing extra towels, extra tooth brushes to giving us advise on where to eat.
review.positiveRemarks: Love the classy look and feeling
review.negativeRemarks: none
review.locationRemarks: it was in the middle of everything we wanted to do

review.title: Fair needing updates
review.reviewText: This hotel is currently, well, supposedly undergoing updates. Our room was OLD, terrible furniture though the bed was comfortable. Bathroom tub had paint peeling down to sheetrock, with some mold. Manager made it right by providing a comp ride to airport via limo, so that part was classy. Do not expect an elegant hotel. But, for the price, I guess I should have expected this. Still, what does paint cost?

review.title: Good stay for the money
review.reviewText: Good value for good money in the time of my reservation. Convinient position near the city center.
review.negativeRemarks: Old style
review.locationRemarks: Near to the downtown

review.title: Not a good place to stay
review.reviewText:
When I made my reserve nobody told me that the hotel was partially in renovation, when I arrived to the hotel I had the news that my room was in the floor in renovation, besides the noise there were a lot of dust.

The hotel is old and the same applies to the installations, you can hear the water running in the bath of your neighbour as if he was taking a shower in your own bathroom.

review.title: Affordable hotel in central San Francisco
review.reviewText: This was a nice hotel within walking distance of Union Square. Very affordable, clean, staff was helpful. The car vaet and garage cost was a bit excessive but thats SF.

review.title: Hotel Carlton
review.reviewText:
The concierge was friendly and was helpful providing information and directions around the city.
Based on other reviews, we were aware of the lack of sound proofing of the walls.
However, we got lucky on the room we got and had a peaceful stay.
review.locationRemarks: The hotel was a little bit of a walk to union square. The commute is about 20 to 30 mins to fisherman wharfs.

review.title: Delightful!
review.reviewText: The location and price were amazing. A treat to stay, very friendly staff, clean rooms and nice facilities. No complaints and enjoyed my stay.

review.title: Lovely Time
review.reviewText: Staff were extremely helpful for a first time visitor to the city (Gio), great recommendations to things to do and see in the city . Helped with great character and personality giving a warm feeling about the hotel. location was fantastic and definitely will stay at this hotel next time in the city. Will recommend to everyone i know to stay at the Hotel Carlton when in San Francisco.
review.positiveRemarks: Staff were outstanding and the hotels great location and the evening socials where you can mingle with other guests.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing
review.locationRemarks: Short distance walk to union square. Had a great pizza place right next to the hotel.

review.title: Diappointed
review.reviewText: Closet smelled of mildew, no amenities in room, and for price, that would be expected, TV had too few channels and cumbersome interface
review.positiveRemarks: staff were very nice and friendly
review.negativeRemarks: update throughout

review.title: Top notch Hotel
review.reviewText: My boyfriend and I did an over night trip to San Francisco and it was my first trip here, we stayed at the Hotel Carlton and received very easy accommodations from here. Not only is the hotel centrally located in a perfect area, the hotel was very clean and most of all, the staff was top notch! An extra recognition is well deserved for staff members Gio & Theo who had made our stay at Hotel Carlton very fun and pleasant! These 2 concierge were crack ups and if we ever come back to Frisco, we will definitely be staying at this hotel again because of the great experience we had. Thank you
review.positiveRemarks: The staff members, they made us feel very comfortable and gave great service!
review.negativeRemarks: Not one thing.
review.locationRemarks: Location is perfect, can walk to Pier 39, the Regency Ballroom for concerts and surrounding restaurants.

review.title: A friendly hotel with real character.
review.reviewText: A friend and I stayed here for a conference, and we absolutely loved it! The staff are all super nice, remembered our names and why were were in town, and made excellent suggestions for things to do while we were in town. We really enjoyed the wine hour, and the entertainment that sometimes accompanied it. The rooms are a little small and the walls are a little thin, but I think that the service, the price, and not having to deal with some of the hassles of larger hotels (like waiting forever near checkout time to get an elevator) more than make up for it. This hotel has great character and gives you a real feel for the city.

review.title: Best hotel experience in SF.
review.reviewText: Great service, feels cosmopolitan and homey. Front desk is staffed by the friendliest, most helpful people I've ever met in a hotel setting.

review.title: Cheers and Thanks - Hotel Charlton!!
review.reviewText:
The charm of the Hotel together with the over and above service of the Staff makes this a 5 rating for us. There wasn't anything that we needed that the staff didn't already provide or suggest. The rooms not only had character but were modern and clean.

The location was close to restaurants and shopping. Cab rides were under $10 anywhere from this location.
review.positiveRemarks: The charm and the friendly above and beyond service by the Staff.
review.locationRemarks: Close to restaurants and shopping. Cab rides to anywhere were less than $10

review.title: Great hotel with great friendly staff.
review.reviewText: We were greeted with a big welcome that we knew we made a good choice of a hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: The atmosphere felt like an upper scale apartment House. There was a happy-half hour (free wine tasting) every evening.The staff was very informative.
review.negativeRemarks: The elevators were small.
review.locationRemarks: The loc was average but,up and com, for the money it was adj. to public tran. great local Mid-Eastern and Kor fare. Just eight blocks away from Un Sq.

review.title: Not very upscale
review.reviewText:
This isn't a very nice hotel. The rooms are small, outdated, and beat up. Trash from a previous guest was in the wastebaskets, there is no thermostat (it was uncomfortably hot in the room), the TV didn't work, and you could clearly hear guests' in other rooms conversations through the walls.

This is a pet friendly hotel which is great if you have a pet but not so good when you don't.

The lobby and other common areas smelled like cigarette smoke,

The hotel is located in a pretty "rough" neighborhood and it’s a long walk to downtown.
review.negativeRemarks: Room, lack of ammenities, loud, not very clean.
review.locationRemarks: Busy and congested part of town. Too far to walk downtown.

review.title: Handy, convenient and pleasant hotel.
review.reviewText:
Staff were very helpful on our arrival allowing us to park right outside long enough to check in, directing us to the car rental return and wisely suggesting a method of getting back to the Airport by Limo for little more than the BART would have cost - without any of the hassle of carrying bags.

The only slight frustration was the porter who insisted on helping us with our bags despite being told we were ok, which lead us to feel under an obligation to give him a tip. I don't mind giving a tip when we've asked for help, but we were tight on 'cash' as it was right at the end of our stay.

I was also a little frustrated by being told the facility to checkin online and print our boarding passes was 'free' by reception and then being charged to print them off.
review.positiveRemarks: Short term parking right outside, advice from reception about alternatives to get to the airport.
review.negativeRemarks: Feeling pressured into accepting help from the porter and being charged for printing boarding passes when it was suggested it was free.
review.locationRemarks: Slightly close to 'Tenderloin' but otherwise reasonably convenient.

review.title: great place for travelers
review.reviewText: We have stayed here before, and returned for another vacation to SF. The staff is just as friendly as we remembered and the evening wine reception was a great way to start our evening. The location is also great for getting around the city. Only complaint would be the road noise that only is bad in the mornings.

review.title: Top Notch Employees
review.reviewText: The staff in this hotel is what makes my rating Superb overall. They are Marc, Gio, Emily and Theo. Super nice, accommodating, friendly and assisted us in every way possible. Our stay couldn't have been better! They gave us a nice room, let us checked out late.
review.positiveRemarks: Staff, free wine, comfy beds, huge walk in closet.
review.negativeRemarks: Thin walls and light inside the closet turns off after a while even you are still inside.
review.locationRemarks: Perfect

review.title: Poor cleaning
review.reviewText: Room was not up to good cleaning standards, staff were very welcoming and friendly
review.positiveRemarks: Staff welcoming, good selection of breakfast
review.negativeRemarks: Automatic gratitude and cleanliness of room and stair case
review.locationRemarks: Location is in the middle of the good and bad, not appropriate for people to walk out Ali r at night unless you are in a group

review.title: Great hotel in every respect
review.reviewText: This was my second stay at th Carlton, and it was excellent. The rooms are a good size, nicely decorated and very clean. The staff are extremely friendly and helpful, with a good sense of humour. The hotel is in an excellent location, close to Union Square.
review.locationRemarks: Great central location!

review.title: Nice people, Nice place.
review.reviewText: Nice people. Nice little hotel. Two blocks from Saint Francis Hospital. Clean Rooms. Wine in the afternoon. Largest hotel closet I have ever seen. Comfortable little robe for the wife to kick back in. Valet Parking was just fine. Bath tub was large enough for a six foot tall person like me.
review.positiveRemarks: Everybody that works there treats you like they are glad you are there.
review.negativeRemarks: One little piece of paint was pealing above the Shower.
review.locationRemarks: Tender Loin. A little rough but not bad for the big city.

review.title: Great, with a few annoyances
review.reviewText:
The Hotel Carlton is a great hotel for those who want to be downtown but near transit in order to get to other parts of the city. It is a fifteen minute walk to Union Square, a half-hour walk to Chinatown, and a two minute walk to a bus that will take you to AT&T Park. The hotel is located on a not-too-busy street that feels safe.

The rooms served our needs well. There was a distinct lack of electrical outlets in our room, but not so much so that we couldn't plug in all of our devices overnight. The room was clean and housekeeping did a good job keeping it that way. One odd feature of our room is that the bathroom faced a building that had glass walls. If the bathroom window was open, people could see clear into the shower. This wasn't too much of a nuisance that we asked for a room change, but it was a little off-putting.

The staff were helpful, knowledgeable, and friendly. One complaint was that the staff--one of the receptionists in particular--was very pushy the first day regarding the purchase of a hop-on/hop-off bus ticket. It seemed like the answer to every question started with "If you get the ticket..." Apart from that, I was very pleased. The staff gave me accurate and complete directions to anything that I wanted to see, usually with handwritten directions and a map.

Overall, Hotel Carlton was an excellent choice, and I would highly consider returning to it in the future.
review.positiveRemarks: Prime location; friendly and helpful staff; great price; clean rooms.
review.negativeRemarks: Odd bathroom setup with a window facing into an office building; staff was pushy about the hop-on/hop-off tour.
review.locationRemarks: Located on Sutter a block and a half from Van Ness. A fifteen minute walk to downtown, half an hour to Chinatown, 30 bus ride from AT&T Park.

review.title: Good for a last minute stay in SF
review.reviewText: Staff very pleasant and helpful. Room OK, but comfortable. Hotel is old, so that is to be expected. Liked being able to open windows at night. Furnishings looked a little "used." Fact that they have in and out 24/7 valet parking a plus in San Francisco. Within walking distance of Union Square.
review.negativeRemarks: Linens, bedding could use a refurbishing
review.locationRemarks: Close enough to walk to Union Square area

review.title: Great hotel with really helpful staffs.
review.reviewText: this hotel is good and clean, i don't hesitate to recommend. the staff is great and even helped me to change my booking (through expedia) from 7 days to 3 days with no fee.
review.negativeRemarks: thin wall
review.locationRemarks: well located in sf center

review.title: Noise problems... Nice hotel
review.reviewText:
Two things have to change somehow so this hotel becomes a recommendable one.
1. Something needs to be done so that hall and outside noise in general is not filtered into the rooms. When someone is cleaning one of the neighboring rooms it's as if he was pretty much in bed with you.
2. Room service needs to be introduced. Specially taking advantage of the fact that the restaurant in house (Saha) is great.
review.negativeRemarks: Noise
review.locationRemarks: Just ok

review.title: No complaints
review.reviewText: Clean well-kept room, polite, responsive staff. No complaints.

review.title: Great service and good location
review.reviewText: The service is excellent. It's not an extremely fancy hotel but it's still very good. And, while we never felt unsafe, the area was shifty. Otherwise, it was very conveniently located and easy to get to all of the major attractions.
review.positiveRemarks: The service and the convenience of the location.
review.negativeRemarks: Didn't offer breakfast service and the walls are a little thin.
review.locationRemarks: Neighborhood is okay, but otherwise excellent.

review.title: Comfort & convenience with affordability
review.reviewText: We had a great experience during our stay. Friendly staff, excellent service, proximity to the city center made it a very memorable experience.
review.negativeRemarks: Noise from the streets
review.locationRemarks: Excellent location

review.title: Good value
review.reviewText:
The room was quaint with an inviting decor. It had everything I needed from a nice comfortable bed to a nice desk and a big comfy chair. It even had a walk in closet with a safe inside. The electronics (TV, coffee maker, and blow
dried) worked well. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The only negative aspect of this hotel is that you can hear people's muffled conversations from an adjacent room. The first night I had a room facing the street and was awaken by the loud sounds of construction that was occuring across the street. That was awful.
review.negativeRemarks: The noise level heard from adjacent rooms and even the street below (for those rooms with a street view) is disappointing.
review.locationRemarks: The location was okay. It's close to a lot of places of interest. The neighborhood is busy, loud, and a little shaddy.

review.title: great hotel for college students, travelers
review.reviewText: Carlton is a solid place to stay with decent price.

review.title: Cool, centrally located hotel
review.reviewText: This hotel was lovely. Their wine 1/2 hour (from 5:30-6) is delightful and the staff is very friendly. I love that their windows open, and if your room doesn't have a fridge, ask for one, they'll more then happily bring one to your room. Parking fee stinks but almost every hotel in SF has an overnight parking fee.
review.negativeRemarks: Parking fee states 35 but they charge you an extra 6 for overnight parking
review.locationRemarks: Two mile walk from fisherman's warf, close to many bars

review.title: Not so good
review.reviewText: Our first room on the 4th floor had dreadful street noise overnight. Then we repeatedly had very noisy neighbours from 1-3am (yelling, fighting), so we were repeatedly phoning security. In the morning we moved to the top floor. The heating in our room was either full-on and too hot and humid (an old style piped heating system) or not going. The decor was in need of a makeover.
review.locationRemarks: 15 minute walk from Union Square was a bit far every day.

review.title: Value for money
review.reviewText: One of the more affordable hotels in SF, with a short 10 mins walk from Union Square and easy access to public transportation. Takes about 25mins to reach Fisherman Wharf on foot. The room was small but adequate, with nice vibrant sheets which brightens you up after each weary day of travelling. There's no fridge in the room though, and the heater works funny... Otherwise, everything is fine.

review.title: Great place to revive a weary traveller!
review.reviewText: A great place to stay for the budget conscious who want to be close to the city and transport but also have some money left over for their holiday. Beds were really comfy, and staff were all characters.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, comfort and price. A hotel with character.
review.negativeRemarks: Could be a but noisy at times.
review.locationRemarks: Be careful you don't walk through Tenderloin when you first arrive, it's not SF's proudest suburb!

review.title: A Wonderfully Refreshing Experience!!!
review.reviewText:
GREAT experience from the moment I walked in until I checked out. First the entire staff was GREAT!!! This might not seem important to some but it was to me, because this was my first time in this wonderful city. Everyone from the front desk to the cleaning staff were very friendly and spoke everytime they saw me, "good morning", etc. The whole experience of SF was new to me & they made me feel like this was home, like I was part of the family. Getting that sort of vibe is very unusual, if non-existant. So now I consider them part of MY family. I will be back to SF as soon as I can, I hope in the fall. The booking process will be VERY EASY at that time. I will stay nowhere else but Hotel Carlton at any time that I return to SF.
Also the entire hotel was decorated very nice and in good taste. Everything from the lobby, elevators, hallways and my room was VERY VERY CLEAN. Very Impressed!!!
Finally the front desk staff were very willing to help with tours, transportation, etc.
When I go back I want to speak with the General Manager and congratulate them on a job VERY well done!!!
review.positiveRemarks: Friendly staff, very helpful, CLEAN and the location was perfect for me.
review.negativeRemarks: No climate control in room. Had ceiling fan but it was a little cool at night. I didn't need heat, but climate control would have been nice.
review.locationRemarks: Perfect for me. Central location for China Town, Union Square and Fishermans Wharf.

review.title: Noisy as hell
review.reviewText: Stayed here one night and won't again. Think of it like the Ritz Carlton, minus the Ritz. Good location for the curran theatre, bar next door fly was good, the staff was hilarious and awesome. The room itself was SO LOUD. During the night you could hear cars honking, people yelling as if you had the window open, but it wasn't, I checked. Our neighbors sounded like they were IN our room it was so loud. I got freaked out because I thought they were coming in our room. Not the best, over priced, not that nice.
review.negativeRemarks: Nois

review.title: too loud
review.reviewText: Right downtown in nice area and nice room, clean.Staff were great. That being said- it was a noisy location- lots of noise outside and from the people in the rooms around us. The parking was $35 per night...much more than any hotel we stayed in over our roadtrip. San Francisco is expensive...but fun. Most expensive we stayed in with the most noise and no free breakfast. Restaurant was also pricey. Staff was great with map showing us everything but we would stay somewhere else next time.

review.title: Just problems with Noise
review.reviewText: Just the noise isolating is not good. Anything else is perfect.

review.title: Nice stay
review.reviewText: We had a great time and slept well on the top floor. Some little hallway noise in the morning. But probably we were too close to the elevator.
review.positiveRemarks: Staff were friendly and helpful and the location is good.
review.negativeRemarks: Room was small and "finish" was not great
review.locationRemarks: Centrally located and close to the Fillmore District (jazz) and the cultural District(s)

review.title: It was ok
review.reviewText:
The bad: The walls were very thin, easily could hear conversations in the room next door. The room doors had 1 inch gaps between floor and door. The mirror in the washroom was very high, and difficult to get ready with if you are under 5'7". Because it was an old hotel, there was no in-room heat controller, needed to order up a space heater. Not enough plugs in the room without having to unplug something in order charge my laptop, cell phone, etc.

The good: The bed was very comfortable and room was clean. The room had flat screen tv (that are not shown on the hotel website), the free wifi was good, and the 5:30 wine serving in the lobby was a good gathering place. The staff were friendly, and very accommodating.

review.title: A good but not great hotel
review.reviewText: Friendly staff but hotel is a little on the old side. Nothing special but a good option for those on a budget.

review.title: Great place
review.reviewText: The only thing I didn't like was that there were no pop machines or room service. But the staff was wonderful and thev restaurant was excellent!
review.negativeRemarks: No pop machines or room service

review.title: Good stay
review.reviewText: staffs were helpful with information i need.wine reception was good and helps you relax after a busy day.Special thanks to zach who was the wine server
review.negativeRemarks: hotel is old
review.locationRemarks: average

review.title: A good value & well maintained hotel.
review.reviewText: The hotel is nicely maintained and modern enough for the average visitor. It does not have really anything much for amenities and the on premise restaraunt is not open much. Staff was friendly enough but did not make me feel like they really were worried about my comfort. Overall, it was a good value given the high costs of staying within the city of San Francisco. The location is ....ok... given that there are plenty worse areas nearby. I'd consider staying there again now that I know exactly what to expect however I'd be plenty open at trying other locations also.
review.positiveRemarks: Was affordable, clean and not too far from all the action.
review.negativeRemarks: Funky room layout (its an old building), not the nicest neighborhood.
review.locationRemarks: In the "Tenderloin" district. Look it up.

review.title: Decent but nothing to rave about
review.reviewText: I stayed here on a recent business trip because all of the hotels closer to the financial district were full or way too expensive. The staff was very friendly and the room was very clean and fairly stylish. However, the hotel is in a very old building that has really no soundproofing so I could hear everything in the room next door, down the hallway, and outside in the street. There was also no way to increase the temperature of the room because although they offered me a space heater (unfortunately it had limited output).
review.positiveRemarks: The room and bathrrom were very clean, and the location was pretty convenient to local transportation
review.negativeRemarks: No sound insulation and very limited temperature control.

review.title: Great hotel for families and couples
review.reviewText: Our experience at the hotel was excellent, when we arrived the reception staff were very friendly and helpful advising of the areas to stay clear of and the ones that were safe, they booked a trip for us to the Muir Woods without any hesitation, they were very cheerful whenever we entered reception, the room was pleasant and clean and very quite in the evening.
review.locationRemarks: The hotel was quite a way from fishermans wharf, but within easy walking distance of union sq.

review.title: gRRRRRRRRRRRRRRReat plac to stay!
review.reviewText: the best boutique hotel in San Francisco' s Nob hill neighborhood! close to all, friendly staff and they're always willing to go above and beyond their required expectations. We've stayed 4 times over the last 3 years and plan to return yearly!
review.negativeRemarks: nothing
review.locationRemarks: perfect and close to all.

review.title: great hotel for couples
review.reviewText: everything is ok except the noice from the restaurant.
review.negativeRemarks: noice from the restaurant
review.locationRemarks: near union square. walk distant.

review.title: Great hotel for couples.
review.reviewText:
The place is good located, pretty near to Union Square and Civic Center. You just need to walk 10 minutes to reach Powell St.
It is a historic remodeled building with his own flavor.
review.negativeRemarks: The coming noise of other rooms, the noise isolation is inexistent.
review.locationRemarks: Close to city activity and to Union Square.

review.title: Great, different spot in SFO
review.reviewText: Great location; interesting and different hotel; good value. Thoroughly enjoyed the stay. Perhaps noise conduction could be an issue, but not if you sleep well. Staff very helpful, enjoyed live quintet in the foyer. Would certainly look to stay there again.
review.positiveRemarks: Old-world style with modern service and facilities
review.negativeRemarks: Some noise issues
review.locationRemarks: Great - walked everywhere in the city!

review.title: Would return
review.reviewText: All in all a pretty good place to stay, rooms kept nice and clean. Location was pretty good also with only a few homeless wandering in the area. But they gave us no grief. Only downside was I had paid through Expedia when I booked however they took a further $330 from my cc when I checked in, and another $80 the second day neither of which I was informed of at the time. Was told this is a deposit etc and I would get it back. Then when I checked out I then was charged another $120 for 3 days parking, while I knew this was the case was a bit disappointed that it couldn't come from the deposit. I only left yesterday and have not received my $400 odd back but he did explain it may take 2 or 3 days.. Time will tell
review.negativeRemarks: No fridge in the room
review.locationRemarks: Pretty good, not too far to walk to the cable cars and Union Square

review.title: Nice and cosy
review.reviewText: Nice and conveniently situated hotel near the center of SF. Lots of cafes in the nearest area. Heating in the room was quite good in the cold nights. If the walls would be a bit thicker (rather noisy neighbors), it would be superb.
review.negativeRemarks: Noise
review.locationRemarks: Not far from Union Square where you'll find lots of places to visit and things to do

review.title: Highly recommended for a stay in San Francisco!
review.reviewText: I don't usually write reviews but in the case of this hotel I feel I need to. This place was amazing! The staff was friendly and I mean ALL of the staff. We were greeted when we came in with "Hello and welcome!", the front desk clerks were awesome asking if we needed directions, help getting around town or if we needed transportation and even the cleaning staff said "Hello!", held elevator doors and asked us how the stay was going. Everything [the lobby, the front desk, the elevators, the room in which we stayed (801)] was very clean. They had a fireplace going and offered free wine tasting and entertainment in the lobby nightly. Upon checking in, we had asked for some extra pillows and a blanket and they arrived at our room just seconds after we did. We had to call down for extra towels a couple of times and they arrived almost immediately. We also utilized the valet car service and the staff was so attentive and aware of the guests arriving and leaving the hotel that we didn't even need to tell them which car was ours -- in fact, it was gone so quickly we actually thought it had been stolen -- but was actually whisked away and parked while we collected our bags and were moving them into the lobby. If you want to eat in the highly-rated restaurant Saha, make reservations as it fills up fast. I was extremely impressed with the Hotel Carlton and would highly recommend it! In the days of waning customer service, many hotels could stand to take a lesson from these guys.
review.positiveRemarks: Friendly staff. Clean everywhere. Close to cable car route (California Street).
review.negativeRemarks: Valet service operated by third party. VERY SLOW to retrieve the car at times (1 hour or more). :(

review.title: Pleasant little surprise.
review.reviewText: I was there for a very short little overnight on my way to SFO. The hotel was full of character and the staff was very helpful and engaging. The morning staff in particular kept us laughing. The beds were comfortable and with the exception of a piece of cookie that got dislodged from somewhere on the floor when I moved a chair, the room was clean and had everything we needed. We weren't there long enough to explore much of the area, but we found a great little diner where we had a late breakfast on Larkin. The street seemed to have tons of options for ethnic restaurants. It's walking distance from Union Square, downtown and the Tenderloin area. We'd book again.

review.title: Clean, great service
review.reviewText: Older hotel, but clean. Great service. Not the most comfortable of beds.

review.title: Good for short cheap stay in SF
review.reviewText: Staff very friendly and helpful only complaint is the noise! Walls very thin could clearly hear the neighbors tv and their conversations!

review.title: Too loud!
review.reviewText: The walls are so thin I could hear every word from the guests in the next room. Could not sleep!

review.title: Ideal location
review.reviewText: We loved the location of the hotel - away from the busy traffic of shoppers and tourists. Trader Joe's is only 2 blocks away.
review.negativeRemarks: No exercise room

review.title: Convenient, clean and good value!
review.reviewText: Good location - about 10 minutes walk to Union Square, 15 to Chinatown, easy to find when driving too (Google maps give really clear directions).

review.title: Great hotel for young couples!
review.reviewText: Great for couples. For older buildings in SF it is common to hear the conversation and sounds of the adjacent guests. We are a family of 5 and the bedrooms were way too small. The staff understood that their accommodations were not the best for such a large family and refunded the prepaid days and were very understanding.
review.negativeRemarks: elevators smelled like indian food
review.locationRemarks: ok

review.title: nice hotel
review.reviewText: the staff very nice and amability,the location is safe,clean rooms,well everything perfect.

review.title: Could be the place for you.
review.reviewText: This could be the place for you if you value a good price, can tolerate some noise, and don't worry too much about the heat. The heating is central and not on all the time. Fine for me but too cold for partner. On the other hand, a call to the desk led to the delivery of a space heater in just a few minutes. Happy hour is a great idea. Free wine and music from 5:30-6:00, but the wine was barely drinkable and the music improvisational. Fun but not as good as it could be. For us the location was good.

review.title: Perfect for a short getaway
review.reviewText:
Wonderful hotel from top to bottom. Service was impeccable, hotel was charming and in a perfect location. The rates were very reasonable. There was a happy 1/2 hour every night with free pouring wine.

Our room was on the 9th floor with a beautiful city view. It was stocked with actual glasses and coffee cups. There was a recycle bin in the room and a pitcher to fill with water from a filter system in the hallway. Green in every way!!

Although we did not dine at the restaurant at night it was very busy the 3 nights we stayed. Breakfast was delicious with reasonable prices and great service.

What a wonderful stay! We will definitely return.
review.positiveRemarks: The service and the hotels commitment to green living.
review.negativeRemarks: none
review.locationRemarks: Centralized. Most everything is withing walking distance.

review.title: Very [pleasant accommodations.
review.reviewText:
Very courteous, from the reservation specialist Astrid to the night attendant. We enjoyed our stay. Only thing was =that the night was very cold and the central heating not great.
Would stay There again.

review.title: Like a hostle
review.reviewText: Like a hostel nothing special. No brequest no parking

review.title: Put in a room with no heat.
review.reviewText:
In the end, a good stay, but the first night they put me in a room with no heat (on one of the coldest days of the year in San Francisco).

The really disappointing thing was that it was obvious the next day that they knew there was no heat. The next morning they said "We're moving you, the heat is out of order in that room." They did give me a space heater, but it did not help much. They also let me check out late the last day due the "no heat" first day.

The staff are great with exception of the above colossal screwup.

I don't think I would stay there again. Who puts guests in rooms with no heat?
Not a particularly good thought that would bring me back.
review.negativeRemarks: being put in a room with no heat. There is also no ventiation system in the rooms.

review.title: An excelent choice
review.reviewText:
The hotel does everything which it is proposed to do.
It is clean,
The people in the front desk are extremely friendly.
They know the city very well, they advise very well what to do, and it is well located.
A low point it has no breakfast included, this is something that they should change.
The restaurant is very good and the people all very friendly, I would go back to the same hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: There is no breakfast included.
review.locationRemarks: very well located closed to everything, but San francisco is a city with a very good public transportation sistem so everything is close.

review.title: Great for quick business visit.
review.reviewText: Spent 2 days in SF for business in mid Dec 2012. Shower was hot, but room was a bit cold at night. Reasonable price. Would return.

review.title: Nothing stands out ... just very nice.
review.reviewText: The room was comfortable and clean. Even though during my stay there was construction across the street, the noise was very minimal. My room did need some touch-up painting, but since it looks like the hotel was undergoing a major repainting during my stay, I still gave the upkeep a 4. The wine reception was a little too noisy (there was a keyboard player for several of the nights during that time). Also, the wine reception was full of couples and groups of people traveling together; it was awkward being a solo traveler at that event.
review.positiveRemarks: Surprisingly quiet considering its location. Attentive staff.
review.negativeRemarks: The keyboard player during the wine reception was distracting and loud.
review.locationRemarks: Nearby Hyde Street is a little sketchy, so I just approached the hotel from a different route.

review.title: Great hotel & service, a lot more than expected !
review.reviewText: The location is perfect to visit Union Sq., Chinatown and to walk thru Nob Hill or to Fisherman,s Wharf. Staff is very friendly and helpful. You would not find a better deal price/location/quality in SFO

review.title: Great boutique hotel
review.reviewText: Great small boutique hotel, a bit of a walk up hill from union square but manageable for someone who is accustomed to walking. Hotel building is old but renovated, there can be ambient noises at night like the stream pipes from the room radiator and some noise from the kitchen of Saha, a Arabic diner below (great food!!!). Bathroom was decent water was hot. Staff was pleasant, a bit stiff but accommodating. I would recommend this hotel, to single people, couples, business travelers, but not to anyone overly fusy. They have a wine hour at 5:30pm very nice touch. Also free wifi offered. I would stay there again, avoid Hyde st because of the many homeless gov assistance individuals. I would stay there again, it's just a few extra blocks away from Union Square. Felt safe there.
review.positiveRemarks: Room size and bed, great rest in hotel
review.negativeRemarks: A little more of a walk from Union Square, but less price was great
review.locationRemarks: Hilly section

review.title: Not a great hotel at all
review.reviewText:
The water in the room when you rinse your mouth is like toxic water taste.
Hotel is very old and not update. Terrible service in hotels.

review.title: Ok
review.reviewText: Very thin walls. People slamming doors at all hours, dog incessantly barking at 2 in the morning. And an hour wait for the valet. Construction going on at 6 in the morning. (Not at the hotel but across the street) Staff was very nice, and considerate.
review.negativeRemarks: The lack of quiet
review.locationRemarks: Great

review.title: Noisy but clean
review.reviewText: The staff is very friendly and accommodating, especially the front desk attendants. The rooms were clean but small. The only real issue I had with the stay was the noise level. Even on the highest floor the street traffic was easily heard and elevator noises were heard all the way down the hall.

review.title: Reasonable but not excellent.
review.reviewText:
Positive: staff is friendly and qualified, room is clean, free wi-fi available.
Negative: room space is not comfortable, hotel slightly desolated.
review.negativeRemarks: Room space
review.locationRemarks: Not the best

review.title: IF you have kids, dont pick this place
review.reviewText: The Room was super clean but it was very small! There was hardly any space to put anything. With a child, it was just too clouded! The staff was great and the room was very clean. Parking is super expensive!
review.negativeRemarks: small bedroom size
review.locationRemarks: the location was ok.

review.title: Nice hotel - best for younger people.
review.reviewText:
Overall we enjoyed our stay at the Carlton - the staff were exceptionally friendly which makes a big difference.
We were on the top floor and I believe we had a room that had not yet been renovated so it did appear a bit dated but still as clean as a dated room could possibly be! It was stylish with a 'vintage feel' and very comfortable. Lots of windows which was both a blessing (interesting views/light) but also because of the weather (stormy) a little disturbing. It is a noisy area generally so if you're a very light sleeper, maybe not for you. The windows (which were retrofitted) are plastic and sounded as if they were open even when they weren't!
It's also on the edge of a not great area but if you head uphill to Nobhill it's a good location! only a few blocks from the California street streetcar.
The hotel does feel a little like a hostel in clientele (and the elevator decoration) but rooms are more hotel than hostel!
review.negativeRemarks: Windows need replacing! noisy and scary in a storm..
review.locationRemarks: On the edge of a bad area but close to a good one and transport.

review.title: Don't stay there
review.reviewText: Dirty and smelly rooms, very bad neighboorhood, thin walls..hard to sleep at night because of noise, no a/c no heating...it's a hostel charging hotel prices
review.locationRemarks: Dangerous

review.title: No parking
review.reviewText: Expensive parking. Nice cozy lobby . Small rooms with not much of a view

review.title: Cold and paper thin walls
review.reviewText:
Walls were paper thin, could hear the guy in the next room snoring all night.
