Very cold and when I asked about heat, I was told they would bring a space heater and it never arrived. Dirty loud area of SF. But comfortable clean bed and kind staff.

review.title: stylish & chic with a converniet location
review.reviewText: Very chic and stylish. Exceptionally clean. And best of all, its only a short cab ride to the best sights and restaurants in San Francisco.

review.title: Cute Little Hotel!
review.reviewText: Hotel Carlton is such a cute hotel! The room is small but comfortable. But the thing that made my stay just grand was the staff. Everyone is so friendly! Nightly wine and entertainment by Snazz is a must do!
review.negativeRemarks: Not very many places to go out and dine. However, the restaurant in the hotel is fantastic!

review.title: great hotel
review.reviewText: this is a boutique hotel, very clean and pleasant. the only reason i stayed here was because of the price, it was discounted
review.positiveRemarks: location, there is a cool restaurant right next door callec FLY
review.negativeRemarks: my room did not have a mini fridge and a heater
review.locationRemarks: civic center location

review.title: Good hotel.
review.reviewText: Very friendly staff and good location. And price was good.

review.title: Awesome hotel!!!
review.reviewText: We loved it!!! The staff were excellent and so nice and very helpful!!! Very clean and classy!!! We will defiantly be back!!
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing
review.locationRemarks: Great location very close to all attractions !

review.title: Not good for family, yes for students & business
review.reviewText: Good location, good service wine tasting from 5-7pm that's a great time to start off the night. No parking and the valet was a little to expensive but overall it was ok. Rooms were to small I felt I was in Europe.
review.negativeRemarks: Small rooms and hallway. No parking valet to expensive
review.locationRemarks: Everything was close by.

review.title: Charming & Affordable
review.reviewText:
Hotel Carlton was a wonderful experience for us. We were traveling (as a couple) to visit family in the Bay Area, and would go back in a heartbeat! The staff is excellent, and the hotel itself is very simple, quaint and charming. We stayed on the 8th floor facing what I think was the back side of things, and it was honestly an amazing view (attaching a few photos).

The rooms are simple but clean. Toiletries are AMAZING, and come on a wall mounted dispenser too, saving on hassle and waste of the little containers. Our room had a huge walk-in closet with an automatic light, which was awesome for changing in the morning without waking up someone still sleeping. This was more than enough room to store luggage and hanging clothes, and even do the ironing!

Yes it's an older hotel & yes it's noisy. That's SF, people! lol It's part of the charm IMO. We opened the windows and enjoyed it. There was one night they did a "round up" in the neighboring Tenderloin and there were a ton of sirens, but hey - it's part of the SF experience. If you can't handle it, then don't stay here. Seemed not to bother the other patrons - of which many were international travelers, along w/some business. All very friendly, which gave it a homey atmosphere. They also do a fireside complimentary wine happy hour in the lobby.

A con was no fridge & microwave, since we were constantly eating out and that made it impossible to really keep any inevitable leftovers.

Overall GREAT stay tho! :)
review.positiveRemarks: charm, warmth, international flair, eco-friendly, unique, friendly, affordable, great service, old but clean, attached restaurant, "homey"
review.negativeRemarks: no microwave, no fridge, elevators are pretty old - avoid the small one, lol! can be noisy from normal SF outside activity
review.locationRemarks: walking distance to coffee, restaurants, market ... borders a seedy area to be avoided at night, parking difficult

review.title: Wonderful Hotel experience!
review.reviewText: Remarkable find! The Carlton experience was really pleasing, from the front desk staff (who are very amusing) throughout the entre staff, restaurnt and wine tasting in the evenings! This is a "European" style hotel without the cost, but including the service! Highly recommend to all who want a safe comfortable stay at a very reasonble price!
review.negativeRemarks: Just a bit far to walk for transportation.

review.title: Great value for the money. And fun to boot!
review.reviewText: I loved this hotel. The staff are really fun and so helpful. The Indian decor is pretty and comfortable; the breakfast was excellent and healthy. And I felt right at home in my room. This was the first hotel I've stayed in that meant it when it said they were trying to go green and would take your towels away only when you wanted them to. They also don't waste all that plastic by giving you little bottles of stuff, but have dispensers in the shower. It's sanitary but saves on labor & materials. It all made sense, yet one did not feel cheated out of comfort. Everything you could want is there. I walked to the Moscone Center from there in 25 minutes and enjoyed the walk.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing
review.locationRemarks: Near enough to interesting shops

review.title: Great value base for SF
review.reviewText: Safe and friendly place with easy access to downtown, airport etc. We had a fantastic week here looking all round San Francisco. The only disappointment was we were out and about so much we kept missing the free wine and cheese.

review.title: Good hotel, good price.
review.reviewText:
It's an old hotel but very clean and pleasant. It's in a good area and HALF the cost of other hotels not that far away. 15 minute walk at most to Union Square.

We had a problem with the valet parking, it appeared that someone didn't communicate properly and our car was 20 minutes late in being ready. On the flip side, the hotel staff, made it very clear how much valet parking would be and that we really didn't need to use it.
review.negativeRemarks: valet parking was 20 minutes late.
review.locationRemarks: good location - 10 - 15 minute walk to union square.

review.title: No air conditioner service in none of the rooms.
review.reviewText:
I dont understand how your web page rates this hotel 4.5 if it doesnt even have air conditioner in none of their room, only a fan.

The personal service is terrible.
review.negativeRemarks: The rooms and service
review.locationRemarks: From from Union Square

review.title: NICE HOTEL
review.reviewText: We enjoyed our stay in San Francisco. This hotel was seven blocks from Union Square, just make sure you bring your walking shoes. The hotel staff was very nice and helpful, they gave us a lot of valuable info regarding the best places to eat and how to get around. If you want a good breakfast, we highly recommend the Golden Gate Grill. It was sooo good! We liked our room, the only thing was that there was some construction going on across the street when we were there and it could get a little noisy in the mornings, but that is just temporary. The only suggestion we have regarding the hotel is that the carpet looks pretty worn. Everything else has been beautifully refurbished.
review.positiveRemarks: Good location, within walking distance of union square. Staff very nice and helpful.
review.negativeRemarks: It was a little noisy when we were there.... some construction going on across the street
review.locationRemarks: About seven blocks from union square.

review.title: an excellent place to stay
review.reviewText: We were welcomed by a cheerful, informative staff when we arrived at the hotel. We didn't know what to expect of our accommodations and were pleased with the attractive and clean appearance of everything from the front entry, the hallways to our room, to the cheery clean room we stayed in for 4 nights. Being in the heart of San Francisco we were surprised at how quiet the hotel is. The people who work at the reception desk were all helpful with directions and making reservations for us--they felt like old friends.
review.positiveRemarks: The 5:30 wine hour each day. The young group of musicians "SNAZZ" who played one evening was definitely a favorite experience in our SF visit.
review.negativeRemarks: We had to leave for home.
review.locationRemarks: We walked to most of our destinations. The staff helped us figure out good transportation when we needed it.

review.title: excellent location and service
review.reviewText:
Great location.

Service was excellent-helpful and friendly.

Amenities were sufficient for our site-seeing purposes. Bathroom was small and could use some updating. No air conditioning, but it wasn't necessary in October.

Walls are super thin and not even close to sound-proof. Heard every siren and dump truck outside; heard all talking and nose-blowing from the hall and adjacent rooms.

Would recommend to anyone-very much enjoyed our stay.
review.positiveRemarks: location, people at the front desk, character/charm
review.negativeRemarks: very thin walls-can hear everything inside and outside of the hotel

review.title: Dated hotel
review.reviewText:
Maybe I should have read the fine print and listened to the reviews. No workout room in the hotel. Walls are paper thin, I mean rice paper thin. I could even hear the neighbor's hiccups. As far as I could tell, there was no heat nor AC. The staff were nice, but the hotel is very dated, not dirty, just has some age on it. I don't mind small rooms, since it is an old building, but it is dated.

Now I understand why the Best Western down the street is more expensive than this hotel.

The restaurant must be good as it was always packed, I didn't try it though.

review.title: San Francisco Travesty
review.reviewText: For the amount paid per night, this place is waaaaaay overrated. No way I'd stay here again.
review.positiveRemarks: The complimentary bottle of wine that was provided at check in.
review.negativeRemarks: Old, small rooms, lame staff.
review.locationRemarks: Great if you are in the market for "ladies of the evening"!

review.title: Excellent value for money
review.reviewText: Not noisy at all considering the location (very close to Polk st with lots of places to eat). Bed was superbly comfortable (queen room). Staff very friendly and helpful and lobby was a nice place to relax while waiting for friends.
review.locationRemarks: Good for food, a long walk to golden gate park and presidio but easy bus travel nearby.

review.title: One night stay
review.reviewText: The staff was excellent. The walls are rather thin and you could hear the people in the next room. One or town night it's ok. Parking was easy and well organized $20 per night.

review.title: Cozy and exotic
review.reviewText:
Cozy and a bit exotic, the Hotel Carlton is a wonderful place to stay.
Expect amazing service with an evening happy hour that allows you to mingel with other guests, and just enough sarcasm to leave you with a smile on your face.

review.title: It's the boutique hotel you hoped for.
review.reviewText:
The staff is very polite and helpful. The rooms are nice and well maintained. The bed linens are as nice as the most expensive hotels.

Location was a concern when booking. Like all downtown San Francisco locations, it is never a far walk to a seedy location. However, Nice pubs and restaurants are near by and it is a short a pleasant walk to Union Square. Do yourself a favor and have at least one breakfast in the hotel's restaurant. Fantastic!
review.positiveRemarks: Bed linens. You just want to stay in bed all day.
review.negativeRemarks: No AC - although nice San Francisco breezes make it rarely needed. You can open the windows and there's a ceiling fan. Very pleasant usually.
review.locationRemarks: It's Downtown San Francisco so you'll see some characters but the immediate area is safe with easy walks to the best places.

review.title: Good hotel 6 blocks from Union Square
review.reviewText: Nice place to stay, good location, very helpful. The location is good for us. Hotel is about 6 blocks from Union Square. Hotel staff is freindly an helpful. Will stay there again.
review.negativeRemarks: Would be nice to have a breakfast included.
review.locationRemarks: Good location 6 blocks from Union Square.

review.title: great for everybody
review.reviewText: The location of hotel is good. It is close to Chinatown, Downtown as well as Japantown. The provision in the room is adequate and up to standard. Although there is tea kettle in the room, it is convenient to get hot/cold water from the water dispenser at the corridor. The staff is nice and helpful.

review.title: Noisy San Fran Hotel
review.reviewText:
Very noisy at night. Heat made lots of noise also. Requested that heat be turned off. They said they would send someone to do so, but never did.
Sounded like they were throwing heavy stuff into dumpsters on and off all night long.
review.negativeRemarks: Noise
review.locationRemarks: Handy to lots of sights in SF

review.title: Great Gotel to unwind!
review.reviewText: Traveled to San Francisco with wife and 3 teenagers. Looked for a medium priced place in the city. The hotel was good and the value was good for the price. The service was outstanding. Everyone, and I mean everyone, had a great sense of humor and a desire to serve. They were attentive, informative and made my boys laugh. We would come back just for the service and highly reccomend this if you are looking for a good safe, clean and not stuffy place to stay.

review.title: decent, but kinda expensive, I guess that's sf
review.reviewText: The lobby is very nice, but the rooms were not as grea, my TV control did not work and there is not a heater, you have to ask for one. You can hear almost every work spoken by people in the rooms next door. The staff is very polite though and fixed my remote right away and brought me a space heater. There is a wine social daily, but you have to ask what time it is at.
review.negativeRemarks: Room
review.locationRemarks: safe

review.title: good place , good location
review.reviewText: Hotel is not supreme, but it is a good deal. Public transportations are close. It is not the best area for dining but you walk half a mile and you enter the popular area of Union Square. I did not find worth buying the sightseeing ticket that is conveniently sold at the reception. With a public transportation map you can do more by yourself.
review.positiveRemarks: helpfulness at the front desk, location, although just behind the Tenderloin, which is definitely a very sketchy area.
review.negativeRemarks: carpet might not have been the cleanest
review.locationRemarks: convenient, close to Union and better than staying at the waterfront if you want to enjoy some life in the evening

photos.caption: View from our room facing Sutter St.

review.title: Surprisingly wonderful hotel
review.reviewText:
I was very surprised at how pleasant our stay was at the Carlton. Upon entering the hotel, it had a very friendly and comforting atmosphere. The staff at the front desk were very friendly and offered my husand and a glass of wine each. They ended up giving us the bottle of wine for free to take to our room.

Our room was nice but small. We had two full-sizes beds to accomdate a family of four. The only problem we had is that our window faced a construction site across the street, so the morning noise was unbearable not to mention an eyesore as far as view goes.

They had two elevators and they both were really small. So, hope that you don't have to get on when there is a large group also waiting. The elevators had pictures and maps on the walls which we found interesting. Unfortunately, one night we had to walk up 7 flights of stairs because the elevator was out of service.

We were pleased with the location. It was close to everything: Union Square, Civic Center, etc. I don't recommend travelng outside the hotel at night with kids though. There are some pretty shady characters that come at night in the area.

Overall we had a very pleasant stay, 4 nights. We will most likely stay there again.
review.positiveRemarks: The lobby is very pleasant. I enjoyed the decor. The staff were very friendly.
review.negativeRemarks: The view from our room was looking directly into a construction sight.
review.locationRemarks: The location was great. Walking distance to Union Square, Chinatown, Civic Center, close to bus and trolley as well as food places and markets.

review.title: Nice staff but an aging hotel.
review.reviewText: Hotel that has seen better days and needs a major renovation. A fine budget hotel and at a low price would be good. A good value at a 2-3 star price. But we realized that for the price we could have stayed at much more luxurious place. On the plus side, the staff is friendly, helpful and cheerful. The rooms were clean and comfortable. Only one working elevator for the entire hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: Rooms were plain and had a real low-budget feel and look.
review.locationRemarks: OK

review.title: Great time!
review.reviewText: Great location to shopping,restaurants, and tourist sites. Overall we had a great stay. The place was Clean and staff wonderful. Also a great on site restaurant.

review.title: Perfectly adequate hotel
review.reviewText: Quite a basic hotel but well maintained and friendly. Don't be deceivedby the pictures of the hotel lobby, the rest of it doesn't look like that.......but overall perfectly adequate. The area is central but beware of lots of homeless and crazy people on the walk to union square.

review.title: Good getaway hotel
review.reviewText: Could use more TV channels. Walls are rather thin - had issues with neighbors one night. Location is fairly good relative to downtown core. The wine happy hour was a very nice touch.
review.positiveRemarks: Wine happy hour. Friendly staff and good housekeeping.
review.negativeRemarks: Sound proofing of room and limited number of TV channels. Price was a bit high with these concerns.
review.locationRemarks: Good - perhaps better suited for couples than families.

review.title: good
review.reviewText: very nice， i like it so much. nice location , good service

review.title: Good value and location for families
review.reviewText: The Carlton was exactly as billed -- not a luxury hotel but nicely renovated, European style city hotel. Room size was what you would expect from a SanFran (or NYC) hotel. Location is fine -- just don't walk towards the Civic Center or Tenderloin, but perfectly fine to walk towards Union Square or Nob Hill, even at night, and Sutter Street itself in front of the hotel is safe. Several coffee/breakfast spots within 2 or 3 blocks. And particularly convenient location to access by car from Rt 101/the airport or to drive to Golden Gate or west toward Pacific ocean. Also only a 3 block walk to California Street cable car line, or 6 blocks to Powell street lines. Overall a good value for families
review.negativeRemarks: street noise a bit loud, in light of no a/c

review.title: I aim to stay here again on my next visit!
review.reviewText: The first thing I found was that the hotel staff was wonderful. They remembered my name and greeted me each day, helped me get oriented with the city and various modes of transportation, and gave advice on restaurants and activities. The restaurant attached to the hotel is excellent and very accommodating to vegans (try the fava bean version of eggs benedict - yum). The room was relatively clean, save for a coffee stirrer on the floor next to the bed and a hair on the bathroom floor. It smelled clean and the windows opened nicely and let in beautiful, cool air and provided a great view of the city (6th floor). I could easly hear the people in the room next to us when they were speaking at a normal level, but I didn't hear any pipes thumping or doors closing or stairs. Complimentary wine our was very popular. I had my first sip of wine ever, which confirmed what I suspected - I am so not a wino! The location was perfect, easy walking distance from Union Square, Embarcadero, Fishermans Wharf, Chinatown, Russian Hill, etc. Sutter Street felt very safe, night and day. I would definitely try to stay here again when I come back!

review.title: Nice but noisy
review.reviewText: The room was nice. Staff was very courteous. Close to several attractions. Only complaints were that the rooms weren't very sound proof. I could hear everything the next room was saying and probably vice versa. Also I could hear everything going on outside. Didn't stay much in the room but probably wouldn't stay there again.
review.negativeRemarks: The lack of privacy and outside noise.
review.locationRemarks: Typical frisco.

review.title: Interesting and enjoyable
review.reviewText: The staff were excellent, the atmosphere delightful and the experience one to repeat.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff were helpful and informative.
review.locationRemarks: The location was ideal for us between the Wharf and Business district with great local restraunts to choose.

review.title: Reasonable value for money
review.reviewText:
Pro: Affordable accommodation 15 mins walking distance to Market St and Union Square. Staff helpful and friendly. Free Wi-Fi in room. Room has a safe.

Contra: Located near the seedy 'tenderloin' area, which some might find uncomfortable after dark, e.g. sex workers on nearby streets, loads of homeless people sleeping in the area. As for the hotel, the online downside was the lack of bar-fridge during my 5 night stay.

review.title: Recommended - good location in heart of SF city
review.reviewText:
The hotel is very conveniently located in the heart of San Francisco. It is near the cable cars and near bus lines that will take you absolutely where-ever you desire in San Francisco city. Make sure you grab a visitors map as it shows all the bus and cable car lines.

The walls are very thin so it was a bit noisy with neighbours staying and talking late at nights. But I wouldn't let that sway you. I would recommend this hotel on the value that you get for this hotel.
review.locationRemarks: great location to all tourist sites

review.title: nice for the price
review.reviewText: hotel is walking distance to union square/china town. room are spacious considering San Francisco area and other hotels.
review.negativeRemarks: had to have our linen changed at check in due to found hair on comforter .
review.locationRemarks: excellent walking distance to everything.

review.title: i would not stay there again
review.reviewText: the walls between rooms are thin and in a room with a connecting door you can give up on having some peace and quiet if your next door neighbors are a loud inconsiderate family. instead of the management insisting the other guests be quiet they offered to further inconvenience us and move us in the middle of the night to another room. we parked our car with their vallet service and the car came back scratched clearly bc of a close turn against a wall or another car.
review.negativeRemarks: was not able to sleep for 2 nights bc of thin walls and slamming doors
review.locationRemarks: ok location. sort of sketchy at night

review.title: Cheap for good reasons
review.reviewText: It is not a boutique hotel and shouldn't really advertise as such. The room looked pretty, but had no fridge. The staff were grumpy and uncommunicative. The area it's in is pretty scary at night. It's cheap, but it's cheap for good reasons.
review.negativeRemarks: grudging staff
review.locationRemarks: dangerous

review.title: Great service
review.reviewText: The staff at the hotel were friendly and helpful. They were also very responsive when we had a party going on in the next room in the small hours. The location made walking to main tourist spots relatively easy (if you don't mind the hills) and there is a lovely bar right next door. The only downside of the hotel was the paper thin walls. The happy hour drinks in the lobby with live music was a unique experience.
review.negativeRemarks: The paper thin walls

review.title: few comments about my stay
review.reviewText:
it was not good they had no a.c. but it was good their managed to bring us a heater to the room.
elevators are funky, what does not exactly match the rest of good decor in the hotel.
breakfast staff do not seem really neat.
we were not able to check in when we arrived at 3.15. it only took some 10 minutes more, but still.
however they allowed us late check out 1pm.
review.negativeRemarks: no ac
review.locationRemarks: a bit of a walk, but wasn't that bad

review.title: Good value
review.reviewText: Older but well-maintained hotel in a good location.
review.positiveRemarks: Cleanliness and comfort made this a good value.
review.negativeRemarks: One side of room was separated by a door to next room and could hear even light conversation next door. Internet a little weak during peak hours.
review.locationRemarks: Nob Hill area is still relatively nice and safe. Good restaurant corridor two short blocks away on Polk north through Russian Hill.

review.title: Hotel Experience: Loud Hotel Guests
review.reviewText: The hotel has quiet hours from I believe 10PM-8AM, but I can hear people in the hallways at around 1-2AM and also at 6AM super loud.
review.negativeRemarks: Bathrooms weren't the greatest
review.locationRemarks: Convenience, close to a lot of places yet close to the Tenderloin district, so it's not very safe to walk at night

review.title: Very Nice
review.reviewText: It was really nice and comfortable, and we slept more than we expected very peacefull

review.title: We'll be back.
review.reviewText: The Hotel Carlton was pleasantly surprising in its eclectic styling and amiable staff. Also, it's just a couple of blocks from a major bus route and within doable walking distance of Chinatown. You'll enjoy your stay.

review.title: Traveller
review.reviewText: The staffing was very kind and friendly. Easy to speak with them regarding upcoming events in the area and needs. The wine reception was enjoyable and allowed the multi-cultural guests a chance to intermingle and make new friends. The hotel ice machine is located in the lobby and on the top floor, so it can be a bit bothersome to get ice repeatedly. The valet wait to bring your car around is around 20 min+ so call the front desk ahead of time before you come down.
review.positiveRemarks: The Wine reception and its friendly staff
review.negativeRemarks: Cracks along walls and doors in room
review.locationRemarks: Close to Union Square and good eats

photos.caption: Happy hour at the bar next door

review.title: We liked it!
review.reviewText: We stayed on the 7th floor with views of downtown. The room was spacious, clean and super comfortable. The hotel does not have tall buildings surrounding it so I think no rooms face a brick wall ( which I have encountered at other SF boutique hotels ). Super convenient location and area felt very safe for myself and my 75 year old mother. We even had cocktails in the bar next door!
review.positiveRemarks: The room size, location and great staff
review.negativeRemarks: The sirens at night and noise from other rooms.
review.locationRemarks: Great central location, short convenient bus ride to many neighborhoods in SF

review.title: Clean Sheets now theres a plus
review.reviewText:
We arrived early and were told to wait till 3pm. So we waited staff were friendly cracking stupid jokes! After a 300 mile drive this wasnt what we wanted. Rooms still were not ready at 3pm and still the silly jokes, hence being given a free breakfast...
Once in the rooms paint was peeling in the bathrooms and mould on the ceiling. The sheets were clean so that was a plus. To me this hotel was more like a hostel for back packing. Wasnt what we were all used too.
Over all though the staff were friendly and we made it through the experience. I just guess I have been spoiled in the past with higher end hotels.
If your looking for a place to put your head and clean sheets this meets your needs. Personally I wouldnt stay here again just not my thing.
review.negativeRemarks: It needs some money spent on the hotel its more like a back packing hostel then a hotel
review.locationRemarks: It was just up from Union Square so was good you could walk down to the square and everything was there for you.Just make sure you have good footware

review.title: a hidden gem
review.reviewText: The staff were very warm and welcoming. Although we could not check in when we arrived we did get a free upgrade to the top floor, so we had no noise problems. There were only 2 elevators but we never had to wait long. Enjoying our wine, it was a bonus to find free win-tasing every evening between 5 and 5,30. Lots of eateries within few minutes walking distance, plus restaurant on-site, although not actually part of the hotel. It was about 10 minutes walk to Union Square, but remember SF is a city of hills! Hotel was clean, comfortably decorated, definitely recommended.
review.negativeRemarks: Location
review.locationRemarks: 10 minutes walk from Union Square. Not the best area, but seemed safe enough. There are homeless everywhere in SF.

review.title: Perfect hotel for a girls trip!!
review.reviewText:
I would totally go back to this hotel!! I went with 2 other girl friends for the first time in SFC. When I was booking a hotel, all the other inexpensive hotels had reviews saying it was in a sketchy area with lots of homeless people. This hotel was the only one that didn't have those comments, so I decided to go for it.
It wasn't very close to Union square but still in walk distance like 20min. Even at night, if you walk on Powell.st and Sutter.st you don't feel unsafe.
Hotel has super cute decor since it's a boutique hotel. People who worked there were super nice. The restaurant/bar right next to the hotel was good. Bed was comfy...
This hotel made our trip the best girls trip ever!!

review.title: The Carlton
review.reviewText: Loved the hotel. Laid back, very relaxing. Staff really helpful and we loved the free wine and music, especially Mr Snazz!! Would definitely stay here again.
review.locationRemarks: Close to walk to Union Square if you enjoy hills....

review.title: Excellent Hotel
review.reviewText:
We had a really good time at this hotel. The staff were excellent - very helpful & friendly without being overbearing. Willing to recommend places to eat - even though they had their own restaurant on site.
We asked them to book us a cab one morning, and they offered us their own chauffeur driven car - at the same rate as a taxi - a small thing, but personal and saved us waiting around for a cab.
Had everything you needed, with just a little extra - the breakfast waiter remembered what we liked after day 1, the beds were soooo comfortable !! You felt you were a person rather than random income providers.
Would highly recommend to anyone.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing
review.locationRemarks: Very central, everything within easy reach of a short walk or public transport

review.title: Great Hotel in the Tenderloin area
review.reviewText: Fan to slow to cool the room, opening windows was very hard but doable. Great staff at the front Desk, caring and funny!
review.negativeRemarks: No Air Cond
review.locationRemarks: Great Location in San Francisco

review.title: Great stay at carlton
review.reviewText: Very nice and equally helpful staff. Great location. A little noisy but I'm sure any hotel in the area would be. Great complimentary wine hour

review.title: Great hotel!
review.reviewText: The hotel was near everything! My kids kept complaining because of all the walking but everything was so close, getting in the car & paying for parking is a real pain. They have free wine every night as an added bonus! It's walking distance to both union and Washington square and even to Coit tower. From check in to check out everyone went out of their way to help me and my family - it was a fantasic stay. Some minor cosmetic issues with the paint chipping in the bathroom, but in no way will it affect your stay.
review.negativeRemarks: Noting
review.locationRemarks: Close to everything. Ghetto side not an issue if you stay away from it. Hotel was far enough away from it that it won't affect you.

review.title: Noisy but nice
review.reviewText: It was nice enough for the price and the location was close to town. The room was clean and the bed was comfortable. The staff is what makes this hotel good, they were very friendly and helpful. The free drinks every night were a great way to end the day of sightseeing and start for dinner. The only negative was that it was noisy at night with sirens going off all night and the walls are very thin and you could hear everything the next door neighbour was up to.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff and the restaurant were very good
review.negativeRemarks: Noise at night
review.locationRemarks: Convenient location

review.title: So So
review.reviewText: This hotel is old and worn out. The room has central heating with no way to control in the room. It gets too hot. With no airconditioning, the only way to cool is to open the window and gets very noisy.

review.title: Not bad--worth the price
review.reviewText:
The staff were great. They were extremely helpful with tips on where to eat, areas to avoid and attention to our needs. The walls were rather thin as we could hear just about everything next to and below us. The room was clean and well kept, but a bit cold next to the window where the bed was situated. And since there is no heat control in the room we had to ask for an extra blanket which they brought to us right away. They also offered a space heater but frankly I don't know where we would have put it given the limited space in the room. The location was pretty good--6 blocks to the Powell Street cable line.
One thing that bothered me a bit was that while our reservation stated that there were 4 people in our party (2 kids) we still had to ask for additional towels and glasses. But they did bring them right away, so can't complain too much. Also, the late afternoon wine reception did not include any drinks for kids, so I might not consider it much of a family hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: thin walls
review.locationRemarks: 6 blocks from Powell St. cable line

review.title: My stay in Hotel Carlton
review.reviewText: It was just slightly further away from union square than expected. Overall, it is a good experience and the staff is very friendly. The room has a nice fan in the ceiling and the decor is very cultural.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing noted.
review.locationRemarks: It was just slightly further away from union square than expected

review.title: An nice experience
review.reviewText: Loved the staff more than anything. We checked in early and were able to make a meeting in time. The staff that checked us in were friendly and very funny. They like to joke with you. The room was clean and nicely decorated. Walking distance to Union Square. We didn't get to eat in the restaurant but it was filled with people when I passed it. Make sure to be around for the evening free wine in the lobby.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff made you feel right a home.
review.negativeRemarks: Bathroom needs some updating.
review.locationRemarks: Six blocks from Union Square. Was one of the quietest hotels I've staying at in SF.

review.title: None
review.reviewText: Good. Had a peaceful trip. Just a little noisy at night times. But that cant be helped.

review.title: Cozy stay with a couple caveats.
review.reviewText:
Stayed here on our first trip to San Francisco. Nice decor, and its a real nice boutique feel, especially with the events they have there at night (wine/cheese and other types of meet ups). Great location that is very easy to get to and access the important parts of the city. Decent staff, clean hotel but a couple of things. They omit the fact that they don't have A/C, even though you probably won't need it, it was a little disappointing of a 3 star hotel. Also, of the 4 nights we stayed there, the FREE WiFi only worked for one night. When we asked why it wasn't working, the answer was that "technicians are working on it". When asked again the next few days, answer was a rude and abrupt "nope" from the reception. A) it should NEVER take 4 days to fix the WiFi, and B) if you're going to offer something complimentary and advertise it as such a major perk, make sure it works.

For a 3 star hotel that is one of the few in the same price/location to offer free wifi and prominently advertise it, we were very disappointed at the fact that it did not work. Some parts of the hotel feel a little too old because of a lack of renovation.
review.positiveRemarks: Decor, location, and cozy, clean room.
review.negativeRemarks: Free Wifi didn't work, no A/C or temperature control of any kind. No refrigerator/microwave, but that wasn't advertised.
review.locationRemarks: Great! close to mission, north beach and the wharf. a bit far from the financial district.

review.title: happy customer
review.reviewText: perfect, loved the atmosphere of lobby and room and very friendly staff
review.locationRemarks: don't know the city too well but seemed great

review.title: oldie but goodie
review.reviewText:
The hotel is fairly old but thats what gives it charm, we have stayed here before and really enjoyed it for the price.
The evening wine hour is fun, and nice to come home to after a long day in the city.
The staff is amazing and super friendly and will help you with whatever you need.

Next door is a great bar with nice food and wonderful bar tenders who always make our stay even better!
review.positiveRemarks: great for the price! the staff is so friendly, the lobby is very accommodating, just like home.
review.negativeRemarks: dirty bath tub , central heating takes getting used too, the walls are very thin
review.locationRemarks: the tender nob is just on the border of nob hill and the tender loin, I wouldn't walk at night alone between here and market street

review.title: Vacation visit to Hotel Carlton San Francisco
review.reviewText:
We arrived in San Francisco in the morning, on calling the hotel we were able drop our lugage off before checkin. On arriving at the Carlton, they had a room ready so we were able to have an early chech in. The reception staff were very friendly and welcoming.
We stayed there for 4 nights and found the hotel very convenient for the city centre-- about 10 minutes walk from Union Square. Breakfasts were of good quality and not unreasonably priced for a major city hotel.
If visiting Frisco again, the Carlton would be our first choice.
review.locationRemarks: 10 minutes walk from the city centre, handy for shopping ,eating and cable car stops

review.title: Charm in the city
review.reviewText: This hotel is charming and comfortable, and I like the international feel of it with all of the photographs from Tibet. The staff were very welcoming and friendly.

photos.caption: first dirty bath tub. this is absurd for a hotel.

review.title: Filthy hotel...would not recommend this hotel
review.reviewText:
When we arrived at the hotel, the baggage man came out to tell me to pull up closer to the car in front of me. Even though it was pouring rain, he never came out to offer help with the luggage, nor did we get help with our bags to our room. Mind you, I am a mom and I had my young daughter with me.
Then we got to the room and the room was filthy. The bath tub was so disgusting that there was no way we would have set foot in the tub. We love to go camping, so a little dirt is not big deal, but this was gross. We should have brought flip flops.
We did ask for a new room and got one. They blamed the filth on the fact that they are a "green hotel" and cannot use bleach. A little bit of elbow grease is needed though. The tub part of the next room was better, but the mold growing on the wall tile was uncalled for. The cleanliness of the hotel in general was very poor. I wold never recommend this hotel to anyone, nor would we stay there again. Such a disappointment.
review.negativeRemarks: cleanliness
review.locationRemarks: right in the tenderloin district. don't go.

review.title: Good stay!
review.reviewText: I am really glad that i have chosen this hotel for my SF trip. Very clean rooms and friendly staff. I will be back for sure.

review.title: Pleasant surprise in SFO
review.reviewText: Very good value. Not fancy but very adequate and comfortable. Staff was extremely welcoming and helpful. Wine evenings fun. Room comfortable and quiet. For SFO , very reasonable. I would book it again.
review.positiveRemarks: Staff was terrific, quiet, good value in an expensive city
review.locationRemarks: not far from Union square. Walk 2 blocks west to nice restaurant neighborhood

review.title: We Will be Back
review.reviewText: This was our first time in San Francisco and we stayed at the Carlton on advice from our friend. The location was good with only about a 10 minute walk to Union Square and easy access to transportation. The hotel staff was excellent. We asked them plenty of questions and they were very friendly and knowledgeable every time. If I find myself in San Francisco again, I will definitely stay here.
review.negativeRemarks: None
review.locationRemarks: Good location. About 10 minute walk to Union Square and good access to bars, restaurants, and transportation.

review.title: Great bargain hotel!
review.reviewText: The staff was fantastic and the hotel and rooms were very cute. The walls are very thin so you can hear EVERYTHING. This would be my only complaint. Other than that the location is convenient and my overall stay was great.
review.negativeRemarks: Sleeping rooms were noisy
review.locationRemarks: Very convenient but close to some sketchy areas

review.title: NOT WORTH THE MONEY. VERY LOUD
review.reviewText:
The room itself smelled and the carpets were dirty. It simply didn't feel clean. The blankets were musty and so I slept with just the sheet.
The hotel was ridiculously loud and the heating element was clanging ALL night. The doors are wall are very thin so I heard every conversation on all sides. I didn't sleep a wink and I was up at 4 am that day. I'm from NYC so trust me, I am used to lots of noise. But this was just ridiculous.
I would never stay there ever agin. The ONLY reason I am giving it a 2 and not a 1, is that the staff was friendly and efficient.
review.negativeRemarks: The noise.
review.locationRemarks: Location was fairly convenient. Hard to catch a cab.

review.title: review
review.reviewText:
charming staff who were welcoming and helpful
very enjoyable stay
review.negativeRemarks: bathrooms a little tired but no big deal
review.locationRemarks: 20 mins wali from union sq but good access to japan town

review.title: Was the price right?
review.reviewText: I felt like I was on the edge of sketchy. I walked to the hotel from BART, which was about 5 blocks too far in the SF hills, but I walked past alot of bums, and sketchy looking people, and I felt weird walking in that area with my roller bag. The room was small, and the furnishings seemed new, but the walls were old, and the shower needed to be caulked and re grouted. The towels were fresh and the bed was comfy. And the Wi-Fi was terribly slow, though they said they would look into it. Overall it wasn't bad, I just expected more. Perhaps too much for a hotel in downtown SF, they never claimed to be the Hilton. Staff was nice.
review.positiveRemarks: Considering my short notice, I was greatful to find any place at all. Friendly staff.
review.negativeRemarks: Wi-Fi was very slow, neighborhood was sketchy, I wouldn't want to walk more than a block or two after dark.

review.title: Great location and price
review.reviewText: Good location and price for the hotel. Walls are thin

review.title: Loved it!
review.reviewText:
Booked this hotel for the cheaper prices and also the location as it was close to a friends house. I was pleasantly surprised at the very friendly staff who made me feel welcome every time I walked through the lobby. They provided top notch service and always made sure you were comfortable.
It was a nice 10 minute walk to Union Sq and plenty of little coffee shops nearby.
I would definitely recommend this to my friends & family and have every intention of staying here again on my next trip to SF.
review.negativeRemarks: The small elevators.
review.locationRemarks: Very decent location. Walking distance to Union Sq & cafe's.

review.title: Just right.
review.reviewText: The room was a little small, which is understandable cause it was a small hotel, but overall the rooms were very clean and we had everything we needed. Also, the staff was really great and having complimentary wine every night was wonderful (even though we only took advantage of that once). The only thing I would say is don't bother parking there, there are much cheaper places in the area you can leave your car.
review.positiveRemarks: Free wine and a comfortable bed.
review.negativeRemarks: Expensive parking
review.locationRemarks: A bit of a walk depending on where you wanted to go..

review.title: reasonable, but pricey
review.reviewText: Reasonable only, expensive for what it is. Location ok, on bus route, tram 2 blocks away, easy walk to union square in 10 min. Great restaurant in hotel.
review.locationRemarks: not too far from Union square, about 10 min walk. (7 blocks). Easy walk

review.title: Great hotel in Great location
review.reviewText:
This room was very clean and had a good powerful shower and nice bathroom. The bed was extremely comfortable and a great size. The price was amazing (although we were travelling in low season) and we were in the middle of the city centre. The room was a bit basic in decor but had everything you needed, including a suitcase rack, ironing board and tea and coffee facilities. I stayed in the Fairmont the week before for work, and although beautiful, it did not have tea/coffee making facilities in the room!

The only bad thing was that it could be noisy outside with the bin (garbage) collectors coming very early in the morning and some street noise, but when you stay in the middle of a city, this is exactly what you expect, and is the same in London, Paris, New York etc.

We asked at recption to book a car and they recommended a place, rang them up and got a great rate for us on the same day we wanted to go.
review.positiveRemarks: location, helpfulness of staff when booking a car, cleanliness, bed comfort
review.negativeRemarks: outside noise
review.locationRemarks: in the middle of the city, not far from Chinatown -- short walk to Nob Hill and Fisherman's Wharf

review.title: Great staff
review.reviewText: The hotel is located well enough to catch buses on Van Ness to GGPark & Mission district and Polk St with restaurants. The staff at the hotel deserve top marks for friendliness and service. They joke and keep things light. The wine reception at 5:30 is especially nice in meeting other travellers. They delivered a small fridge when we asked to refridgerate something. My only complaint would be that the room was expensive for what it was, it was clean but a bit dated, small tub and bath, but mostly the dirty, dusty windows left a bad impression. We had a top or 6th floor room so was quiet. I would recommend this hotel however because the staff were great.
review.negativeRemarks: Dirty windows
review.locationRemarks: Good

review.title: Fun and cute place to stay
review.reviewText: shower floor was a little dirty looking. I loved the feel of the place. Everyone was very helpful. It felt clean and safe.

review.title: Great, affordable place.
review.reviewText: The staff was great, very friendly and helpful. The rooms were cozy and comfortable and focused on being green. The restaurant had spectacular food though pricey. The place was very affordable. The only drawback is that the bathrooms need to be updated.

review.title: Ok for a night.
review.reviewText:
This hotel is OK with what you paid.
Staffs are very nice.
wall is too thin to hear every noise from next room.
if you are shallow sleeper like me you have to ask for that.
The corner room was not update to be pleasant
Not many place to eat near hotel.

review.title: Thin Walls
review.reviewText:
The room was nice, and the restaurant downstairs was very good, I can't recommend this hotel since the walls (and room connecting doors) were so thin that I could even hear my neighbors shifting on their bed.

Unless you are a deep sleeper, I would suggest looking elsewhere.

review.title: boutique with sparkle
review.reviewText: Renovated in the things that matter, but retains character of the old hotel that it is. Staff helpful, friendly, and sense of humor. Lots of restaurants/bars within walking distance.
review.positiveRemarks: Festive atmosphere in lobby, great for just relaxing, or meeting up before going out.
review.negativeRemarks: Hotel's age means some walls are thin, so noise could be an issue. But it wasn't for me.
review.locationRemarks: Close to Van Ness, major street, and Japantown a few blocks further. We even walked over to Fillmore (great shopping plus!)

review.title: Great Hotel for the price
review.reviewText: I really enjoyed my stay at this Hotel, the staff were very friendly and helpful, the room was spacious, comfortable, clean, and had every facility I required and the location was good with about a 15 minute walk to Union Square.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: The hotel was located within walking distance of China Town and Union Square, and for beer drinkers there is a lovely bar/restaurant with some unique brews next door. The hotel itself was very clean and comfortable. The service was exceptional! Theo, made us feel at home right from the start. I would recommend this hotel to anyone going to San Francisco for business or pleasure. I will defeinitely stay there whenever I return.
review.positiveRemarks: The Service and the view from my room (tip stay on the 8th floor)

review.title: San Fran Break
review.reviewText: Surprised at how good the hotel was. Location good and added bonus was the daily happy hour with California wines. Also all required local tours available with hotel pickup.
review.negativeRemarks: No parking - valet parking expensive. I found more economic parking 5 mins away
review.locationRemarks: Good - San Francisco is hilly but if one checks the map and location can minimise the steep climbs.

review.title: just OK, price good and service very good
review.reviewText: room we had was very small, hard to just get around th bed. The bathroom needs to be updated, the bathtub had mold in a few spots and the handicap bar in the tub hits the body.
review.negativeRemarks: old room and very small
review.locationRemarks: outside of the main area of union square, a lot of homeless a block away, need to walk in one direction

review.title: Cool wine reception!
review.reviewText: The wine reception with music is really cool!!! An easygoing hotel in quite a convenient and not so touristy area!

review.title: It is a good location and family enjoy this hotel
review.reviewText:
It is good for the price . It is not good for business men due to the things ; for example
fax machine was broken and they did not say about it . I was awaiting a whole day to receive a very important document faxed to me but never came in and i was in trouble because they did not tell me about broken machine .
review.negativeRemarks: towels sanitation
review.locationRemarks: very good .

review.title: good deal
review.reviewText:
Good hotel close to the city centre.
It is not so good to exit at night until you call a cab.

review.title: It was fine for the price, but I won't go back.
review.reviewText: Nice hotel and friendly staff, but you can hear everyone in their rooms, in the hallways, and walking down the stairs. The tub was gross (looked green and black streaks) and if you wanted to take a bath you would need some serious bleaching to be done.
review.negativeRemarks: the bathtub, and you can hear people through the walls

review.title: Loved the Hotel Carlton
review.reviewText: Hotel staff were very pleasant & efficient. The room was extremely clean & comfortable especially the mattress. Liked the dressing room feature in our small room. Really liked the access to filtered water for drinking. Wish there had been a fridge for fruit snacks. Really liked having a recycling bin right in the room! Location was perfect; very safe neighborhood w/in walking distance of Union Square, Civic Auditorium, restaurants, coffee shops. I would highly recommend this hotel to everyone, including pet-lovers. There is free wine tasting & a wonderful restaurant on site. I would definitely stay there again!
review.positiveRemarks: Cleanliness, pleasantness of staff, filtered drinking water, location.
review.negativeRemarks: Walls seemed a little thin; we could hear entire conversations from another room but only on one occasion. Otherwise, it was fairly quiet.
review.locationRemarks: We loved the location! We could walk everywhere yet had easy access to public transportation had we chosen that. Union Square was 6 blocks away!

review.title: An incredible value in downtown SF
review.reviewText: This is a cute hotel in the heart of San Francisco, walking distance from Van Ness St., Nob Hill, and Union Square. The rates can't be beat, free wireless, comfortable rooms. It's on the border of a somewhat sketchy neighborhood, but definitely not dangerous. I stay here on every trip to SF and love it!

review.title: wonderful staff, comfortable room, i'll go back
review.reviewText: very cute boutique hotel, with accordingly small but well appointed room. large enough bathroom, large closet, a little small but cozy. free wine and entertainment (funky jazz by one of the employees!) every afternoon and a warm fireplace in the very nice lobby. not too far to walk to the bart station. good restaurants all over the neighborhood, which seemed safe most nights but got a little sketchy on friday night. the staff were super friendly, charming, and very helpful. helped me get a rental car (with a nice discount). i will definitely stay at the carlton whenver i'm in SF.

review.title: Fantastic little hotel with great caring staff
review.reviewText: It's about five to ten minute into town depending how fast you walk. The staff couldn't be more friendly or have a greater sense of humor. There's free wine in the evening and music entertainment from one of the talented staff. Breakfast: either eat at the hotel or wait until you get into town.

review.title: Extremely friendly Hotel in a convenient position
review.reviewText: This was our second stay at this Hotel. We returned as we found the staff very friendly and helpful on our first visit. The location is very good for all areas and the cable car stops. Although the bathroom could have been more glossy it was clean enough and our bed was very comfortable. The Hotel holds a wine reception every night which is very welcome after a long day of sightseeing and an ideal opportunity for lone travellers to meet others. Overall I would stay here again although I can see it not being to everybodys taste.

review.title: No A/C
review.reviewText: Great hotel for the price I paid. You can't ask for more. I felt safe too and that is very important. The only down side was no A/C, just a ceiling fan. Excellent for cooler months.

review.title: Overall nice hotel with the deal
review.reviewText: It is great once we request to change to a quiet room away from the main door of the hotel. However the wall is thin that you can hear people laughing and talking as if they are right next to you. But I guess it is the common problem of non-expensive hotel in San Fran
review.locationRemarks: Union square, fisherman wharf

review.title: Nice for the price
review.reviewText: the hotel has a very good location. You can walk to Union Square and Market Street, where a lot of shops are. Even the Pier is in walking distance. The hotel offers free wine very afternoon.
review.locationRemarks: Downtown

review.title: Very satisfied
review.reviewText: First time to San Francisco. Great location. Walking distance to shopping, dining, and night life. Would stay there again. Great value.

review.title: Comfortable and friendly Hotel
review.reviewText: I found this hotel to be comfortable. What I remember most though was the friendly and helpful staff that I interacted with.

review.title: Very Happy
review.reviewText: The staff were all the lovely, the room was very nice and comfortable. I would stay there again if I go back to San Francisco.

review.title: Carlton - would stay again
review.reviewText: While the hotel is a little old and pokey, the service and friendliness of the staff can not be beat. The beds were clean - no bugs seen! They helped us book our trips, recommended great restaurants, and greeted us everyday like old friends. I would definitely stay there again.

review.title: Great San Francisco Hotel Value
review.reviewText: The Carlton proved to be a conveniently located, clean, comfortable hotel. Our room, while not luxurious, was larger than we expected, with a large sleeping area, a modern bathroom, and a separate walk-in closet. The staff was extremely helpful and friendly. The wine hour (actually half-hour) was a nice touch, with occasional music performaed by a staff member. It was a great value!
review.locationRemarks: North Beach has great restaurants and cafes; also nice for people-watching.

review.title: Very happy with the hotel
review.reviewText: Great location close to a lot of tourist place. Walking distance from the cable car, and the bus. Friendly staff from the check in to the people who work within the hotel are nice. Clean room friendly staff can't complain. They even give you a map and give you suggestion from where to eat to where to go.

review.title: A friendly place to stay while visiting San Francisco
review.reviewText: The staff were warm, friendly and welcoming. The few things I requested they were happy to oblige. I would return to this hotel again.
review.locationRemarks: Pier 39 and the wharf area are great places to visit as there are many things to see and do for all age groups. It is fun to sit and people watch here when taking a break from sight-seeing.

review.title: Dated but friendly, clean and good coffee close by...
review.reviewText:
The property is clean, quaint and located on a 'good' street but with a bit of a walk, but in this city, that is a pleasure.
Friendly, helpful and efficient staff.
Wireless sometimes slow but always retrievable.
Good shower.

Good coffee, with options as with convenience stores.
review.locationRemarks: People often elect to stay in or near Union Square, I prefer to walk there.

review.title: Very Noisy! Paper-Thin Walls!
review.reviewText: Great staff, location in a rapidly-gentrifying part of the Tenderloin, easy to get to sights, clean room -- but the noise is terrible between rooms. The walls are very thin. None of the people in rooms around us were doing anything inappropriate or having parties -- but it's as if they were in the room with us. More of a dorm-like experience than a quiet hotel room. It's a pity, because so much else is admirable about the Carlton. But next time I'll go somewhere where I can sleep!

review.title: Wonderful Stay! Highly reccommended
review.reviewText: we had such a lovely time at hotel carlton. the decor is so warm and inviting. they have a wordly theme and books and facts scattered around the lobby. the staff is beyond friendly. they try their best to answer all your questions and always welcome you with a warm smile. every night they have free happy hour with wine and live music....it was so lovely!!! highly reccommended. you wont be dissapointed.

review.title: Not impressed!
review.reviewText: Apparently air conditioning is not a standard amenity in American hotels. It was incredibly stuffy when we entered the room, which was very strange. Then saw the ceiling fan and realized the room had no AC. Luckily the nights werent too bad with the windows opened, but during the day the room was hot and had a funky smell. I would not go back to this hotel. The location was not great. Surrounding area was seedy. Stay elsewhere.

review.title: Marathon weekend in San Francisco
review.reviewText: The hotel was very clean and the staff was very friendly. I gave the hotel a 3 on surrounding neighborhood because it was several blocks from Union Square and there were alot of abandoned buildings that we had to walk past and we were approached by the homeless on numerous occasions. I wasn't afraid but sometimes I felt alittle uncertain. I also gave a 3 on Comfort of the room because there was no air conditional and the weekend we were there, it was unseasonably hot and the room was stuffy at times. Otherwise, we enjoyed our stay at the Hotel Carlton. The restaurant in the hotel was fabulous!
review.locationRemarks: Closer to Union Square

review.title: OK
review.reviewText: We found to our room to be clean and comfortable, and the staff was helpful. The hotel had a "European" feel about it. We enjoyed meeting other guests, many from foreign countries, at the 5:30 daily wine reception. We found the area of the hotel to be full of many decent food options for breakfast and dinner. We also felt safe when walking the streets at night although the No. 2 and No. 3 buses stopped at a nearby corner. The California Street Cable Car was only 3 blocks away. The Powell Street Cable Cars were 6 blocks. We did not like the charge to use the internet in their business center. We also felt thier valet parking charge per day was high compared to many close-by options for parking. Don't go during Fleet Week (Oct 7th week) as prices are greatly nflated ad crowds are bad.
review.locationRemarks: Don't miss the National Maritime Museum and Chinatown.

review.title: Fun, quaint, comfortable hotel
review.reviewText: We very much enjoyed our stay at the Hotel Carlton. We liked the eclectic decor and the friendly staff. We also enjoyed our dinner in the hotel restaurant, Saha. We went for a late dinner the night of our arrival, loved the lively atmosphere, delicious small plate offerings and good wine. The hotel location was good. I was there to run the NIke Women's Marathon and the hotel was in a quiet neighborhood for some good rest and easy walking distance to the starting line at Union Square. Yes, we would go back!

review.title: Good location, great service
review.reviewText:
The hotel staff is excellent - very friendly and helpful. Very flexible when we needed a late check-out. Easy walking distance to theaters, Union Square, Van Ness,many restaurants and bars.

The evening wine reception was hopping, with live music. An enjoyable way to start the evening.

The immediate area is a little hit and miss, but the hotel lobby, foyer and inside is nice. Not fancy but clean and maintained, old-school SF style. Our room was on the small side, but surprisingly quiet. A good unique option.

review.title: good value and very friendly
review.reviewText:
Very welcoming. Front desk very well informed about the area, what to see and where to avoid. Room was clean and stylish, very, very comfortable and reasonable size.
Hotel well placed for bus services, easy to get around from.

review.title: Good value and location
review.reviewText:
Good location at the top of nob hill, we walked everywhere (we like walking) and had a blast.

Room was fine, staff were great, an exhaust fan in the bathroom would be great next time.

review.title: One of the best
review.reviewText:
We booked into the hotel for six nights for my daughters 30th birthday and were instantly upgraded to a Deluxe room. The hotel provided a cake and balloons (on the house). The reception staff were the most obliging I have ever met...always willing to help. Really happy atmosphere within the hotel. Hotel itself is within easy walking distance of Union Square with not too steep a hill to climb. Restaurant was convenient and food reasonable.
Down side was that refuse collectors woke us at 4.30 each morning as they were so noisy.
I would say that this was one of my best hotel experiences and would certainly go back.

review.title: Friendly, helpful, service
review.reviewText: We had an enjoyable stay for a long weekend. Nice room, in good condition. The front desk staff was very helpful, friendly and accomodating to our needs and requests. We didn't eat in the restaurant, but it looked very nice and the aromas were VERY enticing morning and night. Solid value and would not hesitate to stay here again.

review.title: Pretty basic, but does what it says on the tin
review.reviewText:
The staff at the Carlton are friendly and helpful, but sadly that's the best thing about this rather run down, unloved hotel. Rooms are small, but adequately furnished - a comfortable bed and decent cupboard space, but a rather grubby bathroom, peeling wallpaper and badly designed bedside lights.

Breakfast was vile: burned coffee and tepid food.

The hotel's location is pretty central, but it's rather off-putting to have staff hand you a map of downtown San Francisco on check in, then mark off an area just behind of the hotel and warn you that it's a no-go area. Information much appreciated, but hardly a recommendation for the location.

review.title: Don't Waste Your Money
review.reviewText:
The pictures on the website are TOTALLY INACCURATE!! Hotel was dirty - mold in the tub, dead bugs on the floor. Walls were extremely thin and could hear everything in the hall, room next door, and street. Bed too hard, pillows lumpy, sheets rough. Carpet old and dirty. No air conditioning. Location was great - within walking distance of tons of restaurants and bars, but wander one block too far and you end up in The Tenderloin = very dangerous. Food only ok.

Staff was extremely nice but LAZY. Refused to call us a cab and forced us to hail our own from the street - with our hands full of bags! - while they chatted with each other. Tried to convince us over and over to use their house car which they said "was cheaper than a cab". We refused and took a cab anyway. And guess what - IT WAS CHEAPER.

Only perk = free wifi.

review.title: Low Budget Hotel
review.reviewText: Elevator smelled like vomit, carpet in the hotel room had dirt stain, shower soap and shampoo smelled real bad. The plus side of this hotel is that they provide complimentary wine around 530-630 and the staff were really nice. However, the quality of the room and hotel would make me not stay here again.

review.title: Different than what we are used to, but still nice
review.reviewText:
The hotel was older but still had a nice room. Walking distance to the BART station, 5 minute cab ride to the pier. Neighborhood is a bit rundown, but not dangerous by any means. So many great places to eat, our favorite was Olivo's and their pupusas. Great place to stay if you like to see the non-tourist side of SF.

Staff was VERY helpful and VERY polite. From valet, housekeeping, and the front desk staff. We would stay there again in a heartbeat.

review.title: Return to SF
review.reviewText: Having had lived in the TenderNob area for close to 6 years, this return to SF at this location made it a very easy walk to most fantastic bars/restaurants along the Polk corridor as well as downtown.

review.title: International experience
review.reviewText: Love the international vibe at the Carlton - seemed like we were the only Americans there. Also love the evening wine hour, it's a great chance to talk to other travelers. Our only complaint is that the walls are pretty thin. But the room was nice and clean, and the staff is very nice. The location is a great jumping off point, it's pretty easy to get to everything San Francisco has to offer.

review.title: Charming Hotel
review.reviewText: Very charming hotel. Front desk staff were very friendly and funny. The valet service was incredible, and fast. Rooms were small and hallways were tight. Centrally located to a lot of attractions in SF.

review.title: San Fran
review.reviewText: Unique, clean hotel, not the greatest location. Fabulous restaurant.

review.title: Good atmosphere, nice vibe
review.reviewText: We were made to feel welcomeat the hotel, it is obviously an older hotel that has been spruced up, but it's the feel of the place that made me enjoy the stay.

review.title: Good midrange hotel
review.reviewText: Comfortable room, friendly service

review.title: Comfy, quant hotel
review.reviewText: The main reason I came across Hotel Carlton is because it is small dog friendly. The staff is great and always a pleasure. The rooms are neatly decorated and the flatscreen tv's are nice. Beds are comfy and I always sleep well here (and I am a light sleeper). The location is a little tough on the edge of the tenderloin but there is a nice area going north, and north-west with Whole Foods and Lafayette park, avoid going south if possible. Going south isn't that bad, just a less pleasing experience. The rates for Hotel Carlton are a little pricey for the value, but it is dog friendly and I expect to pay more because of that.

review.title: NIce exerience
review.reviewText: Always a walk (over many hills) to most locations, and near bus routes. Staff were extremely nice, room was always well kept. No complaints except immediate area was bit bland-for a main street.

review.title: Pretty Average All Around
review.reviewText:
This hotel is centrally located and moderate walking distance from many of the "sights"...you can walk to Chinatown, Union Square. The trolley stops are 4 or 5 blocks away. It's a fair hike to the BART station on Powell Ave. Lots of restaurants within a 4 or 5 block radius as well, but we didn't find anything we liked in the immediate vicinity (there's a mid eastern restaurant in the building...we didn't eat there).

We felt like we had a fair deal. The hotel is acceptable in terms of cleanliness, and the staff is helpful. Seems to take a long time to check in. The rooms aren't well insulated in terms of keeping things quiet, and you can hear conversations in the hall well enough to understand what's being said, and various bumps/knocks/banging from adjoining rooms. You also get to hear all the big city night noises...sirens, etc.

We felt safe in the area, although the Tenderloin District/Little Saigon, which Sutter Ave borders, has a large homeless population, and they won't hesitate to try to strike up a conversation with you and ask for money. The streets are very dirty in this area as well. It can be avoided, if you're willing to pay for a taxi. If you're going to do public transportation, though, you're going to have to catch the bus down there to get to Golden Gate Park/Haight Ashbury/Hayes Valley, etc.

review.title: Good base for San Francisco
review.reviewText: The Carlton is not top brand so do not expect the Ritz. What you do get is a safe place with a reasonable room for the money. The staff are all great; good rapport with the customers etc. The evening wine was a nice bonus. You are ina fairly busy part of the city so there are sirens and traffic. The view was there but nothing to write home about. The complaints about the bath were justified and ours was pretty tired. A pretty good experience though and reasonably priced compared to other places on offer.

review.title: Exemplary service
review.reviewText: This hotel really provided great service.

review.title: Just Average
review.reviewText:
Well, our experience was fine, nothing special.
The walls are very thin, so if you're a light sleeper watch out. (I'm not, but I could see how it might bother others.) We could hear conversations in other rooms sometimes.
The hotel isn't brand new, you can see wear and tear on carpets, fixtures, etc (the bathtub floor was decidedly gray), but things were clean.
Water pressure in the shower was great, and hot water was abundant, but towels were threadbare and very rough.
Weirdly, our king bed was short-sheeted when we arrived- housekeeping remade the bed for us after we asked.
The neighborhood was nice, lots of cute restaurants are within walking distance, as well as some shopping and an indie movie theater. It's close to buses, but a long walk from BART or MUNI trains. We never ate in the hotel, there are so many good restaurants nearby that are cheaper.
Front desk staff were very nice and helpful. I would try to find another hotel for my next visit, but I don't regret choosing this place.

review.title: Very nice, friendly, and personal.
review.reviewText: The hotel is nicely placed so you can easily get to Market Street, by foot, or any where else, by public transport. The staff are so lovely, helpful, and accommodating. The rooms are old, a little run down, but clean and well organised. I had a great stay. The wine time in the late afternoon is a great opportunity for people to meet and make connections. It really helped me as a person travelling on their own.

review.title: Cute, Small hotel
review.reviewText: Friendly staff, Sutter is great, Cool coffee shops around, In the middle of the city, Has windows and fan which is all you need in SF.

review.title: Noisy neighborhood
review.reviewText:
The walls in between rooms were very thin, so all the noise from the neighbors was heard.
The neighoborhood is very noisy even douring the night hours.
One night a drunk man came yelling into the hotel hallway and kept shouting as he walked through the hallway outside the rooms in the middle of the night. The police came over and knocked loudly on his door, so the noice kept on for about an hour. It was a very unconfortable situation.

review.title: Good for its Price
review.reviewText: Good basic hotel, fair for its price. Not a lot of info in room about hotel services. Poor breakfast, very good evening meal with very helpful staff.

review.title: Hotel in San Francisco
review.reviewText:
The room was rather small and had a musty smell. I had to buy air freshener but the smell was still there. The carpet was dirty also. When we checked in, there was only one wash cloth for two people. The maid had to get clean wash cloths from another maid when I requested more because she didn't have any. The towels were dingy.

The beds were comfortable and clean. The bathroom was all right too.

The front desk staff was great. They moved us to a better located room the second day of our week long stay. The maid was very nice and so were the bellmen and other hotel workers. All of the staff members were friendly and helpful.

The neighborhood wasn't the best, but we walked to Union Square each day from the Carlton. We enjoyed shopping in all the Mom and Pop markets close to the hotel. There were homeless people sleeping on the sidewalks and begging for money. At night, there was a lot of noise on the surrounding streets. We could hear people screaming, calling their dogs, and cursing and we heard car alarms going off.

I would not stay there again, but since I got the hotel through Expedia, I guess it was worth the money I paid.

review.title: Sf Trip
review.reviewText: Hotel was fine. The surrounding neighborhood was sketchy.

review.title: The worst hotel I've ever stayed. Not worth $$$!
review.reviewText: The room picture is completely fake. Dusty rug, smoky and cramped room, terrible noise from the neighborhood.. I can't name all of bad experiences enough. Just do not waste your money!!!

review.title: Impossible to sleep - never again
review.reviewText:
Older buildings have charm and character, but it is inexcusable to have a guest room with zero (or wholly inadequate) soundproofing behind the one and only older elevator for the hotel, which whined and clanged all night long as guests, staff etc. rode back and forth from their respective floors. Sleep was impossible due to the constant noise.

My stay in this 2nd floor room was also subjected to the street noise in the alley and the noise of silverware and dishes from the dining room, with only loose, ill-fitting wooden blinds to block sound and light and a huge gap between the room door and the floorboards. I have stayed in many charming, older B&B's and hotels, but this room was totally unacceptable and below standard.

review.title: Very San Fran!
review.reviewText: I stayed at this hotel in May 2011. I loved the decor, very San Franscisco! The staff was very helpful and let us check in early at no charge. The elevator is very small and kinda shady but overall I enjoyed my stay! They offer free wine tasting in the evening between 5 and 6. The hotel is about 5 blocks from Union Square, which is a hike with the hills in San Fran. There are a few cafe's and shops along the way though. The hotel is in a nice area, but a few blocks away from what they call "Tenderloin" which is a shady area with lots of bums and crack heads, so just ask someone where that is at go the other way to Union Square.

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: Hotel Carleton is great as long as you're expecting a clean, comfortable, well-run and maintained hotel. The building is definitely older and has a few quirks. The elevators are a little small and the walls are thin, but don't let these minor issues discourage you. The staff is fun while still being professional and efficient. Given the location and amenities the clientele leans towards leisure travelers. Wireless internet signal was great throughout the lobby and rooms (my room at least).

review.title: love the place
review.reviewText: Really great vintage feel and not a cookie cutter hotel like the typical. This is unique and comfortable. It feels good to stay in this place for reasons of comfort and pleasure and because you are supporting green practices and ethical business found in all of the joie de vivre hotels. ( FYI-We also love their hotel Avatar in Santa Clara when we go to the theme park) My little girl loved it too. We felt safe walking around during the day with our child (and we are very careful with her safety) but we took a cab at night. We would do this from almost any location in San Fran though. A cab to Fisherman´s Wharf was only $10 and back it cost $8. We walked the five easy blocks to China Town. (Eat dim sum at Four Seas!!!) Lots of cute markets, coffee places, and delis right by the hotel. Our room was so quite too! That rarely happens in any hotel in CA!! There is a $20 parking across the street but it was full. They charged $30 to valet park. This was MUCH less than the other area hotels which charge upwards of $48-$62. Nice people work here. Read other reviews of San Fran hotels and you will see that this is different.

review.title: budget hotel
review.reviewText:
expected more of a regular hotel but this is more a budget hotel place. only recommended for budget travellers.
hotel doesn't come with aircon, though weather in san francisco is cool during the time i was staying.
pictures on wall is creepy but hotel staff removed upon request.
walls are thin and activities outside room can be heard clearly

review.title: I will return.
review.reviewText: This property exceeded expectations based on reviews. The staff was professional and always willing to provide assistance. Our room was clean and comfortable. No downsides.

review.title: Joie-Carlton
review.reviewText:
The front desk and housekeeping staff were super helpful, outgoing and efficient. The accomodations were better than expected and the location was convenient.

My family thoroughly enjoyed their stay!

review.title: A great find
