review.reviewText: I have stayed in this hotel three times over the past 15 years and it continues to be one of the best values in San Francisco. It's close enough to the major sites but not so close that you feel like you're constantly in the hurried mix of things. We had some friends stop by to visit and it was easy for them to get to and to park. My only complaint about my visit this time was the snippy attitude of the attendant at the valet. It's neither owned nor operated by the Carlton but his tone and attitude was very unexpected compared to everyone else on the staff at the hotel. If you don't have a car to deal with, you won't even encounter this guy, And if you do, give him my warmest regards.

review.title: Lovely stay, super helpful staff
review.reviewText: I had a really nice stay at the Hotel Carlton. The atmosphere is very warm and friendly, and the wine tastings at night are a sweet time for all of the visitors to congregate and relax. The staff went out of their way to help us get around, find the best breakfast in the area, and make us as comfortable as possible. Robes in the room and HBO, as well! Such a nice time. Would definitely recommend it.

review.title: Cold room but great location
review.reviewText: Room did not have heat control and bathroom a little dingy but the location, walking distance to MUNI and Union Square was perfect. Staff were very pleasant and had good cheer and humor. Restaurant was marginal.

review.title: Great dog friendly place
review.reviewText: Walking distance to coffee shops, whole foods and lafayette park, this hotel is a great place to stay.

review.title: A nice hotel in a great location.
review.reviewText:
Overall, I thought this hotel was very nice and it certainly served my needs. It is very close to downtown as well as the BART. It is clean and the room is comfortable. The restaurant downstairs has great Persian food.

My only complaint is that it was pretty noisy at times. The walls are pretty thin as it is an old building. It wasn't terrible though, and my wife and I could get to sleep pretty easily. We would stay here again.

review.title: Great staff....CRAZY LOUD!
review.reviewText: Really nice atmosphere. Great staff...knowledgeable and friendly. Could not have been more helpful! Unfortunately, the noise from the room next to ours was difficult to take.. and the guests weren't doing anything other than talking and laughing. They might as well have been in the room with us. They were up all night to watch the Royal Wedding, so we should have just watched it all together as we got the full benefit of their loud commentary.

review.title: Beautiful hotel
review.reviewText: The staff of this hotel were very accommodating and polite. I really enjoyed the happy hour at the hotel. It was a great way to mingle and meet people from all over. The room I stayed in was a little small for an extra bed, but we made it work. I would recommend a deluxe if you need a pull out.

review.title: Best Staff EVER!
review.reviewText: We got a real value on Expedia. The staff bends over backwards to make you comfortable and help you with any confirmations you need for airlines and trips. The daily free wine at 5:30pm is a great place to visit with people from all over the world! We had a bottle of wine in our room when we arrived too! There are cafes in the area and little neighborhood grocery stores to get your basic supplies. We could walk everywhere from here! We walked to Union Square and Fisherman's Wharf several times. Public transportation is very convenient and the staff is very familiar with which buses go to what areas. The city map they gave us on the first day was very helpful and the fact they marked the area NOT to go to was useful to newbies! We turned our huge walk in closet into a dressing room. Open the ironing board and use it for personal items. Being an old hotel, the rooms and bathrooms are not huge, but they are kept neat and in great repair. We were so busy sightseeing, that more floor space wouldn't have added any value. The bed was comfortable and the TV had good reception. We couldn't have asked for more! I have already recommended this hotel to anyone that visits San Francisco! Oh, and dogs are welcome as they are all over the city.

review.title: Good for the money
review.reviewText: Nice location and price.

review.title: Great location, good value
review.reviewText:
First time in SF for me, but my partner had been there a few times before. The hotel was great with one exception and that was the rooms are not very sound-proof so there was a lot of noise during the late afternoon from the housekeeping brigade - not a problem at night though.

Hotel staff very friendly and helpful - free wine from 1730-1800!

I would stay in the Carlton again without hesitation.

review.title: aida
review.reviewText: it was clean, staff were friendly

review.title: The best little hotel in San Francisco!
review.reviewText: A hidden gem with great customer service, location, and parking / stay combination! Many hotels charge a huge amount to park your car (if you drive there or rent), but the hotel carlton provide you with a combo buy! We saved an average of forty dollars a day.

review.title: central and handy
review.reviewText: I found the hotel was in a good location at the bottom end of Japan Town, close to all amenities. The rooms are cleaned to a basic standard but on close inspection they don't move furniture or high shine the surfaces (previous occupants cup rings on glass tops). but, that said it wasn't filthy, and it was comfortable, and convenient. The first room we had was a bit dark and stuffy as you couldn't open the windows, but the return leg of our trip we were in a better room with light & open windows - and you can ask for a fridge to be delivered to your room, which we didn't know the first stay. Loved the recycling bins in the rooms. Wasn't overly pleased with staffs inattention to a dog locked in a guest room for over 12 hours yelping- many of us complained about that. On the whole a decent hotel, but would maybe try somewhere new if we go again!

review.title: Fun Hotel
review.reviewText:
The staff really makes the difference with this hotel. Everyone is very accommodating and friendly.
The nightly wine tasting is fun and a good way to start the evening. They make sure your glass stays full and provide some live music.

review.title: San Fransico Japantown Hotel
review.reviewText: Good value.

review.title: A GREAT HOTEL
review.reviewText: JUST BACK AFTER A 9 DAY STAY, THE STAFF WERE VERY HELPFULL NOTHING TOO MUCH TROUBLE. WE FOUND GETTING AROUND VERY EASY ,WE GOT A THREEDAY MUNI TICKET. WE DID NOT LIKE THE CONTINENTAL BREAKFAST,SO WE WENT UP THE STREET TO HANS DINER VERY GOOD. WOULD GO AGAIN.

review.title: Had an amazing time
review.reviewText: Lovely staff, great location and free wine!! Reasonably priced, really comfortable room with a bit of personality. The hotels restaurant is definitely worth a visit.

review.title: Sylish and Welcoming!
review.reviewText: What a wonderful gem of a hotel in the downtown area of San Fransisco. Delightful staff, very cute and comfortable decor, and an independent flair. Will definitely stay here again.

review.title: Nice old Hotel
review.reviewText:
Great Value for the Price, Not a luxury Hotel but perfect for a downtown sightseeing trip or getaway.
Simple Room analog TV, No AC but very clean and comfortable.
Lots of places to eat and drink within walking distance, short walk to Chinatown, bit longer walf to FishermansWharf.

Hotel Front desk staff was very helpful with directions and recommendations.

review.title: Almost with your neighbor....
review.reviewText:
I think is a very nice hotel, the restaurant is delicious, the staff is really nice...the inconvenient is that you can hear everything of other rooms!!! You can hear not just the chating, you can hear clearly what they are saying, even if you are watching TV!! And if they are doing something else....of course yo can hear it too!!! That was really bothering.....
But if you don´t care about the noise, I think is a en excellent option. Is clean, not expensive, in a nice neigborhood...It was a good experiencie.

review.title: Great value for money
review.reviewText:
For the price, this is great value. If i had my time again though i would have forked out a bit extra and stayed nearer north beach / fishermans warf - not that far to walk but late night this can mean walking past undesireables and lots of beggars and prostitutes hasstling us on the walk back. But taxi's are cheap and if you aren't going to be walking home at 2am this probably won't affect you!

The rooms are definitely not soundproof - and there is a hospital and firestation around the corner - a LOT of noise at night - i'm a deep sleeper and wasn't affected all that much but keep that in mind if you need quiet at night!

The staff were AMAZING! And are what make this place special. This really is the friendliest hotel i've been to by far - and not just the staff behind the counter but even the maids - never walked into or out of the place without a smile from everyone who appear to genuinely enjoy their jobs! Free wine from 5:30-6pm while listening to self composed piano music makes the beginning of the night start with happiness. The staff are extremely helpful for any info you may need about San Francisco!

If you can put up with the ambulances and fire trucks this is a great place to stay if travelling on a budget!

review.title: Awesome! Best hotel ever!
review.reviewText: Okay seriously, I'm am very particular about my hotels and I can't even express what a great hotel this is! It begins and ends with the amazing staff, funny, friendly, hospitable, they really made our stay. The hotel itself is decorates with items and themes from around the world, you definitely feel like a world traveler when you visit. The rooms ( more like little apartment studios) are clean, well decorated and very cozy. It was a pleasure to come back to such a place after a long day of San Francisco sightseeing. The front desk was very helpful in helping us navigate the various neighborhoods of San Fran and they were always really nice about it. Best part of this hotel besides the customer service was the complimentary wine service held in the lobby for the guest every evening. It was a great way to get to know the other guests and relax in the beautiful lobby.

review.title: The restaurant was AMAZING and the service was GREAT.
review.reviewText: What a lucky find for anyone who wants to save more cash for their time in SF. We are already thinking of going back . . .

review.title: Nice but noisy.
review.reviewText: Nice place. The staff were nice and helpful, but the in-house phone system was odd. (We called the front desk a few times but got no answer.) We're both light sleepers, and the room was noisy. Walls are thin, and loud voices kept us awake until 4 AM one night. Also, there is a hospital ER one street over and sirens were going much of the night. This is unfortunate because we really liked the hotel. It has a great foyer with comfy couches and a fireplace, and is warm and welcoming. All was good except for the noise factor. I would definitely recommend it to others, but with a caution about the noise. Some people can sleep through anything, and it was a great value for the price. I liked the place.

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: We enjoyed our stay and even when we had a problem with the toilet on "Valentines" evening they came right away and fixed it for us.

review.title: Mediocre
review.reviewText: You get what you pay for. The staff was very courteous and greeted us well, however, that's about all the hotel has going for it. The location is just far enough from the cable cars and bus to be sort of a nuisance to get 'downtown' and I didn't want to walk in the area after dark, but driving is even more inconvenient. I wasn't ecstatic about the room, but it was fine for just one night... until I tried to sleep. DO NOT stay here if you like to sleep at night. The walls are paper thin and I was kept up from 1am - 3am by the people in the room next to us who were simply talking! We could hear everything! It must be by a fire station because we heard sirens all night and everyone getting in and out of the elevator, etc. I won't go back. Also plan to pay $30-$40 per night for valet at any hotel you book in San Fran.

review.title: Nice hotel, friendly staff
review.reviewText: My second time at this hotel was a good as the first. It is in a neighborhood that is close to downtown businesses without being in the heart of the tourist zone. Very attentive staff.

review.title: Nice hotel, nice price
review.reviewText: Beautiful hotel with interesting rooms and incredibly helpful staff. Location wasn't fantastic, but not bad either. We got stuck with two full beds, but other than that it was really nice for the price. I wish I wasn't pregnant so I could have enjoyed the wine reception every evening! The restaurant attached to the hotel claimed to not have any reservations for dinner even though there was NOBODY in there, so that was disappointing.

review.title: A comfortable hotel hosting a unique experience.
review.reviewText: This is a small boutiue hotel. When we arrived our room was ready. We immediately felt at home due to the rapport with the staff. The front desk personnel were delightfully engaging and funny and got us in a fun mood. The room was fine, the beds were quite comfy and we had everything we needed. In the early evening, they have a happy hour with jazzy music creating an upbeat atmosphere in the lobby with comfortable sofas and a crackling fireplace. We enjoyed the hotel and the easy walking location to what we wanted to see. Union Square is a few blocks.

review.title: Quirky, characterful, memorable
review.reviewText:
An outstandingly friendly and welcoming staff got our stay off to a great start. This is a quirky hotel which will not be to all tastes or meet all guests' demands (no bar, no room service, for example), but it's full of character. The daily free wine reception, held in the elegant lobby from 5.30 to 6.00, sets the tone, encouraging guests to mix and chat, to the accompaniment of ace receptionist Theo's inimitable keyboard stylings. The in-house restaurant serves a reasonable (if quite pricy) breakfast, but there is a host of alternatives in the surrounding streets, particularly Polk Street with its vast range of cuisines. Great location means that downtown, Chinatown, the waterfront, anywhere you would want to be, in fact, are accessible within 20-30 minutes' brisk walking or by means of a short cab - or cablecar - ride. I'd strongly recommend the pedestrian option - there is so much to see that can only fully be appreciated on foot. Bit hilly, though, which doesn't bother me, but may not be for everyone.
Downsides - the rooms seem to lack any soundproofing, and being woken up at 4 am by the sounds of a seemingly endless and very noisy trash collection wasn't great, nor was the unignorable sound of the the - er - enthusiastically occupied couple in the room above. However - on balance a memorable stay at a hotel with warm, genuine staff and a great atmosphere.

review.title: Rundown and smelly
review.reviewText: This hotel is much too close to the rough parts of the tenderloin. The building is rundown. My room smelled like curry. And the walls are thin and sound carries. Do not stay here.

review.title: Nothing Special
review.reviewText: Hotel was not in the best area. The hotel had a bit of a smell to it and was noisy. You get what you paid for. I would not stay here again.

review.title: What a deal!
review.reviewText: What a find! Stayed here for a few nights prior to getting our marriage license. I am a Bay Area native, but have never stayed in the City overnight. Great location- close to pretty much everything. Hotel was really nicely decorated- nothing over the top, very welcoming and comfortable. Our room was perfect and the staff was very friendly and helpful. And of course, the price is unbeatable. We are planning to stay here again in the next two months for our wedding!

review.title: "Best vacation ever !!"
review.reviewText: from the first step into this wonderful,colorful hotel I felt at home--front desk was the start of a truly wonderful trip--hotel is eclectic,warm and full of interesting people from all over the world-walking distance to bart system-great restaurant on site Sahar ( I highly recommend it). wine & entertainment at 5:30 in the lobby with warm fire place a plus--I am looking forward to my next visit there--

review.title: Lovely, affordable, comfortable
review.reviewText: The room was very comfortable, the location was decent, and the hotel staff were extremely friendly. It's a nice, small hotel, and extremely affordable. The only drawbacks were a startlingly loud flush on the toilet and very thin walls - it was to hear what was happening in adjacent rooms (and be heard). But the beds were nice, and the room was appointed with unique furniture - not the blase big hotel standard decor. I'd definitely stay there, or to another Joie de Vivre hotel, again.

review.title: A delightful find
review.reviewText: This establishment is a great value for the price. With coffee makers in the room and free filtered water I didn't have to leave the comfort of my room to have morning coffee. The staff is friendly and wine reception very generous. A nice little boutique hotel right in the heart of San Francisco. I would stay here again and suggest it to friends traveling on a budget.

review.title: Beautiful hotel, great staff, but iffy location and paper thin walls
review.reviewText:
Clean hotel with great service. The hotel was decorated beautifully. I really liked the people at the front desk, they were incredibly helpful. If you are looking for bars and restaurants, the hotel is steps away from Polk Street and you will find plenty there. That being said, you also have to be careful to avoid the Tenderloin area about two blocks over from the hotel, it can get dangerous and they will point that area out to you at check in.

My only real complaint about the hotel is that the walls are paper thin. I could hear my neighbor get up in the middle of the night to use the bathroom..... and spent one night listening to him vomit all night long which wasn't so enjoyable.

review.title: Not very clean, Rooms Not Configured for Business Users
review.reviewText:
I should have stayed at a chain hotel. The hotel room was cramped, no amenities. The internet service was atrocious.... dial up speed. Single ice machine on the first floor, but its a multi-floor facility, and my room was on the 5th floor. They had a water cooler in the hallway though.

The bed was comfortable. I took offense to the wall mounted shampoo, shower gel and conditioner dispenser. It didn't dispense very much product at all, and I'd rather use bar soap. Due to the location of the hotel, there's a lot of traffic outside. The walls are thin. One morning as I woke, I could hear the guy in the room next door snoring away. The room cleanliness wasn't what I expected, Dust on most of the surfaces other than the tops.

The guys at the front desk were the best part of the trip. Very helpful and entertaining!

But I wouldn't stay there again, wouldn't recommend it to anyone. In this case, you get what you pay for.

review.title: Hotel Carlton
review.reviewText:
Great hotel and staff. Room a little noisy because of the age of the hotel. San Francisco streets are narrow and alot of the sound ie ambulances is amplified.
Some of the fit and fixtures are a little shop worn but other than that a great experience. The staff were very helpful and informative.

review.title: Great value for price and location
review.reviewText:
For starters, Hotel Carlton is a very clean, simple, and well appointed place to rest away from home. It's not the Ritz Carlton or Marriott. Do you not necessarily feel like you're in a hotel while staying here. Although structurally the building is like a hotel and the elevators and hallways are like a hotel, the room itself it feels, rather, like a rented room in someone's quaint house.

The basics and the housekeeping needs are met with precision. From the front desk to the maintenance and housekeeping workers, the staff are all friendly. It is apparent the owners put significant effort into keeping the hotel esthetically fresh.

Other reviewers have commented that the hotel is in a dangerous part of town and is surrounded by "druggies and seedy people." I have worked extensively with inner city people and the "lower class" in many cities. I guarantee you that this is not a dangerous location. It may be on the outskirts of a rougher section of town, but this part of the street is fine. Just make sure you don't walk through the wrong part of town en route to the hotel. Anyone would be happy to show you an appropriate route if you're concerned.

It's a relatively busy street 2 blocks from a hospital. You'll hear sirens. This did not bother me, however. Request a room higher up in the back of the hotel if you're concerned about the noise.

Again, for the cost, Hotel Carlton can't be beat. It's right near the 27, 70, and many other convenient bus routes.

review.title: Three Star Hotel in Business District
review.reviewText:
The staff was very friendly and attentive to helping us with any questions. Also, they made sure we were aware of the nice Indian restaurant adjacent to the hotel, discounted parking garage near the hotel, and a free wine tasting each day at 5:30 pm. :)

The hotel is in a kind of dicey neighborhood. It is close to cable cars and Bart transportation, and just south of the trendy and expensive neighborhood of Nob Hill, however, there were hookers on the corner the first night when we got back from dinner, and in general I felt like I should watch my belongings closely.

The room was nice but definitely not luxury accommodations. We could hear the people in the next room through the walls, and the bathroom door opened the wrong way so that when you could not close it without squeezing between the toilet and the door to get out of the way.

This is definitely a 3 star hotel, but the cheaper price is a reflection of being away from the more touristy areas. If you spend more, you can get a comparable hotel in Fisherman's Wharf or Embarcadero area, but it is great place to stay, if you don't mind being in a less desirable neighborhood.

review.title: value hotel for city-travellers
review.reviewText:
Checkin was easy, hotel was clean -- elevators were very small, but functional. There was some street noise, but not a lot. The rooms are small but comfortable and the bed was high quality. Wireless internet access was available, but pretty slow -- not uncommon in bay area hotels. There is a restaurant in the hotel, but I preferred the firefly bar next door which had good food and a laid back atmosphere. Location is a little far from main attractions, but it is centrally located if you don't mind a bit of a walk.

Overall, a very satisfactory experience.

review.title: good get away
review.reviewText: good find

review.title: Nice convenient stay
review.reviewText: Good value for DT San Francisco.

review.title: SF Regular, Excellent Value
review.reviewText: The guys at the front are jokesters, though not in a bad way. The room was spacious and clean. I really liked that the windows open for a cool breeze at night. We had a bit of trouble with the radiator in the room as one of the pipes was corroded and it was spewing water, we notified the front desk and the quickly fixed the problem. We also come from Amsterdam and are quite used to older facilities. All in all they were excellently priced, good location, much safer location than others around Union Square, and well located. I give them an 8.5 and would be a 9 had the radiator not acted up.

review.title: The Best of Boutique Hotels
review.reviewText: The Hotel Carlton is the best of the boutique hotels in cleaniness, location, courtesey and professionalism. Rooms are not fancy but well appointed. The hotel is green, pet friendly and free wi-fi. The staff is at your beck and call for any of your reasonable needs and always with a smile When in San Francisco I always stay at the Hotel Carlton..

review.title: Hotel Carlton, S.F. As a frequent S.F. visitor, Carlton is certainly a hotel to keep on the radar.
review.reviewText: I found the Hotel Carlton offered satisfying and friendly customer service. Clean, cheerful rooms though not refined or sophisticated. Located in the Polk Street Gulch area, the area both through the day & nights are teaming with an assortment of restaurant, bars and clubs. Good place to go if you're visiting and want to experience San Francisco authenticity, maybe not so much if you're there on a business trip and need quite study. Overall I found the Carlton Hotel to more than adequate for a 4-5 day stay but anything longer than that you might want to find more spacious rooms and and an upgraded amenities.

review.title: Bad location; thin walls
review.reviewText: While the people at this hotel were very nice and it had an interesting, funky appeal, ultimately what one wants is a good night sleep. The walls of the room were very thin, and I could hear clearly the people next door and people in the hallway. The bed was very comfortable and the tv was fine. Breakfast the next morning in the hotel restuarant was ok. The location of the hotel is dreary. The hotel must be near a fire station because I could hear fire engines throughout the night. Wouldn't go back.

review.title: An older hotel but well run
review.reviewText:
An older hotel but well run. Main downside is that it is a long walk from the Union Square area. Rooms are a little on the small side; no thermostat or air conditioner.
Helpful. friendly staff.
Excellent restaurant in the hotel that specializes in middle eastern cuisine.

review.title: good value
review.reviewText: accommodations were better than expected. HUGE walk in closets in our seventh floor room. Some street noise but not unreasonable for a urban Hotel. Powell St. cable car broken down during our stay so local transportation not good to Union Square. Enjoyed wine reception but keyboardist very loud.

review.title: Great service, good room, good location.
review.reviewText:
Great service. Very nice atmosphere. Green: environmentally friendly.
They have a wine & music everyday at 6pm which is very nice too.

Room was nice, closet was huge, bathroom was good and had a nice windows with a view. Central heating was not very good though there was a heater that we borrowed.

review.title: A Great Hotel
review.reviewText: We just returned after 3 weeks in SF, having spent the whole time at Hotel Carlton. It was great! The service was excellent, the room large and comfortable, and the atmosphere friendly. There is some noise from the street (what else would you expect in a city) but we experienced none of the 'thin wall' issues others have mentioned. We would definitely stay again.

review.title: Great find, near Union Sq
review.reviewText:
A pleasant find. This hotel was well located, has well appointed rooms, that were clean, and friendly staff. Fun lobby. Great restaurants close by, and a walk to Union Sq.
There was a $20 car park across the street if you need.

review.title: a good, cost effective San Francisco stay
review.reviewText: Not expensive, easy to work with, not luxury, but definitely not a dump. They don't tell you there are a fair amount of fairly aggressive street walker types seeking their business the street over, but this is San Francisco, so no harm no foul--and if you're into that thing, maybe the better, but I don't imagine they'd take kindly bringing one back to the hotel. You are centrally located for walking, a little but not too far away from BART, and the bus lines come through. A short walk to shopping districts, and restaurants an even shorter walk for night life. I attended a major academic conference on a budget, and it worked for my mile walk each way until it rained really hard the last day. This is a nice place and the people are friendly and courteous.

review.title: Beautiful Union Square Hotel!
review.reviewText: This is a lovely small hotel in Union Square. The hotel staff are incredibly nice and fun. The rooms are beautiful and have unique artwork including amazing photography. The walls were a little thin, and I could clearly hear the conversation going on in the next room. But it was well worth it for such a nice hotel!

review.title: Not Impressed!
review.reviewText: Hotel staff were AMAZING, but the room didn't feel comfortable or clean. It looked clean, but didn't make me feel like I wanted to take nap or be romantic with my husband. Just a place to sleep and be careful its close too a not so good part of town.

review.title: Horrible Stay!
review.reviewText: This hotel did not have heat for 2 nights of my stay and had other customer service problems which I previously mentioned. I was not expecting this and it may my stay very poor and uncomfortable. I will never ever stay there again and can not reccomend it to anyone!

review.title: Not recommended
review.reviewText: Could not control air temperature in hotel room; room decor was drab; shampoo and conditioner left an unpleasant smell in the hair; breakfast in the restaurant was a disaster--terrible service.

review.title: fabulous hotel and staff
review.reviewText:
this is the 2nd time we've stayed in this hotel and everything was as good as it was before. The staff are extremely knowledgeable about their city and very helpful.

They have a wine reception at 5.30- 6pm which is very nice.

review.title: Not impressed at all!
review.reviewText: I booked Hotel Carlton through Expedia taking into consideration its great reviews and the location as well. However, my experience was not as good as the other travelers who wrote those reviews. First, I had to leave a another name on the reservation and called the hotel a few days before I checked in. I was asked to call another time because the front desk was so busy they couldn't take the other guest's name. When I called again the next day, I was transferred to an answering machine but apparently it did work since the name was on the reservation by the time we arrived. Check in was fine, attentive front desk, no complaints. Secondly, we needed a cab so we called the concierge and got our call transferred to another guest's room which had us all confused with whom we were talking to. And the worst comes next... I got back to the hotel in the afternoon and the room had been cleaned however, the bathroom was exactly the way it was when we left. I again called the front desk and they said the maid was hungry and forgot to come back to finish the room. Since we were leaving in ten minutes, we asked them to send the maid then but she got there right away and I had to tell her to come back later. So apparently communication is a bit hard at this hotel, they seem to not listen to what you say. Those were my biggest problems, but overall the hotel was clean, ok for the price, room was a little small and the shower could be a little hotter, specially early in the morning.

review.title: Nice Hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel was really nice. They held a nightly reception with free wine, and that was very appreciated! The staff were very helpful and friendly, making you feel as though your custom is important to them. The room was comfortable and apart from the lack of tea bags (I'm such a Brit) it was a great place to stay. The area is pretty central to most things. Check with the maps for the buses and what one-way streets there are. There is an area called Tenderloin I was told to avoid, but to be honest the whole of the city felt pretty safe. There are a lotof homeless people and beggars but it isn't too intimidating when you get used to it.

review.title: Great location and value
review.reviewText: The location was great- a quick walk to Union Square, and tons of cute little places all along the way. The hotel staff was fabulous and extremely helpful.

review.title: Excellent Staff
review.reviewText: The hotel staff was very accomodating and friendly. Very cozy sitting in front of the fireplace in the hotel lobby. The only complaints are the walls are paper thin you could hear your neighbors conversations and the restaurant in the hotel did not have a very good selections and our meals were cold. On a good note the free wine served everyday was a nice touch and the entertainment was nice.

review.title: Hotel Joie De Vivre=Convenient
review.reviewText: The hotel was located conveniently near the center of San Francisco. We were within a short distance of Union Square. The cab was less than $6 and from Union Square there is a direct train to the Airport which is very cost effective. The hotel staff were extremely nice! They have a restaurant in the hotel but don't go by the menu, pick your own food separately. The day of our departure we were able to leave our luggage in the storage room with no fee as our flight was at midnight. The beds are very comfortable. The rooms are average size but very comfy for the age of the hotel. Room service did an excellent job of cleaning the room. ***There were no hidden fees*** which is always great! Overall great experience! Will come back for sure!

review.title: Nice place, good location
review.reviewText: Hotel Carlton is a nice, older hotel. The location was convenient to several good restaurants. The room was clean and quite comfortable. The showers were great, too. We would definitely recommend this hotel to our friends. It was recommended to us.

review.title: Great Place To Stay
review.reviewText: I don't normally take the time to write these reviews, but I felt that it was important to let others know about this place. My girlfriend and I spent a couple of nights here last weekend for her 40th birthday celebration. We stayed on the 9th floor (which is the top floor). This place is very nice, and it was exactely what others have said about it. Here are some important hightlights: The staff was VERY helpful and pleasant. The comedy show by the guys at the front desk was great. There is a daily wine reception every night from 5:30 pm to 6:00pm. Parking is VALET only and is $30.00 per day. It's a short walk to Hyde Street, where you can catch the cable car. Taxi's are everywhere and easy to hail. The rooms are nicely sized (for two) and are equipped with flat screen tvs. The only down fall to the hotel was the siren noise at night. There is fire station located close by and the Fire Trucks run regulary at night responding to calls. A good idea to bring ear plugs if you can sleep with them. The hotel was very charming and quaint. Easy to get to from the 101 freeway and just a short drive to the Golden Gate Bridge. A good place to stay since it's Centrally located. I travel alot for my job and normally stay at the larger chain hotels throughout the country. This is an OLDER hotel with charm, so if you're looking for a newer type Sheraton, Marriott, Embassy Suites style hotel, then this place is not for you. This is a great place to stay and would recommend it.

review.title: Going back soon!!
review.reviewText: This hotel was wonderful! Front desk staff were so friendly and helpful with everything from where to go, how to get there and making tour and transportation arrangements. The room was comfortable and very clean, with plenty of room for 3 adults. Great location convenient to Union Square and bus and cable car lines. Wine reception in the lobby was great too! We would definitely stay here again upon returning to this great city!

review.title: Good option if discount available
review.reviewText:
For the price the hotel is well located. Also, the rooms are neat, but nothing remarkable considering other hotel options, especially the room or bathroom sizes. Bed a little old and the duvet was so cheap and ‘nylony’ that I had remove it.
Service wise I'd say I am satisfied, very accesible people… but one of the persons at the desk "did not know well" San Francisco, so he couldn't tell me about where to find a bookstore or hardware store (no one else was available then). On another occasion the butler kept throwing jokes and got a little personal... very discouraging. What makes up for it all is the restaurant! Great place to go for a well-priced, exotic Middle Eastern dinner or the everyday breakfast!

review.title: Great hotel with a small feel.
review.reviewText: We had a lovely time at this hotel. The staff are extremely friendly and accommodating. The room was clean, comfortable and had style. This hotel feels like a smaller guest house with the styling and atmosphere. Heartily recommend.

review.title: Nice hotel. Different from regular chains.
review.reviewText: Smaller than we expected, but nice hotel, and different. Teeny elevator!

review.title: recomend this hotel
review.reviewText:
Everything was perfect no problems with check in or out. All staff were very helpful and if they did not know they would find out for you. The room was nicely decorated and cleaned daily. Bed very comfortable. coffee maker was great if u like tea don`t put in the coffee.
Hotel was situated perfectly for us 10 min from shopping area 30 min from fishermans warf yes there are steep hills but you can take the tram 2 blocks away but we love to walk and enjoyed going up diferent streets some lovely buildings and well maintained houses. Had no problem with the area it was in. Beggers were in the good areas as well they did not seem to bother anybody.
recommend cycling across golden gate bridge easy to hire bikes ask for puncture repair kit it will not be offered although we did not need it take ferry back across had a fantastic day alcatraz is also a big must.In all had an absolutely
fantastic time the weather was great during the day but got very cold at night.
Hotel again perfectly situated lovely entrance staff fantastic no bad points from our point of view other than the noise outside which did not really bother us but may bother some. We were also lucky enough to go to a 49ers game my husband thought it was fantastic I did not understand the game but the atmosphere was great they lay on a bus that takes you there and back caught it 2 blocks from hotel no probs. As above had no problems to report other than wanted to stay longer but holidays unfortunetly have to end.

review.title: great trip in San Francisco
review.reviewText: very well located and such a good deal in downtown San Francisco. many good coffee houses and good restaurants nearby. an older hotel but had lots of charm. easy to get around from there.

review.title: Would always stay here if I could.
review.reviewText: The hotel is delightful. Pretty, clean, welcoming, lively neighbourhood & a good price. The restaurant served delicious food & the whole atmosphere is lovely. I would definitely stay again if I ever return to San Francisco.

review.title: Good hotel, good location
review.reviewText:
It is advertised as a boutique hotel and so I expected a modern, contemporary hotel. It is quite old and quirky which is OK but not expected. The room has all the facilities (coffee maker, hairdryer, extra blanket, etc) I expected.
The staff were extremely helpful, recommending an excellent city tour and booking it for us.
The area is handy for Union Square but is a good walk from Fisherman's Wharf, although you can get the Cable Car. By and large the area is OK, but there are dodgy areas nearby.
A small supermarket 5 minutes walk away is useful.
At night there was a lot of noise, particularly sirens, which disturbed our sleep.

review.title: Good price, convenient location.
review.reviewText: I like the Joie de Vivre hotels. They are reasonably priced and the accommodations are comfortable and clean. I like the international feeling of the hotel. I will definitely stay there again.

review.title: Reasonably priced, great location, cute hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel was very nice. The room was extremely clean and comfortable. Staff was very friendly and helped out with whatever I needed. I would definitely go back here.

review.title: Great Hotel, Great Staff, Great Restaurant
review.reviewText: This is a great hotel with a great staff and a fantastic restaurant. The staff couldn't be nicer and the free wine and music at 5:30 was an added bonus. If you prefer staying in real touristy hotels, it may not be for you. This hotel is in more of a residential area that has a bit of attitude (We like attitude). If and when we come back to San Fran we will definitely consider this place again.

review.title: It is an average hotel
review.reviewText: The description on expedia is exagerated!

review.title: Wonderful! Stayed there twice, would definitely come back.
review.reviewText: Wonderful Hotel! Extremely helpful and friendly staff; warm and welcoming decor; rooms clean and well-appointed. Surrounding neighborhood is not the greatest in San Francisco but not bad. For the price, Hotel Carlton is an excellent choice!

review.title: Very friendly hotel with good housekeeping
review.reviewText:
The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful, the lobby was inviting, and invited guests to hang out, the rooms if small were very clean. The condition of the hotel itself could use some capital improvements, but the hallways, carpeting, etc. were kept in good condition. There is a restaurant in the hotel itself, with an Eurasion theme, which looked inviting, and it also served traditional breakfast in the mornings.
The hotel is centrally located a few blocks off Union Square, on a very busy one way street, so be prepared if you have brought your vehicle! If not, it is very easy to walk over a few blocks and hop a bus or a cable car.
Overall, I was very pleased with the hotel and the price and would recommend it to others.

review.title: Great staff, fun hotel, I would stay there again.
review.reviewText:
The hotel is an older building and has lots of character. This is not your normal big business hotel. If you are looking for impersonal service and a starndard hotel room this isn't the place for you.
From the moment we arrived the staff was friendly, funny and really wanted to help. They recognized us after check in and the front desk would say hello and ask about our day. Theo and Gio at the desk were absolutely amazing. They appear to love their jobs and want you to love their city. Several times we asked about fun and different places to eat and their suggestions were right on. And were within walking distance from the Hotel.
Theo is an amazing person that speaks several languages and is extremely helpful. He also plays the keyboard during the nightly, free, wine reception that they have every evening. This is held in their lobby (remember, not a big box hotel lobby, much smaller with lots of couches and chairs) where you can mix and mingle with others that are staying there, or just sit and enjoy your wine.
We took public transportation (bus, street car, cable car) everywhere. If you get the pass that is good for several days, its a real bargain! Thanks again to the guys at the hotel for telling us about it! The hotel was within one block walking distance to any bus we needed.
The rooms at the hotel are smaller, but comfortable.
Theo and Gio, thanks for a great hotel and exceptional service! If I'm ever back in San Francisco I know where I'll be staying.

review.title: An excellent smaller hotel
review.reviewText:
The Hotel Carlton is an excellent place to stay if you want an affordable, clean, and friendly place to stay that's conveniently located to most attractions in San Fransisco.

LOCATION: We like to walk -- and we walked everywhere from the Carlton Hotel: to Fisherman's Wharf... to Union Square... to the Mission District... to Japantown. And if we didn't feel like walking -- the cable car and several bus lines were very close. The hotel is located at the very top of the Tenderloin (the seedier part of San Fransisco), so we were careful not to walk too far below Sutter during the night -- but during the day we encountered no problems.

ROOM: We loved our room -- we were lucky and got a corner room. It was so uniquely decorated -- we just loved it! We're smaller people -- so we felt like we had plenty of room even though we recognize that the rooms of many chain hotel rooms are usually bigger. But this wasn't a problem for us.

Also -- kudos to the Carlton Hotel for putting shampoo, conditioner, and body wash dispensers in the shower as well as recycling bins in the room.

The only downside of the room was the noise level: we could hear people in the room next to ours very clearly... and no doubt they heard us. But its an old building, so this isn't a surprise. Plus -- we didn't hang out in the room much -- there is just too much in San Fransisco to experience to stay inside!!!

review.title: The best attention for you at a good price
review.reviewText: This is a hotel located in a place where you can visit the main part of downtown, price is according to its quality. Don't expect a luxury place, but it has the best attention for information and suggestions. The lobby personnel know how to treat you as in your own city. If you like to walk round the neighboor, be careful because few blocks from it there are people on the street asking for money (beggers), just ignore them and don't walk too late.

review.title: Excellent Customer Service
review.reviewText: The customer service we received from the hotel staff was excellent. They were there to help answer questions, suggest dining spots, book tours, etc.

review.title: Best Customer Service Experience at Hotel Carlton!
review.reviewText: From check in to check out, we had a good time during our stay. The staff joked with us and made us feel like good friends. Wasn't the best deal around for us financially, but the customer service we experienced made up for it. Hope we can make it over again this year.

review.title: Great hotel in a neighborhood that sucks
review.reviewText: Inside, nothing to blame for. Rooms are clean, service is good. Outside - drunk homeless, prostitutes in evening. If you are a tourist or a visitor that is going through San-Francisco by feet, the location is wrong. If you never walk around by feet, a good choice.

review.title: Good value in San Fran
review.reviewText: A quaint older hotel with good service and lots of European guests. Stayed there on business but most guests were leisure travelers. Neighborhood is a bit sketchy but the hotel is a nice, reasonably priced place to stay in the city, it has character. The Yemeni restaurant across the street was very good.

review.title: Friendliest Staff Ever!!
review.reviewText: Hotel Carlton was a quaint unique hotel experience. Small staff who remembered us everytime they saw us. The wine reception every evening was a great way to meet other travelers and begin our night. Within walking distance to Chinatown Union Square Restaurants and bars.

review.title: Fiar, too noisey for me
review.reviewText: For the price, I guess it was o.k. However, I moved from one room to another because the man in the room next to mine had a bad cough. It was like we were in the same room!!! The second room was alright butg, street noise.

review.title: Good choice in SanFran
review.reviewText: It's an older hotel, so the rooms are small by today's standards but nicely decorated, clean, and reasonably updated. Staff is great, very helpful. Nice old-time SF feel and a very interesting restaurant.

review.title: Perfect Place to stay in San Francisco!!!
review.reviewText: Great location... could walk amost anywhere we needed to go. Hotel itself was pleasant and in good neighborhood. Excellent experience

review.title: So charming!
review.reviewText: My husband and I stayed here on our honeymoon. From the moment we arrived, the staff was great! The hotel is very charming and our room was so comfortable. The location was also perfect: very close to everything and you can walk just about anywhere. I would absolutely recommend this and would stay there again.

review.title: Good value for price
review.reviewText: Good value for price, clean accommodations and funky/fun lobby interior and room interior. I like that there are no air conditioners (no need in SF!), but the downside is that you get street noise and noise from the hallway. Away from the city hub, but walkable - you're in Union Square in less than 15 mins! Have yet to try their restaurant!

review.title: Will be happy to go back again!
review.reviewText:
Found the attendants at the front desk very kind, witty and helpful.
Enjoyed the stay very much.
Valet parking fee was 30 dollars per night which we thought was a bit costy.
But, that is due to the nature of lack of spaces in San Francisco and was the policy of the hotel, and had nothing to do with personnel. So, will not be too bitter about it...
Very clean, close enough to the trolley lines to get easily down to Fisherman's Wharf and some of the main attractions. Will not hesitate one bit to go back to the hotel if we were to be around the area again.
One of the door attendants seemed very kind and genuine, we really wanted to write to the hotel and tell them that he is a keeper. But sadly, we failed to get his name.

review.title: grea hotel and its just as its described
review.reviewText: The staff were friendly and we able to help with every query we had in relation things to do in the area. They assisted with all transport needs. It was easy to get around by either walking or with the public transport. I would stay in this hotel again.Raecgel

review.title: Great find in San Francisco!
review.reviewText: This hotel is a great find for anyone who wants to see more than just Fisherman's Warf and Pier 39. The staff is very funny and caring. We really liked the overall design of the hotel and our room. We didn't have any of the noise problems that others have described. The atmosphere is very relaxing and quiet, even though we were there on Pride Weekend, which means lots of people. The one thing that I wished I had known about ahead of time is about the parking. It costs $30 a day to have the hotel valet park your car and you can have access to it any time you want. (And this is a very comparable rate to many other places that we saw) However, I heard them telling someone else that if you want them to store your car and you don't need to use it while you are in SF it is only $20 a day. With plenty of public transportation around and the pain in the butt it is to find parking in the city I wish I had taken advantage of this option. Overall, we really really enjoyed staying here and are planning on staying here again when we come back to San Francisco.

review.title: Best way to travel!
review.reviewText: The staff was extremely attentive, friendly, and entertaining. They were very helpful and had great suggestions for how to spend our time in the city. I was also very impressed with the size, and cleanliness of the room. The European flair to the hotel gave it a unique touch.

review.title: LIke home only better
review.reviewText: Everyone working at the hotel was incredibly friendly & always helpful. Rooms were delightful; food was excellent...............just the best!

review.title: Great service, convenient location and comfortable rooms
review.reviewText:
Enjoyed my stay - comfortable room, with all the basic conveniences, and a
good location. Would definitely return.

review.title: The Best Service, Very Clean and a Good Central Location
review.reviewText:
This hotel is well worth trying. It has such a great staff that go out of their way to help. The hotel is very clean and well appointed in most areas. The location, while not known for sightseeing, is safe, very centrally located and just a short walk to most public transportation, Union Square and other hot spots.
There's a wine happy hour each evening, sometimes with live music. It's a great way to meet your fellow guest. During my stay there were visitors from all over the globe.
The restaurant is fablous. The best service and excellent food. I'm a vegetarian and I was in heaven with all the veg choices. But you carnivors will find plenty to love as well. I have to say the decor in the dining room looked like an amature might have done the designing, but the food, wine and service more than make up for it.
I really liked this place and will stay again on my regular visits to the city.

review.title: Nice weekend get-away
review.reviewText: Very friendly staff. Wine reception a nice touch. Rooms fresh and airy with contemprary decor, beds comfortable. Can't find character/vintage hotels very often, nice change from the cookie cutter modern hotel boxes.Location central enough to walk to Union Square or to the cable car stop. All just a couple of blocks away. Public transport is very convenient and easy to use in SF.

review.title: Satisfied in San Francisco
review.reviewText: After a very long haul flight it was nice to get to our hotel room. We booked through Expedia and front desk were expecting us, a room upgrade was appreciated . We were very happy with the room, bathroom, service, and location. The front desk gave us helpful information, the lobby was always warm and welcome to come back to. I would stay there again and recommend it to others. It was about a 10 minute walk to catch the cable cars, lots of food place on the way.

review.title: Great staff, great price
review.reviewText:
The staff was so great, they are friendly and helpful. Ask them anything - a suggestion for dinner, the best bus stop to get downtown, or help in reserving a great tour. They are definitely the best part of this hotel.

Everything was clean and comfortable. We had 2 people in a full/full room, and it was fine, but would have been small for more people or kids. The location is a little out of the way of the tourist spots, but the public transportation is great. It's close to the bus stop, and the cable car line is just a couple blocks north.

review.title: The good outweighed the bad
review.reviewText: Customer service was generally great, with the exception of housekeeping....they were very stingy with the towels. When we called for more towels, sometimes they would just bring us ONE. Other down sides: (1) the closet light was on a motion sensor rather than a light switch, so if i didn't sense you come in, the light wouldn't come on. This was extremely annoying time after time. (2) In their "renovations" they failed to put outlets in the room. We had to unplug the lamps, tv (which was tiny, BTW), and other things to charge our phones. (3) the bathtubs REALLY need to be cleaned better, stripped, replaced or SOMETHING. It really brought the overall bathroom down. However, the hotel was in an area that was close to all the places we wanted to go. We could walk to alot of spots in the neighorhood or catch a cab to anywhere we wanted to go for $10 or less. Front desk staff were very friendly and helpful with directions, calling cabs, restaurant recommendations, etc. There was also some kind of entertainment and free wine in the lobby almost every night we were there.

review.title: Sweet, older charming hotel.
review.reviewText: This was a lovely small older hotel with lots of character. The staff was very personable and helpful. Having an in hotel restaraunt was a and the Middle Eastern cuisine was a nice change from the expected. This was my first visit to San Francisco. Although this was not in the heart of the financial system I was close enough to walk, take the trolley cars or buses. Without a care I only had to take a taxi once or twice.

review.title: The TRUTH
review.reviewText: It was good. Most of the people who provided the customer service were excellent. There were steps out front, an employee was there (I think he was security), but nobody assisted me with my luggage. Some of the front desk people lacked personality. Others were outstanding. They should provide transportation to and from the airport; it would not be expensive for them, and would save the customers 32 dollars, and make them look even more professional and classy.

review.title: A Great Place to Stay
review.reviewText: With unique and eclectic decor, the feel of a European hotel, and an attentive and friendly staff, the Carlton is a wonderful alternative to downtown glitzy hotels. There are a number of good casual restaurants within short walking distance and easy bus access, so the location offers all the convenience of downtown at half the cost. I will stay again at the Carlton and have already recommended to friends.

review.title: A Bit Out The Way
review.reviewText:
We spent 4 nights at the Carlton and found it to be ok-ish.
We were greeted by very friendly staff at reception, we were told about the area, where to go and more importantly where not to go, gave us a map of the whole Bay area which came in very handy for the duration of our trip.
The hotel itself was clean, pleasant and quaint.
The rooms were small but clean, it can get quite chilly in San Francisco so was disappointed that the bedding only consisted of 2 sheets and a throw, could have really done with something a bit "thicker".
Oh and the walls are paper thin, that was a real down side... you could hear everything from the room next door.
As for the area, its situated quite a way away from everything... its about a 10 minute walk to Union Square and to get up to the bay area/fishermans wharf, I recommend getting the bus/tram as it can be quite a hike up those steep hills.
Don't wander out of a nightime too far as we found the area to be quite intimidating after dark, take the wrong turning and your in one of the "no-go" areas for tourists.

review.title: GOOD CHOICE
review.reviewText: VERY NICE older hotel in nice condition and pretty interior colors, people friendly and helpful, service was fine. Our room was very clean, very comfy bed. we were walking distance to China town, Union square shopping, plenty of places to eat. Don't venture too far as the neighborhood becomes seedy, at best. We only stayed there one night and I would go back.

review.title: San Francisco for 4 nights
review.reviewText: I really enjoyed my stay. Interior of the room and the hotel (especially elevator) is quite original. Location of the hotel is close to the Hyde and Market st., very convenient. Everything was just great)

review.title: Cool, ethnicly diverse.
review.reviewText:
The staff were very cool, welcoming abd helpful. The clientel were from all over the wrold, it seemed. We were very comfortable at this hotel having traveled in Europe a few times. A excellent near-'east restaurant in the hotel..
We wouldn't hesitate to return.

review.title: Everyone on the staff was extremely friendly and helpful.Will stay there next visit to San Francisco
review.reviewText: Great hotel with great location. Staff was wonderful from the day we arrived until we left 7 days later. Staff were all friendly, helpful, and most had a terrific sense of humor. Enjoyed the daily wine reception for the wine and the socializing. Ate in the restaurant twice with others staying at other hotels and we were all favorably impressed with both food and service. A few more electrical outlets, more hangers (received upon request), and a mini-frig (stocking not necessary due to many convenient restaurants and stores) are the only things that could have made the room more comfortable. The surrounding neighborhood in a certain direction (the Tenderloin) was not desirable but the staff alerted us and it was easily avoided. Great experience and great value. We plan to stay there when we return to San Francisco. Our son and his girlfriend and her parents will probably stay there next time even though they were at other hotels on this trip.

review.title: good hotel
review.reviewText: lovely little hotel with great staff. my bath's surface looked dirty though - probably just old

review.title: First trip out west
review.reviewText: It was a very reasonably priced hotel with everything we needed and courteous staff plus great location!

review.title: For Young Travellers only
review.reviewText: After reading everyone else's reviews, this hotel was pretty much what I expected. I picked this hotel because of the location + free parking. Those were the pluses. The minuses were the noise factors - and it was pretty bad. Not from the street or neighborhood, but from other rooms. Lots of young guests, party-going, late-nighters, so if you're someone who needs lots of peace and quiet, this is not the hotel for you. We stayed over a weekend, and it was pretty noisy throughout. Conversations in the next room, even at "lower" voice levels, were easy heard (though not clearly). Bring ear plugs, make sure the morning light can come in to wake you, and everything will be just fine. Other than that, hotel was great.

review.title: Great price for the location!!!!
review.reviewText: We stayed at this hotel for a quick vacation in early April. From the beginning, we were pleased with the atmosphere. The staff was extremely friendly, The room was very clean & spacious. Even being next to the elevator, the noise sounded more a toilet flushing one floor above us. The bathroom could use some TLC (some mold growing around the outside,near the floor), & the shower head was a little too high for my 5'2" wife. Other than that, we both found our stay to be very pleasant. There are a lot of good restaurants & cafes close by & 2 car rental places within walking distance. Would definitely recommend this hotel.

review.title: I will stay in the same hotel during my next visit to San Francisko.
review.reviewText: Very pleasant hotel. I red in reviews about sound penetration between rooms. I called in advance and was given room on 8th floor. It was quite. I admit, you can here the phone ringing in next room. But my neighbours did not produce much noise. So, I cannot complain.

review.title: Affordable Hotel, Walking distance to Union Square
review.reviewText: This hotel is a true gem with comfy beds. The Hotel Carlton's rooms are perfect for two people, though a little small for families. The only negetative with the rooms are that the walls are paper thin, but that often hapens in older hotels. Athough the hotel is located in the "Tenderloin" area. My twin sister and I felt perfectly safe by day. The hotel staff was both funny and helpful showing us on a map which areas to avoid. There are sight seeing bus tours that take off from the hotel. Muir Woods and Alcatraz are well worth seeing. The free wine (red or white) served from 5:30 to 6:00 p.m. is a real treat.

review.title: from a disappointed Los Angeleno
review.reviewText: I do not recommend this hotel. The rooms are small. The hotel is in good repair, but the building is old. The decor is not particularly attractive. The neighborhood is run down. I did not care for the quality of people on the streets in the area.

review.title: Lovely Rooms, nice location
review.reviewText: Great hotel upon check-in, much of surrounding neighborhood leaves something to be desired, but very close to shopping and major public transportation.

review.title: hotel with a great vibe
review.reviewText: Great hotel with a cool ambience. Hotel staff very helpful. Nice wine reception. Very clean rooms. Walls a little thin so some noise from the halls come through. Nice deep bathtub. Very comfortable bed. TV is small but this wasn't a problem since was in san francisco to see the city and didn't watch tv. Good price for the hotel plus free internet.

review.title: very friendly personnel
review.reviewText: I booked the hotel due to the good ratings and I have to admit they were all right. Very friendly and helpful staff. The room was clean, nice and not to small. The resturant is good and the breakfast was delicious. The location is perfect you can reach all important places in San Francisco very esaly (public transport). All lot of resturants and bars are very close located to the hotel.

review.title: Would recommend to friends!
review.reviewText: The hotel is in a great location. Friendly staff. We checked in pretty late and so the night staff checked us in a different category of room, but next day we were shifted to the right category that we had booked. Its a good hotel in a great location!

review.title: Great Hotel!
review.reviewText: Friendly service, loved the cocktail hour.

review.title: Awesome little boutique hotel
review.reviewText: This is a great little hotel within walking distance to Union Square and the Ferry Building etc. Very friendly staff, excellent service and nice rooms. I've stayed in other boutique hotels in the same area before (same price range) and this one beats them all. Best bang for your buck!

review.title: Hotel had the nicest staff ever!!
review.reviewText: The staff were very helpful and thoughtful. The guys on the desk were always full of fun, it was a pleasure to talk to them, plus all their recommedations lived up to expectation!!

review.title: Great no-frills hotel for a great price in a great location!
review.reviewText: We picked this hotel primarily due to its proximity to a few friends' apartments, and it turned out to be a great choice! The area immediately surrounding the hotel is kind of dullsville, but it's just a quick, five-minute walk to some amazing neighborhoods and streets that are full of great shops and restaurants! The hotel itself is exactly what I'm looking for when visiting a city like SF - a decent bed; a good, hot shower; friendly hotel staff; and decent TV channels (when I need to rest my tired feet after a long day of exploring). The hotel is also environmentally friendly - you tell the staff if you would like your towels and/or sheets to be changed; otherwise, they re-use your existing linens when cleaning your room each day. I will definitely consider staying here again!

review.title: A real gem
review.reviewText: There are so many hotels to choose from, but I keep going back to the Carlton. They really make you feel at home, and everyone, from the housekeepers to the front desk are a class act. The hotel is close to public transportation, great restaurants and many good coffee hang outs. The variety of restaurants is great, and the front desk can ofer recommendations. My room was on the seventh floor, but bring ear plugs just in case. If you take the BART from SFO, get off at the Powell street station. You could take a cab, but if your fit, walk straight up Powell to Sutter and hang a left. About a ten minute walk, and you get to pass by some boutiques for shopping and cool places to eat.

review.title: Wonderful staff, but sketchy area and thin walls
review.reviewText: The hotel staff are exemplary and will go out of their way to recommend a restaurant, assist you with transportation, etc. They were the friendliest staff I've ever encountered! However, the hotel is not in the best part of town. We were nervous walking around, especially at night. We didn't encounter any problems, but certainly didn't feel safe in the surrounding neighborhood. Also, we could hear everything the people in the room next to us were saying. The walls are very thin and you can hear doors slamming, people talking, etc. The staff were great and the room was pretty clean, but I wouldn't recommend this hotel due to the poor location and noisy rooms. I wish we would've stayed a little closer to Fisherman's Wharf.

review.title: Made San Francisco an amazing trip
review.reviewText: Amazing experience. They let us check in early, the room was very nice, tidy maid service, and awesome location. The front desk was very helpful in arranging tours and making sure everything was okay. The wine reception was awesome as well. The hotel is not in the middle of it all, but it's a short walk to EVERYTHING. Just be prepared to walk a lot of hills. I would highly recommend to anyone. They also explained the bus system very well, which is key to getting around the city, but very easy to learn.

review.title: Great hotel, amazing staff
review.reviewText: My husband and I thorughly enjoyed our stay at Hotel Carlton. The staff was amazing. Friendly, accomodating, and humerous. Upon arrival they did not have the king size bed we requested and put us in a room with two doubles. 10 minutes after arriving they brought a bottle of wine to our room for our inconvience. The next morning they personally moved our belongings to the king size room! The evening wine receptions are fun and relaxing. Also- Saha was a delicious restaurant. Not expecting too much from a hotel restaurant we were completely amazed!! Delicious Arabic fusion food with a very cool vibe. Would recommend this to anyone, anytime!

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText: The hotel seemed more like an upscale youth hostile and the neighborhood was sketchy.

review.title: Great little hotel for the price
review.reviewText: We stayed just one night, but wished we could have stayed longer. We really liked the location, appreciated the humor and good nature of the staff and were comfortable in our rooms.

review.title: Would stay there again.
review.reviewText:
The hotel was as expected from reading the online reviews.

The staff was extremely helpful and friendly.

review.title: hotel carlton
review.reviewText: it was good, a bit far from the golden gate bridge, fisherman's wharf etc.

review.title: Nice, friendly place to stay
review.reviewText:
I stayed at the Hotel Carlton during March of 2010 and must say I enjoyed it. It was quite simple and to the point, but it was a nice place with a fair price. If you're into it, they had a nice wine reception each evening. The room was comfortable and looked nice, though nothing hugely fancy. The streetside that the hotel faced was nice and seemed like a nice enough area. A few blocks away, however, isn't as nice of a place but the clerk kindly marked rougher parts of the town on a map for customers (the hotel was not within those areas, of course).

The staff was very friendly and helpful and would go out of their way to help. There is a strong theme at the hotel of helping other, less fortunate countries, which is a good enough theme to promote. There was an Arabic restaurant inside the hotel as well.

A special note should be made of the odd but creative elevator door on one of the elevators, which had a handle and pulled open (the outer, not inner door).

Overall, it was a nice place with a friendly staff. It was pretty basic, but that's what I was looking for.

review.title: Very quaint hotel
review.reviewText: I originally picked this hotel because of the reviews I read about it. Both my husband and I were very satisfied with this hotel. The staff was extremely helpful, friendly and approachable. The nightly wine receptions were very nice and enjoyed by many A string quartet played one night and it was very enjoyable. We purchased a MUNI pass and had no problem finding public transportation close by. Dining was close by also. There were a mix of guests from all over - Australia, France, England. There is a fire station and hospital close by, so yes you will may hear sirens when the windows are open. If you want a unique place that is centrally located - stay at the Carlton and enjoy the true city.

review.title: Terrific staff, even better value
review.reviewText: It's definitely not in the best location, a bit too far from the Bart, and a bit too far from Union Square. However, the low price and incredible service make it a worthwhile hotel for visitors on a budget. There's a free wine reception, and the front desk is incredibly accommodating. The facilities are obviously newly renovated. I appreciated the free car service in the morning, that can take you to Union Square and the convention center.

review.title: Great location=close to everything-but noisy
review.reviewText:
We were welcomed by the hotel staff, very friendly. Clean hotel lots of character,
clean rooms.

review.title: Perfect for the Price
review.reviewText: A great in-city hotel, a short walk from Union Square. Most of the surrounding neighborhoods are safe and comfortable (even as a single woman traveling alone), with one exception that the front staff will gladly point out. The wine tasting in the evening is a nice little touch. Try the Mexican restaurant a block and a half to the east (on the same side of the street) for a cheap take away meal...best burrito I've ever eaten.

review.title: Would stay there again...
review.reviewText: The Hotel Carlton was a older hotel, but we loved the character of it...The staff was very helpful and made suggestions to make our trip better...Our room was very quiet from road noise...If you like wine, they serve wine for 30 minutes in the evening...

review.title: Will definitely return
review.reviewText: The hotel was amazing for the price that we paid. The one and only concern that I have is how paper thin the walls are. We were having a normal conversation, and the people in the room beside us complained. Other then that, I could not have asked for anything better!

review.title: Can't wait to go back !!
review.reviewText: First Tip, dont take a cab from SFO, it will cost about $45. There are local shuttles in town you can call for $12 a person. I love their complimentary wine at night. You can meet and greet other guests, or you can just hang out by the fireplace. Very cozy and romantic. The hotel is in a very busy neighborhood, so if you are into a quiet, lonely place, this hotel is not for you. Their staff are all very helpful with directions and recommendations. There are so many restaurants around the hotel, you will never get hungry. The room is very clean, it has a very modern atmosphere. The bed is absolutely comfortable, the bathroom is super clean. Enough with the little bottles of shampoo and conditioner, this hotel is very environmentally friendly, so they use soap dispensers. I cant wait to go back!!!

review.title: nice, simple, and clean
review.reviewText: Very accomodating and professional service. i don't know very many hotels i can compare it to, but for the price, if you're looking for a nice, clean, simple hotel near everything, then hotel carlton will more than do.

review.title: Great budget option in Downtown
review.reviewText: The hotel was great. It is very near to Nob Hill and in a nice neighborhood. The rooms are small but well-appointed. The service was great. Would definitely stay here again.

review.title: Friendly and relaxed
review.reviewText: Within walking distance or transportation from most attractions. Hotel staff is great. This is an older well maintained hotel that is centrally located. Rooms are clean and well kept..We had no noise issues as noted in other reviews. Great value for your money. For a good breakfast try Cafe Bean just a couple of blocks on the same street as the hotel.

review.title: Convenient for travel with family
review.reviewText: The hotel was very pleasant. Not fancy, but convenient location and friendly staff and atmosphere. We were not put off by the location, as some others were; it is very close to nice areas and tourist attractions.

review.title: Central location, pleasane efficient service, strange neighborhood !
review.reviewText: Great deal with Valet Parking included.

review.title: Bright and airy
review.reviewText: The room was bright and airy and very comfortable. Good location. Walking distance to everything. But ambient sound and street noise did make it through the walls, so not perfectly quiet.

review.title: Would definitely go back
review.reviewText: Good location, nice rooms (free wifi was welcome too), great service, and definitely good value.

review.title: Great Price for a great Hotel
review.reviewText: It was a great hotel. Nice atmosphere, not too big, good location. Parking across the street. Would go back there instantly.

review.title: Beauti ful and friendly hotel
review.reviewText: it was a great hotel

review.title: Solid good hotel
review.reviewText: We brought our folding bikes from the SFO on the BART and then biked to the Carlton. The elevators are small but handled the Brompton bikes with ease. The staff was warm, courteous and efficient. The wine social at 530 was pleasant surprise. Up the street/hill are a number of restaurants that local haunts and family owned. Again, a Choose Local attitude will be rewarded with good food choices.

review.title: Excellent customer service. Delicious restaurant if you yearn for healthy Middle Eastern cooking.
review.reviewText: Hotel was easy to find from the SF airport. The curbside valet service was excellent. Reception was warm, friendly and helpful at all times. The hotel was showing its age in some areas- not a fancy hotel, but clean! It well made up for any fraying carpet edges with its superb customer service! The wine hour in the lobby was very sweet during the early evening.

review.title: Earthquake-Proof
review.reviewText: Excellent value! The lobby was tasteful without being boring. Staff was friendly and had a great sense of humor. Clean rooms. You can tell this place has had a couple coats of paint, but they've done great things with the latest one. This hotel is in a conveniently central location if you're looking to split your time between touristy stuff by the water and hipster mission district. Parking is a headache, but you should take the BART anyway. Was only there two nights, so I didn't get a chance to check it out, but the guys at the front desk said something about a free wine tasting at 6 in the lobby. Be there.

review.title: Best hotel ever.
review.reviewText: This was one of the best hotel experiences that I have ever had. The staff were very helpful and pleasant. Thank you for a great experience.

review.title: Pleasantly surprised
review.reviewText:
It is what it is - clean rooms, amazing good deal rooms. The elevator is the most off-putting thing - you get into a cheesy elevator with a world map and photos and pictures cut from magazines on the wall. At this point you ask yourself - what will the rooms be like? Clean rooms, recently (by the looks of things) refurbished. Highspeed internet.

I liked that they were a business striving to be energy neutral with touches like a happy 1/2 hour with free drinks, filtered water and ice machine in the lobby.

For me it was because I had to be in town while having hospital tests done - and it's close to the hospital. Walking distance to Union Square and buses right outside the front door.

Other reviews mentioned loud neighbours and unsavoury part of town. I did not have this experience.

review.title: Will definitely return in the future
review.reviewText: The hotel was great. Not being a chain hotel, we were concerned before hand. I read alot of reviews on it and was afraid on the cost per night. Once we arrived and were greeted by the front desk clerks and arrived at the room, we were impressed. We also enjoyed the free wine tasting in the evenings. If we return to San Francisco, we will definitely return to this hotel.

review.title: Loved this hotel!
review.reviewText: I was thoroughly pleased with this hotel. The Tenderloin has a seedy charm with lots of cute ethnic restaurants and shops and close proximity to everything. Hotel is friendly and hip with complimentary happy hour and terrific Arabic fusion restaurant. And the price was definitely right on Expedia.

review.title: Great stay!
