review.reviewText: On the north edge of the Tenderloin (a not-so-nice neighborhood) we found it convenient to public transportation, to Avis, to great breakfast and dinner spots, and within walking distance to Union Square. Great staff and very nice hotel! We plan on coming back!

review.title: "Our home away from home"
review.reviewText:
Hotel Carlton is a great hotel to spend your week away in San Francisco. The hotel staff is very professional, comical and personable. We felt very welcomed and valued during our stay. The hotel is situated near many transportation routes and in a nice neighborhood with lots of coffee shops.

Our room was quite comfortable and we slept well. If you want a nice, relaxing place to stay while visiting beautiful San Francisco, make sure you check out the Carlton Hotel.

review.title: The Best Hotel In Boston
review.reviewText:
I had the pleasure the be in Hotel Carlton which offers outstanding service.
The hotel is about 10min walk from SF center or 1-2min with taxi.
The room was clean and the bed was comfort.
In overall, I'm very satisfy with my selection

review.title: Great
review.reviewText: Great hotel!

review.title: Cant wait to go back
review.reviewText: I cant wait stay there again. The hotel staff we very pleasant and helpful and answered any questions you had. The room was clean and housekeeping was great!! I also enjoyed the free wine reception and music every evening in the lobby. I would definately stay there again!!

review.title: Great place to stay at an affordable price.
review.reviewText:
I had a very good experience. This is my second time to stay at the Carlton. It was also recommend to me by others.

It is classy, fun, and affordable.

The service was great.

review.title: Not too bad, but there should be better options, even at this price.
review.reviewText: The location is not bad and if you like to walk can be a good point, since you have a chance to see the real enviroment of SF, when you walk down to fishermans Wharf, to Market street, Ferry building, etc - the hotel is kind of in the middle of everything. The room was older than I expected, but comfortable. The heating system was very very noise, not sure why it was doing lots of metal noises around midnight. The free wine at the lobby is nice and you have some restaurants in walking distance, all in all, it is not bad, but far form an exciting experience.

review.title: Can't beat free wine!
review.reviewText: Very friendly staff, free wine tasting everynight, anything I needed was attended to very promptly. Room was clean and comfortable :)

review.title: Good hotel
review.reviewText: We were well pleased with the service from the staff at this hotel. They were very happy to help in whatever way and nothing seemed too much trouble. Rooms were clean and tidy although a little small. Restaurant was good though we only used it for breakfast and lunch. All in all, well recomended

review.title: Great for the price!
review.reviewText: The hotel exceeded our expectations. The staff was friendly, pleasant and very helpful. Really loved the decor of the hotel lobby and rooms- asian influenced. Its not right by Union Square but its close enough to walk. There is a nice variety of restaurants in the surrounding area that met our dinning needs. Its great for the price and would go back.

review.title: Great Experience
review.reviewText: This hotel was so friendly, clean and unique. I highly recommend it. It had a vintage vibe and the staff was awesome. Great neighborhood too. Definitely felt like I got a great value for my money.

review.title: Another trip to SF
review.reviewText: Friendly staff, hotel nice with wine session each evening. Lift a little unreliable and room was cold due to lack of heating controls in cold weather. However room OK and location considered I would stay again and I don't usually give hotels a second chance.

review.title: Light Sleeper
review.reviewText: Great hotel. Very comfortable bed. The only issue was the paper thin walls. I'm a light sleeper and I could hear everything in the rooms next door. One guy was talking to his wife on the phone and I could hear HER!

review.title: Not a good place for a restful night's sleep.
review.reviewText:
Although the staff at the hotel were all very nice and helpful, it didn't make up for the location and condition of the hotel. I wish I had been warned before I made the reservation that there is a firehouse a block away, with sirens blaring ALL NIGHT. The windows are not insulated, so sound just comes right through. In addition, the walls themselves are ultra-thin. If you have neighbors, you WILL hear EVERYTHING! The first night, I only slept for 2.5 hours. We asked the front desk what we could do, and the best option they had for us was to switch rooms, and I appreciated very much that they kept guests out of our neighboring rooms for the rest of our stay. We were given earplugs after requesting them, so that did help a bit, but I cam back from a four night stay utterly exhausted. In addition to all of the noise, none of the rooms have actual curtains or drapes-- just horizontal blinds. I am used to sleeping in the dark, so it was very problematic for me to have all of the city lights just shining right in. The staff gave us blankets to hang over the windows, so that did help some, but we did not feel pampered in any way, that's for sure! Some of the beds were comfortable, but my companion got a lousy bed that was very bowed in the middle and woke up with shoulder and neck issues.

To reiterate, the staff there is very kind and do their best, but the hotel itself is lousy and all of the smiles in the world cannot change that. I would definitely not go back.

review.title: Good quality/price
review.reviewText: The Hotel was very well located for public transportation and with a parking garage very close. The Lobby is very nice looking, though the rooms are a bit old. But as I said quality/price is ok. It's very close to many bars, it's fun for having a drink but very late at night gets a bit dangerous, not recommended to walk in the streets to the south of the hotel

review.title: Vintage hotel, thin walls
review.reviewText: Our room was clean and nicely decorated even if the door jambs and bathtub were a liitle on the worn side. The temperature in our room was pleasant right on through the cool winter nights. The staff was always helpful and the wine tastings each night were nice to come home to after a day walking all those hills. Hearing the wild sex of our neighbors at 1:30 am through the thin walls was not. We still give this hotel a thumbs up. We very much enjoyed our stay.

review.title: Comfortable Stay
review.reviewText: The staff was great! Funny and welcoming. The hotel was clean and comfortable. Overall, great experience. But.....the location isn't the best. Union Square is not really walking distance so if you're booking this hotel for the price, you might end up spending the same amount on cabs.

review.title: " If you want convienence for shopping this is it, a 15 minute walk to heaven"
review.reviewText: This was my first trip to San Francisco and it was a great experince. The accomodations were excellent as well as the individuals providing services at the hotel. I could definitely return for another visit with the help of Expedia.

review.title: not bad for the price.. but a few compromises to be made..
review.reviewText:
Staff were friendly n courteous, however, the location isn't good at all. Not only would we would hear a lot of sirens in the evening thus disrupting our sleep (Emergency Hospital nearby) but it'd be quite a walk to get to Union Sq et al.

All in all, you get what you pay for.

review.title: Will definitely go back!
review.reviewText: My husband and I thoroughly enjoyed our stay at Hotel Carlton. We really appreciated the simple decore, beautiful photographs and Buddhist art that decorated the lobby and our room. To us, Hotel Carlton had a lot of character and charm that one can't find at a Hilton et al. We will choose this hotel over any others we've visited in San Fran in the future.

review.title: We were made to feel very welcome by all the staff, highly recommended!
review.reviewText:
Hotel and staff very, very friendly and helpful. Every member of staff greeted us so warmly on each of our ten day stay.

Although we did not use the hotel restaurant due to choice of outside restaurants, it always looked busy and some wonderful smells and sounds were emitted.

review.title: Not good if light sleeper
review.reviewText: The hotel is clean, the staff is friendly however if you are a light sleeper do not go to this hotel. IWe were awaken at 4:30, 6:30 and 8:00 a.m. to a ringing sound that lasted 10-15 minutes each time. The staff said it was coming from outside the hotel and it could not be helped. Maybe other parts of the hotel didn't suffer from this (we were in room 605). Additionally there is no in-room temperature control. Our room was cold. We were told a space heater would be sent but it never was. We probably could have complained again to obtain it.

review.title: Fantastic hotel... iffy location
review.reviewText: Hotel Carlton is in an area of town that can be a bit dicey but the hotel itself is worth the stay. The staff is funny and there is great food and entertainment in the area. I'm a fan!

review.title: An accurate representation of a San Francisco Hotel...
review.reviewText: Nice decor, very good location.Friendly and relax ambiance.Good service in general.The feeling of been in a beautiful and relax city translated to the hotel...

review.title: Feels like home in San Francisco
review.reviewText: A unique hotel with freindly and personable staff. We would definitely stay again if we return to San Francisco.

review.title: Nice and good service
review.reviewText: The hotel was very nice, in a convenient location. The staff was very nice and helpful. I had a couple of problems with lighthing and my key in the room and they always sent someone to help me within minutes.

review.title: nice stay
review.reviewText: It was a nice place to stay with reasonable prices. The room was small, but clean and comfortable. You can hear your neighbors if you have any. My only wish was that it was closer to the mass transit. We will most likely go back.

review.title: Can't wait to go back
review.reviewText:
We had no idea what to expect but were very pleased.
The hotel was very clean, with pleasant decor. The staff was so nice, they persona;ized our visit and made us feel at home. We were 3 blocks from the California cable car. We were 3 blocks from authenic NY pizza at the Village Pizzeria. Polk Street and Van Ness are pleasant walking streets. Van Ness has a regular bus line to the wharf. Found a wonderful bakery and a Walgreen's on Polk street. Would highly recommend this hotel.

review.title: Great Hotel and Service
review.reviewText: I stayed here in min-November of this year. The hotel was great! Clean, great service and very freindly and accomodating staff. The only downside to the hotel was the location. It was close to Union Square and walkable to many sights however the surrounding area didn't offer much. We had trouble trying to find a place to eat both nights. Overall, I would stay at this hotel again, I just might plan meals better.

review.title: Lives up to its great reviews!
review.reviewText: Hotel Staff are probably the best part of this hotel.......everyone was very friendly and helpful. One night they brought us up take out menus that delivered to the hotel and recommended the best ones, and they were right, the food was great! Another night, they found us a bar to watch the Pacquiao/Cotto fight. If you don't mind walking a little, you can pretty much get to any destination on foot. We had our anniversary dinner at Fleur de Lys, I would definitely recommend that for a special occasion celebration! I will definitely stay at Hotel Carlton again!

review.title: Value for money and not too far from Union Square
review.reviewText: Hotel is around a 10 minute walk to Union Sq with many amenities around the hotel. Hotel is very clean and staff very helpful. One thing is that the walls are thin and most rooms have a door joining the room next door. You can hear your neighbours talking\showering\flushing etc so make sure you ask for a room with no connecting doors... or take earplugs. Other than that no worries about the service and quality of the hotel.

review.title: “The Carlton Hotel is the best stay in SF for stay for the price!"
review.reviewText: We had a perfect stay at the Carlton from Nov. 4th to 9th. The staff the best. They put our friend close in #610 and us in #608. None of us found the walls paper thin. The view wasn't great but we didn't care. You could hear the doors in the hallways and water running but nothing unordinary. We could hear sirens sometimes from a nearby fire station and hospital but it wasn't bad. I sleep with earplugs anyways. The room is a good size with a desk and big closet with safe, iron and ironing board. The bed was sooo comfortable! rooms clean and the perfect temperature. Nice Moroccan, modern decor, a coffee maker in room with complimentary coffee, teabags would be nice. It's a green hotel so you can have laundry done or not, just let the cleaning staff know. They also have recycling bins which is great.There are 2 computers in the Lobby, you get 20 minutes free per day on your Visa. The free wine tasting in the evenings from 5:30 to 6:00pm is awesome and it's very popular!! We thought the location was great, lots of buses go nearby and not too far from Market St. and Union square. Good shops and restaurant nearby. I know there are some rough spots in the Tenderloin, we had no problems. The SAHA Restaurant is fabulous and we were not disappointed. The food was amazing! and they had Vegan options. a reasonable amount and price for the fantasic flavor sensations there.So I would just say "stay here" next time you are in San Francisco it's a FABULOUS Hotel!

review.title: "Fabulous and well-rounded hotel in San Francisco"
review.reviewText: Hotel Carlton has: wonderful beds, fabulous customer service, phenomenal food at Saha Restaurant in hotel, comfortable walk from Union Square, parking available at reasonable cost. Cannot pay enough compliments to the entire experience at this hotel. "Joie de Vivre" at its best!

review.title: Hotel Carlton, a Joie de Vivre Boutique Hotel staff can't be beat!
review.reviewText: Staff at this hotel is great! They are very friendly, funny and helpful. They went out of their way to make our stay enjoyable. However, I wasn't 100% impressed with the condition of our room. Although the decor is nice it is an older building and our room (King size bed) felt a little cramped. The bed didn't actually feel as big as the king sized bed we have at home. The rooms don't have any air conditioning (not a problem since we were there at end of October and didn't require air conditioning.) The bathroom was cramped. It appeared as though the bathroom had been given a "facelift" ie new tile surround around the tub but the job didn't appear to be professional. Our room had a big walk-in closet (where the safe was housed) good for dressing but it had a motion activated light which was a bit of a nuissance because if you were standing in the closet getting dressed/ready the light would go out and you had to stand in front of the light and swing your arms to get the light back on. Also no electrical outlet in this room - sort of an inconvenience because if you wanted to iron your clothes (ironing board & iron stored in the closet) you had to take the iron into the already cramped room.

review.title: Nice hotel, but...
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel for the money, but a little too close to the not-so-nice part of town.

review.title: Confortable and warm Hotel
review.reviewText:
We visited San Francisco the last two weeks, it was the first time in San Francisco and whe did'nt know the city. Al first we booked another hotel but we decided to change to Carlton Hotel. It was a good experiences. The people were very nice, the hall it's very confortable, you can fell as if you are in your home's living home (there were confortable sofas and a chimney)
The roon was very nice, warm and confortable. Very clean and with a good taste decoration.
I recomend sincerely

review.title: Loved the happy staff and the international mix of travelers
review.reviewText: A perfect place to stay in SFO. The staff was friendly ; the service was prompt and the premises are well kept. The ambience is upbeat and has an international flair. We would definitly go back.

review.title: treated like royalty
review.reviewText: We could walk or take public transport to every tourist location from the hotel. The staff are super friendly and helpful. They even have a wine tasting "happy hour" each evening, where you can meet other residents from all over the world whilst sitting in comfy sofa's, in front of the fire, listening to live music. The best breakfast from The Saha restaurant, a little mexican/east indian fusion. The decor is the same, quirky and welcoming. Will definately go back

review.title: Can't wait to go back
review.reviewText: Can't wait to go back FOR REAL!

review.title: Hotel Carlton Rocks!
review.reviewText: A friend and I decided to stay at Hotel Carlton because the price and location were great. We definitely got more than we expected. The hotel staff was simply amazing! They answered questions, suggested places, and always made us laugh. The place makes you feel like you are a world traveler complete with all the amenities you could possibly need. The FREE wine service, yes I said FREE, was a fantastic way to start our evening every night. Theo played his music as the lobby filled with happy travelers all mingling and having a good time. I will not stay anywhere else if I venture back to San Francisco, this place is the place to be. It's also located close to everything, so you're in walking distance of just about anywhere you want to go.

review.title: Superior Service
review.reviewText: We had a wonderful stay at the Hotel Carlton. The service from the staff was exceptional! Very friendly and accommodating. It was clean and the room was unique. The breakfast we had in the restaurant was excellent, and the service there also outstanding. Cabs were plentiful! Would stay there again in a heartbeat. Felt it was a very good value compared to prices of other "commercial properties" in the area which don't have any of the charm. A++

review.title: Great location and great buy!
review.reviewText: We stayed at the Carlton 4 nights while visiting for Nike Marathon. Very quaint and personal with great front desk reps. Upon reading reviews asked for private area w/2 double beds. No frills but beds are amazingly comfortable. No a/c but ceiling fan worked to circulate air. Reviews are correct, paper thin walls-could even hear vomiting next room over - take ear plugs and you will be fine. Loved the location, central to everything. Walked in the evening without problem, front desk warned us to stay out of certain area. Could pick @ little issues such as no fan in bathroom, tile missing in bathroom, no ice machine on our floor but we feel we had a bargain so won't go there. I would totally stay again for the price we paid!

review.title: can't wait to go back!
review.reviewText: This hotel was great. It was clean, comfortable and the hotel staff was great. We stayed for 4 nights. Our room wasn't ready when we got there for early check in so they held our bags and gave us a great place to eat for lunch. When we came back our room was ready and someone took our bags up for us. They told us how to get everywhere we needed to go and what was the fastest way (we didn't have a car). They were a great help!!! If we ever go back to San Francisco we WILL be staying here!

review.title: Very impressed
review.reviewText: Guest service extremely helpful and friendly.

review.title: Can't wait to go back
review.reviewText: Hotel Carlton, a Joie de Vivre Boutique Hotel,is exellent. I recomend this hotel to any body

review.title: We stay there again, great location.
review.reviewText: The stay was wonderful, our room was very clean and comfortable. Had breakfast in the resturant every morning, plenty of food good prices. Staff was very helpful and friendly. Have recommended it to many friends already.

review.title: Well placed, comfortable, friendly 3-star hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel is situated near the downtown area of San Fran and ideally placed to catch the public transport system. The Carlton is a very good 3-star hotel with very friendly and helpful staff. We stayed on floor 6 and heard first-hand from a guest who was on the 1st floor, finding the street noise unbearable. So, thanks to those who pointed out that the higher floors are better! Also make sure you have a room that isn't next to the lift shafts! The on site restaurant, SAHA offers arabic-fusion food - highly recommended! A great atmosphere in the restaurant and the food was brilliant. Free internet access another bonus to the hotel, and there are two PC's near reception with a printer (first 20 minutes on internet is free). No fridge in the room which would have been nice, although there is a safe. There is no air-con, but the windows can be opened fully. The ceiling fan offered good air circulation and the temperature in the city during our stay was pretty comfortable, but I can imagine the room being quite uncomfortable in the height of summer! Free wine evenings from 530pm for an hour in the lobby - a nice touch offered by the hotel - and a good way to mingle. In summary - a real gem in the city, a good quality 3-star hotel and we'd definitely recommend and would go back if visiting San Fran again!

review.title: comfortable base
review.reviewText: Hotel staff were very friendly and helpful. Our room was ready an hour before check in, which was much appreciated after a long journey. The room was not quite as big as anticipated, and the bathroom a little dated, but very clean and comfortable. Only one fault, the coffee machine in the room only made one cup at a time.

review.title: Great value for money!
review.reviewText: This is a great little hotel. Great location, staff were extremely friendly and helpful, the room was great and clean and the overall atmosphere was very relaxed and comfortable. I travel a lot for business and often stay in high-end hotels. This little boutique hotel rivals those high-end ones in terms of service and comfort and outperforms them in terms of making you feel at home away from home. Highly recommended. I will definitely go back.

review.title: Highly recommend
review.reviewText: I can't emphasize enough how friendly and service oriented the staff was here. They made you feel like one of the family. While the hotel was a bit older, it was nicely decorated, clean and comfortable. My wife and I were very happy with our stay here and would recommend it to others.

review.title: Nice boutique hotel
review.reviewText: Very friendly hotel with nice views of the city from the 6th floor. Complimentary wine tasting in the designish lobby with the fireplace is awesome. Parking for $20 per day located just opposite the hotel. 10-15 minutes by public transport to Ferry port restaurants and bars.

review.title: a original hotel
review.reviewText: near city center and all the shopping streets a little too noisy in the room when someone is speakind in the corridor or car in the street but otherwise a very good hotel witj a good quality of hotel service

review.title: 2nd Stay As Good As the 1st
review.reviewText: Enjoyed our second stay at this delightful hotel. The staff is always friendly and helpful, and the hotel lobby is a great gathering place in the early evenings for their complimentary wine reception, almost has the feel of a B&B. The rooms are small by today's standards, but very comfortable, with a huge closet, complete with safe. Not air-conditioned, so there was a bit of street noise coming through the open window. This hotel has gone "green", so they don't provide bottled water in the rooms or ice on the floors. There is a single filtered cold water dispenser on the first floor...I would suggest that these water dispensers be placed on each floor for guest convenience. Great location within walking distance of Union Square, easy access to bus and cable cars. We would definitely stay here a 3rd time!

review.title: San Fran Hotel rules
review.reviewText: The staff here is awesome and friendly and I loved them. The rooms are clean and cool and the area is perfect for getting anywhere you would want to be in San Fran

review.title: 5 stars and cozy
review.reviewText: Folks, I chose this hotel on the strength of the testimonials. Everything was exactly as described and the price point is well worth it. Saha restaurant in the hotel is excellent, the best middle eastern/merican I have ever ate. Nob hill cafe (italian) is excellent (45 min wait, check web site). Now, location, its a little funky, so not the place you can walk after dinner, its just seedy. I have no problem with seedy, but I was there with my daughter. So, next time for me it will be fishermans wharf where my boss stayed, and after dinner u can bookstore, cafe or walk along the water. Still a fantastic stay for us and expedia was perfect

review.title: Great Hotel Close to Everything
review.reviewText: Although the rooms were a little small, I was very impressed with the cleanliness of the rooms and the hotel. I also felt that the staff was extremely helpful. There are also many complimentary services offered like WiFi, car service on weekday mornings, wine tastings, etc. It is inexpensive but it is only a couple of blocks from the expensive hotels. It is not very far to walk to get to Union Square or many of the other attractions.

review.title: Carlton Hotel: good location, comfortable, good value
review.reviewText: On a business trip, I skipped the fancy conference hotel on Nob Hill and chose the Carlton, a few blocks away, with convenient location. Friendly, helpful staff, clean, comfortable, good value for the location. For eating, the Arabic-fusion restaurant on 1st floor is fantastic, with vegie, vegan and meat dishes. Next door is a good places for nicely served sandwiches/interesting beers for lighter fare.

review.title: Excellent Service
review.reviewText: This hotel is really well placed to visit all the major areas. It was on a regular bus route and had bars and restaurants within easy walking distance. The Staff were extremely polite and helpful. The room was very clean, a good size and had comfortable twin beds. The furnishings were tasteful and modern. I would return to this hotel next time I stay in San Francisco.

review.title: My home away from home in San Francisco
review.reviewText: I was delighted with the welcoming hotel foyer, which was celebrating a free wine reception upon my arrival. A burning fireplace greeted us every evening upon our return to the hotel with comfy seating areas that invited relaxation and conversation. The staff was consistently helpful and friendly. I was pleased with the hotel's location, since there were many small restaurants within a short walking distance and the area felt very safe. The room was delightful, clean and inviting, as was the bathroom. A request for extra bath towels was responded to in minutes. Only setback, the radio/cd player in my room didn't work well, but I did not request for this to be fixed as I was generally too busy. I'm sure it was an oversight.

review.title: Freindly Staff
review.reviewText: Hotel staff very friendly and helpful. Centrally located to take advantage of all public transportation. Wine reception added bonus

review.title: VERY NICE HOTEL
review.reviewText: I would recomend without doubt this hotel. It was good placed close to downtown and other amenties. It is a warm place and attention is outstanding.

review.title: Not a bad place, just a bad area
review.reviewText: I can't really fault the hotel itself - the room was clean and certainly had a huge closet and plenty of towels, etc. It is the location of the hotel that is less desireable. I arrived for business very late at night (around 11:30 p.m.) and needed to get a bite to eat. I took a brief walk around the block and felt very uncomfortable - as if any moment someone would jump out of the shadows at me - and I live in Chicago! Also, the hotel is on a major bus route, it seems, because in the morning, you are constantly woken up to the sounds of air brakes and what sounded like garbage trucks going down the alley - there is little to no sound-proofing from the outside, yet when in the halls, it is eerily silent. The room itself was quite small, but very clean and had just about everything I needed -other than a mini fridge. This definitely is not a business hotel - more like an upscale hostel from the looks of who else was staying here.

review.title: Nice hotel in a good central spot
review.reviewText: We were recommended to stay here by friends who had stayed before. They said it was just a decent place to stay. I thought it was very nice and the front desk were very helpful. Our room was clean and sufficient. It was centrally located and not far to walk or get the cable cars.

review.title: Single girls on summer vacation
review.reviewText: This is a very quaint hotel. The staff is very helpful and considerate. It is an older building that has been refurbished so the rooms are smaller than average but still very comfortable. You can hear your neighbors so keep that in mind if you are a light sleeper. Overall it was a great deal for the money. Be prepare to walk or use public transit since the main attractions are several blocks away...no big deal if you're in shape but remember SF has big hills. Also, check out the bar next door called FLY. Very cool bartender. Also, the hotel is a good breakfast place.

review.title: Great Hotel, Bad Parking
review.reviewText: The hotel was great but if you have a car it is $35 (including tax) to park. They do have valet but only open during certain times.

review.title: Quaint Hotel, Quality Customer Service
review.reviewText: The Carlton Hotel is truly one of the most enjoyable experiences I have had in a long time. By far, the customer service, the cleanliness & comfort, the eclectic styling, and the great location make it the best lodging choice in San Francisco. Pros: excellent customer service at the desk-willing to help you with any question you might have, comfortable beds, bathrooms with a luxurious feel, availability of basic toiletries (shower has 3 dispensers for shampoo, conditioner and soap-no more tiny bottles), nice-sized rooms, and a fabulous location--3 major bus lines run practically near the hotel, getting you most anywhere you would want to go; It's location is great, walking distant for many sights. Have I mentioned the customer service? Every time we left or came back, we were personally greeted, asking us how we were finding the town and if they could help. Our maid even left us a Happy 4th of July note one day. Additionally, the decor has this Asian eclectic Zen feel, making it so inviting, warm, and friendly, like a friend's home. It was such a welcoming place at the end of a long sight-seeing day. Things to be aware of: --no breakfast served, few restaurant near by (but if you are willing to walk, you will find something, thin walls (you will hear some noise from your neighbors. However, I cannot brag enough on this fabulous hotel. It is comfortable, clean, and customer friendly.

review.title: Very friendly hotel
review.reviewText: staff are superb and rooms are very clean. We stayed in a quiet room at rear of hotel but it is still a noisy hotel at night...Fab time though and would recommend people to stay there

review.title: loved it!!!!!
review.reviewText: i got a great deal on expedia and decided thats where i was going to stay. i had heard a few problems with the hotel, but not anything that concerned me. the walls were paper thin, but it didnt interfere with my stay, as most people are gone most of the day. another problem i heard about was the lack of a refrigerator, but when i went to the front desk with half a sandwich i wanted saved, someone brought a fridge to my room immediately. front desk was amazing, and so were the guests in the hotel. the hotel restaurant was awesome, and they took great pride in their service, and invited me back to see it at night, when it was illuminated. my only regret was i didnt make it there.

review.title: best customer service
review.reviewText: This hotel had the best service and made me feel very welcome. Old, but clean and full of character. A bit of a walk to union (10-15 mins) but let's face it, if you're going to SF get used to the walking. Very satisfied.

review.title: One of the best hotels I've stayed in
review.reviewText: This hotel in San Francisco was so good I had to tear myself away from the charming room to explore the city.

review.title: A Keeper
review.reviewText: The most memorable part of our one night stay was the staff--super-friendly and helpful, each and every on. The rooms are clean and comfortable. The public areas' comfortably literary/World vibe includes elevators you could spend an hour in just examining the walls. We usually just pick whatever hotel's available at reasonable rates for a weekend stay in the City, but I'm actually going to make it a point to return here.

review.title: Great little hotel with international flair
review.reviewText: The quality of this hotel was pleasantly surprising. The staff was exceptional and went out of their way to be helpful and personable. The location felt safe and close to everything. The wine tasting was a fun extra. The rooms are small, but very clean and so comfortable. The only drawback was a paper thin door that connected the room next door and made it loud at times. A frig in the room would have been nice. Still, one of the best hotels for the price I've ever stayed at.

review.title: Gem
review.reviewText: Pleasant mix of fellow guests, nice wine party each evening, and best of all: a really excellent persian restaurant on the first floor.

review.title: I'd stay there again.
review.reviewText: The hotel is in a good location and close to the bus and cable cars. The staff is courteous and very helpful. They have a wonderful sense of humor. There was wine but no cheese at the 5:30 p.m. get togethers but that was OK. Housekeeping is good. The tub was little grungy, needed some bleach, and one of the non-skid strips was loose. The market on the corner was nice; we bought our bus passes there. Very convenient and good coffee. We stayed for three nights. At night the amulance from the sirens at the nearby hospital were annoying. On our last morning there some very noisy people checked in next door. They were slamming doors and yelling at each other in French. I would stay there again but would ask for a quieter room, preferably on the top floor.

review.title: Great little hotel in SF
review.reviewText: Staff was great from check in to check out. Everything was what you would expect for a nostalgic hotel in a big city. Loved it!

review.title: Great place to stay
review.reviewText: This hotel was wonderful. The staff was the best-lots of helpful advice for first timers. The hotel restaurant was also fantastic. If we ever get the chance to go back to San Francisco, we will go back to the Carlton.

review.title: Very nice hotel
review.reviewText: I really loved this hotel, it was clean and all the staff was very friendly. The only thing that I disliked (and this is not the hotel's fault) was that I was woken up too early in the morning by the trash and recycle people, but this only happened once though. The location was good; everyday we would walk a few blocks to Union Square to catch the cable cart or bus. I would definitely stay here again and would ask to be put on a room that is not on the side of the ally where the trashcans are.

review.title: Pleasantly surprised!
review.reviewText: I only used Expedia "customer satisfaction" comments to choose this hotel, so I wasn't certain what to expect. The staff was incredibly friendly and accommodating, and the rooms were ample-sized. The hotel itself was fairly small but very quaint. I really could not have been happier with my stay. The wine receptions were very nice and there were constantly people mingling in the lobby, which gave it a cozy feel. Hope your stay is as nice as mine was!!

review.title: Great place to stay!
review.reviewText: For the price, this hotel was excellent and had a consistent conserving "Green" outlook. Conveniently placed only blocks from union square and the symphony hall. Close to many great restaurants. The hotel is completely themed (Indonesian?)and is beautiful and clean. The bedrooms are small (old but really well kept)and very comfortable. The bed and floors were very comfortable and clean. The bathroom was very nice as well- no hairs or stains of any kind. There was no noise from the streets or in the hall or walls. Overall, a wonderful little hotel that we will definitely return to.

review.title: The Best
review.reviewText: Our stay here was so nice. Starting with the people at the front desk, they were super friendly and funny and very helpful. We went in to our room and it was clean and it even smelled nice. The bathroom was clean as well, but the best part was the bed. It was supper comfy and we had a great sleep. We are very impressed with the hotel as well as the staff. Oh I almost forgot, the restaurant in the hotel was very yummy as well. We will sure be staying here again. Blessings to you all.

review.title: Okay
review.reviewText: No frig., no microwave. Catching the bus was easy. Staff very helpful (expect i left my pillow and still no return phone call about it).

review.title: Wonderful Weekend
review.reviewText: We had a great stay at the Hotel Carlton. They probably have the friendliest staff I have ever met at a hotel. Our room was very lovely and comfortable. The bathroom was nice and big and bright. Location was very close to public transportation and zip cars. If I had to say there were any drawbacks, it would have been nice to have a mini fridge tucked into the closet.

review.title: My new hotel in San Francisco
review.reviewText: I will never stay anywhere else when I am visiting San Francisco. The staff was wonderful and fun. The room was charming and quite. We had a fabulous time.

review.title: Good Hotel and Breakfast
review.reviewText: The hotel was old (historic), but remodeled and the staff were friendly and helpful.

review.title: Not Posh, But Everything That You Need
review.reviewText: Good location - close to transport. Rooms are comfortable but basic. A little noisey, but nothing that even a lightish sleeper can't cope with. Be aware not to stray into the Tenderloin area (a few bocks behind the hotel). Staff are friendly and helpful. The evening wine tasting is worth staying in for at least once! WiFi is great - no problems with access.

review.title: Ok stay for the money
review.reviewText: free wine, comfortable but small room and within walking distance of everything but expensive valet

review.title: Would definitely stay here again
review.reviewText: Very nice small remodeled older hotel not far from downtown, but conveniently located for access to other areas of the city. Very clean and comfortable. Staff was courteous and friendly and prompt. Excellent restaurant on premises. Because it is San Francisco, valet parking at the hotel is most convenient and the car was ready is just minutes from the time we asked for it. We recommend this place for a few days stay.

review.title: Fantastic customer service
review.reviewText: When we arrived, we were greeted by three of the best front desk attendants. They were having fun, were glad we were there, and did everything to make sure that we had a great visit. Location is great, rooms are nice and clean, and the wine tasting every day is a fantastic bonus. Great place to stay, and we will be back.

review.title: Very friendly and comfortable
review.reviewText: The only problem was the parking costs but I think it is a city problem not a hotel problem. The hotel is downtown and there is little public parking, so valet parking is a relief until you get the bill.

review.title: Tough Location Decent Hotel
review.reviewText: The Hotel Carlton is a classic 1940's era hotel that has recently undergone a medium-budget upgrade. The rooms are fine, the service is fine and the location is pretty poor, but certainly the price is pretty good. Stay here if you are traveling on a budget and renting a car, and my guess is that you'll like the price like the hotel staff and have nothing particularly bad or great to say about the property overall.

review.title: Had a very good time staying at this hotel
review.reviewText: Hotel was clean, good customer service, very good attitude

review.title: What a trip!
review.reviewText: My friend and I went to SF April 2009, we had a wonderful time for our first trip to SF. The hotel staff was pleasant and made us feel comfortable there. We loved the fireplace and wine tasting in the evening at 5:30pm. I enjoyed the hotel restaurant for breakfast. There are good restaurants nearby for breakfast, lunch, and dinner. The cable car is only 6 blocks away that takes you to Fisherman's Wharf. We had a great time and would definitely go back. I might go back during the summer since I had a pleasant time there. The room was comfortable, rather small, but we spend most of our time sightseeing and hanging out. You must take a tour to SF. Enjoyed it!

review.title: excellent in many respects
review.reviewText: The staff was superb - friendly and helpful. The hotel restaurant may have been the best we experienced all week - and we got around. Excellent central location in easy walking distance to mass transit. Spacious room was well-equipped.

review.title: Free wine tasting
review.reviewText: Free wine tasting every evening at 5:30 is excellent. Location great. Front desk mostly great and super friendly. Although one day when asking for a restaurant recommendation I received a "we have one here" and no further advice.

review.title: A good stay
review.reviewText: Our room was loud, our bed was a little hard, but all in all we aren't complaining & would visit again & recommend to friends. Friendly staff. Good (albeit somewhat seedy)location--walked everywhere--& the room was very clean. I think our room was especially loud because it was connected to another room with only a thin wooden door between us & our neighbor who coughed all night long. I would have asked to change room but the hotel was full.

review.title: Happy customers
review.reviewText: We love the Carlton Hotel, this was our second visit. It's perfectly located for visiting San Francisco. The staff is very friendly, and gave us great tips for dining and sightseeing. We'll definitely be back again!!

review.title: Can't wait to go back
review.reviewText: It was our first time staying in San Francisco and we loved both our hotel & its location. We walked everywhere but it was also conveniently located within walking distance of Powell St and Union Square where we could get the famous cable car or street cars respectively. The hotel staff was always available; they were cheerful and knowledgeable & helpful. We especially liked the complimentary wine happy hour held in the lobby each night. We could only manage breakfast in the hotel's restaurant (Saha) but it was uniformly excellent & the decor is picture-worthy. The room was bigger than we expected and we loved the Moroccan accents/colors in the decor. We would definitely go back to this hotel the next time we visit San Francisco.

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: Comfortable clean hotel with excellent service and a friendly atmosphere. Beautiful lobby with fireplace. All located in the heart of San Francisco

review.title: It *can* be good
review.reviewText: This hotel is great in several regards: * It can be a pretty good value for the area. * The neighborhood is safe - it's a short walk from Nob Hill or Japantown. (Don't head south, though.) * The room conditions are quite nice. * The service is excellent. * The bathroom amenities are very unique, though the tubs need a little TLC. The downsides are all sound-related: * The glass is single-paned. You will hear everything outside. Period. * If your room faces west, you will have to listen to screaming children until 8pm. (There's some playground on the roof of a building.) * Wednesday is recycling day. West-facing rooms enjoy the melody of crushing glass for about 30 minutes starting at 6:30am. If you're a sound sleeper, I highly recommend it.

review.title: Highly recommended
review.reviewText: The Hotel is sited in a Central Location and very convenient to access various attractions. The Staff are extremely courteous and helpful. Room are adequate and extremely quiet and adequately furnished.

review.title: Decent hotel.
review.reviewText: This is a very clean and tidy hotel, and the staff are very friendly and helpful especially during the daily "free" wine tasting session. But, as mentioned in other reviews, the walls are paper thin, not really a problem, just be aware.

review.title: Carpet is not clean
review.reviewText: Carpet is not clean, and the bathtub is too small. But the house keeping is good.

review.title: Cheap was the ONLY Redeeming Quality of this Hotel
review.reviewText: Seriously - what is with the rave reviews of this place? This is a renovated apartment building, AND it was renovated a LONG time ago. It was clean and the bed was OK but that was about it. Served my needs as a business traveler but essentially it was a cheap, spartan hotel worthy of a maximum rating of, like, 3.9 or so.

review.title: Comfortable, modern...
review.reviewText: Definately will return to Hotel Carlton. My boyfriend and I decided not to stay near the Fisherman's Warf area, and the Hotel Carlton was a great choice. The only downside, is that touristy areas are far for walking, but taxis are easily available. The staff at Hotel Carlton was very helpful in advising where to go and how to get there. The only negative, was that a local hospital is around the block to the hotel, so we could constantly hear sirens from ambulances, but other than that, our stay was great.

review.title: i'll probably stay here again
review.reviewText: I liked the service and the environment-friendly attitude. Location was good (near a Calafoods supermarket, and easy access to California Street cable car). Stayed twice: first room very clean and pleasant; second room had a slightly doggy unclean smell in closet.

review.title: Bargain and Comfort
review.reviewText: Given most hotel rates, their rate is a bargain without feeling like you're staying at a bargain hotel. They were very accomodating (moved to a different room with ease due to a loud neighbor) and friendly staff. And, the location is very convenient to great restaurants. Two thumbs up!

review.title: Really good value
review.reviewText: I almost hesitate to write this since it may get just too popular, but this is the best value hotel I have ever stayed in. I've stayed in comparable hotels in Paris that were over twice the price. My room was beautiful (and you can open the windows). The staff are really helpful and friendly. I would certainly come back.

review.title: A hit and a miss
review.reviewText: This hotel is great for budget conscious travelers. The rooms are clean, and the price is unbeatable. However, the rooms are also noisy, and ours had an unpleasant odour. The heat is centrally controlled, and doesn't come on until 9:30pm - so it was uncomfortably cold in mid-February. Space heaters are available, and will heat the room well enough. The staff members are great, the parking is expensive, the location is okay, the towels suck. I don't know why this hotel is rated so high. It is only a good choice for budget conscious people.

review.title: Bargain hotel in a great location
review.reviewText: We stayed there for three nights and the room was very clean with the basic amenities. We were able to go on foot for dinner, shopping, and entertainment. Hotel staff were very pleasant and helpful. I loved the international theme of the hotel. My only complaint is that the walls were paper-thin. I thought my husband was peeing twice in 5 minutes but it was really my neighbor.

review.title: very satisfied
review.reviewText: Room is big and comfortable. It was too cold outside so I was provided with space heater. Every day at 5:30pm they do "wine reception" for hotel guests - free wine tasting. It was nice but a little early for tourist to get back to the hotel. 10 minutes walking both to the Union Square and Civic Center.

review.title: Perfect for a short break.
review.reviewText: We stayed here for 3 days in Feb 09. The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful. They called the room within 15 minutes of our arrival to check everything was to our satisfaction. It rained constantly whilst we were in SF so the staff found us plenty of indoor events to visit around the city. The weather certainly did not affect our stay. The hotel does feel a little dated but was very clean and the service certainly made up for it. Would stay here again and the location is perfect for all areas of the city.

review.title: Carlton Hotel Sutter Street Great Hotel, Nice lobby area, Staff helpful.
review.reviewText: The Carlton is a fine hotel lobby are is lovely and spacies with an open living flame fire and pleanty of space to sit down and relax. Staff were more than helpful and seemed they would go out there way to help you. Only niggle was that even though the rooms are double glassed and I was on the 6th Floor there was still noise from the street (I was at the back of the hotel also). The lorrys, fire engines etc were very loud and it seemed the double glassing did little effect in blocking this noise out. I resolved the problem by useing ear plugs. This is the only downside to this lovely eco friendly hotel so please don't let this put you off as I also think I had one of the older rooms as they were renevating other rooms at the time i stayed with flat screen TV and new carpets. The hotel is a anout 6 blocks (10 minute walk) to Union Square and abot 12 blocks (15-20 minute walk ) to Symphony hall & Opera House.

review.title: Great place to stay
review.reviewText: loved the location, a bit of a walk to fisherman's wharf but fun to walk through the neighborhoods of san francisco. cute room, a bit on the small side, but how long are you in the room anyway? the walls were a bit too thin but other than that, the hotel was great, service was great, and was a great price. would definitely recommend it.

review.title: Great hotel!
review.reviewText: Wonderful, friendly service, attractive ambiance and a wonderful restaurant to top it all off.

review.title: Definetly would go back
review.reviewText: Great location, walking distance to everything. Close to cable car lines, china town. Very friendly staff, highly recommend going to the evening wine tasting receptions!

review.title: Nice Place to Stay - Business or Pleasure trip
review.reviewText: Smallish rooms (but typical for SFO) were well styled and comfortable. Internet connection worked OK. Noisy from the street noise (Hey, that's city life) but clean with helpful and nice folks at all interactions. I would stay here again.

review.title: PERFECT FOR BUDGET TRAVELLERS
review.reviewText: This hotel is not new but the location is fine, not far from Union Square. Rooms are small but clean and cozy, the hotel staff is efficient, very helpful and friendly. There is a certain oriental charm in the decoration of the main lobby. I would definitely recommend this hotel for those who want to stay in a satisfactory quality hotel in SF without speding too much money.

review.title: Good hotel with excelent bed !
review.reviewText: I stayed for 8 days at the Carlton in January 2009.When i checked in in the afternoon my room was not yet ready, but they were very friendly at the reception and took care of my stuff. I got a big quiet room on the 5th floor with a king size bed which was excelent , and the wireless in the room worked fine. The room was very confortable and clean. A nice touch is the complementary wine late in the afternoon at the reception area , everyone seemed to enjoy it. Valet parking was speedy but somewhat expensive. The hotel is about 7 blocks from Union Square, easy to walk there. I did not eat at the Carlton's hotel, so not much i can say about the food there. Personal were very friendly, got a lot of good tips concerning restaurants in the area. Cosy reception area , lots of book and newspapers, a nice fireplace too. I will come back, can recommend it to everyone.

review.title: Great Location...
review.reviewText: Pros: Staff was very friendly, helpful, and informative. They let us know of things to do and what not to do. Mainly what areas to stay out of. Never felt un-secure. 101/Van Ness just a few blocks away. Union Square about a 15-20min walk. And if your up for it, Fisherman's Wharf a good 30-45min walk. No biggie. Bus stop close to the hotel. Would gladly stay at this location again next time around to the city. Cons: Only ice machine in hotel on hotel lobby. That was kinda a down. Bring your own ice.

review.title: Excellent Hotel
review.reviewText: nice and clean rooms in a good location, highly recommended.

review.title: Repeat visitor
review.reviewText: Come to San Francisco every year and stay at the Hotel Carlton. Like it very much. Nice room, good service and a reasonable price.

review.title: Love this little hotel
review.reviewText: Loved the service in this hotel, really unbelievable staff with great sense of humour and always very helpful and smiley. Location was good, nice walk to Union square and the local neighbourhood was interesting and felt more like San Francisco than the areas around Fishermans Wharf. Room was comfortable and the best thing ever was the Wine reception in the lobby where we got to meet many other travellers and it made a big difference in our stay in SF

review.title: Ritz carlton Hotel
review.reviewText: Very good hotel with perfect treatment and friendly hotel`s employers. Next to time square. Good Place to stay in San Francisco.

review.title: very bery nice but...
review.reviewText: housekeeping staff is starting relatively early in the morning, needless to say, together with vacuum cleaner noise... this may disturb morning sleepers like me... Except for that point everything (especially highlight for the reception staff) were elegant for me...

review.title: great location
review.reviewText: Basicaly a short walk to many things we wanted to see, very friendly and helpful service, comfortable room.

review.title: A green hotel in the heart of San Francisco
review.reviewText: The Carlton is on Sutter Street, walking distance to Union Square and Chinatown. It's a "green" hotel with a drinking hot/cold water fountain located on two floors of the hotel. Each room has a pitcher so that it can be filled as wished. the rooms are clean and the service is excellent and friendly. They even offer a wine tasting in the afternoon.

review.title: Would stay again
review.reviewText: Nice but small hotel. Perfect for a single traveler. The room was small but comfortable. I think the heat for the room was steam heat (typical of SF) with no thermostat - which left the room cold at times. Other than that - good location and friendly staff with a great sense of humor.

review.title: coziness on Sutter
review.reviewText: An interesting hotel on Sutter. I was impressed by the eco-global perspective. Usually stay at 4 star but enjoyed the change of pace where comfort meets hostel atmosphere.

review.title: A little gem
review.reviewText: Upon check in to this small, European-feeling hotel, we were welcomed and then invited to join the lobby's free wine tasting accomapnied by a live music. The ambiance was lovely. The rooms are small by US standards, but certainly adequate. Service was prompt. It is walking distance from some exellent malls/restaurants. We would definitely stay there again.A good value.

review.title: recommended
review.reviewText: great service. got little disappointed my room didn't have a frigo bar...

review.title: Warm welcome in San Fran
review.reviewText: Lovely hotel and staff extremely pleasant and welcoming. Good East meets West atmosphere, definitely recommended for staying.

review.title: Great service
review.reviewText: This trip was to celebrate my mother's 70th birthday. There were 5 of us staying at the hotel, my mom, my 3 sisters and myself. We booked 2 rooms. Upon arrival we were surprised to find that the hotel put us in 2 connecting rooms. This worked out perfectly. Hotel staff were very helpful with providing information about bus schedules, directions and local restaurants. Plus they all had a great sense of humor which was fun. We ate breakfast one morning at the hotel restaurant- very good, and we loved the decor. The hotel itself is decorated nicely. We checked out of the hotel, but stayed in San Fransico until late afternoon on Sunday. The hotel let us keep our luggage there, and allowed us to keep our car past the 24 hour timeline with no extra charge. I have nothing bad to say about Hotel Carlton. We had a wonderful stay.

review.title: Excelente Hotel
review.reviewText: For the price I pay, I expected an average hotel, but I find out that everything was great. If you go to San Francisco please go to this place. You are going to love it. Is only 6 blocks away from Union Square. At the corner in Van Nais you can ride the bus all the way to fishermans warf. Overall: 10 (5 is not enough)

review.title: will stay again
review.reviewText: My wife and i had 2 nights here,and found it very friendly and comfortable.The free wine tasting between 17:30-18:00 is well worth a visit and it's a great way to meet people from over the world.It's perhaps not in the nicest area,but nothings to far away,and for an extra tip,pay a visit to ace's bar only a few yards up the road,very friendly place for a drink or 3!

review.title: Cute & chic Boutique Hotel in SF
review.reviewText: Very helpful and friendly staff, clean, unique, has a great restaurant inside of it

review.title: good location, good price
review.reviewText: clean and friendly and incredibly well-located. A renovation of a residential hotel from the '30s. not the same luxury as a modern chain, but charm, with original porcelain tubs and real closets, etc.

review.title: Friendly Staff !
review.reviewText: The staff friendliness was wonderful. As a woman traveling alone, a friendly face is always welcoming.

review.title: Nice hotel--lousy area
review.reviewText: This hotel is very nice, but its location is too close to the Tenderloin neighborhood, so get used to walking by junkies and losers. As the recession deepens, this problem should get even worse.

review.title: Great place and price
review.reviewText: We had a great time and the hotel staff were all very nice and accomodating. I will stay here again! Easy to get around on the buses too from this location.

review.title: A great value
review.reviewText: Staff very helpful and accomodating. Particularly enjoyed evening 'meet and greet' in Lobby with complimentary wine.

review.title: Excellent service - highly recommended
review.reviewText: As soon as we walked into the Hotel we were greeted as old friends - it is our third visit.None of the staff could have been more helpful, and our one problem was fixed immediately. The bedroom was very comfortable, and the bathroom of good size. We enjoyed breakfast where the service was quick and food excellent. We did not eat there in the evening as the restaurant is closed Sunday and Monday. There is a free wine reception for residents daily. The hotel is situated 5 blocks from Union Square, the main shopping centre, and from the cable car to Fisherman's Wharf. On arrival, the reception staff warned us of the parts of the City to avoid. In all our visits we have never encountered the slightest difficulty. There is a well-stocked supermarket opposite. There is a water dispenser on each floor, although we were assured the tap water was perfectly drinkable. Our room was on the 9th floor and very quiet so far as the Hotel was concerned. However, the San Francisco Fire Department disturbed us with their sirens as we prefer to keep the window open whenever possible. Why so much noise even at three o'clock in the morning! This complaint must be common to most SF hotels. Overall we found this Hotel excellent value and the service the best we have found anywhere. The reception staff in particular are most welcoming and will do all they can. We will definitely stay here on our next visit.

review.title: A nice weekend break
review.reviewText: I booked this hotel after doing a lot of searching for a decent hotel in San Francisco and was still a little apprehensive my choice when our cab drove us to the hotel via some really seedy areas. However, the hotel was great. It was centrally located, easy to get around the city, and our room was comfortable. We arrived earlier than check-in time, but were allowed to check-in right away, which was really convenient. I liked how the hotel used many "green" things like recycle bins in the rooms and free wi-fi. Also, there was a wine tasting every evening, but we kept missing it. All in all it was a great place for the price and location in a city where it seems hard to find a decent hotel. Only two downsides: no free breakfast in the morning, no fridge in the room.

review.title: paper thin walls
review.reviewText: We stay for 2 nights for a quick weekend get away we are very satisfied with the "top of the line" service and the cleanliness of the hotel, small but nice and very well kept. The only problem was that the walls are paper thin so if you get noisy neighbors you would not enjoy your stay as much. Take some plugs just in case but the hotel is definitely worth staying.

review.title: Clean and comfortable, a great staff, in a good location
review.reviewText: The Hotel was impressively clean and the bathroom very modern for a hotel in such an old building with such character. The location was good for sightseeing. The staff were extremely helpful and friendly. They went out of their way to take care of me on my stay. Highly recommended for the price.

review.title: The Hotel Carlton is a great first impression of San Francisco
review.reviewText: It was our first trip to the city and therefore the hotel was major part of our experience. After we walked through the Carlton doors, we were greeted and let into our very welcoming room. It was very clean, the decor was colorful but not annoying and our bed was extremely welcoming - especially after our morning flight. Throughout our four-night stay at the Carlton, I have many fond memories including free toothpaste and surprisingly fun, nightly wine receptions. We had read a ton of reviews on this place and while there many compliments, there were also some criticisms that I would like to address. The number one negative comment was about the noise and thin walls. Yes, there were sirens occasionally and you could here other people moving about in the hotel, but it was minor. I may get less tolerant as I get older, but it wasn't as bad as I expected based on some reviews. The second criticism has to be about the neighbourhood. Homelessness exists and the sketchy Tenderloin district is within walking distance, but anyone who wanders around aimlessly and passively in a new city maybe shouldn't be travelling by themselves. Not once did we feel uneasy in the area. Another negative comment that I had read a couple of time before our trip was in regards to the Carlton staff being overly polite and borderline-annoying. I may not have developed intimate relationships with the Carlton staff, but I did talk to them enough to see that their concern for our comfort was genuine.

review.title: A well kept hotel, very conveniently located
review.reviewText: We appreciated the very friendly and helpful staff. Being on a three-weeks trip, we especially appreciated the closet, where the luggage could be stored, away from our daily life. Extended our stay at the Carlton from planned 5 to 9 days. The only thing missing is a fridge in the room.

review.title: A wonderful stay!
review.reviewText: We had a great time. The only caveat was it was not clear how much the parking was (until we got there, and it ended up being over $30/day). The staff were all very friendly, upbeat, and jokesters.

review.title: San Fran-Castro
review.reviewText: The hotel has much history. With so many modern amenities. The beds are a bit uncomfortable. No flat screen TV however you should not be in your hotel room in with so much city to explore. Everything else was great.

review.title: Gorgeous hotel!!!
review.reviewText: This place is fantastic, one of the best hotels we've stayed at. The room was amazing, the staff were wonderful and friendly and the location was great. We would love to go back, and will as soon as we've saved up again!

review.title: Among the best in San Francisco
review.reviewText: i recently stay at the Carlton Hotel in SFCO, the room had a lot of character, it was quite (ask for the rooms of the back), the staff was very friendly and helpfull...they know there way arround...there is a lot of good places to eat very close.

review.title: Average hotel - rough area at night
review.reviewText: Decent hotel for the price. I would not recommend for children or families. No AC but you can open the windows. Friendly enough staff. Paper thin walls means you can hear everyone in adjacent rooms.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: The Carlton has very comfortable rooms with large walk in closets and friendly, efficient reception staff. Close to everything the only negative was the noise from outside!

review.title: Not bad, not excellent
review.reviewText: The good: location is walking distance to touristic places in San Francisco, easy access to local buses, affordable. It was great for what I was needed. I was looking for a place to sleep comfortably (have privacy, not much noise - I was staying on the 3rd floor). I have no complains in that respect. Room decoration is quite unique. They had pictures of less privileged people. I don't really care about room decoration, but this might be good, bad, or ugly depending on your preferences. The bad: couldn't keep shower from soaking the whole bathroom floor. The ugly: there was a prostitute walking down the street when we arrived around midnight. However, that was just once, the neighborhood didn't seem that bad at all in daylight. It could have been just a coincidence and it didn't make a difference on my stay.

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: Very nice staff, loved the wine hour at 5:30 each night.

review.title: Awesome value
review.reviewText: We stayed for a weekend and loved it. Great location, eclectic and exotic, really friendly/helpful staff with a sense of humor, cozy room, nice restaurant..just all around comfortable and at a great price for what you get...will definitely come back.

review.title: Not the best experience
review.reviewText: The hotel is cute, no doubt and they have extraordinarily friendly staff. I booked it based on reviews on the internet. But...they had turned off the heat in the hotel. It was cold and we were given a space heater, but that is not what I expect at this price. The location also isn't "happening".

review.title: What a Great Deal
review.reviewText: Just returned from a week in San Francisco and was extremely impressed with the Hotel Carlton. Yes, the rooms are a little small, but we basically were there only to sleep. The city was a little noisy with the windows open, but that's true of any major metropolis. The staff was so extremely helpful and nice with many, many excellent suggestions and recommendations. The hotel was on and near major bus lines, so we were able to get everywhere with no problems. I highly recommend the $24 week-long bus pass. We look forward to our next stay at the Hotel Carlton!

review.title: Excellent service
review.reviewText: Staff is fabulous, most comfortable bed I've slept in at a hotel.

review.title: Excellent boutique hotel in centre of San Francisco!
review.reviewText: This is an excellent hotel in the centre of San Francisco. Its very warm and welcoming, with the staff willing to help you with anything and they are at hand to recommend places to eat and go. The rooms were the perfect size, definitely not small, plenty of room with walk in wardrobe for clothing and storing suitcases! I loved the way the room was decorated in a simply and elegant manner. I would definitely stay in this hotel again and recommend it to any of my family and friends.Its great value for the standard you get.

review.title: Something different with lots of character
review.reviewText: Od fashioned hotel that has been jazzed up recently. Situated between Nob Hill and Tenderloin so mixed emotions about the area. Excellent reviews for restaurant (middle eastern flavour) although we only had breakfast which was very tasty. About ten minutes walk along Sutter Street to cable cars going down to Fishermans Wharf but closer to trolley cars running down Van Ness to Beach end of Fishermans Wharf. If its your first time you need to experience the cable cars (conductors are some of the rudest people I have ever met but just accept it as part of the experience). Overall six out of ten for being a little different and good value for money.

review.title: Pleasant Stay
review.reviewText: The hotel was satisfactory. The rooms were clean the bed was very comfortable. The lobby was very cultural and you could sit in the lobby read a book and get warmed by the fireplace. Every evening they had wine and cheese served to their guests. THe area of the hotel was okay. The staff was friendly and very helpful. The bathroom was a bit small and the hotel room was small. The walls are very thin you can hear other people in other rooms like the echo of their voices as well as outside noise. It also can get cold at night in the room. There was no heat they had a radiator but it didn't work I don't know if that's all the rooms but it can get cold so make sure you bring a pair of long sleeved pajamas with you but overall it was a pleasant stay and I would stay there again.

review.title: Enjoyable Stay
review.reviewText: The staff were helpful and friendly. The rooms were comfortable and clean. Especially enjoyed the evening wine reception for a chance to mingle with the other guest. The hotel's arabic restaurant was a new experience but fun. There is a small diner about a block from the hotel which serves a great inexpensive breakfast.

review.title: Very satisfied
review.reviewText: Comfy hotel, the staff went over and above to accomodate us.

review.title: One of the friendliest places we've stayed
review.reviewText: Hotel staff were extremely welcoming and hospitable. We were greeted by name at the front desk. Staff were not very knowledgeable about places to eat near the hotel but they were helpful at getting us places on tours as well as suggesting transit routes to get us where we wanted to go. Our room was a bit small and somewhat cramped. There was only one really comfortable chair. However, the lobby had cosy areas, chesterfields, chairs, newspapers, coffee table books, and a warm ambience. We would have liked a room with a city view but our room on the 2nd floor was adequate for our needs and the hotel atmosphere was wonderful. We only ate breakfast in the restaurant on three mornings. The food was good but the prices were on the high side. The daily complimentary happy hour in the lobby enabled us to meet people from all over the world. I felt completely safe here. Hotel Carlton was cheerful and friendly and I would happily stay there again!

review.title: good hotel close to city centre
review.reviewText: rooms are clean and neat, however on the small side, the walls arent thick so you can hear conversations etc. I stayed in a street fronting room which can be noisy at peak hour howver seemed to be quite ok otherwise. Only some 5 blocks from the city.

review.title: Joie de Vivra - approrpiate title for great features
review.reviewText: From the moment we stepped out of the shuttle bus the staff of the hotel took care of us. Notheing was too much trouble and everything they arranged was done efficiently. The room was large bright comfortable and clean, the furniture an interesting mix of art deco and modern.We particularly enjoyed the 5:30 drinks trolley and the opportunity to meet other people in the hotel. The food and room service was excellent. Thoroughly recommend this hotel.

review.title: So Convenient!
review.reviewText: This hotel is located in a great spot, close to the transportation routes, and even close enough to Fisherman's Warf to walk. We took Polk and it was a pretty easy trip. The crooked part of Lombard Street is also very close. The hotel itself seems to have been newly renovated. Its in an old building, but we were very comfortable. They have a wine social at 530p-6p daily. The restaurant on site was wonderful! (Indian cuisine). I will definitely stay here again. You do have to pay for parking, but I think that is pretty common for hotels in the area.

review.title: fine hotel
review.reviewText: it is a nice hotel rooms are clean, walls are thin and some may find the front rooms noisy from road traffic, however did not worry me that much. .

review.title: Boutique Hotels Are The Way To Go!
review.reviewText: Hotel Carlton is a great Boutique Hotel located centraly in historic San Francisco. With its nightly wine tasting and international happy hour flare, and exceptional staff, we can't wait to go back. The rooms are spacious and have walk in closets. The decor is newly remodeled and the bathrooms are very clean! Make sure to get sugestions for walking distance restaurants which are not only walking distance away, quaint, and extremely tastey! Hotel Carlton is off the charts!

review.title: Hotel Carlton in San Fran
review.reviewText: The hotel Carlton was well worth the stay. The staff is friendly and helpful. The 5:30 wine reception is great - complete with live music. The rooms were spotless. A great stay at a fabulous price

review.title: Excellent Hotel
review.reviewText: This was one of the best hotels that we have stayed in. It was in a nice area of San Francisco, with easy access to the cable car on California St., and the bus was right there as well. We were very satisfied!

review.title: San Francisco gem!!
review.reviewText: Great hotel, great staff..We had a very nice experience at The Carlton Hotel. Good restaurant recommendations, directions, etc.

review.title: The Staff Has the Joy of Life
review.reviewText: I stayed at the Hotel Carlton for a conference/sightseeing trip. The hotel was perfect for this type of trip: I wasn't planning to stay in my room much and I didn't need fancy ammenities, but I did need help finding places to eat, etc. The staff was extremely helpful not only to me, but to my friend who was staying in another hotel! They offered great dining suggestions and other tips, and seemed genuinely concerned that I have a great time in SF. A couple drawbacks: Neither of these issues were a problem for me, but you may want to know... 1. The walls in the hotel are very thin. I was lucky to be at the end of the hallway, but I could still hear every door slam on my floor. Door slamming combined with the city noise (and I think I was directly over the restaurant) made for a noisy stay. 2. You cannot control the temperature of your own room. The hotel also does not have air conditioning (this may be common in all SF hotels--I am not sure). I know it's normally cool in San Francisco, but there were record high temperatures when I was there, and my room got very warm.

review.title: Great location for the money
review.reviewText: You get what you pay for but in this hotel you get a lot more.The hotel is in a old building that has been renovated and maintain. The frount desk manager also works as a one man band at the free afternoon all you can drink wine tasting.The location is with in walk distance of union park shoping, china town,the trolley cars and downtown.

review.title: Most welcoming establishment
review.reviewText: From arrival to check-out, staff could not have been more helpful and friendly. The hotel itself is well maintained and every comfort was provided for. Dinner at Saha is also a must.

review.title: I'll stay there again!
review.reviewText: This hotel is all about service. As a business traveller I didn't spend a lot of time enjoying the amenities. The desk personnel could not have been kinder, more proficient, more joyous or more helpful.The location was fine, we were able to walk many places we needed to go, or we were close to the bus routes we needed. The decor reminded me of hotels in Europe. I'll tell my San Francisco bound friends, and hope to have the opportunity to stay at the Hotel Carlton in the future.

review.title: Great place to stay in San Francisco
review.reviewText: This hotel was absolutely perfect. The entire staff was so friendly and helpful. They helped us with directions, drew us a map, and were really personable and all had a great sense of humor. They allowed us to check in early and they took care of parking our car. That was a relief since driving in San Francisco can be tricky with all of the one way streets. Our room was very nice and clean and had a neat decor. The closet in the room was a huge walk in closet which gave us more space in our room becasue we didn't have to deal with luggage in the floor. The Wine Reception was great. I think that is the best idea any hotel has ever had!!! I recommend staying here for sure.

review.title: Will go back
review.reviewText: The hotel was nice and the staff was very helpful. My only complaint would be the service at the restaurant. It is small, but they do not have enough staff, and you can find better food anywhere in the city. The rooms were comfy. I will definitely stay here again.

review.title: Perfect Hotel
review.reviewText: This hotel was wonderful, the staff at the hotel treat you so great they answer any questions you have about getting around the city, places to eat, and transfers back to the airport. They were the best!

review.title: Friendly, comfortable, efficient
review.reviewText: The Carlton has a friendly ambience, comfortable rooms, efficient desk staff. If you need a massive room, this may not be the place for you, but my room was certainly more than adequate, including a very large walk-in closet. It had a good view over the downtown area. Would stay there again.

review.title: Lovely hotel, friendly staff
review.reviewText: b

review.title: Definitely going back....
review.reviewText: I love this hotel, and will definitely go back again. My boyfriend and I wanted a relaxing, short and inexpensive vacation. We don't need a whole lot with a hotel, but we do need the hotel to be CLEAN! Cleanliness was our primary concern. Not only was this hotel spotless, it was perfect for a younger couple.
