Loved the atmosphere, loved the service and loved the restaurant downstairs. I am extremely picky... well picky for a broke 21 year old, and I am completely sold on this hotel. I am actually shocked it turned out so well. Bus transportation is on the same street, up a block 1/2... the hotel explained everything about the San Francisco transportation systems. There was also a lot of travelers from the UK and France, which was nice. Can't wait to go back!

review.title: Good service but room was not impressed
review.reviewText: The hotel service was good but the room had mold in the bath room. By the bed the window was closed and I could still feel a draft and the walls are to thin I could hear every detail and could not sleep there.

review.title: The Hotel is CUTE!
review.reviewText: I had my family visiting from Japan last week. Then, we stayed there for 2 nights. While we were staying there, my sister and I kept saying that this hotel was very cute. All furniture, decoration and everything were cute, not too modern not too classic. Hotel services are great as well. I will go back there when I get a chance to stay in SF again.

review.title: Nice Hotel
review.reviewText: This is a nice hotel but it can be really noisy in the middle of the night (we coudln't figure out what it was - street cleaning or deliveries at 3am?). Apart from that it is clean and comfortable; everyone is really polite. They also have free wine every afternoon at 5.30 which is much appreciated! The neighbourhood is ok - Union Square is 10 mins away but so is a dodgy part of town so it can be a bit hard to orientate yourself.

review.title: Great value for money
review.reviewText: This hotel is in a great location for those wanting to see all of San Francisco's attractions. It is only 3 blocks from the cable cars, 4 blocks to their fantastic Chinatown and 2 blocks from great shopping in Union Square. What the hotel lacks in modern amenities (i.e. balconies, fancy toiletries, and state of the art furnishings) it more than makes up for in hospitality. The hotel staff are welcoming and remember every guests name, they offer safety tips and ideas for sightseeing. If you are expecting a new "boutique" hotel, this place is not for you, but if you are seeking the bohemian ambiance of San Francisco this is it.

review.title: Highly recommend this hotel!!
review.reviewText: Took my mother to SF and had a great time. The hotel was cozy, comfortable, and clean. The bathroom is a little small, but that is to be expected in an older building. The staff was great, very friendly and helpful. I would definitely stay there again or recommend the hotel to friends and family.

review.title: good experience
review.reviewText: overall experience was good. had to move rooms once;restaurant blower loud in 1st room;2nd was fine.

review.title: Great hotel in downtown San Francisco
review.reviewText: Excellent hotel. We really enjoyed our stay there. Good location, very friendly and helpful staff, comfy rooms. Lots of charm and character.

review.title: Extra Friendly, Helpful staff
review.reviewText: We enjoyed our stay at the Carlton in San Francisco. The staff called us by name, and began and ended each day by asking, "What can we do for you today?". They arranged tours, recommended restaurants, set up transportation, researched on the internet, and even ordered pizza for us. They provided so many little extras that made us feel special including chocolate and mints while we were playing cards in the lobby, plus daily wine tasting at 5:30 PM. We travel a lot, and this hotel has the best staff ever.

review.title: Nice Decor
review.reviewText: Stayed for 4 nights. Very Interesting "International" decor. Everything is nearby and easily walkable (Cable cars, Chinatown, etc.) Clean Bathroom. NON-SMOKING hotel.

review.title: What a great surprise!
review.reviewText: This hotel on the edge of the tenderloin is a very good place to stay. Economical and very handy to walking downtown, China town, etc. The staff is very helpful and genuine in their desire to assist you. Older hotel with quite clean rooms and comfortable beds!

review.title: All about Attitude!
review.reviewText: Last year I stayed at a 5 stars hotel but this year I chose this one through expedia and was really impressed with such clean and nice hotel which can compete with the five stars one! The employees have nice and helful attitude especially the front-desk guy named Theo! The location is quite central but you dont relaly need to worry as SF is 7*7 city!

review.title: Like the World Market at Target
review.reviewText: First, let me say that the staff was amazing. Super friendly, very nice and warm when we checked in. The lobby was pretty cool - a warm fire was going and that was nice because it was a rainy, cool day. Beyond that - ew. One elevator is like a service elevator. The elevators are plastered with pictures of people from all over the world. The artwork is all focusing on what seemed to seemed to be struggling/developing nations. The towel rod fell off the wall twice. I would not return.

review.title: Great value
review.reviewText: This was a terrific find. While the room was average-sized, the complimentary toiletries were first class, the Egyptian cotton sheets as advertised, the ceiling fan and complimentary happy hour a bonus. Even better, as I was there during the earthquake, was the knowledge that the Carlton was built on bedrock with a unique cage foundation and is so sturdy that the FEMA people stay there.

review.title: Great Hotel!
review.reviewText: This hotel was not right on a BART line, but near enough to buses that we could get around that way. Though, it was also close enough that we could just walk to Union Square. We pretty much just walked everywhere anyway. The hotel was clean and really cute. We would book it again in a heartbeat. We were in a corner room with the hallway on one side. The bathroom was clean and bright.

review.title: Nice hotel
review.reviewText: It is really well located, very near to Civic Center Station (if you are coming from the airport take the BART to Civic Center and then take a taxi; it will charge 6-8 US$). It is not a five star hotel, if that is what you are looking for. Carpet looked old, but rooms are clean and nice. Staff treated us really kindly. Really close to cable cars station and within walking distance from Union Square.

review.title: Would definitley stay here again.
review.reviewText: This hotel has a warm character with its decor, the Arabic fusion restaurant (Saha) on the first level and the friendly staff who treat you to complimentary glasses of wine every evening in the lobby. The room with two full beds suited my boyfriend and I quite well. It was tidy and the shower had a strong flowing shower head. We had a view of the building next to the hotel, but it really was not a big deal-- we got a great rate, were in a convenient location and if you pay a bit extra city views are available on higher floor levels. The room, like most places in SF, did not have air-conditioning, but had a good ceiling fan and screened windows. My initial concerns about this were unfounded since in October, the weather was crisp and cool. I had colleagues who stayed at a hotel closer to Union Square, paid significantly more and had a smaller, more generic room. Lastly, the restaurant's Lebanese meatball dish Kofta is excellent and they have several Dutch ales on the menu. Overall-- I would go back and as a female traveller, I felt very safe in this neighborhood.

review.title: Pleasantly surprised
review.reviewText: Nice hotel, good location.

review.title: Lots of character and good location
review.reviewText: The Hotel Carlton was the perfect hotel for our stay. Upon entry, the stylish and worldly-decorated lobby invited us in, and our room only sold the deal on this charming little hotel. An overall attention to detail also went a long way for making our stay all the more special and memorable. If I know anyone is going to San Francisco, I will without reservation recommend Hotel Carlton.

review.title: Excellent base, centrally located for visiting San Francisco
review.reviewText: The hotel was very clean and comfortable, The reception staff were both friendly and helpful. Our room was on the 4th floor and had everything we needed. Would definitely stay here again.

review.title: A little Jem
review.reviewText: This was my second time in Joie De Vivre hotel and I was even more impressed. The Hotel Carlton doesn't look much from the outside but when you get in! Lovely decor, a large clean room. The staff were very helpful and the restaurant was great (sort of arabic fusion) try the tofu benedict - great! Also recommend the retaurant first left outside the hotel, called the Brick! Fanstastic food, great atmosphere. Great location for seing San Francisco, turn right to head towards Union Square, the cable cars, Pier 39 etc. Turning left , mmmhh the neighbourhood gets a bit dodgy! Would recommend it to anyone, might try another Joie De Vivre hotel the next time, well worth the money. Enjoy! Ocbotber 2007 UK.

review.title: Very nice hotel, great staff
review.reviewText: If you want to stay somewhere other the Union Square this is a nice place to pick. Its about a 15 minute walk to the tourist areas but I think thats the best way to see the real city. The lobby and service was a nice surprise when we arrived. Our room was not ready but they told us they were upgrading our room and putting us on the top floor. The room was spacious and comfortable and everyone we met was very nice. The only downside and its one you need to consider is the noise from the street. We were on the top floor but were still woken most nights but the various dustmen, lorries & police that operate throughout the night. Of course it may be the same in any hotel in the city but I dont recall being woken so frequently even when Ive stayed in New York or Las Vegas. Take some ear plugs and you will be fine. Overall a very nice hotel and one I would consider using again.

review.title: Excellent Hotel at competitive price
review.reviewText: Stayed for 5 nights in September. Found the location ideal for sightseeing on foot. 15 mins from Union Square. Although Fisherman's Wharf 30 - 45mins we didn't find this a problem as we like to explore on foot. Hotel staff very enthusiastic and offered tips on places to visit/eat and bus routes to take to explore further afield. Only made the wine tasting once as were still out sightseeing the other days but a very nice touch. Parking expensive garage next to hotel was $25 per night. Luckily we only had the hire car for the first day having travelled from Yosemite. Only downside was that we had an adjoining door through to the room next door which had quite a gap at the bottom so were kept awake the first night by the chap next door coughing & then a couple of nights later by the new guests coming in at 3am and could hear every detail of their conversation. Used the cushions from the bed to block the gap and muffle the sound. However as said this was the only complaint of the stay.

review.title: Off the beaten path, but OK
review.reviewText: It's not a resort, but they try hard, it's clean and it's relatively quiet. If they laid down some new carpeting, it would be fine. They could do a slightly better job keeping the valet-parking space open. They let tour buses sit there way too long waiting for passengers when they could have the bus show up when everyone is ready to go, so that the rest of us could get our cars pulled up to the front door so we don;t have to drag our bags up a hill.

review.title: hotel carlton, an unknown s.f. jewel
review.reviewText: Funky hotel not far from Union Square. They have a happy hour with free wine. But the best thing about this hotel was their free San Francisco guides. My daughter and I used it to venture all over S.F.

review.title: Great Service Hotel
review.reviewText: Front desk staff were very helpful and pleasant. Helped with car rental, parking, places to see and actually helped to save us money. The hotel was very quaint and clean and the wine at 5:30 pm was great. Highly recommended.

review.title: Very comfortable and inexpensive
review.reviewText: Having got a fairly good price we were not expecting much but the hotel staff were incredibly helpful and friendly. The room was extremely comfortable and clean. We didn't eat in the hotel as it wasn't included and there are so many options in San Francisco although the restaurant look pretty good. There is a slight ethnic feel to the hotel with various pieces of African art and lovely travel photographs, making it much more individual than the larger hotels. Some people were surprised by the location (in the Tenderloin district) but we found it only a short (10mins) walk from Union Square and a very good base to explore from.

review.title: Would stay again!!!
review.reviewText: The hotel staff are wonderful. Would stay again. Rooms were very clean and the beds were comfortable. About 5-6 blocks from Union Square.

review.title: Location and price best of both
review.reviewText: We really enjoyed our stay at Carlton. We were walking distance to Union Square but not too close.

review.title: Not Impressed
review.reviewText: Decent hotel, nice staff, but unexciting. Rooms were generally clean but somewhat dated feeling. Clearly a renovated building.

review.title: Loved the hotel and the restaurant!
review.reviewText: I loved the hotel, but I wished it was closer to the Trolley carts and Union Square. I guess that's my fault by not looking at the map location! :] but I did indeed love the hotel and the restaurant!

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: We were very impressed with the hotel. The service was phenomenal. We'll definitely stay there again.

review.title: Great experience!
review.reviewText: This hotel was awesome! Staff was friendly and helpful, wine reception every evening, free car service to the convention center weekday mornings! I would recommend this hotel to anyone going to San Francisco!

review.title: Very impressed
review.reviewText: Good hotel in good position. Excellent service from staff. Superb restaurant. Happily recommend it.

review.title: Service
review.reviewText: Excellent personal attention, and very good location.

review.title: A Pleasure
review.reviewText: This hotel is a class act. From the minute we stepped through the door, we were greeted with the most accommodating and friendly people. Despite being off the beaten path this hotel was a jewel. Public transport and the trolley were close at hand to get us where we wanted to go.

review.title: Good value
review.reviewText: Good location.

review.title: Comfortable stay but a bit sketchy neighborhood
review.reviewText: The hotel was impeccable; everything from the service to the bedsheets was a treat. However, the Carlton is in the Tenderloin area of town, namely prohibitive parking situation and some sketchy characters nearby... even with double paned windows, the room was still quite noisy. Also, th e hotel leases a parking lot nearby, which closes from 00:30 to 06:00, so if you are planning on going out in your car it may be a problem. Overall, though, reasonably priced, friendly staff and comfortable. A good option for San Francisco.

review.title: What a jewel!
review.reviewText: What a wonderful surprise this hotel is! Clean, friendly staff, near many good restaurants, within walking distance to Union Square (7-8 blks) large room, large bathroom and walk-in closet with a floor safe. Eclectic mixture of books on the table in the lobby and very interesting wall decor. I feel like I have found a real treasure and will most certainly return on my next trip to San Francisco.

review.title: Nice hotel, declining neighbourhood
review.reviewText: The hotel staff are still very helpful and the restaurant good, but the neighbourhood is in decline. People living on the street just a few blocks away, and the concierge said that the only part of SF that was not safe to walk at night was the part just south of the hotel.

review.title: Great lobby ambiance
review.reviewText: The desk staff were among the best I have ever encountered - informative, helpful, efficient, and sincere in wanting to ensure that our stay was comfortable and enjoyable. The lobby has a great ambiance and always seemed to be bustling with people interacting with one another. A welcoming place to sit and relax or meet with friends by the fireplace. Although the guest room was smaller than more modern hotels, it did not feel cramped and in fact was quite comfortable. This will be my hotel of first choice in the future when I visit San Francisco.

review.title: Different from the norm
review.reviewText: Pretty nice hotel albeit no A/C, but didn't really need it since it was cold at night,and this was in June.I travel a lot and was pleasantly suprised at the 'hominess' feel.The sheets and linen were not your typical hotel type sheets,and the soaps and shampoos were organic from Australia rather than your run of the mill made in China.It was a pleasant stay.Tried to eat breakfast there but felt I was being ignored and stood at the doorway for 10 minutes even though there were tables open. Probably because I was wearing shorts and slippers?I travel on business all the time and this experience was bad.I ended up choosing one of th ecool diners up the street.

review.title: Nice, clean and great value hotel.
review.reviewText: Staff are friendly and helpfull. Rooms and elevators were clean and as described. Nice place to stay for not very much money. I would certainly return.

review.title: Great Customer Service, Charming Hotel
review.reviewText: I travel to SF several times a month, and I've stayed in a number of different hotels. This is the only one that I've written a review for...the customer service is great - warm, friendly, helpful, and professional. The room size was average for SF and the bed wasn't the best I've slept in, but it was a comfortable room/bathroom. I'll stay there again.

review.title: Good place for good money
review.reviewText: + - good place + - cosy atmosphere - - thin walls

review.title: reasonable value for money
review.reviewText: our first stay in San Francisco, 3 nights. Staff were very welcoming and helpful. Room was clean.Rooms a little tired looking and breakfast was one to miss. Location good for city centre - seven easy blocks to Union Square. Overall a clean friendly welcoming hotel.

review.title: Would definitely recommend!
review.reviewText: This place is great. The rooms are clean, the beds extremely comfortable, and the showers were great. The staff were extremely courteous - as soon as we got there they recommended places we should visit and areas to avoid. The guy on reception even offered to print my online boarding passes off for me free of charge. The hotel is about 5 blocks from Union Square, the only time that was ever a problem was a few days where we had done a LOT of shopping and walking and had heavy bags to carry back uphill! Otherwise the location is fine. Just as good as other higher priced hotels. I'm disappointed I managed to miss the wine-tasting every day though!

review.title: The Best Front Agent Staff
review.reviewText: For the price and location, this hotel is top. I would recommend a continental breakfast and microwave in room to make in perfect! Otherwise, if you stay a week or so, you have to keep eating out etc. We had a child with us, so that would have been useful. I really was impressed with the front desk agents. They were always available for special requests and information.

review.title: A hidden gem in San Francisco
review.reviewText: This hotel has a wonderful history, a wonderful staff and is fairly centrally located in the downton area. I like to walk so had not problems getting around. Fisherman's Warf and Union Square were only 15 - 20 minute walks and if you use taxi or transit you are there in five minutes. I will definitely use this hotel again.

review.title: Very satisfied!
review.reviewText: All hotel staff was very friendly and went out of their way to provide assistance.

review.title: A great bargain with terrific atmosphere
review.reviewText: This was my first trip to SanFrancisco. The hotel was extremely clean, and the people at the front desk were exceptional. They were extremely patient, and they gave us great advice from transportation concerns, to which restaurant to choose. They were also good about cautioning us about areas NOT to venture into in SanFrancisco. My criticism would be that the beds were extremely small--they were supposed to be double, but they seemed small. Otherthan that, the hotel was a bargain, and met out needs well.

review.title: Just Right
review.reviewText: I'm happy that I ended up here. The price was right, and the service was excellent. The room was clean and spacious with WiFi. I used the morning shuttle to the financial district, which was very convenient.

review.title: Incredible hotel at a great price!
review.reviewText: This was truly a boutique hotel and so inexpensive! It was great to stay right in san francisco and not break the bank! The rooms are a good size, huge walk in closet, and the bathroom was a little small but very well appointed. The service was outstanding, 5 minutes after I got to my room I received a call from the front desk to make sure everything was to my liking. They also recommeded places to go, how to get around, and what area to stay away from for safety reasons. Great restaurant next door (Brick) and at the hotel (Saha). Wine reception from 5:30-6:00 every evening. Overall a great hotel...I will stay again!

review.title: Not impressed-not 3 star
review.reviewText: The hotel staff were very courteous but the hotel is rundown and I don't consider it a 3 star hotel-perhaps 2 star. Very different than how it appears on-line. The hotel seemed run down and the rooms smelled and the immediate location was not very good for a family trip.

review.title: Nice place to stay, but...
review.reviewText: Clean hotel, extremely friendly and informative staff, but the wall's are thin and you can hear everything inside the hotel as well as outside on the streets, so if you're a light sleeper beware. Also a good distance from fisherman's wharf where you can see the bay and the golden gate bridge. If you can't see that, then this experience is no different then any other major city.

review.title: Very nice and comfortable!
review.reviewText: Great service, friendly staff, close to shopping.

review.title: Very Impressed - Great Staff
review.reviewText: Room wasn't massive but had eveything you would need. There was a bit of noise from other rooms but nothing terrible. The nightly wine tastings are great. The staff were wonderful & very friendly. Good location. The hotel does nice breakfasts also. Overall very happy.

review.title: Everything was beautiful!
review.reviewText: Very clean hotel in a quiet location. Everyone was very polite and helpful. Very nice decoration. The restaurant was a bit small and dark. I would prefer to eat outside.

review.title: very nice hotel
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel with kind employees. They offer free wine every afternoon at 5 ! Just a few points which could be improved such as the noise isolation of the room. But my overall appreciation is just : come to this hotel if you plan a trip to SF.

review.title: Brilliant hotel and people
review.reviewText: The hotel was in an excellent location, close to Union Square and within reach of Fishermans Whart. Hotel staff and management were helpful and friendly from the minute we arrived to the time the car (which they had arranged for us) came to take us back to the airport. They arranged cars/excursions and helped with all local information. I would recommend this hotel to anyone that wanted to visit San Francisco.

review.title: Not bad, not great.
review.reviewText: Our stay here started off a little rough - bell hop watched us unload the car and carry our bags to the front desk. The person that greeted us at reception was pleasant and informative. The same bellhop watched us carry our bags to the elevator (we didn't have that much and he'd alread lost his opportunity for a tip). The rest of our stay was uneventful.

review.title: Recommended hotel - great staff very helpful
review.reviewText: Had a wonderful stay in this hotel. First time in San Francisco and this hotel was everything we could have wanted. The staff were fantastic and although we had to request a room change due to being by the noisy elevator, they moved all our stuff for us. Very helpful. Enormous bed - very comfortable. Only minus points as mentioned by others is it isn't easy to get a lay-in if your neighbours are up, as the connecting doors between rooms mean you can hear every word. I had to buy ear-plugs. Quite noisy in that respect.

review.title: Comfortable, convenient and reasonably priced.
review.reviewText: Staff was friendly, attentive and helpful and warned me (a single woman traveler) to stay away from Tenderloin area. I'm sorry I missed the evening winetastings but I was too busy running around. California St. cable car is 3 blocks away and 2 of the blocks are uphill (tho not a steep hill). Hotel is in a quieter area but accessible to most major sights. There was a fire burning in the lobby's fireplace. Breakfast in the restaurant was fine. I used the PC off the lobby to check email. I would stay here again.

review.title: Warm & friendy; great for personal travel
review.reviewText: The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. I had stayed in Union Square at a "nicer" hotel before but didn't receive near the level of service I did at Hotel Carlton. I loved the atmosphere and world motiff. It won't have all the frills of an "upscale" hotel, but there's so much to do that you're hardly in your hotel anyways.

review.title: Great staff
review.reviewText: The best thing about the Carlton Hotel is the staff. They're friendly, helpful, and very knowledgable. I travel to San Francisco several times a year for business, and even though this hotel is a little older and the rooms are sometimes smallish, I keep coming back because the staff is so great.

review.title: What a great stay!
review.reviewText: My wife and I had the most amazing stay at the Hotel Carlton. The staff was top notch as were the facilities. It is in a great location with easy access to shopping and transportation. I have already recommended others to stay there and think of it as my best hotel experience to date!

review.title: Overall a nice choice...
review.reviewText: Although my stay was short, I had a comfortable stay. As some other reviews state, it was a bit cold inside the room and required the use of a portable space heater. The front desk promptly brought it up to us. There was noticeable reverberation from the walls and created a lot of noise even from our own TV. Inconsiderate neighbors may be a problem, though we had no issue with that ourselves. If looking for a unique experience, this is the hotel for you.

review.title: A Great Time....
review.reviewText: The hotel is in a great location, most importantly it's reasonably priced and is within easy walking distance of the city centre. The hotel ambience is good, if a little dated. The staff are friendly, relaxed...and at times, a little cheeky. But most importantly they're really helpful, so don't be afraid to ask them for help. They we're more than willing to sort out cabs etc and it was always done with a smile. The rooms are well kitted out, but the walls are pretty thin, meaning you can hear what's going on next door. But that said, the rooms are well kept and they've packed a great deal into them. The free wine tasting in reception (every night) is also a real bonus. I'd recommend this hotel to anyone travelling to San Fransisco.

review.title: Excellent
review.reviewText: Good quality - price

review.title: Good balance betwen cost and services
review.reviewText: The hotel seams to be a good balances between cost and services offered to guest. It is enough closed to main shopping center.

review.title: Very comfortable, clean Hotel.
review.reviewText: We had a very enjoyable stay at the Carlton. The room was the right size for a couple and the Queen size bed was huge! We had a walk-in wardrobe which was useful and the bathroom was a good size also. The room was clean as was the Hotel in general. The staff were very helpful and when a tour that I had booked did not show up, they phoned the company on my behalf. The location is only a 5 minute walk from Union Square but quite a long way from Fisherman's Wharf. I can't fault this place.

review.title: Incredible service, always beyond the call of duty,always with a smile
review.reviewText: This is a small, centrally-located boutique hotel, with a very international atmosphere. From international theme-based rooms to Arabic fusion cuisine and Indian breath-freshening mints at the reception, the motto "peace through travel" really applies. The rooms are clean and comfy, there is a nightly free wine-tasting for guests, they lay on complementary shuttles to the financial centre: in a word... impressive! The staff are more than friendly, and have a great knowledge of tourist sights, local entertainments, activities and geographical directions. They seem to be waiting for you to ask them the most tricky questions, and are always prepared to answer with a smile. Overall, I would recommend both this hotel and San Francisco to anyone thinking of a trip to the West Coast of the USA.

review.title: Third time very lucky
review.reviewText: This was the third time that I have stayed here and every time has been great. Although a bit apprehensive about the refurbishment and takeover the staff are still very friendly and it was nice to meet Theo once more. The 5.30 - 6.00 wine reception is excellent and not to be missed. Contrary to other reviews there was heating in the room which was very welcome as was the easy to use in room safe. The bathrooms have been refurbished and, to European standards, are of normal size. The beds were very comfortable. Gripes - thin walls and the elevator service could be better although still an improvement on what was there before.

review.title: Happy stay
review.reviewText: The staff were pleasant and accomodating throughout our short stay. Wine reception was fun, we loved the restaraunt and the atmosphere overall. If we return to SF we'll definately look for a room at the Carlton.

review.title: 2nd stay and will be back again
review.reviewText: My business collegues and I have stayed here prior and booked it again because we liked it so well. The decor is so homey and comfy that it was nice to come home to. We keep missing the wine tasting at night, but have really wanted to fit it it just ran out of time. We did find out this time that the location is good, but sort is a couple blocks from the Tenderloin district which isn't great. However, we were totally comfortable walking around to the East, West and North of the hotel. We'll definitely book here again.

review.title: San Francisco Carlton Hotel
review.reviewText: Good hotel, new room. One elevator was out of order. Good location.

review.title: Very good
review.reviewText: The only negative is that the rooms are not very sound proof and hence you can hear your neighbors.

review.title: Unique and warm hotel with excellent staff
review.reviewText: I've stayed at this hotel a couple of times now, and would certainly go back again anytime. Hotel Carlton is a kitchy cute hotel with unique and gorgeous decor. I like that every room is quite individual with amazing photographs. Staff members are attentive and warm. The hotel isn't very far away from Union Square, only a hop, skip and jump away... I love this place.

review.title: Reasonable
review.reviewText: The Hotel Carlton is reasonably located, with easy access to most of San Francisco. The rooms are clean and well kept. The tv service is unimpressive and the rooms are difficult to heat. The bathrooms also tend toward the small side. The daily wine tasting is enjoyable and the lobby is a great place to relax with a fire and wireless internet service. I would stay here again, barring a better deal elsewhere.

review.title: I'll stay there again when i go back
review.reviewText: Great hotel! Obviously, my experience,the night staff was great! Was in the city for my first time and they answered all my questions with good attitude. Location feels safe, near busy streets yet very quiet once inside. Rooms were really clean even for the lower level rooms. A safe box in everyroom, perfect if you carry a laptop with you. Had everything i was expecting for the price. The only thing i would considered not so great is the smaller than usual elevators and no wi-fi internet access for the room i stayed in.

review.title: Great Staff, Thin Walls
review.reviewText: Good location...within walking distance of Union Square and the Opera Great, helpful staff. Good humor. Rooms are clean and very nicely decorated with blue and white painted walls and photographs of people in Nepal or India (not sure where). Please, albiet brief, wine reception in the evening. Rooms have coffee makers and good cd/radio alarm clocks. Problem: Very thin wals and we had some noisy neighbors. But the staff moved us in the middle of the night (giving us a new room while allowing us to keep our clothes in the old room). Another mixed problem is that the hotel has steam heat which has variable efficacy from room to room. One morning our heat wasn't working and we called downstairs and immediately got a space hater delivered. My advice...ask for a quiet room away from families with children OR be a person who doesn't mind thin walls.

review.title: Friendly Service
review.reviewText: This hotel has the friendliest staff I have ever encountered. There services was excellent from the managers, front desk, bellboy, and cleaning personnel. The hotel restaurant was excellent. The food was great and the owners and staff have a great sense of humor. Never in my years of traveling have I felt so at home. The rooms are very cozy, even though there is no central heating it is warm enough during the winter.

review.title: Would Stay Here Again
review.reviewText: The staff was extremely helpful, courteous & friendly. Had a small problem w/the heat coming on and not being able to control, but the staff was very apologetic and tried to correct the problem as quickly as possible. The rooms were as good as any other hotel of the same cost. The cleaning service was timely and excellent. Many good people work there and the evening wine social hour was a nice touch.

review.title: Nice environment, but with minor technical inconveniences
review.reviewText: The hotel had a really good athmosphere and acomodations overall. Service and cleanliness were very good. There were 2 things that I did not like about this hotel. First, there was no central heating in the building (although the temperatures would fall around 40s at night) and we had to request a portable heater for the night. Second, the room walls are extremely thin and you can hear ALL conversations that your neighbours have as if they are in your room. That was extremely irritating especially early in the morning.

review.title: feel like home
review.reviewText: I didn't expect much of the hotel on my way from the airport as the downtown didn't seem to I should. But the front desk welcome us warm. Sometimes they come to open the door for you! They keep the hotel room as clean as possible. There are San Francisco guide books in the room which made me feel they really care about the guests. People who were staying at the hotel seemed to be joyful. I will definately stay there again if I go to San Francisco!

review.title: Not impressed.
review.reviewText: This hotel could have been cleaner, newer, and more spacious. I don't feel I got a good deal on this one.

review.title: Had a great time...
review.reviewText: The hotel staff was extremely helpful at all times of day. The rooms are quaint and cozy. The wine tasting was short (5:30-6:00), but very nice. I had a great stay here and would definately stay again.

review.title: A great place to stay!
review.reviewText: All employees were wonderful, The afternoon staff the best, made you feel at home. Very clean rooms,Lobby area was perfect for reading the morning paper by the fireplace. Our room was great except no view, next to a building so we had to keep our blinds closed, made it a little dark. Would stay again on our next trip!

review.title: The Best in Service Ever
review.reviewText: The rooms were fine, standard and clean as were the bathrooms which were nicely accessorized, however the greatest asset to the hotel are the staff. All the staff were very welcoming and really made us feel that they were happy we were staying at their hotel. There was nothing they could not do for us. The evening wine receptions were great.

review.title: Very clean and comfortable and hotel staff were very helpful
review.reviewText: Was very impressed when we arrived at Hotel Carlton, staff were friendly and helpful. Room was clean, comfortable and very nicely decorated. Unfortantely never made it for the complimentary wine or to the restaurant but heard both were worth a shot. We walked everywhere while we were there, Union square 10 mins, Fisherman's Wharf 45 mins. Would recommned to friends and would stay there again.

review.title: A good deal
review.reviewText: We took the less expensive rooms ( floors 1-3) and got two rooms at the back on the third floor, looking over the roofs of the SF. Possibly had we been given rooms at the front, over the street, they would have been noisy. Restuarant served an A-La-Carte breakfast that was a strange mixture of Mexican and Arabic food; I would have preferred a straight buffet which would have saved time on the single waitress taking orders, preparing coffee, and serving; it would also have been less expensive. But all in all, a good deal. Front desk were extremely friendly and informative, hotel location is within walking distance of Union Square, and the rooms were clean, stylish in a boutique kind of way, and adequate. Does "boutique" mean that the towels have to be thin?

review.title: Hip Hotel
review.reviewText: This hotel is very chic and modern. I highly reccommend to the young and hip crowd.

review.title: Excellent and Stylish Hotel
review.reviewText: We had a tough morning of travel and when we checked in the staff recognized this and gave us a complimentary bottle of wine. The hotel was incredibly clean and very beautiful (Tons of character too). I would definately reccomend this Hotel.

review.title: Great choice for a reasonable price
review.reviewText: The hotel & staff were great. We loved the sheets and comfortable beds. The only downside of our visit were the large number of homeless and their leavings all over the city. If this otherwise beautiful city is interested in tourists it should do something about this problem. Maybe they could take a lesson from what was done in New York City.

review.title: Fun spot
review.reviewText: Friendly staff, helpful advice for tourists, spotless room and attention to little details--a great place to stay for a night or a week!

review.title: Great place to stay!
review.reviewText: Hotel staff and restaraunt were great.

review.title: Good Choice
review.reviewText: Very pleased with choice of hotel. Hotel room was 8th floor, at the back. Situated not far from Union Square and local amenities. Staff were very informative, friendly and helpful. They highlighted the areas not to visit and mentioned the local transport routes. Restaurant - did not use.

review.title: Wonderful hotel, we'll come back!
review.reviewText: This hotel was much more than we were expecting from a 3 star hotel. The people at the front desk were extremely friendly, rooms were nice and decorated and overall our stay was very pleasant. One thing to mention though - the hotel is located on a kind of noisy street and the window glass dosen't seem to block much of the noise. This didn't bother us, but if you're a light sleeper you might want to consider...

review.title: Clean, convenient, friendly staff
review.reviewText: A successful trip is one where you don't complain about the hotel. We enjoyed the Carlton very much. The rooms are somewhat small but it is San Francisco, after all. We didn't eat at the restaurant in the lobby but the smells were great and lots of other people ate there. The HC was walking distance to several places for breakfast, coffee shops and bars.

review.title: Rooms and bathrooms are small
review.reviewText: Rooms and bathrooms are small

review.title: Good, but others may be better
review.reviewText: It is difficult to find a reasonably priced hotel room in SF. The boutique hotels I have stayed at, including the Carlton, are Victorian buildings refurbished to varying levels. However, at the end of the day, they are still Victorian buildings with all their limitations. Our room at the Carlton was clean, but its wood-frame windows let in a fair bit of traffic noise even on the 8th floor away from the street front. And we could hear the conversations in the adjoining room through the walls. I expected better for the price.

review.title: Great Hotel!
review.reviewText: We stayed at Hotel Carlton for the 1st leg of our honeymoon. This was a great hotel for a very reasonable price. The service was outstanding. The people at the front desk were very accomodating and always were available to answer any questions or to give great recommendations. The hotel itself was decorated beautifully and very hip. There was also a highly acclaimed restaurant "Saha" in the hotel. I only found 2 drawbacks- the room was a little small, and the hotel bordered on a not-so-nice neighborhood-but there were no problems. To end on a positive note, it was within walking distance to Union Square!

review.title: Very nice hotel
review.reviewText: Don't get off the BART at the Civic centre. Go one more stop. Around civic centre is really ghetto. Stay away from this area!!!

review.title: inexpensive gem
review.reviewText: I recommend this hotel very highly. The service was friendly and helpful, the bed was comfortable, and the eclectic, international (mostly middle eastern) decor was really fun. For the price, it seems like an excellent deal.

review.title: Comfortable hotel
review.reviewText: Helpful, friendly service. Restaurant has a very interesting menu. Pretty good location.

review.title: Great Boutique Hotel
review.reviewText: Very comfortable, 10 min walk to Union Square, the staff was knowledgeable about the city and always willing to help. This hotel has great character.

review.title: I'd stay again
review.reviewText: The Carlton was very clean, nicely decorated and in very good condition. The neighborhood is safe and walking distance from Union Square and Chinatown (assuming you don't mind walking six or seven blocks). The rooms are small. We were on the top floor and occasionally had low water pressure. The price was excellent.

review.title: better I expected
review.reviewText: stuff is kind room is clean

review.title: Highly recommend
review.reviewText: Hotel Carlton was actually chosen by feedback from others using expedia. The hotel and rooms were very neat and clean. It seemed as though the hotel was newly remodeled. The rooms were not big but we were not planning to be in there much with lots of siteseeing to do. The hotel staff were extrememly nice and helpful during check-in and with recommendations on what we do on a Sunday evening in the city as this was when we checked in. They also gave us a map on areas to see and also areas to stay away from because they were not safe. Very much liked this feedback from them. They also recommended a siteseeing tour to view the entire city so that we could really concentrate on what we would like to spend our time doing in San Francisco during a short stay of about 3 1/2 days to be a tourist.

review.title: Wonderful hotel for a Good price
review.reviewText: We came in town for a concert on Saturday night. Checking in the hotel staff was friendly, the lobby is open and airy and modernly appointed. Our room was on the 5th floor looking back on the city. The rooms are updated nicely for the building's age. The windows opened and the bathroom was clean and bright. We didn't hear the neighbors and had a good night's sleep. Good value, cool, funky old hotel.

review.title: Affordable comfort in San Francisco
review.reviewText: This is a nice middle-sized "boutique" hotel ~6 blocks from Union Square. The lobby is small but well appointed and people actually congregate there. The rooms are average size for SF. The bathroom was small but clean. Perhaps my only criticism is that it abuts a rather sketchy area if you walk in the wrong direction.

review.title: Great hotel!
review.reviewText: So easy to get to, easy parking. MUCH better than some of the other reviews led me to believe. We'll definitely stay here the next time we're in the city. The wine social hour in the lobby is so fun!

review.title: Good Experience, Helpful Staff
review.reviewText: The hotel was clean, well located, and the staff was extremely helpful recommending places to eat, as well as constantly gave us maps & directions to where we wanted to visit around the city, and always being very nice about it. I would stay there again, and recommend the hotel to friends.

review.title: Great Value
review.reviewText: Good location and great service from the staff. Rooms were very neat and a little larger than expected for a mid-town hotel. Price was very good....highly recommend this hotel for business or pleasure.

review.title: Loved the hotel, but it was very noisy
review.reviewText: My husband and I just returned from our trip and while we loved the hotel itself, it was very noisy at night. I had to go and buy earplugs and Tylenol PM just to be able to sleep. Also I thought the area was a little too far from Union Square. It was a good five block walk just to get to Union Square or the cable cars. The hotel was very clean and our room was very nice. We enjoyed the wine tasting in the evening and the staff was very helpful. I am torn on whether or not to recommend this hotel because I loved the hotel itself but the noise and location would deter me from staying there again, especially if you're not used to noise at night. Maybe if you asked for a room high up and away from the street it would help.

review.title: Quaint, but not very comfortable
review.reviewText: While I found the room had a lot of character, it was not very big in size. The bed was not very comfortable either. The hotel staff was amazing! Very informative and helpful in every way. Location was not far from Union Square and close to the trolley down to Fishermans Wharf. Overall, if you are looking for something with character, this is your place-comfort look somewhere else....

review.title: comfortable hotel in central SF
review.reviewText: Had a great stay, very comfortable for business travellers, free high speed internet is a bonus!

review.title: Humourous, Personable Staff Make it Memorable
review.reviewText: We weren't completely sure what to expect when we got there since it was about 1-2 blocks away from the seedy party of town (Tenderloin), but despite the room being small with no climate control (you can ask the front desk for a space heater and extra blankets if it gets cold), it was a great place to stay! We didn't notice any noise problems like the other reviews were talking about, the staff was very friendly (all the housekeepers made a point of saying hello whenever they saw you leave or return), the room was well kept, the front desk staff (especially the manager) were a extremely friendly and great for a laugh! They'll recommend places for you to go and how to get there, they are more than happy to take a photo of you in their lobby, or even behind the front counter!!! (It was their suggestion and they even had us pose like we were running the place!) Their wine reception was quite good, but the restaurant didn't have very good service or menu selection. Close to public transit (several busses run along that street as well as streets nearby) and it's just a short walk to Union Square. Would definitely go back!

review.title: We Would Return
review.reviewText: This hotel is a gem! It is located on the bus routes. The rooms were very comfortable, everything was squeaky clean, and the staff were superb!

review.title: Great Hotel!
review.reviewText: My daughters and I have an annual trip to SF, this year friend from Japan were joining us, we decided on The Carlton for it's price and were not disappointed, the rooms were clean and neat, the staff was one of the most helpful were have encounter in a while in the city. The room was alittle tight with the three of us. Double beds with an 8 and 7 year old, but we made due!

review.title: did not like food
review.reviewText: The restaurant food is terrible. They only have an Indian menu, can't order desserts or other items to your room

review.title: A Good Value
review.reviewText: The hotel had a charming atmosphere.

review.title: Great Experience
review.reviewText: My daughter & I were very pleased with the hotel, staff, and price. We would recommend it to others without hesitation.

review.title: I will stay here again
review.reviewText: Good hotel with great location and not noisy.

review.title: Flawless service and tremendous value for money
review.reviewText: This is how all hotels should be! As we entered the stylish reception area our first impression was great. From that point onward our expectations were constantly exceeded. The welcome was warm, the staff were tirelessly helpful and attentive and the rooms were peaceful and comfortable. We found it to be a great spot to see the San Fran sights and relax at the end of an extended trip. We were sad to leave.

review.title: Small hotel with international chic
review.reviewText: A hotel with a heart, the Carlton Hotel, SF, is based in the financial district and is close to major SF shopping and cable car rides around the city. The renovated hotel is staffed by personable, warm characters with good concierge skills. The small restaurant Saha gets a good breakfast review. The room we stayed in was modest, very comfortable, and moderately priced. The Carlton looks to its neighbors in need with a round-up on your bill as a donation to emergency family housing nearby. Win a week at the Carlton with your cash donation by a drawing later in the year. Guests from all over Europe and Asia made the experience especially pleasant.

review.title: Great hotel!
review.reviewText: Very friendly staff, and accommodating when requested to change rooms due to crying baby in adjoining room. Room was fairly small, however tastefully decorated and clean; not your average hotel room. Loved the complementary wine every afternoon in the lobby. Enjoyed sitting by the fireplace in the lobby reading a book. Soothing music and very relaxing. Would definitely stay there again and again and again!

review.title: Good Location
review.reviewText: I used to live in San Franciso. Hotel Carlton although 8-10 blocks from Union Square was still ez access to public transportation.The hotel staff always friendly and helpfull. My room was on the 6th floor. Quite and clean. I was very pleased with this hotel selection and would return.

review.title: Convenient place to stay in San Francisco
review.reviewText: good location, great ambiance, welcoming personnel.. I would advise this hotel to anybody who wants to have a nice place to stay without paying a lot.

review.title: Great Value & Very Comfortable!
review.reviewText: The Hotel location is great, just a couple of blocks from the cable car stop on Powell St. The staff at the hotel is fun & gracious & also very helpful. The room was very comfortable, clean, and even had a huge walk in closet! I highly recommend this hotel!

review.title: a nice hotel in a nice location
review.reviewText: This was a nice hotel with nice staff. The decor was pretty. The rooms were on the smaller side but not too small. We could hear other people from our room but it was never obnoxious. The location was also great; we were able to walk just about everywhere downtown and to the pier, and we were only 9 blocks away from the BART so we could get to the southern part of the city. they have a vegan/vegetarian friendly restaraunt right in the hotel!

review.title: A fair price in a pricey city
review.reviewText: The room was commensurate with the price, and that was the primary consideration for choosing this hotel. It was a relatively good location, considering we didn't need to be 'on the Wharf' or 'Under the Bridge', but only within walking distance to some good dining and evening entertainment. Beds were comfortable, and bathrooms could use just some minor updating, but otherwise were fine. We'd certainly stay again.

review.title: One of the nicest 3 star hotels in the area
review.reviewText: Located in downtown, pretty close to china town and other attraction spots, although the walk seems long because of all the hills. Hotel is old but was pretty clean, no air condition, only heater. We also stayed at another hotel on the same street and it was really bad, so for 3-star hotel, I recommend staying in Hotel Carlton.

review.title: Excelent value for the price
review.reviewText: Terrific front desk service. Very nice decorated and confortable lobby. Pretty good rooms.

review.title: A Hidden Jewel in SanFran
review.reviewText: This small, intimate hotel lacks some of the amenities of your 4 star chain hotels (i.e. fitness center) however it more than makes up for these absences with it's attention to detail and cleaniliness. I've stayed in impeccable hotels across North America and I can't say that I've ever had personalized service like I experienced at Hotel Carlton. The front desk staff, bellman, and custodial staff were fantastic! I am very peculiar about cleanliness and I couldn't find a flaw in the housekeeper's method even if I tried. I was more than impressed!

review.title: Great hotel ,questionable area
review.reviewText: We really enjoyed staying at the Carlton. We had a large room so we were very comfortable. Our only concern was the area of the city looked somewhat rundown. We did not eat at the hotel restaurant but it looked very good and had many patrons.

review.title: Great Experience
review.reviewText: Nice and clean. Very close to Chinatown and Union Square, and about 15 minute walk to Moscone Center. Hotel staff extremely helpful. Would have liked to have internet service available in the room, but free service was available in the lobby.

review.title: Friendly staff
review.reviewText: Friendly staff, good hotel. The restaurant is a little bit overpriced though.

review.title: Nice Stay
review.reviewText: Nice comfortable hotel with clean rooms, great service and a good restaurant. Wireless internet in the lobby and high-speed in upper floor rooms worked perfect. Convenient location with a few bars, stores and restaurants nearby.

review.title: Not Bad  for dowtown San Fran
review.reviewText: Hotel service was great. Bathrooms need to be updated, but that was to be expected in an old building. Rooms are steam heated so there are no temp controls. We had to sleep with the windows open to keep cool, which made outside noise very apparent. Be prepared for fire truck sirens and 4:30 am dumpster dumps (very loud!). Location was excellent. Close to Union Square shopping and authentic restaurants/bars on Polk Street.

review.title: San Francisco Gem
review.reviewText: Great Boutique Hotel in a great central location. Walkind distance to major points of intrest. Nice African Themes with a comfortable chic lobby. Friendly staff. Amazing Aribic Restaurant. Highly recommended.

review.title: it 's not the best
review.reviewText: the hotel is very cold and we field the neighbours.

review.title: Charming Moroccan decor, attentive staff
review.reviewText: Attractive hotel with excellent staff. Room was clean and well-maintained. Only concern was that it was in the heart of the Tenderloin district. Hotel's security wise was good.

review.title: clean, cute & cozy
review.reviewText: Hotel Carlton is a small but modern boutique hotel about 5-6 blocks from union square. I thought it was a great deal for it's low price. The room was adequate in size, not spacious, but very clean. The personnel were all very friendly and gave us recommendations on where to eat (other than saha, their restaurant). I'd go back in an instant.

review.title: would stay again!
review.reviewText: Great place to stay...a little loud on the weekend and the beds are a "cozy" full. Staff was excellent, hotel was clean, and the wine at night was great!

review.title: Will go back!
review.reviewText: We had a very nice stay. Will go back when in SF again.

review.title: good choice with limited budget
review.reviewText: 1) location: union square within 10-min walking distance 2) cleanliness: pretty good especially with recycling service on papers, plastic bottles etc. 3) staff: ok service 4) resturant: quality breakfast even though a little bit expensive

review.title: very satisfied
review.reviewText: helpful reception, quiet, clean, all best

review.title: It was OK.
review.reviewText: The hotel was very convenient. It was within walking distance of Chinatown, Union Square, and if you have the legs for it, Fisherman's Wharf. Great for those who want to stay out and enjoy the city.

review.title: Great hotel, will stay there again
review.reviewText: Great value for a great hotel in a convenient location. Very helpful staff.

review.title: i will defintely stay there next time
review.reviewText: the front ddesk is very curtious and helpful. i loove the wine hour by the fireplace and the new decor. the elevator was pretty interesting.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Would stay here surely again but with a pair of ear plugs. Like all older renovated hotels the walls are thin. Everything else was quite nice.

review.title: Chic, downtown hotel with a winetasting every evening...
review.reviewText: My husband and I recently stayed at this 'hidden jewel.'Located just 5 minutes from Union Square. The rooms are all re-done with an Ethnic vibe. Service is incredible. Knowledgeable staff and an overall good feeling to it. They offer a nightly winetasting which allows the opportunity to meet other hotel guests. I would recommend this to any friend.

review.title: Nice for a quick trip..
review.reviewText: We were staying for 1 night only celebrating our anniversary. The hotel is truly a boutique and very quaint. The room was comfortable and decorated very charming. The wine reception was a nice treat. The hotel is a old, renovated building and it is a little bit noisy in the morning hours with doors slamming and toilets flushing...but for the price it was very nice. Not very close to Union Square...definitely a cab ride unless you want a really good walk.

review.title: Great deal, but thin walls
review.reviewText: Excellent hotel for the price. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Hotel was clean, but the walls are super thin. My two girlfriends and I are not a rowdy bunch, but our neighbor banged on the wall almost each night we were there!

review.title: good deal
review.reviewText: The Carlton is a very cute hotel, very nice friendly staff and clean, modern rooms. Also it is in a great location, lots do within walking distance. I would recommend to those in town for sighseeing.

review.title: A great place to stay - we will certainly go back
review.reviewText: The Hotel Carlton was a real suprise, a great place to stay. Very modern and comfortable, not too fancy or lots of added extras which you tend not to use anyway - especially when you are in a city like san francisco. The hotel staff were very helpful and friendly, rooms clean and comfortable. Great location within easy reach of all the major districts and attractions. The public transport is great with a MUNI bus stop almost outside the door of the hotel. Don't let the proximoty of the Tenderloin put you off staying here, it is a few blocks away and the area around the hotel is safe, local and contains lots of good places to eat and drink. Have a look at our traveller's tips for great local places to eat and drink.

review.title: Will use again for sure!!
review.reviewText: The carlton hotel on sutter st in San Francisco was amazing, the service was impeccable, the staff was wonderful, the rooms were much nicer than you average hotel with ample space for storage, great spa products, walking distance to union square and the BART through very safe Nob Hill, the only thing is you can hear everything in the hallway through your room door, also even though the BART map will tell you to get off at Civic Center you then have to walk though the Tenderloin area (not good), better to go to the next exit, Powell and walk up that way from Powell and Market.

review.title: Walk to Chinatown
review.reviewText: This is a fine hotel to stay at if you want to be close to it all. It's close to Market Street shopping and the entrance to Chinatown on Sutter Street. The financial district and the Civic Center Bart station are near enough to walk to.The hotel was clean, comfortable and affordable. The hotel staff was very friendly. I would stay here again. The only complaint I had was that the elevators are really small. You have to wait if you have luggage with you.

review.title: Very accomodating
review.reviewText: Everyone was wonderful and went out of their way to make certain that we had a most enjoyable stay. The only thing I would suggest is that more large towels are put into each room. Those of us with long hair need one for our body and our hair... We will return!!

review.title: The Only Problem was...
review.reviewText: The Hotel Carlton has the distinct disadvantage of being in a not so great neighborhood. That's the only negative thing one can say. If only the place could be picked up and set back down in a cleaner, more upscale neighborhood it would be perfect. The staff were very gracious and friendly and hotel itself was very clean and nicely decorated.

review.title: Good value
review.reviewText: Not the best neighborhood but close to Union Square. Extremely friendly staff. Rooms were very clean but not fancy. We had a room off to the side so it was quiet.

review.title: Great place to stay
review.reviewText: This hotel was great! It was clean and the people who worked their were friendly and courteous. We had a great time. The room looked exactly as it did on the virtual tour. It had a lot of personality - not like a standard hotel room.

review.title: Decent hotel for the price.
review.reviewText: The hotel is fine and for the $ the hotel is one of the better places in the city to stay. I have stayed at a lot (and one might say too many)hotels in the SF area and this is one of the better 'deals'. The hotel itself is fine.

review.title: Can't wait to go back!
review.reviewText: Excellent restaruant (Saha) and service.

review.title: Great Place
review.reviewText: We really enjoyed this hotel.

review.title: Would definitely stay here again
review.reviewText: We found this hotel to be quite charming and perfect for our needs. It is decorated nicely, is in a great location, and the staff provided exceptional service. The Arabic fusion restaurant located in the hotel was excellent. We had a wonderful dinner there one evening and ended up eating breakfast there each morning because it suited our tastes so well.

review.title: Great location - quality hotel
review.reviewText: The services offered by staff was very good. The accomodations were also more than acceptable. Our room was comfortable and clean. The hotel is a short walk from Chinataown, downtown commercial area and Fisherman's wharf. The free nightly wine tasting meeting (6 to 7pm) offered hotel guests the oppotunity to meet each other. Staff was also helpful with restaurant and tour selections.

review.title: Great value for the price!
review.reviewText: Clean, quaint spot, further from Union Square than I wanted, but very close to bus line that takes you right to Fisherman's Wharf. Park your car yourself at the hotel parking and set out on foot or take a bus or cab - it will be cheaper. Very nice room and lobby, but what really made this stay special for us was the hotel staff at the front desk - very accommodating - they will help you with your SF tour. I would certainly stay here again!

review.title: Fun and funky spot
review.reviewText: The wine reception gives you an opportunity to hear other travelers' faves for San Francisco. The staff were incredibly attentive and very helpful. Elevator went out of service one day during our stay, luckily we were on the second floor, just one flight of stairs up!! Walking distance to Union Square, a couple of great coffee stops along the way too. Would recommend to an adventurous traveler, but not for those accustomed to very large rooms. Bathroom was a bit small - had to balance the cosmetic bag on the top of the toilet.

review.title: Charming boutique hotel
review.reviewText: The photos on Expedia represented Hotel Carlton well. The rooms were very clean and had nice internationally inspired decor; charming atmosphere and a nice change from chain hotels. The staff was incredibly helpful with good suggestions. The only complaint shared by others is that the walls are quite thin and a problem if you have loud neighbors or are a particularly light sleeper. On our last night we could actually hear a terribly loud snorer in the next room! This was such a great little find that this wouldn't deter us from staying again. Although a few blocks from Union Sq. shops, it's still an easy 4-5 min walk. We found the buses very easy to use (even into the evenings), which will take you just about anywhere. At $30 for overnight hotel parking, consider the street. We rented a car for two days and parked on the street overnight with no problem.

review.title: Value for money
review.reviewText: Just nice hotel, very friendly staff.

review.title: Great hotel with attentive staff
review.reviewText: We were very pleased with our stay. Room was comfortable & clean and adequate in size. Staff was very helpful & attentive. When the front desk found out we were celebarting our wedding anniversary they sent up a complimentary bottle of wine with glasses & a cork screw. Location is also close to many attractions. Highly recommend!

review.title: Noisy place
review.reviewText: We stayed two nights over the Memorial weekend. The hotel lobby and room look just like the picture on the web. Nicely decorated. Our room was on the 2nd floor facing the street, the room is nice and the bathroom very very clean, but the noise from the street is very annoying. Maybe people are in high spirit because it was a holiday weekend, but it sound like people are shouting at each other. The walls between the rooms are not sound proofed either. You can hear your next door visitors' conversation and the television. I woke up on Sunday morning at 4:00am by the television sound coming from next door. The worst part is the door do not have a automatic return that will close the door gently, you hear doors slamming all night and all morning long. Being a light sleeper I will never consider staying here again.

review.title: good times
review.reviewText: nice people

review.title: Great little hotel
review.reviewText: Hotel room was comfortable, service was friendly and accomodating. The free wine tasting every night was fun and a great way to mingle w/ other travellers. Only (very minor) complaint is that the walls were a little thin. But for the relatively inexpensive price, this hotel can't be beat!

review.title: Good simple hotel
review.reviewText: A nice hotel with simple well decorated rooms. Area was fairly quiet but within a 8 to 10 block walk to civic center and Union Square. I did not have much need for hotel staff and services so I could really evaluate them. Evening wine tasting was a nice touch.

review.title: Hotel Carlton
review.reviewText: Hotel was recently rennovated. It is a very nice quaint hotel. The rooms were very clean and the hotel staff was extremely nice. Good hotel for the price. No central air, only ceiling fans which proved to be sufficient. I would recommend it if you are looking for something quaint and quiet. Hotel is a $7 cab ride from Union Square but, easily walkable.

review.title: great place to stay.
review.reviewText: very nice, freindly,downtown, 10 minutes from anything. good wine , good times. need i say more!!

review.title: Excellent value
review.reviewText: Yes, the rooms are well appointed. Yes, the location is central. But what really distinguished my stay at this hotel was the level of service. The staff were both personable and professional, extremely courteous and helpful without being obsequious. The concierge who checked me in, in particular, was excellent and even called up to the room after I had checked in to make sure everything was in order.

review.title: Great Service
review.reviewText: A boutique hotel located comfortably within walking distance of many SF attractions. Small but well appointed rooms and first rate service. Hotel also boasts an excellent restaurant that guests should try. All in all a great stay.

review.title: Second time around even better....
review.reviewText: This is a quaint, romantic hotel, with a lot of personality. This was our second time staying and I must say it only got better. We had an amazing view of the city from our sixth floor room and the staff was extremely helpful and pleasant. I would highly recommend this hotel to everyone. The price cannot be beat. Not only that but each room has a private bath and in San Fran that is hard to come by in most hotels for the same price. A++++ in my book. Oh and try the wine reception every evening from 6 to 6:30, great wines!

review.title: not bad
review.reviewText: The rooms are smallish but comfortable. Who goes to San Francisco to spend alot of time in the rooms anyway? The staff were very nice and the hotel was very clean. The decor and especially the old fashioned bathrooms were charming. The carpeting was in desperate need of replacement. It was located very conveniently, although on the border of a very nice area and a rather red light area of town. Service at the restaurant was very marginal.

review.title: Excellent value and quality, custom service
review.reviewText: This hotel truly defines to what boutique hotels should aspire. The hotel has a global them, which is pulls off with class without seeming contrived or passe. The small size means they know who you are and treat you special. The rooms are clean, but the hotel is located a good walk (uphill then down) to Union Sq or the BART. For those familiar with SF, it's a fine neighborhood, ie, north of the Tenderloin. The only problem is the trouble getting to public transport.

review.title: Definitely a keeper
review.reviewText: This hotel was a great find. The lobby and room were spotless, the decorations were very nice, and the staff was among the friendliest I have ever encountered. The hotel is in easy walking distance to Union Square, and there is a bus route right out the front door. Valet parking was $30/day and you can remove and replace your car (if you really want to drive in San Francisco) as often as you like.

review.title: Great Stay
review.reviewText: We enjoyed our stay here and would highly recommend this hotel. Clean rooms, great ambiance and helpful friendly staff. Located centrally and walking distance to some great restaraunts. We recommend Firenzi in North Beach for good italian food.

review.title: Attractive Boutique Hotel
review.reviewText: Very clean, recently remodeled, charming hotel. Great lobby and dining on premises. Short walk to Union Square. Great value, would stay again.

review.title: what a nice surprise in S Fancisco
review.reviewText: It' different from what you usually find in USA: either anonymous big chains or inexpensive but very uncomfortable and dull. This one is small, with a nice atmosphere and decor inspired by exotic travels. Rooms are not big, but I found myself very at ease.

review.title: I will go again to this hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel service reflect the international and warmfull atmosphere of San Fransisco.

review.title: Best Kept Secret
review.reviewText: I don't want the secret to get out and this become a very busy popular hotel. This is now my favorite inexpensive hotel in San Francisco. It was clean, quiet, the staff was excellent. The hotel restaurant was very good and inexpensive for breakfast. The location was perfect,your right in the middle of the city, and easy access to anywhere.

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: I was very impressed by my overall experience with Hotel Carlton. The style is great and I loved the design of the rooms. The staff was also very curtious and helpful.

review.title: Great service and decor, can't wait to go back!
review.reviewText: The staff of the Carlton were always helpful and nothing was too much trouble,  and they really know the local restaurants too. The decor is an ecelectic international style mix which adds to the relaxed atmosphere. Our room was clean and comfortable with a good sized full bathroom. The Saha Restaurant in the Hotel was a great find with the best breakfast menu I've seen anywhere around the world.

review.title: one cold long night,  but still a nice place
review.reviewText:
I took my wife to SF for a weekend get-away.  The room was real nice,  the hotel staff very helpful and friendly-  unfortunatly the heater in our room (radiator style) only came on very rarely-  and when it did come on it sounded like a loud TV on a channel with no reception (white noise).  They attempted to repair at 11:00 PM,  but later found out they were not too successful.  We woke up in a room about 40 F.
After reporting our problem again the next morning to the front desk and a very helpful maid-  we were very relieved to return the next evening to a room with heat and a nice quiet register.  That had assured us it would be taken care of,  and delivered on this promise. 
Even with a disappointing first night we had a great time in SF and at this hotel.  We would probably stay here again.

review.title: Fabulous Hotel!
review.reviewText: The staff were exemplary! The decor was very eclectic, great ambience. The beds were so very comfortable! Good location, can walk every where.  Try the Turkish restraunt 2 blocks down Larkin on the left street La Turca!

review.title: Far exceeded my expectations!
review.reviewText:
As I write this review I have mixed emotions. How I would love to keep Hotel Carlton a secret. I only hope that they will stick to the same values that made my trip so memorable. 

 Upon arrival we were greeted by a bell hop which unloaded our car for us. We then proceed to check in which at this time we were greeted by the Front Desk personnel. The person that checked us in was most helpful he provided us maps and even gave us recommendations on restaurants in the area.

 The room was very spacious we had a king size bed and the bathroom accommodations were very nice. According to the bell hop Hotel Carlton had just completed a several million dollar renovation which explains the condition of the room. 

 With all this good there has to be some bad. After reviewing the entire stay the only thing I could find bad was that they provided heat via radiator which was controlled centrally. The main problem with this is if you are a person that tends to get hot very easily which I am, I had no control over the heating. 

 For the price of the hotel I will stay at Hotel Carlton over and over again. The staff was great and the room far exceeded my expectations. They offer a valet parking service which I highly recommend simply for the convenience.

review.title: As Advertised
review.reviewText: Highly satisfied with the service and accomodations.  A few blocks walk from the activity of Union Square, but this hotel has personality and did not disappoint from the advertised attributes.

review.title: Definitely Worth A Stay
review.reviewText:
My only negative was a bit of a backup at the front desk at check-in.  Other than that, this is a very clean and comfortable place to stay.  I like "European Style" hotels, so if you are looking for tons of extravagant space, this might not work for you.
I think the place is in a great location, easy walking access to Union Square, and it has a lot of charm.

review.title: Fantastic Hotel with Cozy Charme
review.reviewText: Charme with character and very friendly staff. Great rooms with style and atmosphere. Would highly recommend.

review.title: Comfortable Place to Stay
review.reviewText: This hotel is recommended to people who enjoy smaller and more intimate hotels.  We enjoyed sipping complementary wine by the fireplace.

review.title: "San Francisco's Best Keep Secret"
review.reviewText:
Everything about the Hotel Carlton on Sutter is Marvelous.
Upon checkin we where treated with outstanding courtesy and
we arrived alittle late for the complimentary half hour wine tasting.
That was not a problem and before we knew it two glasses just appeared.  The transition at the checkin counter was swift and painless from the booking with Expedia and our room was clean, comfortable and romantic. We where on the sixth floor and experienced very little city noise and all amentities where first class.
The dinning area is very clean and the morning coffee fresh.
The internet access is close by for printing your Southwest
Airlines A boarding pass and taxi service is easy and the Hotel is only a ten minute ride to the BART Train.

review.title: Loved San Francisco & this hotel
review.reviewText: From the moment my friends & I arrived at the Hotel Carlton the staff was extremely nice & extremely helpful. They gave us maps of downtown & even highlighted the neighborhoods that we should stay away from. The location was great, walking distance from Chinatown and good restaurants and bars. I especially love the hotel's decor, from lobby to room. I will definitely go back to this hotel the next time I'm in San Francisco.

review.title: Small but beatiful and warm welcome
review.reviewText:
It's better than I hope. Firstly, I've got very warm welcome both people and place. You'll love the furnace at the lobby. The room is small but it has very large storage then you've got the enough space.
This place is 6-7 blocks from downtown but It's easy to travel with MUNI, you should try ;-) 
I love this hotel and When I come back SF, I wish to be here again ;-)

review.title: Nice hotel, but....
review.reviewText: I thought everything was great (service, decor, bed, cleanliness), but our room had an old oil heat radiator in it which seriously lacked the punch to provide any real heating.  It was a cold night and we were in a corner room.  The chill in the room kinda negated the other pleasantries.   I would inquire about other rooms with heat perhaps if I was going to go back.

review.title: nice place
review.reviewText: we really enjoyed ourselves, we appreciate the decor of both the room and the common areas. service ok. walking distance from the main attractions of downtown. parking prices reasonable. lovely weekend.

review.title: Excellent experience
review.reviewText: Newly remodeled hotel offered great service, fun staff, good breakfast in the restaurant, and very clean room. We would stay again.

review.title: Great hotel, great staff
review.reviewText: This was my first time in SF and it was great. The staff were friendly and very helpful in getting around the city.

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: I thoroughly enjoyed my time at The Carlton Hotel, the staff are friendly and the ambiance of the foyer together with the daily wine reception ensures a great stay.

review.title: No frills, good hotel.
review.reviewText: The Carlton Hotel is a good value, no frills hotel.  The most interest aspect of the hotel is the strange asian/middle eastern decor and pictures, which added character.  Everything was clean and the service was very good.  The only downside is that it is only a few blocks from a shady part of San Francisco, which my mother and I mistakenly walked through.  But it is a totally avoidable part of town if you stay north and west of the hotel.

review.title: Carlton Hotel
review.reviewText: The Carlton is an excellent, affordable, clean, cute boutique hotel close to all the action in San Fran.

review.title: great, reasonable place, friendly staff, great location...
review.reviewText: The Carlton is a no-frills, clean and comfortable place to stay in a great area of San Francisco.

review.title: nice place
review.reviewText: This hotel was very cute and decorated well.  The only complaint we had was the very thin walls!  Otherwise we loved it!

review.title: Carlton Hotel
review.reviewText: We enjoyed staying at the Carlton.  Furnishings were modest but neat, clean, attractive and comfortable.  Staff members were outstanding and hotel is very convieniently located.  Would stay there again.
